DEFINITION: popular HIV/AIDS antiretroviral drug.
TRANSLATION: òògùn KASA àti ìsọdọ̀lẹ àjẹsára.

DEFINITION: between the chest and the hips that contains the stomach, small intestine, large intestine, liver and gallbladder.
TRANSLATION: igbá-àyà àti ìbàrá-ìdí, tí àkójo ̣pò ikùn, ìfun kékeré, ìfun-nla, ẹ̀dọ̀ àti òrónro wà.

DEFINITION: pain Pain in the belly. Abdominal pain can be acute or chronic.
TRANSLATION: Ẹ̀ dùn inú ikùn. Inú dídùn lè jẹ́ ògidì tabi pípẹ́.

DEFINITION: Outside the expected norm, or uncharacteristic of a particular patient.
TRANSLATION: sí ìhùwàsí tí a ń retí tàbí àbùdà tí o yàtọ̀ sí ti agbàtọ́jú kan.

DEFINITION: expulsion or removal of all embryo or foetus from the uterus at a state of pregnancy when it is incapable of independent survival.
TRANSLATION: yíyọ oyún tàbí ọmọ nígbà tí a mọ̀ pé kò lè yè.

DEFINITION: Placentae Premature separation of the placenta from the site of implantation on the uterus before delivery of the foetus.
TRANSLATION: àti ilé ọmọ saájú ọjọ́ ìbímọ.

DEFINITION: contra- indication When a particular treatment or procedure should not be used under any circumstance because of the severe and potentially life-threatening risks involved.
TRANSLATION: Nígbà tí a bá ní kí á má lo ìlànà ìtọ́jú kan lábẹ́ bí ó tilẹ̀ wù kí ó rí nítorí pé ó lè la ẹ̀mí lọ.

DEFINITION: (V) Restrain oneself from doing or enjoying something.
TRANSLATION: láti ta kété sí ìgbádùn ohun kan. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 2

DEFINITION: Faithful Use Condoms (ABC) A popular HIV/AIDS prevention message.
TRANSLATION: , lílo rọ́ bà ìdáàbòbò Gbajúgbajà ìmọ̀ràn nípa KASA àti ààrùn ìsọdọ̀lẹ àjẹsára.

DEFINITION: practice of restraining oneself from indulging in something, typically alcohol or sex.
TRANSLATION: ìkó ara ẹni ní ìjánu nípa nǹkan pàápàá jùlọ ọtí mímu àti ìbálòpọ̀.

DEFINITION: nigricans A skin disorder characterized by velvety, light brown-to-black markings that develop mainly in the folds of the body, such as in the armpits, groin, and creases of the neck. Acanthosis nigricans can be an inherited condition or can occur as the result of an endocrine disorder, cancer, or use of certain medications.
TRANSLATION: Àwọ̀ ara tó yàtọ̀ látàrí kí apá kan yàtọ̀ sí àwọn tó kù pàápàá àwọn ibi ìsẹ́po ara bí i abíyá, abẹ́nú àti kòtò ọrùn. Àìsàn àwọ̀ ara yìí lè jẹ́ àjogúnbá, ajẹmọ́ ẹsẹ́, jẹjẹrẹ, tàbí nípa ìlo àwọn òògùn kan.

DEFINITION: to information This is the ability of having the opportunity to know what is going on in your environment.
TRANSLATION: Ọ̀ nà láti mọ ohun tó ń ṣẹlẹ̀ ní àyíká wa.

DEFINITION: inoculation An occupational exposure to HIV that occurs during the performance of job duties (by a nurse or doctor, for example). This includes a needlestick injury or cut with a sharp object, contact of mucous membranes (mouth, eyes), or contact of skin (especially when the exposed skin is chapped,
TRANSLATION: kokoro wọnu ara Ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ ẹnu iṣẹ́ tí ó máa mú ni dójú kọ ewu kíkó KASA(Bóyá dókítà tàbí nọ́ọ̀sì, bí àpẹẹrẹ). O lè jẹ́ láti ara abẹ́rẹ́ aláàílààbò tàbí ọgbẹ́ nípasẹ̀ ohun mímú, ìfarakan ìwọ̀ aṣekún (ẹnu tàbí ojú), tàbí ìfarakan ara (pàápàá nígbà tí awọ ẹnìkejì bá ti bó, ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 3 abraded, or afflicted with dermatitis – skin rash – or sores or the contact is prolonged or involving an extensive area) with blood, tissues, or other body fluids (stool, urine, vaginal secretions, saliva, mucus) to which universal precautions apply. dáranjẹ̀ tàbí ní egbò – tí ìfarakínra yìí bá pẹ́ tí ó sì ní ṣe pẹ̀lú ẹ̀jẹ̀, oje ara (ìgbẹ́, ìtọ̀, oje ojú ara, itọ́) àti àwọn nǹkan mìíràn tí ó pè fún ìsọra kárí- ayé.

DEFINITION: inherited, or present at birth (congenital), but developing after birth. It is obtained by one’s action.
TRANSLATION: se àjogúnbá, tàbí jẹyọ lásìkò ìbí, sùgbọ́n a máa wáyé lẹ́yìn bíbí. Ó lè jẹ́ nípasẹ̀ àfọwọ́fà.

DEFINITION: drug resistance When a drug-resistant strain of HIV emerges while a person is on antiretroviral therapy (ART) for the treatment of HIV infection.
TRANSLATION: tí KASA tí ó ti jáàgùn bá je ̣ yo ̣ nínú ènìyàn nígbà tí ẹni náà ń lo òògùn KASA lọ́wọ́ láti ṣe ìtọ́jú ìkóràn ìsọdọ̀lẹ àjẹsára.

DEFINITION: immunity Immunity that develops during a person’s lifetime. There are two types of acquired immunity: active immunity and passive immunity.
TRANSLATION: tí ó ń dàgba nígbà tí ẹni náà wà làáyè. Irú àjẹsára kíkó méjì ló wà: àtinúdá àti àìtinúdá.

DEFINITION: Immune Deficiency Syndrome (AIDS) Deficiency of cellular immunity induced by infection with the Human Immuno deficiency Virus (HIV1).
TRANSLATION: Ìsọ àjẹsára di ọ̀lẹ nípasẹ̀ ìkóràn kòkòrò asọ-àjẹsára ènìyàn di ọ̀lẹ. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 4

DEFINITION: is a process or state of acting or of being active.
TRANSLATION: ìgbésẹ̀ tàbí ipò ṣíṣe iṣẹ́.

DEFINITION: immunity Protection from a disease as a result of previous exposure to the disease- causing infectious agent or part of the infectious agent (antigen). The protection can be a result of having had the disease or having received a vaccine to prevent getting the disease.
TRANSLATION: lọ́wọ́ ààrùn gẹ́gẹ́ bí i èsì àbájáde ààrùn ìkóràn tàbí ẹ̀yà asojú àjèjì adára-lóró. Ààbò yìí le jẹ́ èsì níní ààrùn tàbí àti gba òògùn tó ń dẹ́kun kíkó ààrùn.

DEFINITION: Acute is the description of a disease of rapid onset, severe symptoms, and brief duration.
TRANSLATION: jẹ́ àlàyé àìsàn ìbẹ̀rẹ̀ kánkán, ó ní àpẹẹrẹ àmì tó gboró àti àkókó pérété.

DEFINITION: care clinics Urgent care is a category of walk-in clinic focused on the delivery of ambulatory care in a dedicated medical facility outside of a traditional emergency room.
TRANSLATION: àìsàn ògidì Itọ́jú kánjú ǹkánjú jẹ́ ẹ̀yà ìtọ́jú sárénbájà ní ibi ìwòsàn tó ní gbogbo irinṣẹ́ ìtọ́jú nínú yàtọ̀ sí yàrá ìtọ́jú pàjáwìrì.

DEFINITION: infection It is the primary stage of infection and lasts until the body has created antibodies against HIV. During this first stage of infection, the virus is replicating at a rapid rate.
TRANSLATION: péréte Èyí ni ìpìlẹ̀ ìkóràn tí ó sì wà títí di ìgba tí ara yóó fi pèsè àwọn sójà lòdì sí KASA. Ní àkókò ìpele àkóràn àkọ́kọ́, kòkòrò naa yóó máà ṣe ẹ̀dà ara rẹ̀ ní yanturu.

DEFINITION: infection An infection causing disease with a sudden onset, severity and (often) short course. As related to HIV infection: Once the virus enters the body, HIV infects a large number of
TRANSLATION: ìkóràn tó ń fa àìsàn òjijì tí ríro r ẹ̀ kéréjọjọ. P ẹ̀lú ìfarajọmọ́ ìkóràn KASA : nígbà tí kòkòrò yìí bá w ọ ara ọ̀pọ̀ CD4+ hóró T tó yara ní ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 5 CD4+ T cells and replicates rapidly. During this acute or primary phase of infection, the blood contains many viral particles that spread throughout the body, seeding themselves in various organs, particularly the lymphoid tissues. àfijọ. Ní ìbẹ̀rẹ̀ pẹ̀pẹ̀ ìkóràn, ẹ̀jẹ̀ a máa ní kòkòrò àìfojúrí tó ń tàn ká gbogbo ara pàápàá jùl ọ ẹ̀yà àrídìmú omi-ara.

DEFINITION: Infection and Early Diseases Research Program (AIEDRP) A federally funded research programme that studies how HIV infects humans and how the disease progresses to AIDS.
TRANSLATION: àìsàn péréte Ètò ìwádìí tí ìjọba àpapọ̀ ń fún lówó láti kọ́ bí ènìyàn ṣe máa ń kó ààrùn ìsọdọ̀lẹ àjẹsára àti bí àìsàn yìí ṣe máa ń di KASA.

DEFINITION: Inflammatory Demyelinating Polyneuropathy (AIDP) An autoimmune process that is characterized by progressive muscle weakness in the limbs and mild sensory symptoms. It is a disease that affects the nerves.
TRANSLATION: ìmọ̀lára Ètò àje ̣sára tí ó n fa àárè ̣ is ̣an oríkèé. Ó jẹ́ ààrùn tí ó ń fa àkóba fún ìmọ̀lára.

DEFINITION: Retroviral Syndrome The acute or primary HIV infection often passes unrecognized, but may be present as a mononucleosis-like syndrome within three months of the infection. The diagnosis is made by demonstrating HIV antigen in the blood.
TRANSLATION: kòkòrò Ògidì ìkóràn KASA ń wá láìfojúhàn, ó lè farahàn bí i àwọn àìsàn àgọ́ oníhórókan láàárín osù mẹ́ta. Ìdí àìsàn ni a lè sàfihàn sójà ara KASA fún ìyípadà omi ẹ̀jẹ̀.

DEFINITION: antiviral drug used especially in the treatment of herpes and AIDS.
TRANSLATION: Herpes Òògùn apa kòkòrò pàápàá tí a fí ń t ọ́jú herpes àti ààrùn ìsọdọ̀lé ajẹsára. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 6

DEFINITION: disease involving or causing the enlargement of glandular tissues, especially one involving the lymph nodes.
TRANSLATION: tí ó ń fa wíwú ẹsẹ́ pàápàá èyí tó ní aṣe-omi-ara.

DEFINITION: class of virus that causes inflammation.
TRANSLATION: adeno Ẹ̀ yà kòkòrò tí ó má ń fa wíwú ara.

DEFINITION: extent to which a patient continues the agreed-upon treatment as prescribed.
TRANSLATION: jú Iye ìgbà tí aláàisàn fí ń gbọ́ràn sí ìtọ́jú tí a yàn fún un.

DEFINITION: support Adherence support workers are important members of the antiretroviral therapy (ART) clinical team. They help improve patient adherence, knowledge, and understanding; provide education and counselling in the patient’s own language; and free nurses and doctors to focus on other clinical needs.
TRANSLATION: ìgbàtọ́ jú Alátìlẹhìn ìgbọ́ràn Ìgbàtọ́jú jẹ́ ọ̀kan pàtàkì nínú ẹgbẹ́ aṣètọ́jú ààrùn ajẹmọ́ ìsọdọ̀lẹ àjẹsára. Wọ́n a máa ṣe ìrànwọ́ láti jẹ́ kí aláìsàn gbọ́ràn sí àlàkalẹ̀ ìlò òògùn, ìmọ̀ àti òye rẹ̀ Wọn a máa fún aláìsàn ní ẹ̀kọ́ àti ìgbaninímọ̀ràn ní èdè aláìsàn gan-an, èyí sì jẹ́ kí àwọn dókítà àti nọ́ọ́sì ráyè fún ohun ajẹmọ́ ìsègùn mìíràn.

DEFINITION: to HIV Treatment “Treatment adherence” is a phrase that means taking your HIV drugs when and how you are supposed to.
TRANSLATION: ìgbàtọ́ jú KASA Èyí ni ìlànà lílo òògùn KASA bí ó ṣe tọ́ àti bí ó ṣe yẹ.

DEFINITION: ingredient − as in a prescription or solution − that facilitates or modifies the action of the principal ingredient, may be used in HIV therapies or for HIV vaccines.
TRANSLATION: a dàpọ̀mọ́ òògùn tàbí ọ̀nà àbáyọ sí èròjà pátápátá. A lè lò ó fún ìtọ́jú àìlera kòkòrò àti àjẹsára KASA. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 7

DEFINITION: of drugs (Route of Administration). A term used to refer to how a drug or therapy is introduced into the body. Systemic administration means that the drug goes throughout the body (usually carried in the bloodstream), and includes oral administration (by mouth) and intravenous administration (injection into the vein).
TRANSLATION: Èyí ni ọ̀rọ̀ ìperí tí ó túmọ̀ sí ọ̀nà tí òògùn tàbí ìtọ́jú kàn ń gbà wọnú ara. Ìsàkósò ilo òògùn elétò túmọ̀ sí pé òògùn yìí sàn ká gbogbo ara (inú ẹ̀jẹ̀ ni a ti máa ń gbé e ka), ó lè gba ẹnu tàbí ojú abẹ́rẹ́ wọlé.

DEFINITION: Reaction (ADR) Any unintended, undesirable response to a drug taken at a normal dose for normal use. Adverse drug reactions (ADRs) are classified by onset, severity, and type.
TRANSLATION: èsì lílo òògùn ní àìròtẹ́lẹ̀ nípa bí ó ṣe yẹ kí á lò òògùn náà. Àìbáramu òògùn ni a lè pín sí ìsọ̀rí ìbẹ̀ẹ̀rẹ̀, ìdíbàjẹ́ àti ẹ̀yà.

DEFINITION: event In a clinical trial, this is an unwanted effect detected in participants. The term is used whether or not the effect can be attributed to the intervention under study.
TRANSLATION: ti ajẹmọ́-ìtọ́jú, rírí ipa àìfẹ́ lára àwọn akópa wà. Ọ̀ rọ̀ ìperí yìí ni à ń lò ìbáà jẹ́ pé ipa náà dá lórí ìdásí tí ìwádìí tí ó ń lọ lọ́wọ́.

DEFINITION: form of a drug such as pentamidine, turned into a fine spray or mist by a nebulizer and inhaled.
TRANSLATION: Ọ̀ kan lára àwọn òògùn bíi pentamidine tí a yí padà sí aṣeéfin tàbí dàpọ̀ mọ́ nebulizer tí ó ṣe é fi imú fà.

DEFINITION: community This includes HIV-positive people, persons living with AIDS and other individuals, including their families, friends and advocates, directly
TRANSLATION: Èyí jẹ́ àwọn tó n gbé pẹ̀lú KASA, àti àwọn tí wọ́n ń gbé pẹ̀lú ààrùn ìsọdọ̀lẹ àjẹsára tí tí ó fi kan àwọn ènìyàn mìíràn ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 8 impacted by HIV infection and its physical, psychological and sociological ramifications. bíi ẹbí, ọ̀rẹ́ àti alágbàwí, àwọn tí ọ̀rọ́ ìkóràn KASA kàn gan- an bóyá ti àfojúrí, ìfòyemọ̀ tàbí ìfarakínra.

DEFINITION: nemia A near total absence of antibodies (immunoglobulins) resulting in the loss of ability to produce immune antibodies.
TRANSLATION: sójà ara ní èyí tí ó lè yọrí sí pípàdánù okun láti pèse ajẹsára àwọn sójà ara.

DEFINITION: for Health Care Policy and Research (AHCPR) An agency of the Public Health Service that supports activities to enhance health care services and improve access to them.
TRANSLATION: ìlànà ìtọ́ jú Àjọ ìsèwádìí àti ìlànà ìtọ́jú tí ó pèsè ìrànwọ́ ìlera fún gbogbo ènìyàn àti ọ̀nà tí wọn yóò gbà gba ìtọ́jú náà.

DEFINITION: bibliography The National Library of Medicine publishes the monthly AIDS Bibliography, which includes all citations from the AIDSLINE database.
TRANSLATION: àjẹsára Ilé-ìyáwèékàwèé ìsègùn orílẹ̀- èdè máa ń tẹ àbájáde ìwádìí onírúurú tí ó ti inú àká ìsọdọ̀lẹ-àjẹsára ti orí intánẹ́ẹ̀tì jáde lósoosù.

DEFINITION: case definition Diagnostic criteria for AIDS established by the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC). To be diagnosed with AIDS, a person with HIV must have an AIDS-defining condition or have a CD4 count less than 200 cells/mm3.
TRANSLATION: Òsùwọ̀n ìsàwárí fún ààrùn ìsọdọ̀lẹ àjẹsára tí a gbékalẹ̀ láti ọwọ́ ibi-iṣẹ́ fún ìdarí àti ìdẹ́kun ààrùn. Láti sọ pé ẹni kan ni KASA, ẹni bẹ́ẹ̀ gbúdọ̀ ni àwọn asàfihàn ìsọdọ̀lẹ àjẹsára tábí kí òǹkà CD4 dín si hóró 200/mm.

DEFINITION: Clinical Trials Group (ACTG) The ACTG is composed of a number of US medical centres that evaluate treatment for HIV and HIV-associated
TRANSLATION: ACTG ni àwọn ẹ̀ka tàbí ibùdó ìsègùn ní orílẹ̀-èdè Amẹ́ríkà tí ó ń ṣe ìtọ́jú KASA ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 9 infections. ACTG studies are sponsored by the National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases. àti àwọn ààrùn ìkóràn tí wọ́n fara pẹ́ ẹ. Ìwádìí ACTG ní NIAID maa ń ṣe onígbọ̀wọ́ rẹ̀.

DEFINITION: Control Programme (ACP) Country specific programms set up to control the spread of HIV infection.
TRANSLATION: ìsọdọ̀lẹ àjẹsára Àwo ̣n ètò aje ̣mo ̣-orílè ̣-èdè ti a dá sílè ̣ láti dènà ìtànká ààrùn Ìsọdọ̀lẹ Àjẹsára.

DEFINITION: defining illness AIDS defining illnesses are conditions that, in the setting of a HIV infection, confirm the diagnosis of AIDS.
TRANSLATION: ìsọdọ̀lẹ àjẹsára Àìsàn ìṣàfihàn ààrùn ìṣọdọ̀lẹ àjẹsára jẹ́ ipò ṣíse ètò fún ìkóràn KASA àti ìdánilójú ìdámọ̀ ìṣọdọ̀lẹ àjẹsára.

DEFINITION: Dementia Complex (ADC) (HIV-associated dementia or HAD) A degenerative (destructive) neurological condition attributed to HIV infection, characterized by a group of clinical presentations including loss of coordination, mood swings, loss of inhibitions, and widespread inability to think. It is the most common central nervous system complication of HIV infection.
TRANSLATION: -ìsọdọ̀lẹ àjẹsára (KASA ajẹmọ́ ààrùn ọpọlọ) ọ̀kan lára àìsiṣẹ́ dédé ọpọlọ èyí tí ìkóràn KASA sokùnfà rẹ̀, ó sì ní àbùdá ìgbékalẹ̀ iṣẹ́ ìṣègùn pẹ̀lú pípàdánù ọ̀nà ìgbẹ́kalẹ̀ nù, ìsesí ìfipamọ́, àdánù ìfàséhìn àti àìlè ronú lọ́nà gbòrò. Ó jẹ́ ọ̀nà kan pàtàkì sí ètò gbùngbun aṣàkóso ara sí ìdákún ìkóràn KASA.

DEFINITION: Assistance Programs (ADAPs) Federally funded programmes that provide medications and other HIV- related services to low-income, uninsured, and underinsured people with HIV/AIDS.
TRANSLATION: ààrùn ìṣọdọ̀lẹ àjẹsára Ètò tí ìjọba àpapọ̀ sagbátẹrù rẹ̀ tí ó ń pèsè òògùn àti àwọn àkànṣe iṣẹ́ ajẹmọ́ KASA fún àwọn tí wọn kò lówó púpọ̀ lọ́wọ́. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 10

DEFINITION: drugs Any substance, other than food, used in the prevention, diagnosis, alleviation, treatment, and cure of AIDS disease.
TRANSLATION: àjẹsára Ohunkóhun tí a lè lò yàtọ̀ sí ouńjẹ fún ìdènà, ìdámọ̀, ìtọ́jú àti ìwòsàn ìsọdọ̀lẹ ajẹ́sára.

DEFINITION: Education and Training Centers (AETC) The centers train primary caregivers to incorporate HIV prevention strategies into their clinical priorities, along with diagnosis, counselling and care of HIV-infected persons and their families.
TRANSLATION: ìsọdọ̀lẹ àjẹsára Ibi-iṣẹ́ náà ń pèṣè ẹ̀kọ́ fún àwọn olùtọ́jú láti sánnà ìdènà ìtànkálẹ̀ KASA pẹ̀lú ìdámọ̀ àìsàn, ìgbaniníyànjú àti ìtọ́jú àwọn tí wọ́n ń gbé pẹ̀lú KASA àti àwọn ẹbí wọn.

DEFINITION: knowledge base Full-text electronic database on AIDS, available in print as well as electronic form, produced and maintained by physicians and other health care professionals.
TRANSLATION: ààrùn ìṣọdọ̀lẹ àjẹsára Àká kíkún adálórí àbájade ìwádìí ààrùn ìsodọ̀lẹ àjẹsára tí a tẹ̀ jáde tàbí wà ní inú ohun èlò aloná mìíràn tí a pèsè tàbí ṣe ìtọ́jú rẹ̀ láti ọwọ́ àwọn oníṣègùn àti àwọn òsìṣẹ́ elétò ìlera mìíràn.

DEFINITION: Prevention Initiative in Nigeria (APIN) APIN is a leading Nigerian organization in the provision of prevention, care and treatment services to patients with HIV/AIDS and other diseases of public health significance.
TRANSLATION: APIN jé ̣ as ̣aájú nínú ìpèsè aáyan ìdènà ààrùn ìso ̣dò ̣le ̣ àje ̣sára àti ìtó ̣jú àwo ̣n aláàrùn náà pè ̣lú àwo ̣n ààrùn tó gbile ̣ ní àyíká.

DEFINITION: Research Advisory Committee Board that advises and makes recommendations to the Director, National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases, on all aspects of HIV-related research, vaccine
TRANSLATION: ìgbaninímọ̀- ràn ìṣèwàdìí ààrùn ìṣọdọ̀lẹ àjẹsára Ìgbìmọ̀-ìgbaninímọ̀ràn tí ó sì ń tún dábàá fún olùdarí ti ìbi ìwádìí ààrùn ìkóràn orílẹ̀-èdè lórí gbogbo ìwàdìí ààrùn ajẹmọ́ KASA, síṣẹ̀dá àjẹsára, ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 11 development, pathogenesis and epidemiology. ìbẹ̀rẹ̀ àìsàn ara àti ẹ̀kọ́ nípa ààrùn.

DEFINITION: Service Organization (ASO) A health association, support agency or other service active in the prevention and treatment of AIDS.
TRANSLATION: jú ààrùn ìṣọdọ̀lẹ àjẹsára Ẹgbẹ́ ètò ìlera, àjọ àṣèràwọ́ tàbí ẹka mìíràn tí wọ́n ń sa ipá láti dẹ́kun àti láti se ìtọ́jú ààrùn ìṣọdọ̀lẹ àjẹsára.

DEFINITION: vaccine A special preparation of anti-genetic material that can be used to stimulate the development of antibodies and thus confer active immunity against AIDS.
TRANSLATION: ìṣọdọ̀lẹ Àkànṣe ìpèsè òògùn tó n ru ìdàgbàsókè sójà ara sókè kí ó sì fún àjẹsára ní agbára láti lòdì sí ààrùn ìṣọdọ̀lẹ àjẹsára.

DEFINITION: Wasting Syndrome An AIDS-defining condition that includes at least 10% weight loss in the presence of diarrhea, chronic weakness, and documented fever for at least 30 days that is not the result of another infection or disease. In developing countries, it is often called "slim disease."
TRANSLATION: ìsọdọ̀lẹ àjẹsára Ipò àlàyé nípa ààrùn ìṣọdọ̀lẹ àjẹsára nípa síṣọ ìwọ̀n ìdá mẹ́wà nù sí ìgbẹ́ gbuuru, àárẹ̀ líle àti ibà fún bíi ọgbọ̀njọ́ tí kìí ṣe àbàjáde ìkóràn ààrùn mìíràn. Ní àwọn orílẹ̀-èdè tí ó ń ṣẹ̀ṣẹ̀ ń dìde bọ̀, wọ́n tún máa ń pè é ní àìsàn gbígbẹ.

DEFINITION: Aidsline is a statewide confidential information, counselling and referral service on HIV/AIDS.
TRANSLATION: ìgbaninímọ̀- ràn nípa ààrùn ìṣọdọ̀lẹ àjẹsára Ojú òpó ìgbaninímọ̀ràn, ìfitónilétí àti ètò mímúni lọ sí ibi ìtọ́jú mìíràn lórí KASA/ ààrùn ìṣọdọ̀lẹ àjẹsára.

DEFINITION: Cancers Several cancers are more common or more aggressive in persons living with HIV. These malignancies include
TRANSLATION: ìsọdọ̀lẹ àjẹsára Ọ̀ pọ̀lọpọ̀ jẹjẹrẹ ló máa n fara hàn lára ẹni tó n gbé pẹ̀lú KASA. Awọn wọ̀yìí ni jẹjẹrẹ ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 12 certain types of immune system cancers known as lymphomas, kaposi sarcoma, and anogenital cancers that primarily affect the anus and the cervix. nínú àjẹsára tí a mọ̀ sí omi- ara, àti jẹjẹrẹ inú ihò-ìdí tí ó máa n ṣe àkóbá fún àbáwọlé ilé ọmọ.

DEFINITION: Complex (ARC) (Early symptomatic HIV infection) A group of common complications found in early stages of HIV infection. They include progressive generalized lymphadenopathy (PGL), recurrent fever, unexplained weight loss, swollen lymph nodes, diarrhoea, herpes, hairy leukoplakia, fungus infection of the mouth and throat, and the presence of HIV antibodies.
TRANSLATION: ìsọdọ̀lẹ àjẹsára (Ìfihàn ìkóràn KASA) Àkójọpọ̀ ìpìlẹ̀ ìfihàn ààrùn KASA lójú ọjọ́. Wọ́n jẹ́ àpapọ̀ aṣẹ́ oje omi ara, àìsàn ọrọọrún, ìwọ̀n jíjá, ìgbẹ́ gbuuru abbl.

DEFINITION: online database service administered by the National Library of Medicine, with information about clinical trials of agents under evaluation against HIV infection, AIDS and related opportunistic infections.
TRANSLATION: ìṣọdọ̀lẹ àjẹsára Àká iṣẹ́ ti orí íntánẹ́ẹ̀tì tí àjọ ilé-ìyáwèé-kàwé ti ijọba àpapọ̀ ń sagbátẹrù pẹ̀lú ìfitónilétí nipa ìtọ́jú ajẹmọ́-ìwádìí àti àyèwò àwọn ti wọ́n ni ìkọ́ràn KASA, ààrùn ìsọdọ̀lẹ ajẹ̀sára àti àwọn àìsàn akófà mìíràn.

DEFINITION: disease Diseases or bacteria that are spread through the air.
TRANSLATION: Àìsàn tàbí batéríà tí wọ́n ń tàn ká nípa afẹ́fẹ́.

DEFINITION: Aminotransferase (ALT) A liver enzyme that plays a role in protein metabolism. Abnormally high blood levels of ALT are a sign of liver
TRANSLATION: ẹ̀dọ̀ Ẹ́ ńsáìmù ẹ̀dọ̀ tó n kó ipa pàtàkì nínú ìyóró purotéènì. Ipò àìyẹ ẹ̀jẹ̀ onípele gíga jẹ́ àmì ẹ̀dọ̀ ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 13 inflammation or damage from infection or drugs. A normal level is below approximately 50 IU/L. wíwú tàbí bíbàjẹ́ láti inú ìkóràn tàbí àwọn òògùn. Ìpele tí ó dára wà ní nǹkan bíi ipele 50 ti IU/L.

DEFINITION: protein made by the liver and found in high concentrations in blood. This protein may be measured as part of a liver function test.
TRANSLATION: Purotéènì ẹ̀dọ̀ Purotéènì tí ẹ̀dọ̀fóró ń pèsè tí a rí nínú ẹ̀jẹ̀. Ìwọn purotéènì yìí ni a fi ṣe òdiwọ̀n bí ẹ̀dọ̀fóró ṣe ń ṣiṣẹ́.

DEFINITION: phosphatase An enzyme normally present in certain cells within the liver, bone, kidney, intestine, and placenta. When the cells are destroyed in those tissues, more of the enzyme leaks into the blood, and levels rise in proportion to the severity of the condition. Measurement of this enzyme is used as an indication of the health of the liver.
TRANSLATION: eegun àti inú Ẹ́ ńsáìmù tí o wà nínú àwọn inú ẹ̀dọ̀fóró, eegun, kídìrín, ìfun àti ibi ọmọ. Lẹ́yìn tí a ti pa àwọn hónínú ìṣù, àwọn ẹnsaimu yìí wá máa jò sínú ẹ̀jẹ̀, tí ipò wọn máa wá ga sí i. òsùwọ̀n ẹnsaimu ni a fí n ṣe ìtọ́kasí ìlera ẹ̀dọ̀.

DEFINITION: vera A juice or jelly substance obtained from the leaves of an aloe plant used as a soothing treatment for the skin and burns as well as in cosmetics; any of the succulent plant having spiky leaves which yield the jelly and juice.
TRANSLATION: ohun èròjà tí a n rí lára ewé aloe, tí a n lò fún ìtọ́jú ara páàpáà ibi tó jóná àti fún ìkunjú. Èyíkéyìí igi tó ní ewé sóńsó tí ó sì ní oje yíyọ̀.

DEFINITION: of hair that frequently occurs in patients undergoing treatment for cancer or suffering from other
TRANSLATION: ríre jẹ́ èyí tí ó sábà máa ń farahàn lára aláìsàn tí ó n gba ìtọ́jú àìsàn jẹjẹrẹ tàbí irúfẹ́ ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 14 diseases, such as AIDS, where cell- killing, or cytotoxic, drugs are used. àìsàn mìíràn bíi ààrùn ìṣọdọ̀lẹ àjẹsára tàbí níbi tí òògùn tí ó pa àwọ hóró ti di lílò.

DEFINITION: Interferon (Interferon Alpha, IFN) A protein produced by the immune system in response to infection that assists in controlling virus infection.
TRANSLATION: Purotéènì Aṣèdáàbòbò Purotéènì tí àjẹsára ń pèsè ní ìdáhùn sí ìkóràn tó n ṣe ìrànwọ́ fún dídarí ìkóràn kòkòrò.

DEFINITION: test site Alternate site refers to testing blood glucose on parts of the body other than the fingertip: most commonly the forearm, palm or thigh.
TRANSLATION: kan Èyí ni àyẹ̀wò gúlúkóòsì ẹ̀jẹ̀ nínú ẹ̀yà ara yàtọ̀ sí góńgó orí ìka. A sábà máa n ṣe ní ìṣàlẹ̀ apá, àtẹlẹwọ́ tàbí itan.

DEFINITION: therapy This refers to any type of medicine that supplements or is used in lieu of biomedicine ( i.e. conventional medicine) or allopathic medicine. In other parts of the world, where traditional medicine predominates, the term may refer to biomedicine itself.
TRANSLATION: mìíràn Ẹ̀ yà ìṣègùn mìíràn tí a lò gẹ́gẹ́ bí afikún tàbí rọ́pò ìṣègùn òyìnbó. Ní ibi tí ìṣègùn ibílẹ̀ ti gbalẹ̀ ìsègùn òyìnbó náà lè jẹ́ ìtọ́jú àìlera mìíràn

DEFINITION: Complementary medicine A broad category of treatment systems (e.g. chiropractic, herbal medicine, acupuncture, homeopathy, naturopathy, and spiritual devotions) or culturally based healing traditions such as Chinese, Ayurvedic, and Christian science. It shares the common characteristic of non- acceptance by the biomedical (i.e. mainstream Western) establishment.
TRANSLATION: mìíràn Ẹka ètò ìwòsàn ńlá (bí àpẹẹrẹ, àgbo/tewé tegbò, ètò ìtọ́jú ìbáramu ààrùn, ìtọ́jú tí kò lọ́wọ́ òògùn nínú, ètò àdúrà) tàbí ìwòsàn ajẹ́mọ́ àṣà ìbílẹ̀ bíi ti Sáníìsì, ìtọ́jú aláìlóògùn àti sáyẹ́nsì kìrìsìtẹ́nì. Gbogbo wọn ló ni àbùdá aláìṣeégbà àwọn ìṣègùn òyìnbó. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 15

DEFINITION: Potassium aluminum sulfate or ammonium aluminum sulfate, used especially as an emetic (i.e. an agent that induces vomiting), an astringent (i.e. a substance that contracts tissues) and styptic (i.e. a substance that tends to check bleeding by contracting the tissues or blood vessels).
TRANSLATION: aálò ̣mù fún fífa èébì àti fún ìdé ̣kun ̣s ̣ís ̣è ̣jè ̣sí.

DEFINITION: Pertaining to the alveoli sac, the site of gas exchange in the lungs.
TRANSLATION: àpò ẹ̀dọ̀fóró, àyè ìpààrọ̀ gáásì nínú ẹ̀dọ̀fóró.

DEFINITION: inflammation of the intestines caused by infection with Entamoeba histolytica (a type of ameba) and characterized by frequent, loose stools flecked with blood and mucus.
TRANSLATION: Ìfun wíwú tó wá láti ipaṣè Entamoeba histolytica ẹ̀yà àmíbà. Ó máa n fa ìgbẹ́ ẹlẹ́jẹ̀ àti ikun.

DEFINITION: acids Typically, an amino acid of the general formular R- CHNH3 +- COO ̅ (i.e. the amino in the α position); the L forms of these are the hydrolysis products of proteins. In rarer usages, this class of molecules also includes α- amino phosphoric acids and α- amino- sulfonic acids.
TRANSLATION: peptide Hóró peptide jẹ́ ara èròjà àwọn purotéénì.

DEFINITION: surgical insertion of a hollow needle through the abdominal wall and into the uterus of a pregnant female to obtain amniotic fluid (i.e. the serous
TRANSLATION: Ìfamira Iṣẹ́ abẹ fífi abẹ́rẹ́ sí ilé ọmọ aláboyún lọ́nà àti gba oje ara. Pàápàá júlọ láti ṣe àyẹ̀wò ìṣe- ṣégeṣè kírómósónù tí ó ṣe ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 16 fluid in which the embryo is suspended) especially to examine the fetal chromosomes for an abnormality or for the determination of the sex of the embryo. pàtàkì tàbí mọ akọnbábo ọmọ nínú oyún.

DEFINITION: is an antifungal drug often used intravenously for serious systemic fungal infections and it is the only effective treatment for some fungal infections.
TRANSLATION: ọ̀súnwúúrú Èyí ni òògùn tí a fí n kojú ọ̀súnwúúrú, ó jẹ́ òògùn ìtọ́jú tí ó tó kojú ìkóràn ọ̀súnwúúrú.

DEFINITION: intercourse/Anal sex A type of sexual intercourse in which a man inserts his penis in his partner's anus. Anal sex can be insertive or receptive.
TRANSLATION: ìbálòpọ̀ èyí tí ọkùnrin n ní ìbálòpọ̀ lójú ihò-ìdí. Oníbàálòpò ̣-ìhò-ìdí lè jẹ́ ẹni tí ó gbà á tàbí ẹni tí ó ń tì í bọ̀ ọ́.

DEFINITION: response The heightened immunologic reaction elicited by a second or subsequent exposure to a particular pathogenic microorganism or antigen.
TRANSLATION: àjẹsára sí ìtànjáde àjèjì adáralóró.

DEFINITION: shock A life-threatening allergic reaction characterized by a swelling of body tissues (including the throat) and a sudden decline in blood pressure.
TRANSLATION: wọ́ Ìṣesí amẹ́mìí-lọ́wọ́ máa ń mú ìṣù ara àti ọ̀fun wú pẹ̀lú àdínkù ìfúnpá lójijì.

DEFINITION: condition in which the number of red blood cells/mm³, the count of hemoglobin in 100 ml of blood, and/ or the volume of packed red blood cells/100ml of blood are less than normal.
TRANSLATION: ní èyí tí iye ẹ̀jẹ̀ pupa hóró/mm3, ònkà hóró ẹ̀jẹ̀ agbẹ̀ẹ̀mí 100ml nínú ẹ̀jẹ̀ àti ìwọ̀n gbogbo hóró /100ml kéré ju ìwọ̀n síṣedéédé wọn lọ. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 17

DEFINITION: loss or weakening of the body's immunity to an irritating agent, or antigen. Patients may be so immunodeficient that they are unable to produce a reaction to an infectious agent.
TRANSLATION: Ìpàdánù tàbí rírẹ ajẹsára láti dojú kọ ajèjì adáralóró. Aláìsàn lè sàìní-àjẹsára tó bẹ́ẹ̀ ti wọn kò ní lè pèsè ohun èlò ìdojúkọ àwọn ìkóràn.

DEFINITION: cheilitis It is characterized by fissuring, cracking, burning and dryness at the angles of the mouth. Saliva seeps into these cracks leading to maceration of skin.
TRANSLATION: ẹnu a máa ní àkójọ ẹnu wíwú, ṣísun àti bíbẹ́ ní apákan ẹnu. Itọ́ a máa sun jáde ní ojú ibẹ̀.

DEFINITION: products An animal product is any material derived from the body of an animal. Examples are fat, flesh, blood, milk, eggs, and lesser known products, such as isinglass and rennet.
TRANSLATION: ẹranko Èyí jẹ́ àwọn èròjà tí a rí láti ara ẹranko bíi ọ̀rá, ẹran, ẹ̀jẹ̀, wàrà, ẹyun àti àwọn nǹkan mìíràn tó wúlò bíi ohun amáradàgbà àti ohun tí a fí n fún wàrà.

DEFINITION: Related to the anal (rectum) and/or genital (sexual) area of the body.
TRANSLATION: abẹ́ ara.

DEFINITION: Without an ability to identify a person. In anonymous testing, patient- identifying information is not linked to testing information, including the request for tests or test results.
TRANSLATION: fún ènìyàn. Nípa ti àìlórúkọ, ìfitónilétí nípa aláìsàn ní kìí sábà tọ́kasí irú ènìyàn bẹ́ ẹ̀, pẹ̀lú ìṣàyẹ̀wò tàbí èsì àyẹ̀wò.

DEFINITION: lack or loss of appetite that leads to significant decline in weight.
TRANSLATION: Àìrebipa Àìsí tàbí pípàdánù ìfẹ́ àti jẹun tí ó sì lè ṣe okùnfà rírù. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 18

DEFINITION: of a number of cud-chewing deer- like animals having hollow horns.
TRANSLATION: lára eranko igbó tí ó ní tẹ̀kòtò ìwo.

DEFINITION: clinic (ANC) The Antenatal Clinic aims to provide increased continuity of pregnancy care.
TRANSLATION: aláboyún Ilé ìtọ́jú aláboyún ní àfojúsùn àti pèsè ìtọ́jú tó peye fún ìtọ́jú olóyún.

DEFINITION: time/period before childbirth. Antepartum refers to the mother.
TRANSLATION: saájú ọmọ bíbí. Àsìkò ìrọbí ń sọ nípa ìyá.

DEFINITION: Highly infectious, often fatal, bacterial disease of mammals, especially cattle and sheep, that is transmissible to humans and causes skin ulcers cutaneous anthrax or a form of pneumonia when inhaled pulmonary anthrax. Kòkòrò
TRANSLATION: máa ń ràn gan-an, ó sì lágbára. Láti ara àwọn ẹranko bíi màálù àti àgùntàn ni a ti máa ń kó o wọ ara ènìyàn ó sì le fa ọgbẹ́ ààwọ̀, òmìíràn tún wa ní fífín sí imú tí a fa àńtírásì ọ̀nà ọ̀fun.

DEFINITION: Medication
TRANSLATION: Antiretroviral drug. Òògùn KASA Òògùn KASA.

DEFINITION: natural or manufactured substance that prevents the growth of bacteria or fungi. Some antibiotics are used to treat infectious diseases.
TRANSLATION: batéríà Àwọn àkànṣe èròjà tó n dènà ìdàgbàsókè batéríà tàbí ọ̀súnwúúrú. Àwọn òògùn apa kòkòrò batéríà kan ní a máa ńlò fún ìtọ́jú ààrùn ìkóràn.

DEFINITION: Substances in the blood or other body fluids that destroy bacteria, viruses, or other harmful agents (antigens). They are members of a class of proteins known as immunoglobulins, which are
TRANSLATION: èròjà inú ẹ̀jẹ̀ tàbí oje ara tó n pa batéríà, kòkòrò àti àjèjì adáralóró. Wọ́n jẹ́ ọ̀kan lára purotéénì tí hóró ẹ̀jẹ̀ funfun ń pèsè. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 19 produced by special white blood cells called B-lymphocytes.

DEFINITION: Dependent Cell-Mediated Cytotoxicity (ADCC) An immune response in which antibodies bind to target cells, identifying them for attack by the immune system.
TRANSLATION: afararúbọ Ìdáhùn àjẹsára tí sójà ara sopọ̀ mọ́ hóró àfojúsùn, a ṣe ìdámọ̀ wọn fún ìdojúkọ.

DEFINITION: mediated immunity Also called humoral immunity. Immunity that results from the activity of antibodies in blood and lymphoid tissue.
TRANSLATION: inú ẹ̀jẹ̀ Èyí ni àjẹsára iṣẹ́ àkànṣe nínú ẹ̀jẹ̀ àti ìṣù omi-ara.

DEFINITION: drug used to prevent the blood from clotting.
TRANSLATION: jẹ́ àkànṣe òògùn tí a n lò láti dènà ẹ̀jẹ̀ dídì.

DEFINITION: agent that inhibits intracellular (i.e. inside cells) production of folinic acid.
TRANSLATION: asojú tí o máa ń dójúti hóró inú fún ìpèsè àpò ásìdì.

DEFINITION: substance that kills or slows the growth of a fungus.
TRANSLATION: osunwuuru Àwọn èròjà kan tó n pa tàbí fi ìdàgbàsókè osunwuuru falẹ̀.

DEFINITION: substance that, when introduced into the body, stimulates production of an antibody.
TRANSLATION: tí a máa n lò sínú ara, a máa ru ìpèsè sójà ara sókè.

DEFINITION: Presenting Cell (APC) A type of immune cell that enables a T lymphocyte (T cell) to recognize an antigen and mount an immune response against the antigen.
TRANSLATION: Ẹ̀ yà hóró àjẹsára tí ó ń fi àyè gba hóró T láti ṣe ìdámọ̀ àjèjì adáralóró. Èyí a máa mú kí ìdáhùn àjẹsára jẹ gàba lórí àjèji adáralóró. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 20

DEFINITION: drug or other compound that inhibits the physiological effects of histamine, used especially in the treatment of allergies.
TRANSLATION: ara Òògùn tàbí àkójọpọ̀ mìíràn tí ó ń dójúti ìtají ara tí a n lò fun ìtọ́jú ẹ̀hun.

DEFINITION: antimicrobial therapy kills or inhibits the growth of microorganisms such as bacteria, fungi, or protozoans. Therapies that kill microorganisms are called microbiocidal therapies and therapies that only inhibit the growth of microorganisms are called micro- biostatic therapies.
TRANSLATION: ara Òògùn apa kòkòrò ara máa n pa tàbí dójúti ìdàgbàsókè Abẹ̀ẹ̀mí-àìfojúrí bíi batéríà, osunwuuru àti pùrótósúà. Ìsègùn tí ó ń pa abẹ̀ẹ̀mí- àìfojúrí ni à ń pè ni ìsègùn micro biocida, èyí ti o si n dènà ìdàgbàsókè abẹ̀ẹ̀mí àìfojúrí ni a ń pè ní isegun micro biostatic.

DEFINITION: substance that prevents the development or growth of tumour.
TRANSLATION: Èròjà tó n dènà ìdàgbàsókè jẹjẹrẹ.

DEFINITION: substance that kills or inhibits the growth of single-celled microorganisms called protozoa, such as Pneumocystis jiroveci. Apa
TRANSLATION: n pa tàbí dènà ìdàgbàsókè abẹ̀ẹ̀mí àìfojúrí oníhóró kan tí a mọ̀ sí pùrótósúà.

DEFINITION: substance that suppresses a retrovirus such as HIV.
TRANSLATION: tó n pa tàbí fòpin sí kòkòrò àìfojúrí bíi KASA.

DEFINITION: agents Substances used against retroviruses such as HIV.
TRANSLATION: èròjà tí a n lò lòdì sí kòkòrò KASA.

DEFINITION: drugs Substances used to stop the multiplication of retroviruses such as HIV.
TRANSLATION: tó ń ṣe ìdádúró ìtànkálẹ̀ bíi KASA. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 21

DEFINITION: Therapy (ART) The recommended treatment for HIV infection. Antiretroviral therapy (ART) involves using a combination of three or more antiretroviral (ARV) drugs from at least two different HIV drug classes to prevent HIV from replicating. Itoju fun ikoran-KASA
TRANSLATION: fòǹtẹ̀ lù fún títọ́jú ìkóràn KASA. Òògùn apa- kòkòrò yìí jẹ́ àkójọpọ̀ òògùn apa KASA méjì tàbí jù bẹ́ẹ̀ lọ láti dènà ìsẹ̀dà rẹ̀.

DEFINITION: Toxic Neuropathy Nerve damage that is due to antiretroviral (ARV) drugs.
TRANSLATION: KASA Ìmọ̀lára to bàjẹ́ nítorí òògùn apa KASA.

DEFINITION: Antiviral A drug made of short segments of DNA or RNA that can bind to and alter or suppress the function of viral DNA or RNA. Antisense antivirals prevent viruses from replicating.
TRANSLATION: ìgbèrú kòkòrò Ìpele òògùn tí a pèsè láti ara DNA tàbí RNA tí ó lè mú àtúnṣe bá DNA tàbí RNA kòkòrò.

DEFINITION: Antibodies that recognize and inactivate toxins produced by certain bacteria, plants or animals.
TRANSLATION: Sójà tí ó ń ṣe ìdámọ̀ ohun olóró latí ara bateria, ohun ọ̀gbìn tàbí àwọn èranko.

DEFINITION: substance or process that destroys a virus or suppresses its replication.
TRANSLATION: Agbógunti kòkòrò Èròjà tó n pa kòkòrò àti àwọn ẹ̀dà wọn.

DEFINITION: Feeling or showing worry, nervousness, or unease about something with an uncertain outcome.
TRANSLATION: àìnífọ̀kànbalẹ̀ tàbí àìní ìrọ̀rùn lóri àbájáde nǹkan.

DEFINITION: main artery in mammals that carries blood from the left ventricle of
TRANSLATION: Ọ̀ gangan òpó ìpínjẹ̀ wẹẹrẹ tó n gbé ẹ̀jẹ̀ láti inú odò ọkàn sí ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 22 the heart to all the branch arteries in the body except those in the lungs. gbogbo ẹ̀ka òpó nínú ara yàtò sí ẹ̀dọ̀fóró.

DEFINITION: ulcer A painful mouth or throat sore of unknown cause. Aphthous ulcers are common in persons living with HIV.
TRANSLATION: ẹnu aláìnídì. Ó wọ́po lára àwọn tó ń gbé pẹ̀lú KASA.

DEFINITION: normal type of cell death that removes unwanted cells during embryological development, regulates the number of cells in tissues, and eliminates many potentially dangerous cells such as cancer cells.
TRANSLATION: Ẹ̀ yà ikú hóró tí ó ń yọ àwọn hóhó àìfẹ́ ní àkókò ìdàgbàsókè ọlẹ̀, a tún máa sòdiwọ̀n iye hóró nínú ìṣù, a sì máa yọ àwọn hóró tí wọ́n léwu bíi hóró jẹjẹrẹ.

DEFINITION: drugs In the United States, the Food and Drug Administration (FDA) and similar government departments must approve a substance as a drug before it can be sold.
TRANSLATION: Amẹrika, ìṣàkóso òògùn àti oúnjẹ àti ẹ̀ka ìjọba tí wọ́n jẹ́ ìkannáà gbó ̣dò ̣ fóntẹ̀ lu èròjà òògùn kí ó tó di títá.

DEFINITION: apron is an outer protective garment that covers primarily the front of the body. It may be worn for hygienic reasons as well as in order to protect clothes from wear and tear, or else due to a symbolic meaning.
TRANSLATION: aṣọ tí a n wọ̀ lórí olú aṣọ ní àgọ́ọ ara. Ó lè jẹ́ àwọ̀lé torí ìmọ̀tótó tàbí bo aṣọ torí kí aṣọ gangan ma ba gbó tàbí fàya, tàbí fún àmì ìdí kan pàtó.

DEFINITION: Under the Curve (AUC) A measure of how much drug reaches a person’s bloodstream in a given period of time after a dose is given. The information is useful for determining dosing and for identifying potential drug interactions.
TRANSLATION: Òdiwọ́n iye òògùn tí ó wọ inú ẹ̀jẹ̀ ní àsìkò ìgbà tí a lo òògùn tán. Ìfitónilétí yìí wúlò láti mọ ìwọ̀n òògùn àti ìmọ̀dájú ìbáṣepọ̀ òògùn. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 23

DEFINITION: group of participants in a clinical trial, all of whom receive the same treatment or placebo.
TRANSLATION: Àkójọpọ̀ ọ̀wọ́ akópa nínú ìwádìí ajẹmọ́tọjú, tí gbogbo wọn ń gba ìtọ́jú tàbí pìlàsíbò.

DEFINITION: Forces Programme on Aids Control (AFPAC) Specific programmes set up to control the spread of HIV infection among the military.
TRANSLATION: AFPAC Àkàns ̣e ètò ìdènà ìtànkálẹ̀ KASA láàrin àwo ̣n jagunjagun.

DEFINITION: irregularity in rhythm or rate of the heartbeat.
TRANSLATION: Ìṣe ségesège àti àìbáramu lílù ọkàn

DEFINITION: initiation/ Antiritroviral initiation Antiretroviral therapy (ART) is recommended for all HIV-infected individuals to reduce the risk of disease progression.
TRANSLATION: Òògùn KASA ní a fòntẹ̀ lù fún gbogbo àwọn alábàápàdé ìkóràn KASA lọ́nà àti dèna ewu ìgbèrú àrùn yìí.

DEFINITION: small arterial blood vessel just proximal to the capillaries containing a large proportion of smooth muscle relative to its size.
TRANSLATION: Òpó ìpínjẹ̀ tínrín tí ó ní ìwọ̀n iye iṣan bí ti rẹ̀.

DEFINITION: Blood vessel that carries blood away from the heart. It is a blood vessel that transports blood away from heart. All arteries except pulmonary artery carry blood that has been oxygenated in the lungs.
TRANSLATION: Òpó ìpínjẹ̀ tó n gbé ẹ̀jẹ̀ jáde láti ọkàn. Òun ni òpó ìpínjẹ̀ tí ó ń gbé ẹ̀jẹ̀ jáde láti ọkàn. Gbogbo òpó ìpínjẹ̀ ni ó máa ń gbé ẹ̀jẹ̀ abèémí àyàfi òpó ìpíǹjẹ agbẹ́jẹ̀wọlé.
Arthritis Inflammation of the joints. Làkúrègbè Wíwú oríkèé. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 24

DEFINITION: card These are treatment cards used to identify HIV/AIDS patients.
TRANSLATION: jú KASA Káádì ìdánimọ̀ fún ìtọ́jú KASA àti ààrùn ìṣọdọ̀lẹ àjẹsára.

DEFINITION: failure An undesirable antiretroviral drug treatment outcome with evidence of ongoing viral replication.
TRANSLATION: Àbájáde ìlò òògùn KASA, tí è ̣rí sì tún wà pé kòkòrò rè ̣ n peléke sí i.

DEFINITION: Aminotransferase (AST) An enzyme found especially in heart, muscle, and liver cells. Aspartate aminotransferase may be measured as part of a liver function test.
TRANSLATION: ọkàn Oje aṣàfihàn ìlera ọkàn, páàpáà nínú iṣan, àti hóró è ̣dò ̣. A lè ṣe òdiwọ̀n rẹ̀ gẹ́gẹ́ bi ara iṣẹ́ àyẹ̀wò ẹ̀dọ̀ .

DEFINITION: fungal infection resulting from the fungus Aspergillus of the lungs that can spread through the blood to other organs. Symptoms include fever, chills, difficulty in breathing and coughing up blood. If the infection reaches the brain, it may cause dementia.
TRANSLATION: osunwuuru Ààrùn osunwuuru tí ó wá láti ipaṣẹ̀ ààrùn ẹ̀dọ̀fóró osunwuuru tí ó lè ṣànká inú ẹ̀jẹ̀ sí gbogbo ara. Àpẹẹrẹ àmì àìsàn yìí ni: ibà, òtútù, ìnira làti mí dáadáa àti ẹ̀jẹ̀ pípọ̀. Ìkóran yìí máa ń ran ọpọlọ.

DEFINITION: Determining the amount or purity of a chemical substance in alloys, mixtures, living tissues, or any other system, by means or biological methods.
TRANSLATION: èròjà kẹ́míkà ní irin, àpapọ̀, ìṣù àyè, tàbí àwọn ẹ̀yà ara mìíràn.

DEFINITION: and Budding Names for a portion of the processes by which new HIV virus is formed in infected host cells. Viral core proteins, enzymes and RNA (ribonucleic acid)
TRANSLATION: Orúkọ tuntun tí a ń fún KASA tí a ṣèdá nínú olùgbàlejò hóró. Purotéènì fún kòkòrò, àti ẹnsaimu pẹ̀lú RNA kórajọ sínu ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 25 gather just inside the cell's membrane, while the viral envelope proteins aggregate within the membrane. awọ hóró nígbà tí èpoo àwọn purotéènì a dàgbà nínú awọ.

DEFINITION: childbirth An assisted birth is when a baby needs help to be born with the aid of special instruments.
TRANSLATION: Ìgbẹ̀bí onírànlọ́wọ́ ni nípà tí ọmọ kan bá nílò ìrànlọ́wọ́ láti bí i pẹ̀lú ìrànlọ́wọ́ àwọn irin- iṣẹ́ pàtàkì kan.

DEFINITION: Weakness; lack or loss of energy or strength.
TRANSLATION: tàbí àìní-okun nínú.

DEFINITION: Without symptoms. Usually used in AIDS literature to describe a person who has a positive reaction to one of several tests for HIV antibodies, but who shows no clinical symptoms of the disease.
TRANSLATION: aláìlámì tí a sábà máa ń lò nínú lítírésọ̀ ààrùn ìṣọdọ̀lẹ àjẹsára láti ṣe àpèjúwe ẹni tí ó ní ìṣesí àyẹ̀wò sójà fún KASA, ṣùgbọ́n tí kò fi àmì ààrùn hàn.

DEFINITION: infection Stage of HIV infection during which there are no symptoms of HIV infection. During this stage of HIV infection, which varies in length of time from person to person, HIV slowly destroys the immune system.
TRANSLATION: Ìpele ìkóràn KASA tí kì í sí àmì ìkóràn. Ní àkókò ìkóràn KASA yìí, èyí tí ó ní ìyàtọ̀ àkókò láti ọ̀dọ̀ ẹnìkan sí òmíràn, KASA máa ń pa àjẹsára.

DEFINITION: There is incoordination of gait and balance, and this is due to the damage of the cerebellum and spinal cord. Alcoholism may also result in such imbalance.
TRANSLATION: Àìledarí ní ìwọ̀ntunwọ̀nsì tí ó wá nípaṣẹ̀ ìs ̣òro ọpọlọ àti ọpá ẹ̀yìn. Àmupara o ̣tí lè jẹ́ okùnfà. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 26

DEFINITION: gradual build-up of plaque inside of artery walls. (Plaque is made up of fat, cholesterol, calcium, and other substances found in blood.) Over time, the plaque hardens and narrows the arteries, decreasing the flow of oxygen-rich blood to organs and other parts of the body.
TRANSLATION: ̣ Jíjáde ààrùn nínú odi òpó ìpínjẹ̀ kékéré. Ààrùn yìí a máa ní ọ̀rá, kásíọ́mù àti àwọn èròjà mìíràn inú ẹ̀jẹ̀. Èérí à máa jẹ́ kí òpójẹ̀ le kí ó sì tín-ín-rín, tí ó sì mú àdínkù bá ẹ̀jẹ̀ tí ó ń lọ sí ọkàn àti ẹ̀yà ara yòókù tí ó kún fún èémí àmísínú.

DEFINITION: Weakened or decreased. For example, an attenuated virus can no longer produce disease but might be used to produce a vaccine.
TRANSLATION: tàbí ìdínkù. Bí àpẹẹrẹ, kòkòrò ìdínkù okun kò lè pèsè àìsàn ṣùgbọ́n ó ṣe é lò láti pèsè àjẹsára.

DEFINITION: antibody that is active against some of the tissues of the organism that produced it.
TRANSLATION: Sójà-ara tí ó s ̣e tako àwọn ìṣù abẹ̀mí tí ó pèsè wọn.

DEFINITION: disorder A condition that occurs when the immune system mistakenly attacks and destroys healthy body tissue. Autoimmune disorders may be caused by drugs used to treat opportunistic infections.
TRANSLATION: Ọsẹ́ tí ó ṣẹ̀ nígbà tí àjẹsára bá ṣèèsì tako àti ba ìmọ̀lára jẹ́. Ìṣe-ṣégeṣège àìsàn agbógunti- ara-ẹnilè wáyé nípa òògùn lílò láti dènà ìkóràn awá-àǹfààní.

DEFINITION: Susceptible to being inoculated with microorganisms from one's own body.
TRANSLATION: ṣe é ṣe láti ní àjẹsára pẹ̀lú abẹ̀mí-aláìfojúrí láti ara ẹni.

DEFINITION: Pertaining to the same organism or one of its parts; originating within an organism itself.
TRANSLATION: ẹya abẹ̀mí tàbí apá kan lára rẹ̀; láti ara abẹ̀mi yẹn gan- an fúnra re. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 27

DEFINITION: Acting to support or supplement a group of people.
TRANSLATION: láti ran tàbí ikúnwọ́ fún àkójọpọ̀ àwọn ènìyàn kan.

DEFINITION: Necrosis (AVN) Death of bone tissue (osteonecrosis) due to a lack of blood supply. Avascular necrosis (AVN) most commonly affects the hip. Symptoms include pain in the affected area of the body, limited range of motion, joint stiffness, muscle spasms, and limping.
TRANSLATION: dòkú Asọhóró dòkú nítorí àìlẹ́jẹ̀tó. Ìdíwọ́ ẹ̀jẹ̀ asọ hóró dòkú máa ńṣe àkóbá fún ìbàdí. Àwọn àmì àìsàn yìí ni ìrora ni ojú ìpalára, àìlèdúró sinsin, ara gígan àti títiro.

DEFINITION: (AZT) One of the first drugs used against HIV infection, AZT is a nucleoside analog that suppresses replication of HIV.
TRANSLATION: kan lára òògùn àkọ́kọ́ tí a n lò lòdì sí ìkóràn KASA; Òògùn Asiti jẹ́ ẹ̀yà èròjà kòkòrò hóró kinni tí ó ń kiwọ́ ẹ̀dà KASA bolẹ̀.

DEFINITION: lymphoma Lymphoma is a form of cancer that affects the immune system, specifically involving the white blood cell type called B lymphocytes.
TRANSLATION: Jẹjẹrẹ hóró B jẹ́ ọ̀kan lára jẹjẹrẹ tí ó máa ń nípa lórí ètò ajẹsára, pàápàá ẹ̀yà hóró ẹ̀jẹ̀ funfun B.

DEFINITION: Lymphocytes (B Cells) One of the two major classes of lymphocytes. During infections, these cells are transformed into plasma cells that produce large quantities of antibody directed at specific pathogens.
TRANSLATION: kan lára ẹ̀yà hóró omi-ara. Ní àsìkò ìkóràn, àwọn hóró wọ̀nyìí máa n paradà di hóró oje-ẹ̀jẹ̀ tó n pèsè sójà lọ́pọ̀ sí àwọn àjèjì adáralóró.

DEFINITION: group of microorganisms all of which lack a distinct nuclear
TRANSLATION: àwọn abẹ̀mí-aláìṣeéfojúrí tí kò ní oje-ìsàkóso tí púpọ̀ ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 28 membrane (and hence are considered more primitive than animal and plant cells) and most of which have a cell wall of unique composition (many antibiotics act by destroying the bacterial cell wall). wọn sì ní odi hóró ti a pèsè rẹ̀ pẹ̀lú èròjà ọ̀tọ̀ (ọ̀pọ̀ atako- batéríà máa ń ba odi hóró náà jẹ́).

DEFINITION: or pertaining to bacteria, as in a bacterial lung infection.
TRANSLATION: bateria bíi ìkóràn ààrùn ẹ̀dọ̀fóró.

DEFINITION: vaginosis Bacterial vaginosis (BV) or very uncommonly vaginal bacteriosis is an infection of the vagina caused by bacteria.
TRANSLATION: bateria ojú- ara Èyí ni ààrùn ojú- abẹ́ tí ó wá nípaṣẹ̀ bateria.
Bactericide A drug used to kill bacteria. Òògùn apa batéríà Òògùn tí à ń lò láti pa bateria.

DEFINITION: drug used to prevent the growth of bacteria. Bacteriostats do not kill bacteria.
TRANSLATION: dúró Òògùn tí a n lò láti dènà ìdàgbàsókè batéríà. Òògùn adá batéríà dúró kìí pa batéríà

DEFINITION: Capable of inhibiting the reproduction of bacteria.
TRANSLATION: Tí ó séṣe kí ó ṣe ìdíwọ́ fún ìgbèrú batéríà.

DEFINITION: virus of insects used in the production of some HIV vaccines.
TRANSLATION: èèrùn tí a n lò fún ìgbèrú àwọn àjẹsára KASA.

DEFINITION: group of infections caused by the bacteria Bartonella. Examples of the various infections include cat scratch disease, trench fever, bacillary angiomatosis (BA), and bacillary
TRANSLATION: batonẹla Àkójọpọ̀ ìkóràn tí ó ń wá nípasẹ̀ kòkòrò batonẹ́là. Àpẹẹrẹ ìkóràn bẹ́ẹ̀ ni àìsàn ìhọra músù, iba-iná-orí, abbl. Èyí máa ń farahàn lára àwọn ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 29 peliosis hepatis. BA and bacillary peliosis hepatis occur only in people with weakened immune systems, such as people with HIV. ènìyàn tí àjẹsára wọn ti dọ̀lẹ bíi àwọn ènìyàn tí o ń gbe pẹ̀lú KASA.

DEFINITION: (1) Information gathered at the beginning of a study from which variations found in the study are measured. (2) A known value or quantity with which an unknown is compared when measured or assessed.
TRANSLATION: Ìfitónilétí tí a gbà ní ìbẹ̀rẹ̀ pẹ̀pẹ̀ ẹ̀kọ́. (2) Ìwọ̀n iye tàbí èyí tí ohun àìmọ̀dí ṣe àfiwé òdiwọ̀n tí a ṣe.

DEFINITION: is a type of white blood cells that are responsible for the symptoms of allergy. The granules stain blue when exposed to a basic dye for microscopic examination.
TRANSLATION: basofi Ẹ̀ yà hóró ẹ̀jẹ̀ funfun tí ó wà fún àmì àìsàn ẹ̀hun.

DEFINITION: small nocturnal flying mammal with leathery wings stretching from the forelimbs to the rear legs and tail. Bats eat fruits or insects, usually hang upside down when resting, and often use echolocation to detect their prey and to navigate.
TRANSLATION: ẹ̀yà oníwàrà tí ó n fò ní àṣálẹ́. Ó ní ẹsẹ̀ ní ẹ̀yìn àti ìrù. Àdán máa n jẹ èso tàbí kòkòrò; a máa dorí kodò nígbà tó bá n sinmi, a máa lo gbohùngbohùn láti mọ ìkógun àti tí ó bá n fò.

DEFINITION: Confined to bed by sickness or old age.
TRANSLATION: adánigúnlẹ̀.

DEFINITION: mattress, pillows and coverings such as sheets, quilts, and blankets used to prepare a bed.
TRANSLATION: ìrọ̀rí àti aṣọ ìbora tí a n lò fún ìbùsùn. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 30

DEFINITION: Change Communication (BBC) This is an interactive process of any intervention with individuals, communities and/or societies (as integrated with an overall programme) to develop communication strategies to promote positive behaviors which are appropriate to their settings.
TRANSLATION: Èyí ni ìgbésẹ̀ ìfarakínra pẹ̀lú ẹnikọ̀ọ̀kán, ìletò tàbí ìlú lọ́nà àti àgbédìde ìgbésẹ̀ ìbá-ara- ẹni-sọ̀rọ̀ àti láti ṣe ìgbélárugẹ ìwà títọ́ tí ó sì bójúmu fún irú ìgbékalẹ̀ bẹ́ẹ̀.

DEFINITION: faithful to partners This is an act of clinging to one partner and being faithful to one another.
TRANSLATION: olùbálòpọ̀ (Ẹni) Èyí ni fífi ara mọ́ olùbálòpọ̀ ẹni àti kí àwọn méjéèjì sì jẹ́ olótìítọ́ sí ara wọn.

DEFINITION: system A set of beliefs, especially religious or political beliefs, that form a unified system.
TRANSLATION: àwọn ígbàgbọ́, páàpáà ìgbàgbọ́ àwọn olùfọkànsìn àti olóṣèlú tí ó di ìtẹ́wọ́gbà.

DEFINITION: valve One of the four valves of the heart. This valve is situated between the left atrium and the left ventricle.
TRANSLATION: Ọkàn Ọ̀kan nínú fáàbù mé ̣rin tí ó wà nínú ò ̣kàn. Fáàbù yìí wà láàrin òpó agbẹ́jẹ̀wọlé àti agbẹ́jẹ̀jáde.

DEFINITION: (1) A bile pigment whose measurement can be used as an indication of the health of the liver. (2) A substance released from old or damaged red blood cells. Small amounts of bilirubin normally enter the bloodstream and circulate until they reach the liver and then into the bowel, where bilirubin is further broken down and excreted. The normal value is 0.1 to 1.5 milligrams per litre of blood.
TRANSLATION: ẹ̀dọ̀ (1) Òrónrò ìdiw ọ̀n ìlera ẹ̀dọ̀ ní a n lò fún ìt ọ́kasí ẹ̀dọ̀. (2) Ohun tí a tu jáde láti ibi èròjà àtij ọ́ tàbí bíbàj ẹ́ àwọn hóró ẹ̀jẹ̀ pupa. Òrónrò ìdiw ọ̀n ìlera ẹ̀dọ̀ kékeré nígbà tó baá wọnú ẹ̀jẹ̀ lọ tán, a máa ṣànyíká títí yóò fi w ọnú ẹ̀dọ̀fóró l ọ jáasí inú ìfun níbi t í aó ti yàwọ́n dànù. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 31

DEFINITION: antibody As related to HIV infection: An antibody that attaches to some part of the HIV virus. Binding antibodies may or may not adversely affect the virus.
TRANSLATION: Ajẹmọ́ KASA, sójà tí ó somọ́ àwọn kòkòrò KASA kan. Ó ṣe é ṣe kó ṣe àkóbá tàbí má ṣe àkóbá fún kòkòrò.

DEFINITION: measure of the rate and extent to which a drug is absorbed and becomes available at the site of drug action in the body.
TRANSLATION: iye àti gbèdéke ìgbàwọ- ara òògùn tàbí bí ó ṣe wa sí ni ọ̀gangan ibi tí ó ti wúlò nínú ara.

DEFINITION: Response Modifiers (BRMs) Substances, either natural or synthesized, that boost, direct or restore normal immune defences. BRMs include interferons, interleukins, thymus hormones and monoclonal antibodies.
TRANSLATION: èròjà àtọwọ́da tàbí aláìtọwọ́dá tí ó ṣèrànwọ́, darí tàbí dá ajẹsára adààbòbò padà.

DEFINITION: surgical removal of a piece of tissue from a living subject for microscopic examination to make a diagnosis (for example, to determine whether abnormal cells such as cancer cells are present).
TRANSLATION: Ìṣẹ́ abẹ mímú ìmọ̀lára kúrò nínú ohun àlààyè fún àyẹ̀wò aláìfojúrí fi ṣe ìwádìí láti mọ̀ bóyá hóró aláìyẹ bíi jẹjẹrẹ wà níbẹ̀.

DEFINITION: (1) The use of living organisms or their products to make or modify a substance. These include recombinant DNA techniques (also referred to as genetic engineering) and hybridoma technology. (2) The industrial
TRANSLATION: ajẹmẹ́ẹ̀mí Lílo ohun abẹ̀mí alààyè tàbí àwọn èròjà wọn fún ìpèsè èròjà mìíràn. A máa n lo àpapọ̀ DNA àti àdàmọ̀dì ìmúṣe fún ọgbọ́n ìmúṣẹ ajẹmẹ́ẹ̀mí yìí. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 32 application of the results of biological research, particularly in fields such as recombinant DNA or gene splicing, which permits the production of synthetic hormones or enzymes by combining genetic material from different species.

DEFINITION: flu This is an acute and generally fatal viral infectious disease of chickens and other domestic and wild birds.
TRANSLATION: lí Ó jẹ́ ògidì ìkóràn ààrùn tí ó ní agbára, a sì máa mú adìẹ àti ohun ọ̀sìn abìyẹ́.

DEFINITION: member of the class of animals aves in the phylum chordate.
TRANSLATION: lára àwọn ẹ̀yà ẹranko.

DEFINITION: term is often used to describe people whose sexual objects of choice include both men and women.
TRANSLATION: n lò fún ènìyàn tí ó ní ìbálòpọ̀ akọ àti abo. 178 b.i.d (“bis in die”) An abbreviation of a Latin word meaning “two times a day.” The abbreviation is commonly used in drug dosing instructions. Ẹ̀ è ̣mejì lójúmọ́ Èyí jẹ́ igékúrú ẹ̀ẹ̀méjì lójúmọ́.

DEFINITION: kola Garcinia kola (bitter kola, a name sometimes also used for G. afzelii) is a species of flowering plant in the Clusiaceae or Guttiferae family.
TRANSLATION: ọkan lára igi aládòdó gbígbìn.

DEFINITION: kola tree Garcinia kola or bitter kola is a tree that grows in the rain forests of West Africa. The fruit, seeds, nuts and bark
TRANSLATION: orógbó jẹ́ igi tí o máa ń dàgbà ní ilẹ̀-igbó ní ìwọ̀-òòrùn Afíríkà. Èso, àti ihá rẹ̀ ní à ń lò ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 33 of the plant have been used for centuries in folk medicine to treat ailments from coughs to fever. fún ìtọ́jú àìsàn bíi ikọ́ àti ibà láti ayébáyé.

DEFINITION: leaf Bitter leaf (vernonia amygdalina) is a bitter plant whose leaves, extracts, stems and barks are used for culinary, medical and curative purposes.
TRANSLATION: ọ̀gbìn tí o korò, tí ewé ẹ̀ka tàbí èpo rẹ̀ máa ń jẹ́ lílò fún ìwòṣàn tàbí ìdíwọ́ àìsàn.

DEFINITION: seed Black seed oil is an ancient remedy with modern uses for cancers, heart health, eczema and skin health, autoimmune disease and more.
TRANSLATION: èso dúdú ni à ń lò láti ayébáyé ṣùgbọ́n lóde oní à ń lò ó láti wo jẹjẹrẹ, ìlera ọkan, àléfọ́ àti ìlera ààwọ̀, ààrùn àìtó-àjẹsára àti bẹ́ẹ̀ bẹ́ẹ̀ lọ.

DEFINITION: stools This is a symptom of internal bleeding somewhere higher up along the intestinal path but which is far enough away from therectum that it has time to dry.
TRANSLATION: ni ìsẹ̀jẹ̀ alátinúwá ní ibìkan ní òkè ní òpópónà ìfun ṣùgbọ́n tí ó jìnà sí ojú-ìdí, tí ó sì ní láti gbẹ.

DEFINITION: end portion of dental instrument designed for cutting, probing, or scraping, and connected by a shank to the handle.
TRANSLATION: ̣óns ̣ó irins ̣é ̣ tó wà fún gígé, wíwá àti híha, tí ó sì ní èèkù.

DEFINITION: of blood from the body as a result of illness or injury.
TRANSLATION: Pípàdánù ẹ̀jẹ̀ nínú ara látàrí àìsàn tàbí ọgbẹ́.

DEFINITION: disorder Haemophilia and Christmas disease are disorders resulting from deficiencies of two coagulation factors
TRANSLATION: ààrùn tí ó wá nípaṣẹ̀ ohun àìtó fún dídì tí a mọ̀ sí ìfọ́síwẹ́wẹ́ VIII àti IX. Ènìyàn ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 34 called factor VIII and factor IX. Individuals with any of these disorders can bleed internally without warning. tí ìrú èyí bá ń ṣe lè máa ṣẹ̀jẹ̀ láti inú wá láìní ìtanilólobó.

DEFINITION: from body openings Bleeding may occur: Inside the body when blood leaks from blood vessels or organs. Outside the body when blood flows through a natural opening (such as the vagina, mouth, or rectum). Outside the body when blood moves through a break in the skin.
TRANSLATION: ara Ìṣẹ̀jẹ̀ lè wáyé: láti inú wá nígbà tí ẹ̀jẹ̀ bá ń jò láti inú òpójẹ̀ kékeré tàbí ẹ̀ya ara. Ní ìta ara, tí ẹ̀jẹ̀ bá n ṣàn jáde ni ihò ara (bíi ojú-abẹ́ obìnrin, ẹnu tàbí ihò ìdí) ní ìta ara ẹ̀wẹ̀, nígba tí ẹ̀jẹ̀ bá gba ibi tí awọ ara ti bó jáde.

DEFINITION: study A clinical trial in which participants are unaware as to whether or not they are in the experimental or control arm of the study.
TRANSLATION: ìwádìí ajẹmọ́tọjú ni ibi tí àkópa kò ti níran ń kópa nínú ìwádìí ọ̀wọ́ afisòdiwọ̀n tàbí ọ̀wọ́ aláyẹ̀wò ní iṣẹ́ ìwádìí.

DEFINITION: Blindness is the inability to see any- thing, even light. If you are partially blind, you have limited vision.
TRANSLATION: ni àìlágbára láti rí nǹkan, kódà iná Bí ènìyàn bá jẹ́ afọ́jú, ìríran rẹ̀ kéré jọjọ.

DEFINITION: temporary, detectable increase in the amount of HIV in the blood (viral load) that occurs after antiretroviral therapy (ART) has effectively suppressed the virus to an undetectable level. Isolated blips are not considered a sign of virologic failure.
TRANSLATION: Ìfarahàn ránpé ̣ Ìfarahàn onígbà péréte, ìsàwárí ìgbèrú iye KASA nínú ẹ̀jẹ̀ tí ó farahàn lẹ́yìn tí ìgbàtọ́jú pípa KASA ti dín kòkòrò náà kù dé ipò aìṣeéfojúrí. Èyí kò sì túmò ̣ sí ìkùnà òògùn KASA.

DEFINITION: red fluid that is pumped from the heart and circulates around the bodies of humans and other vertebrates.
TRANSLATION: pupa tí ó ń tú jáde láti inú ọkàn, tí ó ń ṣànyíká gbogbo ara ènìyàn àti ẹranko. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 35

DEFINITION: bank A blood bank is a cache or bank of blood or blood components, gathered as a result of blood donation or collection, stored and preserved for later use in blood transfusion.
TRANSLATION: ẹ̀jẹ̀ ni ibi tí à ń ṣe ẹ̀jẹ̀ lọ́jọ̀ sí, pàápàá jùlọ látàrí ìfẹ̀jẹ̀sílẹ̀, kíkó ẹ̀jẹ̀ jọ, títọ́jú ẹ̀jẹ̀ àti ìfi-ẹ̀jẹ̀-pamọ́ fún lílò nígbà gbígba ẹ̀jẹ̀.

DEFINITION: brain barrier The barrier between brain blood vessels and brain tissues whose effect is to restrict what may pass from the blood into the brain.
TRANSLATION: ọpọlọ Ààlà láàárìn òpó ẹ̀jẹ̀ ọpọlọ àti ìṣù ọpọlọ èyí tí ojúṣe rẹ̀ ní láti dènà ohunkóhun tí ó lè fẹ́ gba inú ẹ̀jẹ̀ wọnú ọpọlọ.

DEFINITION: cell Any of the cells that is present in the blood in health or disease.
TRANSLATION: tó wà nínú ìlera ẹ̀jẹ̀ tàbí ààrùn.

DEFINITION: cell count Number of red and white cells in a given blood.
TRANSLATION: Iye hóró ẹ̀jẹ̀ pupa àti funfun nínú ẹ̀jẹ̀ kan pàtó.

DEFINITION: circulation The systemic circulation provides functional blood supply to all body tissues. It carries oxygen and nutrients to the cells and picks up carbon dioxide and waste products. Systemic circulation carries oxygenated blood from the left ventricle, through the arteries, to the capillaries in the tissues of the body.
TRANSLATION: ìsànyíkà máa ń pèsè ẹ̀jẹ̀ yíka gbogbo ara. Ó máa ń gbé èémí-àmísínú àti aṣaralóore lọ bá àwọn hóró tí yóó sì gbé èémí-àmísóde àti ẹ̀gbin kúrò. Ètò ìsànyíká máa ń gbé ẹ̀jẹ̀ eléèmí-àmísínú láti káà agbẹ́jẹ̀jáde apá-òsì, a gba òpó- ìpínjẹ̀ kékeré sí òpó-ìpínjẹ̀ weẹrẹ nínú isàn ara.

DEFINITION: clotting factor Any substance in the blood that is essential for blood to coagulate.
TRANSLATION: inú ẹ̀jẹ̀ tí ó ṣe kókó fún ẹ̀jẹ̀ dídì. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 36

DEFINITION: count The number of red and white blood cells and platelets in a given volume of blood.
TRANSLATION: Ìwọ̀n hóró ẹ̀jẹ̀ pupa àti funfun àti hóró amẹ́jẹ̀dì nínú òdiwọ̀n ẹ̀jẹ̀ kan.

DEFINITION: culture This is a microbiological culture of blood. It is employed to detect infections that are spreading through the bloodstream.
TRANSLATION: ni ìwòṣesí ẹ̀jẹ̀. A máa n lòó láti mọ ìkóràn tó tànká inú ẹ̀jẹ̀.

DEFINITION: donor Somebody who gives blood for use in transfusions.
TRANSLATION: tí ó n fún ni ẹ̀jẹ̀ láti gbà á.

DEFINITION: film examination Blood films are examined in the investigation of hematological (blood) disorders and are routinely employed to look for blood parasites, such as those of malaria and filariasis.
TRANSLATION: ẹ̀jẹ̀ jẹ́ ìwádìí àyẹ̀wò nípa àìda ẹ̀jẹ̀; èyí ni à ńlò láti mọ àwọn ajọ̀fẹ́ nínú ẹ̀jẹ̀ bíi ibà àti àwọn filariasis.

DEFINITION: group A class into which human blood is divided for transfusion purposes according to the presence or absence of antigens that determine its immunological compatibility. The ABO system is the most commonly known set of blood groups.
TRANSLATION: wọ́ tí a pín ẹ̀jẹ̀ ènìyàn sí fún gbígba ẹ̀jẹ̀ ní ìbámu sí wíwà tàbí àìsí àjèjì-adáralóró tí ó gùnlé bíbámọ àjẹsára. Ètò ABO ni gbajúgbajà ọ̀wọ́ ẹ̀jẹ̀.

DEFINITION: group A Blood group A individuals have A antigen on the surface of their red blood cells, and their blood contains antibodies to antigen B.
TRANSLATION: Àwo ̣n ènìyàn oníṣọ̀rí ẹ̀jẹ̀ A ní àjèjì adaralóró nínú hóró è ̣jè ̣ pupa wo ̣n, tí ó ní sójà tí ó ń tako àjèjì adaralóró B nínú.

DEFINITION: group AB Blood group AB individuals have both A and B antigens on the surface of
TRANSLATION: Àwo ̣n ènìyàn oníṣọ̀rí ẹ̀jẹ̀ AB ní àjèjì adaralóró A àti B nínú ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 37 their red blood cells, and their blood does not contain any antibodies to antigen A or B. hóró è ̣jè ̣ pupa wo ̣n, tí kò ní sójà tí ó ń tako àjèjì adaralóró A tàbí B nínú.

DEFINITION: group B Blood group B individuals have B antigen on the surface of their red blood cells, and their blood contains antibodies to antigen A.
TRANSLATION: Àwo ̣n ènìyàn oníṣọ̀rí ẹ̀jẹ̀ B ní àjèjì adaralóró B nínú hóró è ̣jè ̣ pupa wo ̣n, tí ó ní sójà tí ó ń tako àjèjì adaralóró A nínú.

DEFINITION: group O Blood group O individuals have neither A and B antigens on the surface of their red blood cells, and their blood contains antibodies to both antigen A and B.
TRANSLATION: Àwo ̣n ènìyàn oníṣọ̀rí ẹ̀jẹ̀ O kò ní yálà àjèjì adaralóró A tàbí B nínú hóró è ̣jè ̣ pupa wo ̣n, è ̣jè ̣ wọn sì ní sójà tí ó ń tako àjèjì adaralóró A àti B nínú.

DEFINITION: heat Form of transferred energy that arises from the random motion of molecules and is felt as temperature, especially as warmth or hotness of blood.
TRANSLATION: ẹ̀jẹ̀ Ìṣípò okun inú tí ó wá láti ìpinnu àìròtẹ́lẹ̀ mólékù, èyí tí ó yọrí sí ìwọ̀n ooru/gbígbóná, páàpáà ìgbóná tàbí ẹ̀jẹ̀ gbígbóná.

DEFINITION: pressure Blood pressure is the pressure of the blood against the blood-vessel walls.
TRANSLATION: ̣jè ̣ nínú òpó ìpínjè ̣

DEFINITION: products A blood product is any component of the blood which is collected from a donor for use in a blood transfusion.
TRANSLATION: ẹ̀jẹ̀ jẹ́ ẹ̀yà apákan ẹ̀jẹ̀ tí a gbà lọ́wọ́ afẹ̀jẹ́lẹ̀ fún lílònígba ẹ̀jẹ̀ gbígbà

DEFINITION: serum The fluid that separates from clotted blood, similar to plasma but without clotting agents.
TRANSLATION: tí ó yapa kúrò lára dídì ẹ̀jẹ̀, tí ó jọ/súnmọ́ oje ẹ̀jẹ̀ ṣùgbọ́n láìsí amẹ́jẹ̀dì. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 38

DEFINITION: test A scientific analysis of a sample of blood.
TRANSLATION: ẹ̀jẹ̀ ní ìlànà sáyẹ́ńsì

DEFINITION: transfusion Blood transfusion is done to compensate the loss of blood or to correct anaemia. It may also be required after internal bleeding.
TRANSLATION: tàbí ẹ̀jẹ̀ gbígbà sí ara ní a ṣe fún ènìyàn tí ó pàdánù ẹ̀jẹ̀ tàbí ṣe àtúnṣe àìlẹ́jẹ̀tó. A tún lè nílò rẹ̀ fún ẹni tí ó ní ìsẹ̀jẹ̀ sínú.

DEFINITION: vessels An artery, vein, or capillary through which blood flows.
TRANSLATION: Òpó ìpínjẹ̀ kékeré, òpójẹ̀ agbẹ́jẹ̀wọlé, òpójẹ̀ wẹẹrẹ ni ẹ̀jẹ̀ ń gbà kọjá.

DEFINITION: ache Overextending the muscles with physical activity or traumatizing the muscles due to painful activity such as a car accident can result in aches all over the body.
TRANSLATION: ìṣan tàbí iṣẹ́ líle òun ìrẹra nípa ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ tí ó máa ń mú kí ara ro ènìyàn bíi ìjànbá mọ́tò lè fa ara ríro.

DEFINITION: fluids Any fluid in the human body, such as blood, urine, saliva, sputum (spit), tears, semen, mother's milk or vaginal secretions. Only blood, semen, mother's milk and vaginal secretions have been linked directly to the transmission of the HIV virus.
TRANSLATION: ara bíi ẹ̀jẹ̀, ìtọ̀, itọ́, kẹ̀lẹ̀bẹ̀, omijé, àtọ̀, omi-ọmú tàbí omi ojú nǹkan obìnrin. Ẹ̀ jẹ̀, àtọ̀, omi-ọmú àti omi ojú ara obìnrin nìkan ló rọ̀mọ́ ìkóràn kòkòrò KASA.

DEFINITION: habitus changes It is a noticeable physical changes in body shape or appearance. In people with HIV, these changes may be due to
TRANSLATION: ní ara tàbí ìrísí. Nínú ara oníKASA, àyípadà yìí lè wáyé látàrí ìkórisin KASA, ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 39 HIV infection, opportunistic infections, or antiretroviral (ARV) drugs. àwọn àìsàn ajìfà tàbí òògùn apa KASA.

DEFINITION: piercing This is a form of body modification. It is the practice of puncturing or cutting a part of the human body, creating an opening in which jewellery may be worn. The word piercing can refer to the act or practice of body piercing, or to an opening in the body created by this act or practice.
TRANSLATION: ni ìyípadà tí ó dé bá ara nípa lílu tàbí gígé ara ènìyàn, dídá ihò sí ara tí wọ́n sì wọ ọ̀sọ́ sí i.

DEFINITION: boil, also called a furuncle, is a deep folliculitis, an infection of the hair follicle. It is most commonly caused by infection by the bacterium aureus, resulting in a painful swollen area on the skin caused by an accumulation of pus and dead tissue.
TRANSLATION: ààrùn ìsà irùn wíwú. Ó n wá láti ipaṣẹ̀ ìkóràn ajẹmọ́ batéríà tí ó ń yọrí sí ara wíwú tí ó sì dun ni jọjọ ó kún fún ọyún àti ìṣù tí ó ti kú.

DEFINITION: marrow The soft connective tissue found within the inner cavity of certain bones that produces red blood cell.
TRANSLATION: eegun Ìṣù fẹ́lẹ́fẹ́lẹ́ nínú ihò eegun tó n pèsè hóró ẹ̀jẹ̀ pupa.

DEFINITION: marrow transplant The moving of the bone marrow from one body to another.
TRANSLATION: eegun Gbígbé mùdùnmúdùn eegun láti ara kan sí òmíràn.

DEFINITION: second or later dose of a vaccine given to increase the immune response to the original dose.
TRANSLATION: kejì tí ó ń ṣe àlékún àjẹsára sí ògidì òògùn. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 40

DEFINITION: use of an antiretroviral (ARV) drug to increase the effectiveness of another ARV drug.
TRANSLATION: òògùn apa kòkòrò (ARV) tí ó ń se alékún ìṣedéédé òògùn apa kòkòrò mìíràn

DEFINITION: tolerance The amount of oral ascorbic acid tolerated by a patient without producing diarrhea increases somewhat proportionately to the stress or toxicity of his disease.
TRANSLATION: Ìfaradà ìfun Ìwọ̀n iye fítámì tí aláìsàn lè fisí ẹnu láì yọrí sí ìgbẹ́ gbuuru tí ó lè ṣe àlékún bá wàhálà tàbí oró ààrùn.

DEFINITION: warning The strongest form of warning required by the Food and Drug Administration (FDA) for prescription drug labelling. A boxed warning alerts health care providers and consumers to increased risk of serious adverse reactions associated with use of a drug or to restrictions on use of a drug. The boxed warning is presented in a box surrounded by a black border and is placed on the drug label and any package inserts or promotional materials intended for the prescriber or patient.
TRANSLATION: kan lára ìkìlọ alágbára tí àjọ tí ó ń rí sí ìlò òògùn àti ouńjẹ máa ń là kalẹ̀ fún akọlé òògùn lílò. Apótí ìkìlọ̀ máa ń ta elétò ìlera àti oníbàárà ni olobó ewu ńlá tí ó rọ̀ mọ́ òògùn kan ní lílò. Àpótí ìkìlọ̀ náà máa ń yà sára òògùn pẹ̀lú àwọ̀ dúdú tàbí ìwé pélébé tí ó máa ń wà nínú paálí òògùn náà tàbí ìwé ìpolowó òògùn ọ̀hún fún ẹni tí ó dàbàá òògùn náà fún lílò àti aláàárẹ̀ láti rí.

DEFINITION: portion of the central nervous system that is located within the skull. It is the enlarged and highly developed mass of nervous tissue that forms the
TRANSLATION: gbùngbun ààrin ìmọ̀lára tí ó wà nínú agbárí. Ó tóbi, tí ó sì ṣe ìpèsè ìṣù tí ó jẹ́ irisi ìparí- òkè gbùngbun ààrin ìmọ̀lára. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 41 upper end of the central nervous system.

DEFINITION: assay A sensitive molecular technique to monitor the amount of HIV in a patient's bloodstream (i.e. the viral burden).
TRANSLATION: tí a fi n wo iye KASA nínú ẹ̀jẹ̀ àwọn aláìsàn.

DEFINITION: infection An infection caused by the infectious agent the vaccine is designed to protect against that occurs during the course of a vaccine trial. These infections may be caused by exposure to the infectious agent before the vaccine has taken effect,or before all doses of the vaccine have been given. Breakthrough infections also occur in trial participants receiving placebos.
TRANSLATION: afàkóràn Ìkóràn tí ó wá láti ara aṣojú ààrùn tí ó yẹ kó máa dáàbòbò àjẹsára, èyí tí ó ń wáyé nígbà ìwádìí àjẹsára. Nígbà tí ìjákulẹ̀ òògùn ìwádìí afàkóràn ba wáyé ní ara ọ̀wọ́ akópa, a máa fún wọn ní pilasíbò.

DEFINITION: Female breast produces milk for the child and has secondary sexual characteristic function too. Female breast contains 15 to 20 lobes of milk secreting glands. These have outlet in nipple. The breast contains no muscle.
TRANSLATION: máa ń pèsè wàrà fún ọmọ àti ní ìpele mìíràn fún ìgbádùn ìbálòpọ̀. Ọmú obìnrin ní 15 sí 20 ojú ihò tí wàrà ti má ń jáde. Orí góńgó omú sì ni àwọn ihò yìí wà.

DEFINITION: Breastfeeding or nursing is the feeding of babies and young children with milk from a woman's breast.
TRANSLATION: Fífún ọmọ ní ọyàn ní ọ̀nà kan tí à ń gbà fọ́mọ lóuńjẹ nípa ọmú tí ó wà ní igbá-àyà obìnrin. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 42

DEFINITION: procedure used to look inside the airways of the lungs. The procedure is done using a bronchoscope, a flexible tube that has a camera on one end of it. A bronchoscopy may be used to diagnose HIV-related infections or cancer.
TRANSLATION: Ìgbésẹ̀ wíwo òpópónà-afẹ́fẹ́ ẹ̀dọ̀fóró. Ìgbésẹ̀ náà ni wọ́n máa ń lo irinṣẹ́ ìyẹ̀dọ̀fórówò tí wọ́n ń pè ní bronchoscopy. Wọ́n máa ń lò ó láti ṣe ìdámọ̀ ìkóràn KASA tàbí jẹjẹrẹ.

DEFINITION: Sudden, involuntary contraction of the muscles of the bronchii (airways in the lungs).

TRANSLATION: onírun lára yàtọ̀ sí ojú àti etí rẹ̀.

DEFINITION: agent of a sexually transmitted disease. A genus of Gram-negative bacteria that are obligate intracellular
TRANSLATION: Aṣojú ìtànkálè ̣ ààrùn ìbálòpọ̀. Ìran bateria ẹlẹ́yọ̀ Gíràmù tó fa inú hóró ajọ̀fé ̣ nínú èníyàn àti ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 54 parasites in humans and other animals, in which they cause disease. àwọn ẹranko mìíràn, ní èyí tó n fa ààrùn.

DEFINITION: duct disease. (Bile ducts are tubes that carry bile from the gallbladder to the small intestine, where the bile is used to digest fats.) Cholangiopathy may occur as a complication of AIDS or may be caused by certain opportunistic infections.
TRANSLATION: Èyí a máa gbé òrónro láti ibi òrónro inú níbi tí a tí nlo láti fọ ọ̀rá. Ààrùn òpó òrónro lè jẹyọ nítorí ìsekúse ti ìsọdọ̀lẹ àjesára tabi àwọn ìkóràn ajìfà mìíràn.

DEFINITION: acute infection of the small intestine by the bacterium vibrio cholera, which causes severe vomiting and diarrhoea (known as ricewater stools) leading to dehydration.
TRANSLATION: ìkóràn tí ó wá nípaṣẹ̀ bateria ààrùn onígbáméjì ti inú kékeré, èyí tí ó n fa èébì àti ìgbẹ́ gbuuru.

DEFINITION: is a fat-like material (a sterol) present in the blood and most tissues, especially nervous tissues.
TRANSLATION: Nkan ọ̀rá to wúlò (ọ̀rá) tí ó wà nínú ẹ̀jẹ̀ àti ọ̀pọ̀ ìṣù, páàpáà júlọ ìsù ìmọ̀lára.

DEFINITION: Inflammation of the choroid membrane of the eye (Pathology).
TRANSLATION: Awọ ọpọlọ ojú wíwú.

DEFINITION: thread-like structure found within a cell. Chromosomes, which are made of DNA coiled around proteins, carry all of the genetic information essential to the life of the cell.
TRANSLATION: okùn tín-ín-rín tí a rí nínú hóró. Okùn ìran hóró tí a pèsè pẹ̀lú DNA ó wà ní àyíká purotéénì, èyí tí ó n gbé ààyè tí ó ṣe pàtàkì sínú hóró.

DEFINITION: diarrhoea These are frequent loose stools which are a daily occurrence. There may be occasional normal stools. Despite the
TRANSLATION: gbuuru ọló ̣jó ̣ pípẹ́ Ìgbẹ́ gbuuru tí à ń yà ní ojoojúmọ́. Nígbà mìíràn, ó kàn lè ṣà déédé wá, a sì máa mú ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 55 need to stay within the reach of a toilet, the person is otherwise well. ẹni ó mú máa lọse ìgbọ̀nṣẹ̀, kí ara rẹ̀ tó dá.

DEFINITION: fatigue Chronic fatigue syndrome (CFS) is a debilitating disorder characterized by extreme fatigue or tiredness that does not go away with rest, and cannot be explained by an underlying medical condition.
TRANSLATION: ̣ pípẹ́ Àìsàn àárẹ̀ pípẹ́ ni àìda àárẹ̀ tàbí kí ó máa rẹ ẹni tí kì í lọ nípa orun sísùn. Ìpò tí a kò le ṣe àlàyé rẹ̀ nípa ìlànà ìṣègùn nìkan.

DEFINITION: Idiopathic Demyelinating Polyneuropathy (CIPD) Chronic, spontaneous loss or destruction of myelin. Myelin is a soft, white, somewhat fatty material that forms a thick sheath around the protoplasmic core of myelinated nerve fibre.
TRANSLATION: o ̣ló ̣jó ̣ pípẹ́ Àìsàn ségeṣège ìmọ̀lára pípẹ́ jẹ́ ohun àdánù tí ó jẹ́ ohun ìmọ̀lára.

DEFINITION: leukaemia An often fatal cancer in which white blood cells displace normal blood, leading to infection, shortage of red blood cells anemia, bleeding, and other disorders. Certain types of childhood leukemias respond well to treatment, which includes drugs chemotherapy and radiotherapy.
TRANSLATION: ọló ̣jó ̣ pípẹ́ Èyí ni jẹjẹrẹ tí ó léwu nínú èyí tí àwọn hóró ẹ̀jẹ̀ funfun rọ́pò ẹ̀jẹ̀ tí ó ṣe déédé, èyí tí ó n yọrí sí ìkóràn. Àìlẹ́jẹ̀ tó hóró ẹ̀jẹ̀ funfun, ṣíṣẹ̀jẹ̀ àti àwọn ohun àìyẹ. Àwọn jẹjẹrẹ inú ẹ̀jẹ̀ ti ìgbà kékeré máa n gbọ́ ìtọ́jú bí i lílo òògùn jẹjẹrẹ.

DEFINITION: ulcers Chronic ulcers may be painful. Most patients complain of constant pain at night and during the day.
TRANSLATION: pípẹ́ Ọgbẹ́ ọlọ́jọ́ pípẹ́ máa n nira. Ọ̀ pọ̀ àwọn aláìsàn máa n ké ìrora inú rírun ní alẹ́ àti ní ojú ọjọ́. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 56

DEFINITION: (V) To move or flow freely in an enclosed space or defined area.
TRANSLATION: káàkiri láì ní ìdíwọ́ láàrin àgbègbè kan.

DEFINITION: continuous movement of blood through all parts of the body.
TRANSLATION: ní gbogbo ara.

DEFINITION: system The system consisting of the heart, blood vessels, and lymph vessels that pumps blood and lymph around the body.
TRANSLATION: tí ó ní ọkàn, òpó ẹ̀jẹ̀, àti òpó omi-ara tí ó n pọ́mpù ẹ̀jẹ̀ àti omi nínú agbèègbè ara.

DEFINITION: is an act of removal of the foreskin of the penis.
TRANSLATION: okó.

DEFINITION: Pertaining to the area of the face around the mouth.
TRANSLATION: agbègbè ojú ẹnu

DEFINITION: chronic progressive disease of the liver characterized by the replacement of healthy cells with scar tissues.
TRANSLATION: ẹ̀dọ̀fóró tí ó pẹ́ títí èyí tí ó wà fún ìpààrọ̀ hóró pẹ̀lú àléébù ìmọ̀lára.

DEFINITION: Society Network For HIV/AIDS in Nigeria (CiSHAN) CiSHAN is the national umbrella network of Civil Society Organizations (CSOs) working on issues in the prevention and impact mitigation of HIV & AIDS in Nigeria.
TRANSLATION: CiSHAN Èyí ni ajọ tí ó kó gbogbo ajọ tí kìí ṣe ti ijọba tí wọ́n sì ń siṣẹ́ láti dènà ìtànkálẹ̀ KASA àti ààrùn ìsọdọ̀lẹ àjẹsára ní Nàìjíríà.

DEFINITION: group of related HIV variants, classified according to degree of genetic similarity. HIV-1 group M variants are currently grouped into clades A, B, C, D, F,G, H, J and K.
TRANSLATION: KASA, tí a pín bí wọ́n ṣe fara jọ ara. Àwọn àsọmọgbè ni a pín sí ìsọ̀rí KASA A, B, C, D,F, G, H, J àti K.

DEFINITION: regimen Class-sparing regimens are used to save specific ARV drugs for future use
TRANSLATION: òògùn tí à ń lò fún ààbò àkànṣe òògùn KASA tí ó yàtọ̀ ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 57 in case a regimen needs to be changed because of toxicity or drug resistance. A class-sparing regimen may also be used to avoid the adverse effects associated with a specific drug class. sí òògùn mìíràn fún ọjọ́ iwájú. A ṣe èyí nítorí oró àti àtakò ọjọ́ iwájú.

DEFINITION: intake form These are forms obtained by clients or patients when they first came to hospital.
TRANSLATION: ni fọ́ọ́mù tí aláìsàn máa ń gbà nígbà tí wọ́n bá kọ́kọ́ lọ sí ilé ìwòsàn.

DEFINITION: Pertaining to or founded on observation and treatment of patients, as distinguished from theoretical or basic science.

DEFINITION: alert A mechanism, adopted by the National Institutes of Health in conjunction with the editors of several biomedical journals, for urgent cases in which timely and broad dissemination of results of clinical trials could prevent morbidity (sickness) and mortality (death). The Clinical Alert does not become a barrier to subsequent publication of the full research paper. Clinical Alerts are widely distributed electronically through the National Library of Medicine and through standard mailing.
TRANSLATION: jú Ìṣe ètò tí àjọ ìlera orílẹ̀-èdè máa n lò pẹ̀lú orísìríṣi àwọn ìwé àtẹ̀jáde nípa ìṣègùn fún iṣẹ́ pàjáwìrì, tó ṣéṣe kí ó pa ìtànkálẹ̀ èsì ìtaají ajẹmọ́-ìtọ́jú lè jẹ́ dènà àìsàn àti ikú. DEFINITION: characteristics of Ebola The first clinical description of Ebola outbreak in 1976: The illness is characterized with a high temperature of about 39°C, hematemesis, diarrhoea with blood, retrosternal abdominal pain, prostration with "heavy" articulations, and rapid evolution death after three days.
TRANSLATION: Ebola Ọdún 1976 ni àpèjúwe aje ̣mó ̣- ìtó ̣jú lórí Ebola jade. Lára àwo ̣n àmì àáre ̣ yìí ni ara gbígbóná, ìgbé ̣ gbuuru ẹlé ̣jè ̣,inú dídùn, tí yóó sì jásí ikú ní nnkan bíi o ̣jó ̣ mé ̣ta.’

DEFINITION: endpoint In a clinical trial, an outcome or event used to objectively measure the effect of a drug or other intervention being studied. Common endpoints include severe toxicity, disease progression, and death.
TRANSLATION: Ní ti ajẹmọ́tọjú, àtunbọ̀tán ajẹ́mọ́-ìtọ́jú ni èsì tí a fi ń ṣe òdiwọ̀n iṣẹ́ òògùn.

DEFINITION: failure A type of HIV treatment failure. The occurrence or recurrence of an HIV- related complication, usually an AIDS- defining condition, after 3 months of antiretroviral therapy (ART) is considered clinical failure.
TRANSLATION: jú Ẹ̀ yà ìkùnà ìtọ́jú KASA. Ìrìnṣẹ́yìn ìsọdọ̀lẹ ajẹsára pàápàá ìfarahàn KASA lẹ́yìn osù mẹ́tà lílo òògùn apa KASA ni a pè ní ìkùnà ìtọ́jú

DEFINITION: latency The state or period of an infectious agent, such as a virus or bacterium, living or developing in a host without producing clinical symptoms. As related to HIV infection, although infected individuals usually exhibit a period of clinical latency with little evidence of disease, the virus is never
TRANSLATION: Ipò asojú ìkóràn bí i kòkòrò tàbí bateria tí ó wà tàbí dàgbà nínú olúborí láì pèsè àwọn àìsàn ajẹmọ́-ìtọ́jú. Ní ti ajẹmọ́- ìtọ́jú ìkóràn KASA, àwọn tíwọ́n kó ààrùn máa n díbọ́n àìsàn pẹ̀lú ìfihàn ààrùn, kòkòrò yìí kò ṣe díbọ́n sí. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 59 truly latent. Even early in the disease, HIV is active within lymphoid organs where large amounts of virus become trapped in the FDC network.

DEFINITION: practice guidelines Standards for physicians to adhere to in prescribing care for a given condition or illness.
TRANSLATION: -ìtọ́ jú Ìdiwọ̀n tí àwọn olùtọ́jú gbúdọ̀ tẹ̀lé láti fi ṣe ìtọ́jú fún ipò kan tàbí àìsàn.

DEFINITION: progression Advance of disease that can be measured by observable and diagnosable signs or symptoms. For example, HIV progression can be measured by change in CD4 count.
TRANSLATION: ìtọ́ jú Ìgbèrú ààrùn tí a lè ́ṣe òdiwọ̀n rẹ̀ nípa àkíyèsí àti ìwádìí ààmì àìsàn. Fún àpẹẹrẹ, ìgbèrú KASA ni a lè wọn nípa kíka CD4.
