DEFINITION: services Clinical Services are better partnership in service delivery in the hospitals.
TRANSLATION: ìtọ́ jú Iṣẹ́ ajẹmọ́-ìtọ́jú dára fún ìbásepọ̀ ìfijíṣẹ́ ní ilé ìwòsàn.

DEFINITION: trial A carefully designed and executed investigation of the effects of a drug (or vaccine) administered to human subjects. The goal is to define the clinical efficacy and pharmacological effects (toxicity, side effects, incompatibilities or interactions) of the drug.
TRANSLATION: ìtọ́ jú Ìwádìí ìṣègùn tí a fi ara balẹ̀ ṣe fún ipa òògùn tàbí àjẹsára, èyí tí a n lò fún ènìyàn. Iṣẹ́ ajẹmọ́- ìtọ́jú ni láti mọ agbára àti ipa oró, èsì àti ìbásepọ̀ òògùn nínú ara.

DEFINITION: is an erectile organ of the female external genitalia that is homologous with the penis in males. It is partly concealed by the labia minora but free extremity appears as a round tubercle.
TRANSLATION: ó yọ síta ní ojú-ara obìnrin tí ó wà ní ìbádọ́gba pẹ̀lú okó ọkùnrin. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 60

DEFINITION: Clomifene or Clomiphene is a selective estrogen receptor modulator of the triphenylethylene group that has become the most widely prescribed drug for ovulation induction to reverse anovulation or oligoovulation.
TRANSLATION: kilomufin Òògùn Kílómufin ni àpapọ̀ orísìírísìí òògùn tí ó ti di gbájúgbajà òògùn ti wọ́n ń lò láti jẹ́ kí nǹkan osù wá lati ṣe àtúnṣe sí ìsákì nǹkan osù.

DEFINITION: genetically identical replication of a living cell that is valuable for the investigation and reproduction of test cultures.
TRANSLATION: hóró kan-náà tàbí ẹ̀yàwuuru tí ó wá láti ọ̀dọ bàbá kan-náà láti ṣe ẹ̀dà bẹ̀ ẹ́.

DEFINITION: of blood/ blood clot A mass of thickened liquid, especially blood.
TRANSLATION: ìṣọ̀n pàápàá jùlọ ẹ̀jẹ̀.

DEFINITION: Fabric made by weaving, knitting, or felting thread or fibres.
TRANSLATION: tí a fi òwú ṣe ìbáà ṣe hihun tàbí rírán pẹ̀lú abẹ́rẹ́.

DEFINITION: blood disorder A medical condition involving a disturbance to the usual clotting of blood.
TRANSLATION: tí ó ń fa ségesège dídì ẹ̀jẹ̀ nínú ara.

DEFINITION: of differentiation nomenclature This nomenclature was developed to standardize and compare monoclonal antibodies from different sources. Antibodies with similar reactivity patterns are assigned to CD groups representing "clusters of differentiation." T lymphocytes are CD3+ and can be separated into the CD4+ T helper cells and the CD8+ cytotoxic/suppressor cells. Although
TRANSLATION: Èyí ni láti ṣe ìgbéléwọ̀n àti àfiwé sójà ara àtọwọ́dá lati orísìí ibi. Awọn sójà ara ti iṣe wọn jọra pẹ̀lú ọ̀wọ́ CD. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 61 CD4+ cells are predominantly T lymphocytes, some monocytes are also CD4+.

DEFINITION: disease or condition that affects the blood’s ability to clot.
TRANSLATION: ̣ Ààrùn tàbí ipò tí ó ń ṣe àkóbá fún ẹ̀jẹ̀ dídì.

DEFINITION: mycosis An infectious fungal disease caused by the inhalation of spores of Coccidioides immitis, which is carried on wind-blown dust particles. It is an opportunistic disease associated with AIDS. Also called desert fever, San Joaquin fever, valley fever.
TRANSLATION: osunwuuru abáfẹ́fẹ́rìn Ààrùn osunwuuru tí ó wá láti ara ìfínsímú àtakò kòkòrò àìfojúrí tí óhun fa atẹ́gùn tí ó n gbé ìdọ̀tí. Ó jẹ́ ajẹmọ́-ààrùn ìṣọdọ̀lẹ àjẹsára.

DEFINITION: situation or activity that may increase a person's susceptibility to AIDS. Examples of such cofactors are other infections, drugs and alcohol use, poor nutrition, genetic factors and stress. A contributory cause of a disease.
TRANSLATION: Arannílọ́ wọ́ Àwọn ohun aranra-ẹni lọ́wọ́ tí ó ń ṣe àlékún kíkó ààrùn ìṣọdọ̀lẹ àjẹsára. Àpẹẹrẹ rẹ̀ ni àwọn ìkóràn mìíràn, òògùn àti ọtí mímu, àìjẹ oúnjẹ tí ó ní purotéénì, àti wàhálà.

DEFINITION: impairment Difficulty in thinking, reasoning, or remembering. Some people with HIV may have cognitive impairment.
TRANSLATION: èrò àti ìrántí. Ọ̀ pọ̀ nínú àwọn tí ó n gbé pẹ̀lú KASA ni ó máa n ní ònrayè.

DEFINITION: epidemiology, a group of individuals with some characteristics in common.
TRANSLATION: nípa ààrùn, ẹgbẹ́ àwọn ènìyàn pẹ̀lú àbùdá ìwà kan-náà. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 62

DEFINITION: person who is infected with more than one virus is said to have a co- infection.
TRANSLATION: tí ó ní ìkóràn kòkòrò ju méjì lọ ni ó máa n ní ààrùn oníbejì.

DEFINITION: extremities Cold extremities occur when blood vessels are constricted or slightly obstructed.
TRANSLATION: tutu rinrin Ìyára tutu wáyé nígbà tí òpó ẹ̀jẹ̀ bá fún tàbí ní ìdíwọ́ ránpẹ́.

DEFINITION: sores A small painful blister on or near the lips, or sometimes the nose, caused by the virus Herpes simplex.
TRANSLATION: lórí ètè, nígbà mìíràn lórí imú, èyí tí ó jẹ́ àmúwá kòkòrò Herpes.
Colitis Inflammation of the colon. Àìsàn amúfunwú Àìsàn amúfunwú (A-mú-ìfun- wú)

DEFINITION: (Of a person) Fall down and become unconscious as a result of illness or injury.
TRANSLATION: ó s ̣ubú,tí kò sì níyè mó ̣ nítorí àìsàn tàbí o ̣gbé ̣.

DEFINITION: is a procedure to closely examine the cervix, vagina and vulva for signs of disease. During colposcopy, your doctor uses a special instrument called a colposcope.
TRANSLATION: ìlànà tí a n gbà yẹ abẹ́, òbò àti ojú-òbò wò gẹ́gẹ́ bi àmì ìṣèdámọ ààrùn.

DEFINITION: sex worker A sex worker is a person who works in the sex industry.
TRANSLATION: pawó jẹ́ èni tí ó ń ṣe òwò nàbì.

DEFINITION: disease Any disease that can be transmitted from one person to another.
TRANSLATION: kí ààrùn tí a lè kó láti ara ẹnìkan sí ẹlòmíìràn.

DEFINITION: breakdown Communication breakdown is the ability to give or get information.
TRANSLATION: ni àìlágbára láti fúnni tàbí gba ìfitónilétí. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 63

DEFINITION: channels The method to reach the intended audiences. Channels include mass media, information and communication technology (ICT), participatory communication engagement approaches, and interpersonal counselling and communication (IPC/C) for service providers, among others.
TRANSLATION: sọ̀rọ̀ Ọ̀ nà láti fi ọ̀rọ̀ yé gbogbo olùgbọ́ nípa ìgbóhùn-sáfẹ́fẹ́ àti ìfitónilétí àti ọgbọ́n ìmúṣẹ́ṣe, ìlànà ìfàyègba ara-ìlú àti ìgbaniníyànjú oní-ìdákọ́ńkọ́ àti ìbaraẹni-sọ̀rọ̀ fún àwọn tí ó ń pèsè ìtọ́jú pẹ̀lú àwọn mìíràn bẹ́ẹ̀.

DEFINITION: strategy The guiding design in Ebola campaigns and interventions. Developing a strategy involves setting communication objectives, identifying intended audiences and determining consistent messages for all materials and activities.
TRANSLATION: Onírúurú ààbò ìdarí ìpolongo àti ìdásí ọ̀rọ̀ ìfitónilétí.

DEFINITION: health workers These are workers that are employed by public health agencies to work in a community.
TRANSLATION: tí àwọn àjọ elétò ìlera gbà láti máa siṣẹ́ agbègbè.

DEFINITION: outreach Community Outreach is an activity of providing services to any populations who might not otherwise have access to those services. A key component of outreach is that the groups providing it are not stationary, but mobile; in other words they are meeting those in
TRANSLATION: Ìpolongo agbègbè Ìpolongo ni aáyan àwo ̣n e ̣gbé ̣ tó n pèsè ìrànwó ̣ fún àwo ̣n ènìyàn tí wo ̣n kò ní ànfààní. Ibùgbé àwo ̣n aláìní yìí ni àwo ̣n e ̣gbé ̣ náà ti máa n s ̣e ìrànwó ̣ náà. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 64 need of outreach services at the locations where those in need are.

DEFINITION: Programs for Clinical Research on AIDS (CPCRA) A federally sponsored programme that conducts HIV-related clinical research through a national network of community-based research units.
TRANSLATION: CPCRA Àjọ tí ó ń ṣe agbátẹrù fún iṣẹ́ ìwádìí ajẹmọ́-ìtọ́jú láti ipasẹ̀ ìtàkùn orílẹ̀-èdè fún ìwádìí agbègbè.

DEFINITION: volunteer This is an altruistic activity where an individual or group provides services for no financial gain.
TRANSLATION: Ọlọ́wẹ̀ ọ̀fẹ́ agbègbè ni iṣẹ́ tí ènìyàn tàbí ẹgbẹ́ òsìṣẹ́ n pèsè láìní èrè aje ̣mówó nínú.

DEFINITION: Clinical Trial (CBCT) A clinical trial conducted primarily through primary-care physicians rather than academic research facilities.
TRANSLATION: Ajẹmọ́-ìtọ̀jú tí àwọn òsìṣẹ́ ìlera ṣe ju ìwádìí ẹ̀kọ́ lọ.

DEFINITION: Organization (CBO) A locally based service organization that provides social services at the community level.
TRANSLATION: Iṣẹ́ àjọ àgbègbè tó n pèsè àwọn ìrànwọ́ fún àwọn ènìyàn ní àgbèègbè.

DEFINITION: Ebola fact sheet This fact sheet can be used to explain Ebola at the community level. Information includes description of Ebola, signs and symptoms, diagnosis, treatment, transmission and prevention.
TRANSLATION: Ẹbola agbègbè Ìwé àlààyé ààrùn Ebola ni à ń lò fún àlàyé Ebola agbèègbè. Ìfitónilétí nípa Ebola, àwọn ààmì àìsàn, ìwádìí nípa àìsàn, ìtọ́jú, ìtànkálẹ̀ àti dídènà.

DEFINITION: a person has two or more diseases or conditions at the same time. For example, a person with high blood pressure may also have heart disease.
TRANSLATION: Nígbà tí ènìyàn kan bá ní ju ààrùn méjì tàbí jù bẹ́ẹ̀ lọ ní èèkan soso. Bí àpẹẹrẹ, ẹnìkan ẹlẹ́jẹ̀ ríru tún lè ní àìsàn ọkàn. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 65

DEFINITION: group of proteins in normal blood serum and plasma which, in combination with antibodies, causes the destruction of antigens, particularly bacteria and foreign blood corpuscles.
TRANSLATION: àwọn purotéénì nínú ìs ̣edéédé omi àti oje- ẹ̀jẹ̀ pẹ̀lú sójà èyí tí ó n pa àjèjì adáralóró pàápàá jùlọ bateria àti àjèjì ẹ̀jẹ̀.

DEFINITION: Cascade A precise sequence of events, usually triggered by an antigen-antibody complex, in which each component of the complement system is activated in turn.
TRANSLATION: Ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ tẹ̀lẹ́-n-tẹ̀lẹ́ tí ó rú ẹ̀ka àjèjì adáralóró- sójà ara tí ìkọ̀kan wọn.

DEFINITION: International Program of Research on AIDS (CIPRA) A federal programme that provides long-term support to developing countries to conduct HIV/AIDS research relevant to their populations.
TRANSLATION: CIPRA Ìrànwọ́ ètò ijọba fún àwọn orílẹ̀-èdè tí ó ṣẹ̀ṣẹ̀ ń dàgbà láti ṣe ìwádìí lórí KASA àti ààrùn ìsọdọ̀lẹ àjẹsára ti ó wúlò fún àwọn ènìyàn wọn.

DEFINITION: Metabolic Panel (CMP) A blood test that measures several parameters, including blood sugar (glucose), proteins, electrolytes (such as sodium and potassium), waste products (such as blood urea nitrogen [BUN] and creatinine), and enzymes.
TRANSLATION: gbogbonìṣe Àyẹ̀wò ẹ̀jẹ̀ tí ó ń ṣe òdiwọ̀n ọ̀pọ̀ nǹkan bíi adùn ẹ̀jẹ̀, purotéènì, sódíọ́mù àti pòtásíọ́mù, ẹ̀gbin inú ara bíi ìtọ̀, abbl.

DEFINITION: Tomography (CT) (Computed Tomography). Radiography (using X-rays) in which a three-dimensional image of a body structure is constructed by computer from a series of plane cross-sectional
TRANSLATION: Ẹ̀ rọ tí ó n pín ara sí ìdí orísìírísìí ọ̀nà fún àyẹ̀wò kíkún. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 66 images made along an axis. Also referred to as CAT scan.

DEFINITION: tomography scans Computerized (or computed) tomography, and often formerly referred to as computerized axial tomography (CAT) scan, is an X-ray procedure that combines many X-ray images with the aid of a computer to generate cross-sectional views and, if needed, three-dimensional images of the internal organs and structures of the body.
TRANSLATION: Ìpèsè àwòrán nípa ìlo kọ̀mpútà jẹ́ àwòrán ìtàn-àrè ti inú ara àti bí ara ṣe rí.

DEFINITION: drugs Drugs that are taken together. Certain concomitant medications may have adverse interactions.
TRANSLATION: alálòpọ̀. Ọ̀ pọ̀ òògùn àlòpọ̀ ní ó lè ní ìbáṣepọ̀ àìfẹ́.

DEFINITION: couple Sexual partners in which both partners are infected with a sexually transmitted infection, such as HIV.
TRANSLATION: kí ọkọ àti aya kó ààrùn ìbálòpọ̀ kan náà bi i KASA.

DEFINITION: study Joint French/British clinical trial of AZT in asymptomatic HIV-positive individuals.
TRANSLATION: konkodi Iṣẹ́ ìwádìí ajẹmọ́-ìtọ́jú tí AZT jẹ́ aláìlámì lára ènìyàn tí ó ń gbé pẹ̀lú KASA.

DEFINITION: is a condition of having a mistress, kept woman; secondary wife (in cultures which allow more that one wife).
TRANSLATION: ọmọbìnrin kan ní ìdákọ́nkọ́ yàtọ̀ sí aya ẹni; pàápàá, níbi tí àṣà wọn ti fi àyè sílẹ̀ ju ìyàwò kan lọ.

DEFINITION: device used during sexual intercourse to prevent exchange of genital secretions and discharges.
TRANSLATION: Rọ́bà tí à ń lò ní àsìkò ìbálòpọ̀ èyí tí ó ń dènà ààtọ̀ àti àwọn oje mìíràn. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 67

DEFINITION: distribution form A form for reporting and collecting condom distribution data.
TRANSLATION: pínpín ró ̣bà ìdáàbòbò Fó ̣ò ̣mù fún ètò pínpín àti ìjábò ̣ lórí ìfó ̣nká ró ̣bà ìdáàbòbò.

DEFINITION: wart-like excrescence near the anus or the vulva; the flat, moist papule of secondary syphilis.
TRANSLATION: kondilómà Jẹjẹrẹ tí ó wà ní ààrin gbùngbùn tí ó so ìmọ̀lára lórí ìwọ̀ àṣekun tàbí ìta ojú ara.

DEFINITION: expectation that anything done or revealed will be kept private.
TRANSLATION: a gbé jade pẹ̀lú ìrètí pé kó ní lu fóró síta.

DEFINITION: test If tests on the first sample were consistent with HIV infection, it is still essential to test a second, follow-up blood sample.
TRANSLATION: àwọn àyẹ̀wò àkọ́kọ́ kòbá ṣe déédé pẹ̀lú ìkóràn KASA, ó ṣe pàtàkì kí a ṣe àyẹ̀wò kejì nípasè ̣ àyẹ̀wò ẹ̀jẹ̀.

DEFINITION: Inflammation or infection of the conjunctiva, which is the mucous membrane that lines the inner surface of the eye. Conjunctivitis is commonly caused by a bacterial or viral infection, an allergic reaction, or a blocked tear duct (in babies).
TRANSLATION: tàbí ìkóràn ti àpólò, ó lè wà nínú àwọ̀ inú ojú. Àpólò lè wáyé nípasè ̣ batéríà, kòkòrò akóràn,ìríra tàbí dídí- òpó-omi-ojú (àwo ̣n o ̣mo ̣-ọwó ̣)

DEFINITION: is a patient’s agreement with a physician performing an operation or giving certain drugs or doing certain tests.
TRANSLATION: àwọn aláìsàn lọ́dọ̀ àwọn òs ̣ìs ̣ẹ́ ìlera kí wọ́n tó ṣe iṣẹ́ abẹ tàbí ìfúnni ní òògùn tàbí àwọn àyẹ̀wò kan.

DEFINITION: discussion aimed at ascertaining opinions or reaching an agreement
TRANSLATION: tí à ń sọ láti fi ìdí nǹkan múlẹ̀ tàbí àfe ̣nukò lórí nǹkankan. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 68

DEFINITION: room This is a room in which a doctor sees patients, mainly in a hospital.
TRANSLATION: tí dókítà ti ń rí àwọn aláìsàn nínú ilé ìwòsàn.

DEFINITION: tracing In epidemiology, contact tracing is the identification and diagnosis of people who may have come into contact with an infected person. For sexually transmitted diseases, this is generally limited to sexual partners.
TRANSLATION: àfarakàn Nínú è ̣kó ̣ àjàkálè ̣ ààrùn, èyí jé ̣ ìdámò ̣ àti ìs ̣àyè ̣wò àwo ̣n tí wó ̣n ti rìn mó ̣ aláàrùn, bí àpe ̣e ̣re ̣, ààrùn aje ̣mó ̣-ìbálòpò ̣. Ìwò ̣n ìba abáe ̣nilòpò ̣ ni àyè ̣wò yìí máa n tó ̣ sí.

DEFINITION: Capable of being transmitted from one human to another human via direct or indirect physical contact.
TRANSLATION: ìfarakó Èyí s ̣eés ̣e kí ó ràn láti ọ̀dọ̀ ẹnìkan sí e ̣lòmíràn yálà ní tààrà tabi aláisetààrà ìfara kanra: tí amọ̀ sí ààrùn ìkóràn.

DEFINITION: (infection) To acquire, incur, or become affected by a disease.
TRANSLATION: kíkó ààrùn.

DEFINITION: arm The control arm is compared to the experimental treatment arm to determine whether the experimental treatment works.
TRANSLATION: afiṣòdiwọ̀n Ọ̀ wọ́ akópa afiṣòdiwọ̀n ni a fi ń ṣe àkàwé fún ọ̀wọ́ ìtọ́jú aláyẹ̀wò láti mọ̀ bí ìtọ́jú aláyẹ̀wò ṣiṣẹ́ tí.

DEFINITION: disease spread These are ways of contending or controling the spread of diseases.
TRANSLATION: Èyí jẹ́ ìlànà wíwọ ìdìmú tàbí ṣe ìkápá ìtànkálẹ̀ ààrùn.

DEFINITION: experimental A standard against which experimental observations may be evaluated. In clinical trials, one group of patients is given an experimental drug, while
TRANSLATION: àkíyèsí afisediwọ̀n fún àkójọpọ̀. Ní ti ajẹmọ́-ìtọ́jú, àkójọpọ̀ aláìsàn ní a máa n fún ní ìfiṣediwọ̀n òògùn, nígbà tí a ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 69 another group (i.e. the control group) is given either a standard treatment for the disease or a placebo. n fún àwọn míìràn ní ìtọ́jú tó káájú ẹ̀ fún ààrùn tàbí pilasíbò.

DEFINITION: trial A type of clinical trial that includes a control arm. The control arm is compared to the experimental treatment arm to determine whether the experimental treatment works.
TRANSLATION: Ẹ̀ yà ajẹmọ́-ìtọ́jú bí i ọ̀wọ́ akópa afiṣòdiwọ̀n. A máa ń fi ṣe àkàwé fún ọ̀wọ́ ìtọ́jú aláyẹ̀wò láti mọ̀ bóyá ìtọ́jú aláyẹ̀wò ṣiṣẹ́.

DEFINITION: is a violent shaking, spasmodic muscular contraction; a sudden, violent, irregular movement of the body, caused by involuntary contraction of muscles and associated especially with brain disorders.
TRANSLATION: máa gbọ̀n kíkan- kíkan nítorí ìhámọ́ isan ní òjijì, ó s ̣eés ̣e kí ó ní s ̣e pẹ̀lú ṣégeṣège ọpọlọ.

DEFINITION: bullet-shaped centre of HIV. The viral core contains the genetic information (two single strands of RNA) and three enzymes needed for HIV to replicate.
TRANSLATION: Ibùdó KASA. Ààrin gbùngbùn kòkòrò ní jinni ìfitónilétí oní ipa RNA àti ẹnsáìmù tí a nílò fún KASA láti ṣe ẹ̀dà.

DEFINITION: protein As related to HIV: An integral protein of the HIV virus composed of three units, p24, p15 and p18.
TRANSLATION: jẹ́ gbùngbùn KASA tí ó ní ipa mẹ́ta, p24, p15 àti p18.

DEFINITION: protein on the surface of a cell that serves as a second binding site for a virus or other molecule. In order to enter a host cell, HIV must bind to two sites on the cell: the primary CD4
TRANSLATION: Purotéénì tó wà ní pèpele hóró tó jẹ́ ìdí kejì fún kòkòrò ní ọ̀nà àti wọnú hóró, KASA gbúdọ̀ dí ipò méjì nínú hóró olórí ìgbàwọlé sójà ìdáàbòbò CD receptor and either the CCR5 or CXCR4 coreceptor. àti yà CCR5 tàbí CXCR4 ajọgbàwọlé.

DEFINITION: of Immunity/ Correlates of protection The immune responses that protect an individual from a certain disease. The precise identities of the correlates of immunity in HIV are unknown.
TRANSLATION: Ìbáratan Àjẹsára Èsì àjẹsára tí ó n ṣe ìdáàbòbò fún ènìyàn lọ́wọ́ ààrùn. Ìdámọ̀ kòńgẹ́ tí ó jẹ́ ìbáratan àjẹsára lára oníKASA ni a kò mọ̀.

DEFINITION: substances A corrosive substance is one that will destroy and damage other substances with which it comes into contact.
TRANSLATION: máa ń pa tàbí ba èròjà mìíràn tí ó bá pàdé jẹ́.

DEFINITION: Preventive Therapy (CPT) Co-trimoxazole preventive therapy (CPT) reduces morbidity and mortality due to opportunistic infections in patients living with HIV.
TRANSLATION: Òògùn yìí a máa dín ìṣẹ́ tàbí ìlágbára àwọn ààrùn ajìfà kù lára àwọn tí ó ń gbé pẹ̀lú KASA.

DEFINITION: wool Also called purified cotton. Bleached and sterilized cotton from which the gross impurities, such as the seeds and waxy matter, have been removed: used for surgical dressings, tampons, etc.
TRANSLATION: pè é ní òwú amú-nǹkan- mọ́. Lẹ́yìn tí ọmọ/hóró inú rẹ̀ àti àwọn ìdọ̀tí yòókù bá ti di yíyọ kúrò, a lè lò ó fún títọ́jú ojú abẹ àti bẹ́ẹ̀ bẹ́ẹ̀ lọ

DEFINITION: rapid expulsion of air from the lungs, typically in order to clear the airways.
TRANSLATION: yára jáde láti inú ẹ̀dọ̀fóró, pàápàá kí ò ̣na èèmí le baa ja gaara.

DEFINITION: is a type of talking therapy that allows a person to talk about their problems and feelings in a confidential and dependable environment.
TRANSLATION: Ìgbaniní- yànjú Èyí ni ẹ̀yà ìwòsàn nípa ìtàkurọ̀sọ tí ó fàyègba ènìyàn láti sọ̀rọ̀ nípa ìsòro rẹ̀ àti ohun tí ó ń là á kọjá ní agbègbè tí ó fini lókàn balẹ̀ tí kò sì ní tú ni ní àṣírí. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 71

DEFINITION: rumour This is a situation whereby rumours are discarded.
TRANSLATION: Èyí ni ọ́nà ìtakò àhesọ.

DEFINITION: protein found in muscles and blood, and excreted by the kidneys in the urine. The level of creatinine in the blood and urine provides a measure of kidney function.
TRANSLATION: Purotéénì tí a rí nínú iṣan àti ẹ̀jẹ̀, tí ó jáde láti inú kídìnrín sí inú ìtọ̀. Ìwọ̀n asòdiwọ̀n ìlera kídìnrín nínú ẹ̀jẹ̀ àti ìtọ̀ pèsè òdinwọ̀n iṣẹ́ kídìnrín.

DEFINITION: Resistance to one or more drugs that occurs as a result of previous exposure to a similar drug. For example, HIV resistance to one non-nucleoside reverse transcriptase inhibitor (NNRTI) drug may produce resistance to all drugs in the NNRTI drug class, including drugs never used. Excluding all drugs in a drug class from an HIV regimen (drug sparing) is a strategy used to prevent cross-resistance.
TRANSLATION: Títako òògùn kan tàbí jù bẹ́ẹ̀ lọ látàrí lílo irú òògùn bẹ́ẹ̀ saájú. Bí àpẹẹrẹ, ìtako òògùn KASA kan lè mú ìtako irú òògùn tí wọ́n jọ wà ní ọ̀wọ́ kan náà dání bí ó ti lẹ̀ jẹ́ pé a kì kò ì tíì lo irú òògùn bẹ́ẹ̀ rí.

DEFINITION: sensitivity A sensitivity reaction to a drug that predisposes a person to react similarly to a different, but related, drug. For example, a person who has an allergic reaction to penicillin may also have an allergic reaction to amoxicillin, a related antibiotic.
TRANSLATION: lápapọ̀ Ìsesí òògùn lára ènìyàn kan tí ó tún jẹ́ kí òògùn mìíràn onírú rẹ̀ ní ìṣesí kan náà. Bí àpẹẹrẹ ìṣesí bí pẹlisilíìnì bá sọ́wọ́ òdì lára ènìyàn kan, amosilíìnì tí òun náà jẹ́ òògùn apa-batéríà náà lè sọ́wọ́ òdì. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 72

DEFINITION: minimally invasive treatment in which liquid nitrogen or argon gas is used to freeze and destroy diseased tissue.
TRANSLATION: Ìtọ́jú tí a máa ń lo láti jẹ́ kí ààrùn ìmọ̀lára dì tàbí kí a pa á run.

DEFINITION: meningitis This causes chronic basilar granulomatous meningitis, small multiple nodules may also form. These occur in cryptococcal meningitis. Focal neurological deficits, seizures and intracranial hypertension are late findings. There will be elevated cryptococal antigen titre and positive fungal culture.
TRANSLATION: Èyí n fa àìsàn ọpọlọ yírùnyírùn tí ó lè mú ẹ̀mí dání.

DEFINITION: infectious disease seen in HIV- infected patients due to the fungus Cryptococcus neoformans, which is acquired via the respiratory tract. It can spread from the lungs to the brain, the central nervous system, the skin, skeletal system and urinary tract.
TRANSLATION: kitokoko Ààrùn ìkóràn tí a n rí lára aláìsàn KASA sí osunwuuru kitokoko tí a n kó nípasẹ̀ ìdádúró èèmí. O lè tàn ká inú ẹ̀dọ̀fóró sí ọpọlọ, ààrin gbùngbùn ìmọ̀lára, ara, ètò egungun àti ilé ìtọ̀.

DEFINITION: opportunistic infection caused by the protozoan parasite Cryptosporidium parvum.
TRANSLATION: kitopórìdi Ààrùn ìkóràn tí ó wá láti ipasẹ̀ pòtósúà.

DEFINITION: Crystals in the urine. (Crystals are tiny stones composed of chemicals such as calcium.) Use of antiretroviral (ARV) drugs may cause crystalluria.
TRANSLATION: inú ìtọ̀. Òògùn apa- KASA lè fa kí òkútà wà nínú ìtọ̀. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 73

DEFINITION: practices Cultural practices are the customary actions, habit of doing things.
TRANSLATION: Àsà àti ìṣe jẹ́ ìhùwàsí, ṣíṣe nkan.

DEFINITION: propagation of microoganisms or tissue cultivated artificially in the laboratory.
TRANSLATION: abẹ̀ẹ̀mí alàìfojúrí tàbí ìṣù onírúurú nǹkan ní yàrá àyẹ̀wò.

DEFINITION: concave vessel for drinking from usually made of opaque material (as opposed to a glass).
TRANSLATION: Ife tí a fí ń mu omi tí a fi rọ́bà ṣe yàtọ̀ sí aláwo.

DEFINITION: (1) To heal, to make well, to restore to good health. (2) To bring an end to an illness, disorder, or injury by medical treatment.
TRANSLATION: Lati wòsàn, lati mú láradá, lati mú ìlera padà bọ́ sípò. (2) Láti fòpin sí àìsàn, ṣégeṣège, tàbí ọgbẹ́ nípasẹ̀ títọ́jú oníwòsàn.
Cutaneous Of, pertaining to or affecting the skin. Ajẹmáwọ̀ Ajẹmọ́ ohun tí ó nípa lórí àwọ̀ ara.

DEFINITION: protein on the surface of certain immune system cells, including CD4 T lymphocytes. CXCR4 can act as a coreceptor (a second receptor binding site) for HIV when the virus enters a host cell.
TRANSLATION: Purotéénì tí ó wà ní pèpéle àwọn ètò àjẹsára hóró kan, bí i sója ìdáàbòbò T4. Abáwọlé KASA 1 lè siṣẹ́ ajọgbàwọlé fún KASA nígbà tí kòkòrò bá wọ inú olú hóró.

DEFINITION: enzyme that plays a key role in the metabolism of approximately half the drugs in use today. CYP3A4 is a member of the cytochrome P450 family of enzymes.
TRANSLATION: Ẹnsaimu CYP3A4 Ẹnsáìmù tí ó ń ṣiṣẹ́ pàtàkì bí òògùn ṣe ń wọnú àra. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 74

DEFINITION: (CYP450) A group of enzymes involved in the breakdown of drugs in the liver. Many drugs can inhibit or enhance the activity of these enzymes, causing drug levels in the blood to increase or decrease. Cytochrome P450 (CYP450) enzymes metabolize all protease inhibitors (PIs) and non-nucleoside reverse transcriptase inhibitors (NNRTIs) and can cause drug interactions that may result in adverse effects.
TRANSLATION: ẹnsaimu P450 Àkójọpọ̀ Ẹnsáìmù tí ó lọ́wọ́ nínú ìdẹnukọlẹ̀ òògùn nínú ẹ̀dọ̀. Ọ̀ pọ̀lọpọ̀ àwọn òògùn yìí lè dójúti tàbí mú iṣẹ́ àwọn Ẹnsáìmù yìí bọ̀ sípò, kí ó mú ipò ẹ̀jẹ̀ pọ̀ tàbí kí ó dínkù.

DEFINITION: Immune system proteins involved in the normal regulation of the immune response. They may also help to activate HIV-2. Proteins used for communication by cells of the immune system. Central to the normal regulation of the immune response.
TRANSLATION: Saitokin Purotéénì ètò àjẹsára tí ó wà nínú síṣedéédé èsì àjẹsára. Wọn a máa ṣe iṣẹ́ ìrànwọ́ fún KASA 2. Purotéénì tí à ń lò fún ìbáaraẹnisòrò nínú hóró tí ètò àjẹsára. Ó jẹ́ ohun ààrin gbùngbùn fún síṣedéédé èsì àjẹsára.

DEFINITION: (CMV) Cytomegalovirus. Kòkòrò CMV Kòkòrò CMV.
(CMV) Retinitis CMV retinitis is an eye disease common among people who are infected with HIV. Without treatment, people with CMV retinitis can lose their vision. CMV infection can affect
TRANSLATION: Ìfọ́jú CMV jẹ́ ààrùn ojú tí ó wọ́pọ̀ lára àwọn tí ó n gbé pẹ̀lú KASA. Ní àìsí ìtọ́jú, àwọn tí wọ́n ní ìfọ́jú CMV lè sọ ìran nù. ìkóràn CMV lè ṣe àkóbá ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 75 both eyes and is the most common cause of blindness among people with AIDS. fún ojú méjèjì, ohun ni ó sì máa n fa ìfọ́jú lààárin àwọn tí ó ní ààrùn ìṣọdọ̀lẹ àjẹsára.

DEFINITION: infection This is a common virus that can infect almost anyone. Most people do not know they have CMV because it rarely causes symptoms.
TRANSLATION: kòkòrò tí ó lè ran gbogbo ènìyàn. ọ̀pọ̀ ènìyàn ni wọn kò mọ̀ pé wọ́n ní CMV, nítorí ki í tètè fa àìsàn.

DEFINITION: lower-than-normal number of blood cells, including red blood cells, whSite blood cells, or platelets.
TRANSLATION: Àdínkù iye ẹ̀jẹ̀ ju bí ó ti yẹ lọ ìbáà jẹ́ hóró ẹ̀jẹ̀ pupa tàbí funfun.

DEFINITION: of the substance of a cell other than the nucleus.
TRANSLATION: Gbogbo èròjà inú hóró tí ó yàtọ̀ sí gbungbun.

DEFINITION: agent or process that is toxic to cells (i.e. it causes suppression of function or cell death).
TRANSLATION: tàbí ìgbésè tí ó ní oró nínú fun hóró.

DEFINITION: Lymphocyte (CTL) A lymphocyte that is able to kill foreign cells that have been marked for destruction by the cellular immune system.
TRANSLATION: ara Hóró omi-ara tí ó lè pa hóró àjèjì tí a ti ṣe àmì sí fún ìpa- ààrùn láti ọwọ́ ètò àjẹsára hóró.

DEFINITION: activity reporting This is an account of daily activity work.
TRANSLATION: ojoojúmọ́ Èyí ni ìjáàbọ̀ iṣẹ́ ojoojúmọ́.

DEFINITION: reporting form These are forms whereby daily activities of a patient are recorded.
TRANSLATION: ojoojúmọ́ Èyí ni ìwé ìjábọ̀ iṣẹ́ ojoojúmọ́ tí àwọn aláìsàn kọ.

DEFINITION: is an act of celebrating through dancing.
TRANSLATION: ayẹyẹ nípa ijó jíjó. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 76

DEFINITION: Safety and Monitoring Board (DSMB) An independent committee composed of community representatives and clinical research experts that review data while a clinical trial is in progress to ensure that participants are not exposed to undue risks. A DSMB may recommend that a trial be stopped if there are safety concerns or if the trial objectives have been achieved.
TRANSLATION: tí óní àwọn as ̣ojú agbèègbè àti ìwádìí òye ajẹmọ́-ìtọ́jú tí ó n ṣe àtúnyẹ̀wò àká nígbà tí ajẹmọ́-ìtọ́jú bá n lọ kí àwọn akópa má baà fi ara pa nípase ̣ ewu àìròtẹ́lẹ̀.

DEFINITION: organized compilation of information, usually maintained in a computer system.
TRANSLATION: ìfitónilétí tí a ń lò fi ṣe ìmúdúró nínú kọ̀mpútà.

DEFINITION: care centre A place where HIV care and treatment is provided through partnership of key players with a central role for people living with HIV/AIDS and their peer support.
TRANSLATION: Ibi tí a ti n gba ìtọ́jú pẹ̀lú ìbáṣepọ̀ àwọn olùranlọ́wọ́ tí wọ́n n kó ipa pàtàkì fún àwọn tí óhun gbé pẹ̀lú KASA àti ààrùn ìṣọdọ̀lẹ àjẹsára àti àtìlẹ́yìn ẹgbẹ́.

DEFINITION: animals These are animals that are no longer living.
TRANSLATION: ni àwọn ẹranko tí wọ́n ti kú.

DEFINITION: Hearing impairment, deafness, or hearing loss refers to the inability to hear things, either totally or partially.
TRANSLATION: ìdití tàbí ìpàdánù gbígbọ́ jẹ́ àilè gbọ́ ǹkankan yálà díẹ̀ tàbí pátápátá.

DEFINITION: Death is the termination of all biological functions that sustain a living organism.
TRANSLATION: ìfòpìnsí gbogbo iṣẹ́ tí ó fi ọwọ́ sowọ́pọ̀ fún ohun abẹ̀ẹ̀mí. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 77

DEFINITION: Deficiency is a disorder affecting the nervous system that can have a variety of neurological signs and symptoms.
TRANSLATION: ohun àìyẹ tí ó n ṣe ìdàmú bá àìtò ohun ìmọ̀lára tí ó ní orísìírísìí àmì àti èso ara.

DEFINITION: certain; without a doubt. An initial positive HIV antibody test must be confirmed by a positive Western blot test for a person to have a definitive diagnosis of HIV infection.
TRANSLATION: àyẹ̀wò àkọ́kọ́ fún sójà ara KASA ni a gbọdọ̀ mọ̀ dájú kí á tó gba ìtọ́jú ààrùn KASA.

DEFINITION: Elimination of a gene (i.e. from a chromosome) either in nature or in the laboratory.
TRANSLATION: yálà ní ti ìṣẹ̀dá tàbí ní yàrá àyẹ̀wò.

DEFINITION: Chronic intellectual impairment (i.e. loss of mental capacity) with organic origins that affects a person's ability to function in a social or occupational setting.
TRANSLATION: ònrayè líle tí ó ń ṣe àkóbá fún ènìyàn láti siṣẹ́ àwùjọ.

DEFINITION: Destruction, removal or loss of the myelin sheath of a nerve or nerves.
TRANSLATION: Ìmúkórò àpò fẹ́lẹ́fẹ́lẹ́ nínú ìmọ̀lára.

DEFINITION: of the usual branching protoplasmic processes that conduct impulses toward the body of a nerve cell.
TRANSLATION: Ìtànká èso hóró tí ó n dá agbára ìrọ́lù sí ìmọ̀lára hóró inú ara.

DEFINITION: cell vaccine An experimental vaccine that uses dendritic cells to boost the immune system. Dendritic cell vaccines are
TRANSLATION: Àjẹsára afisòdiwọ̀n tí ó ń lo hóró ìmọ̀lára láti ru ètò àjẹsára. Ajẹsára hóró ìmọ̀lára ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 78 currently being studied as a possible way to treat people with HIV. ni ìwádìí ń lọ lọ́wọ́ lórí rẹ̀ fún ìtọ́jú àwọn tí ó ń gbé pẹ̀lú KSA.

DEFINITION: cells Patrolling immune system cells that may begin the HIV disease process by carrying the virus from the site of the infection to the lymph nodes, where other immune cells become infected. Dendritic cells travel through the body and bind to foreign invaders such as HIVespecially in external tissues, such as the skin and the membranes of the gut, lungs and reproductive tract. They then ferry the foreign substance to the lymph nodes to stimulate T cells and initiate an immune response.
TRANSLATION: ètò àjẹsára hóró tí ó lè jẹ́ ìgbésè ààrùn KASA nípa gbígbé kòkòrò láti ibi ìkóràn sí ẹ̀wọ́n omi-ara níbi tí àwọn hóró àjẹsára ti di ìkóràn. Hóró ìmọ̀lára máa n lọ ká à kiri ara tí ó jẹ́ èdìdì sí àjèjì ara bí í KASA páàpáà ìmọ̀lára ìta bí i ara, àti iwọ́ ìfun ẹran, ẹ̀dọ̀fóró àti ìbísí.

DEFINITION: fever This is a debilitating viral disease of the tropics, transmitted by mosquitoes, and causing sudden fever and acute pains in the joints.
TRANSLATION: ni ààrùn tí ó n dín agbára kù, tí ó n wá láti ara ẹ̀fọn tí ó sí ń fa ibà òjijì pẹ̀lú ògidì ìrora.

DEFINITION: is a refusal to admit the truth or reality.
TRANSLATION: gba òtítọ́ tàbí gba òkodoro gbọ́.

DEFINITION: (DNA) One of two types of genetic material found in all living cells and many viruses. (The other type of genetic material is RNA.) Deoxyribonucleic acid (DNA) carries the genetic
TRANSLATION: lára àwọn èlò jínńnì tí à ń rí nínú gbogbo hóró ààyè àti ọ̀pọ̀ kòkòrò. DNA máa ń gba ìtànkálẹ̀ ìfitónilétí láti ìran kan sí òmíràn. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 79 instructions for the development and function of an organism. DNA allows for the transmission of genetic information from one generation to the next.

DEFINITION: of Health and Human Services (DHHS) The United States Department of Health and Human Services (DHHS) works closely with state and local governments and many HHS-funded services are provided at the local level by state or county agencies, or through private sector grantees. The agency’s eleven operating divisions, including the Centres for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC), the Food and Drug Administration (FDA), and the National Institutes of Health (NIH), collectively administer more than 300 HHS programmes.
TRANSLATION: àti iṣẹ́ ẹ̀dà Ẹ̀ ka ìlera àti iṣẹ́ ẹ̀dá ti ìjọba orílẹ̀-èdè Amẹ́ríkà máa ń ṣiṣẹ́ pẹ̀lú ìjọba ìpínlẹ̀ àti ọ̀pọ̀ ibi-iṣẹ́ ẹda mìíràn làtí ìjọba ìbílẹ̀ àti àwọn afúnnilówó aládàáni. Ẹ̀ ka mọ́kànlá ibi-iṣẹ́ náà ni CDC, FDA, NIH wọn sàkóso ètò ibi-ise ẹda ti ó to 300.

DEFINITION: mood disorder characterized by sadness, inactivity, and inability to take pleasure or interest in usual activities. The changes in mood can interfere with daily life and normal functioning. Use of some antiretroviral (ARV) drugs may cause depression.
TRANSLATION: àìyẹ tí ó wáyé láti ara ìbànújẹ́, àìlègbádùn ohunkóhun. Àìṣe dédé ìwà yìí lè nípa lórí ìsẹ̀lẹ̀ ojoojúmọ́. Òògùn apa-KASA lè fa ìrẹ̀wẹ̀sì ọkàn. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 80

DEFINITION: Preventing or reducing a hyper- sensitivity reaction to a drug by gradually increasing the dose of the drug.
TRANSLATION: fún ìwòsàn Ìdènà tàbí àdínkù sí òògùn nípa ṣíṣe àlékún ìwọ̀n ìlo òògùn.

DEFINITION: disorder of metabolism causing excessive thirst and the production of large volumes of urine. Used alone, the term commonly refers to diabetes mellitus.
TRANSLATION: Ṣégeṣège àsèe-hóró tí ó n fa aìfẹ́ òngbẹ àti ìpèsè ìtọ̀ lọ́pọ̀. Èyí tí a mò sí àtọ̀gbẹ/ìtọ̀ súgà.

DEFINITION: identifying of an illness or disorder in a patient through physical examination, medical tests, or other procedures.
TRANSLATION: ìdámọ̀ àìsàn tàbí àìyẹ nínú aláìsàn nípa ìdánwò ara, àyẹ̀wò ìṣègùn, tàbí ìlànà mìíràn.

DEFINITION: services Activities or procedures related to determining the cause of an illness or disorder.
TRANSLATION: Iṣẹ́ ìdámọ̀ àìsàn ni ó n pèsè ìtọ́jú ìlera fún àwọn akọ́ṣẹ́mọ́ṣẹ́ ìlera lórí ìfitónilétí nípa wíwà, bí ó ṣe le tó, àti okùnfà ààrùn lára aláìsàn.

DEFINITION: Mechanical process of removing waste products from blood.
TRANSLATION: ìgbésẹ̀ mímú ìdọ̀tí èròjà nínú ẹ̀jẹ̀ kúrò.

DEFINITION: is an increase in liquidity, frequency or volume of movements as compared to normal for that person. Acute diarrhoea develops from time to time due to contamination of food or water. Such episode clears within 2 or 3 days even without treatment, only from
TRANSLATION: gbuuru Àlékún ìgbẹ́ olómi ju bí ó ṣe yẹ nínú ara ènìyàn. Ògidì ìgbẹ́ gbuuru máa n wá ní òrèkòorè fún bí i ọjọ́ méjì sí mẹ́ta láì lo òògùn kí i ó tó dá. Ìgbẹ́ gbuuru pípẹ́ máa n wá láti ipasẹ̀ àrùn, èyí tí ó nílò ìtọ́jú àti ìwádìí. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 81 fluid balance, while chronic diarrhoea is due to some diseases and requires treatment and investigations.

DEFINITION: (DDI, Dideoxyinosine) Dideoxyinosine (didanosine, Videx), a nucleoside analog drug that inhibits the replication of HIV.
TRANSLATION: didanosin Èyí ni òògùn KASA tí a n lò fún ìtọ́jú KASA àti ààrùn ìṣọdọ̀lẹ àjẹsára pẹ̀lú àwọn òògùn míìràn gẹ́gẹ́ bi ara òògùn ìtọ́jú àìlera.

DEFINITION: (DDC) Dideoxycytidine (zalcitabine, HIVID), a nucleoside analog drug that inhibits the replication of HIV.
TRANSLATION: adójúti ẹ̀dà KASA.

DEFINITION: serious and extremely infectious disease caused by a bacterium called Corynebacterium diphtheria and its highly strong toxin (attacks the upper respiratory tract and the throat).
TRANSLATION: Ààrùn tí ó léwu èyí tí a kó láti ara bateria tí ó ní oró nínú, èyí tí ó n kọlu ìdádúró èèmí àti ọ̀fun.

DEFINITION: Observed Therapy (DOT) A method of drug administration in which a health care professional watches as a person takes each dose of a medication. Directly observed therapy (DOT) is used to ensure the person receives and takes all medications as prescribed and to monitor response to treatment. DOT is widely used to manage tuberculosis (TB) disease. In HIV treatment, DOT
TRANSLATION: ojoojúmọ́ Ọ̀ nà ìsàkóso òògùn ní èyí tí àwọn alábójútó ìlera ṣe ń wo bí aláìsàn ṣe ń lo òògùn wọn. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 82 is sometimes called directly administered antiretroviral therapy (DAART).

DEFINITION: Observed Treatment Short course (DOTS) This is the name given to the tuberculosis control strategy recommended by the World Health Organization.
TRANSLATION: ni orúkọ tí a fún ìsàkóso Ikọ́-ife tí àjọ World Health Organization fọwọ́sí.

DEFINITION: (Dark Blue) Cyanosis is a bluish colour to the skin or mucus membrane that is usually due to a lack of oxygen in the blood.
TRANSLATION: àbàwọ́n tí oun ṣe sí ara fún ìdí àìtó atẹ́gùn nínú ẹ̀jẹ̀.

DEFINITION: couple Discordant couples are those where one partner is HIV-infected and the other is not, where a couple is defined as two persons in an ongoing sexual relationship and each of these persons is referred to as a “partner” in the relationship.
TRANSLATION: kannáà ni àwọn tí ẹnìkan ní KASA tí ẹnìkejì kò ní; nígbà tí a bá a túnmọ̀ tọkọtaya sí méjì ní ti ìbánidọ́rẹ̀, tí a sì mọ àwọn méjèèjì sí olùrànlọ́wọ́ alábàṣepọ̀.

DEFINITION: serious and lengthy speech or piece of writing about a topic.
TRANSLATION: sísọ tàbí kíkọ tí ó pọ̀ tí o si ṣe pàtàkì.

DEFINITION: disorder with specific cause (which may or may not be known) and recognizable signs and symptoms; and bodily abnormality or failure to function properly, except that resulting directly from physical injury (the latter however may open the way for disease).
TRANSLATION: a mọ ìdí bí ó ṣe wá tàbí a kò mọ̀ tí óhun ṣe ségesège nínú ara. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 83

DEFINITION: spread The routes and agency by which the germs that cause a disease move from one victim to another.
TRANSLATION: ̣n ò ̣nà àti akárùn tí àwo ̣n kòkòrò afàrùn fi n tan ààrùn ká.

DEFINITION: transmission Infectious diseases are those that are transmitted from person to person by direct or indirect contact. Viruses, bacteria, parasites, and fungi all cause infectious disease. In medicine, public health and biology, transmission is the passing of a communicable disease from an infected host individual or group to a particular individual or group, regardless of whether the other individual was previously infected.
TRANSLATION: ààrùn tí ó n ràn láti ara ẹnìkan sí e ̣lòmíràn yálà tààrà tàbí è ̣bùrù. Àwọn kòkòrò, batéríà, àti osunwuuru ló máa n fa ìkóràn ààrùn.

DEFINITION: is a chemical agent that destroys a harmful organism (i.e. bacteria).
TRANSLATION: ni àwọn kẹ́míkà tí ó n pa gbogbo ohun tí ó n ṣe ìpalára fún ara bí bateria.

DEFINITION: an infection or disease has widely dispersed in a tissue, an organ, or the entire body.
TRANSLATION: ni kí ìkóràn tàbí ààrùn fọ́nká sínu ìṣù, ara, tàbí gbogbo àgọ́ ara.

DEFINITION: Ebola Response Centre (DERC) A local government level coordination hub for directing responses to the fight against the Ebola epidemic.
TRANSLATION: Ebola Ibùdó ìjo ̣ba íbílè ̣ fún ìgbógunti ààrùn Ebola.

DEFINITION: Intermediate hospital A major healthcare facility which serves a number of local communities.
TRANSLATION: ̣jú ò ̣pò ̣ ìletò Ilé ìwòsàn nlá tí ó n pèsè ìtó ̣jú fún àkójo ̣pò ̣ ìletò. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 84

DEFINITION: of Acquired Immunodeficiency Syndrome (DAIDS) A federal programme that supports research on the following: how HIV is transmitted and causes disease; the development of therapies for HIV infection, its complications, and co- infections; and the development of vaccines and other prevention strategies.
TRANSLATION: àjẹsára Àjọ àpapọ̀ tí ó ń pèsè ìrànwọ́ fún iṣẹ́ ìwádìí adálórí bí KASA ṣe ń tàn ká òǹfà ààrùn náà, ìdàgbàsókè àìlera fún ìkóràn KASA, ìnira àti àwọn ìsọmọgbè rẹ̀ pẹ̀lú ìdàgbàsókè àjẹsára àti àwọn ìlànà ìdènà mìíràn.

DEFINITION: of Aids Treatment Research Initiative (DATRI) An organization established by the National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases as a national network to test new therapies for HIV- infected persons. Its hallmark is the ability to rapidly conduct clinical trials and related research that evaluates new therapies and novel treatment approaches for those with HIV disease.
TRANSLATION: DATRI Àjọ tí NIAID sà gbékalẹ̀ gẹ́gẹ́ bí ìtàkùn àgbáyé orílẹ̀-èdè láti mọ àìlera tuntun fún àwọn tí ó ń gbé pẹ̀lú KASA. Ówà láti ṣe ìwádìí ajẹmọ́-ìtọ́jú àti àwọn ìwádìí tí ó tan mọ́, èyí tí ó ṣe àgbékalẹ̀ àìlera tuntun àti ìtọ́jú tí ó wà fún ààrùn KASA.

DEFINITION: physician or doctor is a professional who practises medicine, which is concerned with promoting, maintaining, or restoring human health through the study, diagnosis and treatment of disease, injury and other physical and mental impairments.
TRANSLATION: tàbí dókítà jẹ́ ẹni tí ó ní ìwé àṣẹ láti ṣe ìtọ́jú àwọn ènìyàn nípa ìlànà ẹ̀kọ́, ìdámọ̀ àìsàn àti ìtọ́jú ààrùn.
Domain A region of a gene or gene product. Ṣàkánì Agbèègbè ẹ̀yọ́-ìran tàbí èròjà ẹ̀yọ́-ìran.

DEFINITION: giver of a tissue or an organ, such as blood or kidney.
TRANSLATION: ìmọ̀lára tàbí ara bíi ẹ̀jẹ̀ àti kídìrín. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 85

DEFINITION: is a period in an organism's life cycle when growth, development, and (in animals) physical activity are temporarily stopped. This minimizes metabolic activity and therefore helps an organism to conserve energy.
TRANSLATION: gbogbo ipò ìdàgbàsókè àti iṣẹ́ ara tí ó kọ iṣẹ́. O máa n ṣe ìdíwọ́ iṣẹ́ díẹ̀, ó sì n gbé okun dúró.

DEFINITION: fat pad An accumulation of fat on the back of the neck between the shoulders. A dorsocervical fat pad may be due to use of some antiretroviral (ARV) drugs.
TRANSLATION: ọrùn Àkójọpọ̀ ọ̀rá ní ẹ̀yìn ọrùn lè jẹ́ ìpèsè àwọn òògùn KASA.

DEFINITION: administration of individual doses of a medication as part of a medication regimen, usually expressed as quantity per unit of time. For example, a prescribed dosage might consist of 25 mg of a medication given 3 times a day for 6 days.
TRANSLATION: bí i àwon èèyàn se ń lo òògùn ìwọ̀n kan fún àkókò kan. Ìwọ̀n òògùn le ní 25mg fún ọjọ́ méta lójúmọ́ fún ọjọ́ mẹ́fà.

DEFINITION: quantity of a medication to be given at one time or the total quantity of a medication administered during a specified period of time. For example, a patient might receive an initial medication dose of 50 mg, and, during the entire course of treatment, receive a total medication dose of 500 mg.
TRANSLATION: òògùn tí a lè lò fún àkókò kan tàbí gbogbo ìwọ̀n òògùn tí a lè lò fún àkókò kan. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 86

DEFINITION: study A clinical trial in which two or more doses of an agent (such as a drug) are tested against each other to determine which dose works best and is least harmful.
TRANSLATION: ìwọ̀n òògùn Ajẹmọ́-ìtọ́jú ní èyí tí ìwọ̀n òògùn asojú méjì tabí jù bẹ́ẹ̀lọ wà fún àyẹ̀wò ara wọn láti mọ ìwọ̀n òògùn tí ó siṣẹ́ jùlọ, tí kò sì léwu púpọ̀.

DEFINITION: trial A type of clinical trial. In dose-ranging trials, different doses of a drug are tested. Trial results are compared to determine which dose is most safe and effective.
TRANSLATION: wò Ẹ̀ yà ajẹmọ́-ìtọ́jú. Nínú dídán òògùn wò, orìsirísi ìwọ̀n òògùn ni a máa ń dánwò. Àwọn èsì àbájáde yìí ni a máa ń ṣe àfiwé ẹ̀ láti mọ ìwọ̀n òògùn tí ò léwu.

DEFINITION: relationship The relationship between the dose of some agent (such as a drug), or the extent of exposure, and a physiological response. A dose-response effect means that as the dose increases so does the effect.
TRANSLATION: Ìbáṣepọ̀ láàárín ìwọ̀n àwọn aṣojú òògùn tàbí iye ìfìhàn àti èsì ẹ̀kọ́ ìwúlò ẹ̀yà ara. Ipa ìsiṣẹ́ ìwọ̀n òògùn túnmọ̀ sí ìgbéwọ̀n òògùn ṣe tó béèni ipa rẹ̀.
Double orphan A child whose parents are dead. Ọmọ òrukàn Èyí ni àwọn ọmọ tí òbí wọn ti kú.

DEFINITION: study A clinical trial design in which neither the participating individuals nor the study staff know which patients are receiving the experimental drug and which are receiving placebo or another therapy. Double-blind trials are thought to produce objective results, since the doctor's and patient's
TRANSLATION: Nípa iṣẹ́ ìwádìí ajẹmọ́tọjú tó n ṣe àfihàn bóyá àwọn akópa tàbí àwọn olùkọ́ mọ aláìsàn tí ó n gba àyẹ̀wò òògùn àti pilasíbò tàbí ìtọ́jú àìlera. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 87 expectations about the experimental drug do not affect the outcome.

DEFINITION: of blood Obtainment of a sample of blood from an individual’s superficial blood vessel usually by means of a suitable equipment.
TRANSLATION: Èyí ni ọ̀nà tí a fí ń gba ẹ̀jẹ̀ lára olùfúnni pè ̣lú irinṣẹ́ tí ó tò ̣nà ní ilé ìwòsàn.

DEFINITION: antagonism An interaction between two or more drugs that have opposite effects on the body. Drug antagonism may block or reduce the effectiveness of one or more of the drugs.
TRANSLATION: Ìbárasepọ̀ láàárín òògùn méjì tàbí jù bẹ́ẹ̀ lọ tí iṣẹ́ wọn takora. Ìtakora òògùn lè dènà tàbí dín ìsiṣẹ́ òògùn kan tàbí méjì.

DEFINITION: class A group of drugs that share common properties, which may include a similar mechanism of action, chemical structure, or approved use.
TRANSLATION: òògùn ajo ̣ra tí ó lè ní iṣẹ́ agbára kan náà, èròjà kan náà èyí tí a fòǹtẹ̀ lú fún lílò.

DEFINITION: concentration The amount of a drug in a given volume of blood plasma, measured as the number of micrograms per millilitre.
TRANSLATION: ẹ̀jẹ̀ Ìwọ̀n òògùn nínú oje ẹ̀jẹ̀ tí nọ́mbà gírámù kékéré rẹ̀ jẹ́ òdiwọ̀n ìdá ọ̀kẹ́ kan.

DEFINITION: detoxification Drug detoxification (informally, detox) is the process and experience of a withdrawal syndrome; and any of various treatments for acute drug overdose.
TRANSLATION: òògùn ni ìgbèṣẹ̀ àti ìrírí ìpadà àwọn àìsàn àti orísìírísìí àwọn ìtọ́jú fún àsìlò ògidì òògùn. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 88

DEFINITION: interaction The effects of two or more drugs taken simultaneously producing an alteration in the usual effects of either drug taken alone. The interacting drugs may have a potentially or additive effect and serious side effects may result.
TRANSLATION: òògùn méjì tàbí jù bẹ́ẹ̀ lọ lára, nígbà tí a bá ń lò ó pẹ̀lú àwọn òògùn mìíràn tí ó ní àyípadà ipa òògùn tí a lò papọ̀ tàbí lásán.

DEFINITION: management Medication therapy management (MTM) is a medical care provided by pharmacists whose aim is to optimize drug therapy and improve therapeutic outcomes for patients.
TRANSLATION: òògùn ni ìtọ́jú ìlera tí àwọn apoògùn tí iṣẹ́ wọn ni láti ru òògùn fún àwọn aláìsàn.

DEFINITION: regimens A programme of treatment which systematically incorporates more than one medication.
TRANSLATION: Ìlànà ìtọ́jú tí ó ní ju ìlò òògùn lọ.

DEFINITION: resistance Drug resistance is the reduction in effectiveness of a drug such as an antimicrobial, anthelmintic or an antineoplastic in curing a disease or condition.
TRANSLATION: òògùn ni àdínkù aporó àsìlò òògùn bí i sójà ara, òògùn jẹjẹrẹ fún ìtọ́jú ààrùn.

DEFINITION: synergism An interaction between two or more drugs that causes the total effect of the drugs to be greater than the sum of the individual effects of each drug. A synergistic effect can be beneficial or harmful.
TRANSLATION: láàárín òògùn méjì tàbí jùbẹ̀ lọ tí wọ́n ní ipa àwọn òògùn tí ó ju gbogbo ipá ènìyàn fún òògùn kọkan. Ipa àjọsiṣẹ́pọ̀ dára ju èyí tí ó ní ewu lọ. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 89

DEFINITION: abuse The recurrent use of illegal drugs, or the misuse of prescription or over-the- counter drugs with negative consequences.
TRANSLATION: Ìlò bárakú òògun àìbófinmu tàbí às ̣ìlò òògùn àko ̣fúnni pè ̣lú àbájáde tó léwu.

DEFINITION: interaction A modification of the effect of a drug when administered with another drug. The effect may be an increase or a decrease in the action of either substance, or it may be an adverse effect that is not normally associated with either drug.
TRANSLATION: Ìyípadà ipa òògùn nígbà tí a báa lo pẹ̀lú òògùn mìíràn. Ipa lè ṣe àlékún tàbí ṣe àdínkù bá iṣẹ́ àwọn èròjà; ó lè jẹ́ ìṣẹ́lẹ́ àìfẹ́ tí kò tan mọ́ òògùn náà.

DEFINITION: interaction A change in a drug’s effect on the body when the drug is taken together with certain foods or beverages. Not all drugs are affected by food, and some drugs are affected by only certain foods. A drug-food interaction can delay, decrease, or enhance absorption of a drug. This can cause the drug to be less effective, cause adverse effects, or increase the action of the drug.
TRANSLATION: àti oúnjẹ Ìyípadà ipa òògùn nínú ara nígbà tí a bá lo òògùn mọ́ irú awọn ounjẹ kan. Kìí ṣe gbogbo òògùn ni irú awọn ouńjẹ kan ń ṣe àkóbá fún, nígbà mìíràn ouńjẹ a máa ṣe àtakò fún òògùn kan.

DEFINITION: is a chemical substance which can alter the function of some organs. These include prescribed as well as over the counter remedies.
TRANSLATION: èròjà kẹ́míkà tí ó lè nípa lórí iṣẹ́ àwo ̣n è ̣yà inú ara. Ó lè jé ̣ às ̣àyàn òògùn tàbí ti orí àte ̣. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 90

DEFINITION: & alcoholism isolation A special programme for treating persons with drug or alcohol addiction problems.
TRANSLATION: ̣ìlò òògùn àti ààrùn ìmupara Às ̣àyàn ètò fún ìtó ̣jú àwo ̣n alás ̣ìlò òògùn àti ààrùn o ̣tí àmupara.

DEFINITION: a strain of HIV is sensitive to one or more antiretroviral (ARV) drugs. Antiretroviral therapy (ART) will likely be effective against a drug- susceptible strain of HIV. Sensitive to the effect of a drug.
TRANSLATION: tí agara bá dá KASA nípa iṣiṣẹ́ òògùn apa KASA kan tàbí jù bẹ́ẹ̀ lọ. Ìtó ̣jú apa KASA le ṣiṣẹ́ tako òògùn kan tàbí kí ó máa dá KASA lágara.

DEFINITION: Blood Spot (DBS) This is a blood test to detect HIV infection on children.
TRANSLATION: ọmọdé Èyí ni àyẹ̀wò àti mọ ìkóràn KASA lára ọmọdé.

DEFINITION: Energy X-ray Absorptiometry (DEXA) A test that uses low-dose X-rays to measure bone mineral density, including calcium content, in a section of bone. Dual energy X-ray absorptiometry (DEXA) scans are used to detect osteoporosis and predict the risk of bone fracture.
TRANSLATION: ìsàmúlò ìwọ̀n òògùn fọ́tò àyà láti ṣe òdiwọ̀n egungun nínú ipò egungun pẹ̀lú ìwọ̀n kásíọ́mù ní apá egungun kan.

DEFINITION: virus A strain of HIV that can enter and infect a host cell by binding to either the CCR5 or CXCR4 receptor on the host cell. To enter a host cell, HIV must first attach to a CD4 receptor, then attach to either the CCR5 or CXCR4 receptor, and finally fuse its membrane with the host cell
TRANSLATION: agba èyíkèyí ọ̀nà wọ hóró Agara KASA tí ó kó ààrùn ran olú hóró nípa àbùdà yálà sí ibùdó CCR5 tàbí CXCR4 nínú olú hóró. Láti wọ inú olúgbàlejò hóró, KASA gbudọ̀ so mọ́ ibùdó sójà ìdáàbòbò kẹrin, kí ó sì wá so mọ́ ìwọ̀ rẹ̀ pẹ̀lú ìwọ̀ ìsokùn rẹ̀. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 91 membrane. HIV is usually R5-tropic (uses CCR5) during the early stages of infection, but the virus may later switch to using either only CXCR4 or both CCR5 and CXCR4.

DEFINITION: Abnormal levels of lipids (fats), including cholesterol and triglycerides, in the blood. Dyslipidemia can refer to either decreased or elevated levels of lipids. Dyslipidemia may be an adverse effect of some antiretroviral (ARV) drugs.
TRANSLATION: Ìpele àìbámu ọ̀rá pẹ̀lú ọ̀rá inú ẹ̀jẹ̀. Àìbámu ọ̀rá inú ẹ̀jẹ̀ lè mú àdínkù tàbí ṣe àlékún fún ìpele ọ̀rá.

DEFINITION: enlargement of an organ or tissue by the proliferation of cells of an abnormal type, as a developmental disorder or an early stage in the development of cancer.
TRANSLATION: ̣yà ara Ìtóbi è ̣yà ara nípasè ̣ hóró kòbé ̣gbé ̣mu tàbí ìbè ̣rè ̣ ìdàgbàsókè ààrùn je ̣je ̣re ̣.

DEFINITION: detection Identification of a specific disease at an early stage in the natural history of the disease.
TRANSLATION: ààrùn kan pàtó ní ìbẹ̀rẹ̀ pẹ̀pẹ̀ ààrùn.

DEFINITION: Warning Indicator of HIV Drug Resistance (EWI) Early warning indicators (EWIs) of HIV drug resistance (HIVDR) are a key component of WHO public health strategy to minimize and assess HIVDR in countries scaling up
TRANSLATION: KASA Ìtètè farahàn ìtakò òògùn KASA jẹ́ ìlànà kan pàtàkì tí àjọ WHO nípa ìlera gbogboogbò ní àwọn orílẹ̀-èdè tí wọ́n ṣe àgbédìde òògùn apa- ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 92 antiretroviral therapy. EWIs are quality of care indicators which specifically assess factors at individual antiretroviral therapy clinics associated with emergence of HIVDR. KASA. Ìkìlọ̀ atako òògùn KASA ni ìwọ̀ afihan iye itọju ti a mọ̀ mọ òògùn apa KASA pẹ̀lú àwọn òògùn atako KASA.

DEFINITION: awareness Having information about Ebola disease.
TRANSLATION: ìmọ̀ nípa ààrùn Ebola.

DEFINITION: centre It is a place where treatment of Ebola is administered.
TRANSLATION: Ebola Ibi tí a ti ń gba ìtọ́jú nípa Ebola.

DEFINITION: clients Persons infected or affected by Ebola virus.
TRANSLATION: ̣n èèyàn tí wo ̣n ti kó ààrùn Èbolà tàbí tí wo ̣n ti rí àkóbá lára kokòrò re ̣.

DEFINITION: Communication Network (ECN) The ECN is a collection of health communication materials designed to help address the spread of the Ebola virus in West Africa.
TRANSLATION: nípa Ẹbola Ìfọwọ́sowọ́pọ̀ nípa Ẹbola láti ṣe ìrànlọ́wọ́ lọ́nà àti gbógun ti ìtànkálẹ̀ ààrùn Èbólà ní ilẹ̀ Afíríkà

DEFINITION: contact A person seen as a possible carrier of an Ebola disease.
TRANSLATION: tí ó ní ààrùn Ebola.

DEFINITION: contaminated house The house that is impure, unclean, or polluted, especially because of the Ebola virus.
TRANSLATION: àìmọ́, pàápàá ààrùn Ebola.

DEFINITION: contaminated zone A zone that is polluted, especially because of the Ebola virus.
TRANSLATION: tí ó jẹ́ àìmọ́ pàápàá ààrùn Ebola.

DEFINITION: contract A situation in which two or more things or people actually touch or strike against Ebola virus.
TRANSLATION: ènìyàn méjì tàbí jùbẹ́lọ̀ fi kó ààrùn Ebola. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 93

DEFINITION: control A place at which Ebola is checked or inspected or from which Ebola is directed.
TRANSLATION: Ebola Ibi tí a tí n wo tàbí ṣe ìkápá Ebola.

DEFINITION: control environment
TRANSLATION: Ebola datasets. Ìṣèdarí àyíká Ebola Àká Èbólà

DEFINITION: datasets Up-to-the-minute datasets on the reach of the virus, health facilities, etc.
TRANSLATION: Ebola Àká data Ebola ní ọ̀nà àti mọ kòkòrò àti àwọn irinṣẹ́ ìlera

DEFINITION: detector machine A device for sensing the presence of or changes in Ebola virus.
TRANSLATION: Ebola Irinṣẹ́ tí ó n ṣe àwárí tàbí ṣe ìyípadà nínú kòkòrò Ebola.

DEFINITION: disease A condition in humans, plants, or animals that results in pathological symptoms and is not the direct result of physical injury.
TRANSLATION: Ebola Ipò àwọn àmì àìsàn ara ènìyàn tàbí ẹranko tí kì í ṣe àbájáde ọgbẹ́ ara tàbí àfọwọ́fà.

DEFINITION: drugs A natural or artificial substance given to treat or prevent Ebola disease or to lessen pain.
TRANSLATION: Ebola Ohun èròjà tí a fi n ṣe ìtọ́jú tàbí jẹ́ ìdènà ààrùn Ebola tàbí ṣe àdínkù bá ìrora rẹ́.

DEFINITION: emergency teams These are individuals who provide immediate action for Ebola treatment.
TRANSLATION: Èbola Èyí ni àwọn tí ó ń pèsè iṣẹ́ pàjáwìrì fún ìtọ́jú Èbóla.

DEFINITION: enlightenment This the state of having conciousness of Ebola.
TRANSLATION: Ìlanilọ́ yẹ̀ nípa Ebola Ìlanilọ́yè nipa Èbólà.

DEFINITION: facts Information about the virus, its spread, detection, treatment, previous outbreaks and different strains of Ebola.
TRANSLATION: Ebola Ìfitónilétí nípa kòkòrò, ìtànkálẹ̀ ìtimọ́lé, ìtọ́jú ìbẹ́sílẹ̀ sáajú àti onírúurú ẹ̀yà Èbólà. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 94

DEFINITION: free Not at risk of involvement with Ebola virus.
TRANSLATION: Ebola Kò sí ewu às ̣epò ̣ pè ̣lú Ebola tàbí kíkó kòkòrò rè ̣.

DEFINITION: incidence The frequency with which Ebola infection occurs.
TRANSLATION: Ebola Iye ìgbà tí ìkóran Ebola fí n ṣẹlẹ̀ nígbà gbogbo.

DEFINITION: infection Ebola infection is an act of contracting Ebola virus.
TRANSLATION: Ebola Ìkóràn Ebola n wáyé nípa fífarakan kòkòrò rè ̣.

DEFINITION: information Definite knowledge acquired or supplied about Ebola.
TRANSLATION: Ebola Ìmọ̀ òye tí a gbà nípa Ẹ̀bola.

DEFINITION: is a rapid response of aid workers to reduce the spread of Ebola.
TRANSLATION: Ebola Ìdásí àwọn òsìṣẹ́ ìlera láti dẹ́kun ìtànkálẹ̀ ààrùn Ẹ̀bólà

DEFINITION: Ebola training toolkit is for organizations (such as non- governmental organizations [NGOs]) to use to offer training to health care workers.
TRANSLATION: Ebola Irinṣẹ́ àwọn àjọ tí a ń lò fún ìdánilẹ́kọ̀ọ́ nípa Èbólà pàápàá fún àwọn òsìṣẹ́ ìlera.

DEFINITION: management The coordination of the processes involved in caring for a person who is considered to have been exposed to the Ebola virus.
TRANSLATION: Ebola Ìsàkóso àti ètò ìdarí ìtó ̣jú e ̣ni tí ó wà ní agbègbè kòkòrò Èbólà.
Ebola medication A drug used to treat Ebola virus. Òògun Ebola Òògùn tí a n lò fún ìtọ́jú ààrùn Ebola.

DEFINITION: message Any concept or information about Ebola virus.
TRANSLATION: Ebola Ọ̀ rò ̣ tàbí ìfitónilétí nípa ààrùn Ebola.

DEFINITION: negative Showing the absence of ebola disease or condition that is being tested for.
TRANSLATION: ààrùn Ebola hàn nígbà tí a bá ṣe àyẹ̀wò Ebola. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 95

DEFINITION: patient Somebody who receives medical treatment of Ebola.
TRANSLATION: ó n gba ìtọ́jú fún ààrùn Ebola.

DEFINITION: positive The outcome of a test that someone has been infected with Ebola virus.
TRANSLATION: àyẹ̀wò múlẹ̀ pé ènìyàn ní ààrùn Ebola.

DEFINITION: posters (community) Selection of posters from Sierra Leone, Senegal and Liberia, as well as generic posters from the CDC and UNICEF, covering Ebola detection, prevention, care and treatment.
TRANSLATION: nípa Ebola Àsàyàn ìwé àlẹ̀mọ̀-orígi láti orílẹ̀-èdè Sierra Leone, Senegal ati Liberia, pẹ̀lú àlẹ̀mọ́-ògiri láti ibiṣẹ́ CDC àti UNICEF, tí ó ní ìfipamọ́, ìdènà, àbójútó àti ìtọ́jú Èbólà.

DEFINITION: prevalence The total number of cases of Ebola virus in the statistical population at a given time.
TRANSLATION: Gbogbo iye ààrùn Ebola ní ìṣirò àwọn olùgbé ní àkókò kan.

DEFINITION: prevention An action or actions taken to stop Ebola contract or to stop Ebola disease from happening.
TRANSLATION: dídẹ́kun ebola kíkó.

DEFINITION: protection Ebola protection may refer to materials used in covering the body in attending to patient.
TRANSLATION: Èbólà Àwọn ohun èlò tí a n lò fi bo ara nígbà tí a bá n ṣe ìtọ́jú àwọn aláàrùn Ebola.

DEFINITION: protection action cards Print materials or Ebola preparedness kit for aid workers.
TRANSLATION: wọ́ Ebola Àwọn ohun tí a tẹ̀ fún ìrànlọ́wọ́ àwọn òsìṣẹ́.

DEFINITION: quarantine centre A facility for the mandatory isolation of people or animals that may have been exposed to Ebola virus.
TRANSLATION: Elebólà Ibùdó ìyàsọ́tọ̀ kànnpá fún ènìyàn tàbí ẹranko tí ó kó ààrùn Ebola. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 96

DEFINITION: response plan Initiatives for countering an outbreak of Ebola infection.
TRANSLATION: Aáyan ìgbógunti `ibé ̣sílè ̣ àkóràn Ebola.
Ebola River A river in Central Africa. Odò Ebola Odò kan ní ààrin gbùngbùn ilè ̣ Áfíríkà.

DEFINITION: screening A test or testing carried out routinely on supposedly healthy people in order to establish, as early as possible, whether or not they have an illness or disease.
TRANSLATION: Ebola Àyẹ̀wò tí a n lò ní òrèkórè fún ènìyàn tí ó pé láti fi múlẹ̀ bóyá ènìyàn bẹ́ ẹ̀ ní Ebola tàbí kòní.

DEFINITION: sensitive protection These are all cover gadgets used among Ebola health workers.
TRANSLATION: onítọjú Elébólà Àwọn ohun adáàbòbò onítọjú elébólà.

DEFINITION: sensitive social protection These are the preventive measure of Ebola gadgets for the community.
TRANSLATION: Ebola Láwùjọ Àwọn ohun adáàbòbò onítọjú Ebólà.

DEFINITION: survivor clinic Rehabilitation centre for persons who survive Ebola disease.
TRANSLATION: Ebola Ibùdó ìdámò ̣ràn fún àwo ̣n alájàbàwo ààrùn Ebola.

DEFINITION: survivors These are the Ebola victims who survived and the aftermath. Many of them are now using their experience to help fight the disease in their community.
TRANSLATION: Ebola Èyí ni àwọn tí orí kó yọ lọ́wọ́ ààrùn Èbólà. Tí ọ̀pọ̀ nínú wọn wá ń lo ìrírí wọn láti kojú Èbólà àwùjọ.

DEFINITION: task force The Ebola Task Force provides in- depth information about Ebola in local languages in West Africa.
TRANSLATION: Ebola Àkànṣe osìṣẹ́ Èbólà tí ó ń pèsè ìfitónilétí tí ó yè kooro nípa Èbólà ní èdè abínibí ní ilẹ̀ adúlawọ̀. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 97

DEFINITION: test An examination of part of the body or of a body fluid or specimen in order to find Ebola out, e.g. whether it is functioning properly or is infected.
TRANSLATION: Ebola Àyẹ̀wò síṣe àwárí ẹbola nínú ara tàbí oje ara.

DEFINITION: test centres Ebola test centres are secluded places where Ebola patients are treated.
TRANSLATION: Ebola Ibùdó àyẹ̀wò Ebola ni a yà sọ́tọ̀ fún ìtọ́jú àwọn elébólà.

DEFINITION: therapy Treatment of physical, mental, or behavioural problems that is meant to cure or rehabilitate Ebola.
TRANSLATION: Ìtọ́jú ara, ọpọlọ tàbí ìsòro ìhùwàsí tí ó wà fún ìwòsàn tàbí ìbọ́sípò.

DEFINITION: transmission This is an act of transferring a contagious disease.
TRANSLATION: Ebola Èyí ni ọ̀nà títan ààrùn ká.

DEFINITION: treament The application of medical care to cure disease, heal injuries, or ease symptoms of Ebola.
TRANSLATION: Ebola Ìlànà ajẹmọ́-ìtọ́jú nípa ìṣègùn láti wo ààrùn, wíwo oju ọgbẹ́ tàbí gba ẹni lọ́wọ́ àwọn àìsàn yi.

DEFINITION: Treatment Unit (ETU)
TRANSLATION: Ebola treatment unit. Ẹ̀ ka ìtọ́ jú Ebola Ẹ̀ ka ìtọ́jú Ebola.

DEFINITION: vaccination A means of producing immunity to Ebola by using a vaccine or special preparation of antigenic material to stimulate the formation of appropriate antibodies.
TRANSLATION: Ebola Ìpèsè àjẹsára fún Èbólà nípa lílo àkànṣe òògùn fún àjèjì adáralóró, àti láti rú iṣẹ́ sójà ara.

DEFINITION: vaccine A special preparation of antigenetic material that can be used to stimulate
TRANSLATION: Ebola Àkànṣe òògùn fún àjèjì adáralóró, àti láti rú iṣẹ́ ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 98 the development of antibodies and thus confer active immunity against Ebola. ìdàgbàsókè sójà ara, kí ò sì ran àjẹsára lọ́wọ́ lòdì sí ààrùn Èbólà.

DEFINITION: victims Ebola victims are referred to as affected individuals or those killed by Ebola virus.
TRANSLATION: Ebola Alárùn Ebola ni à ń pe ènìyàn tí o ba ni ìkóràn Èbolà tàbí àwọn ti kokoro Ebólà pa.

DEFINITION: virus A virus responsible for an acute infection in humans with features similar to those of Marburg disease. Transmission is by contact with infected blood and other body fluids and the incubation period is 2-21 days (7 days on average).
TRANSLATION: Ebola Kòkòrò tí ó n fa ògidì ìkóràn nínú ènìyàn tí ó ní irúfẹ́ ààrùn bí i ìkóràn ààrùn Marburg pẹ̀lú ìfarakàn ẹ̀jẹ̀ àti àwọn oje ara fún síṣàba fún ọjọ́ méjì sí ọ̀kànlélógún.

DEFINITION: virus transmission It is believed that between people, Ebola disease spreads only by direct contact with the blood fluids of a person who has developed the symptoms of the disease. Body fluids that contain Ebola virus include saliva, mucus, vomit, faeces, sweat, tears, breast milk, urine and semen.
TRANSLATION: Ebola Ìgbàgbọ̀ ni pe, láàárín àwọn ènìyàn, ààrùn Ebola máa ń tànká nipa fí fi ara kan ẹ̀jẹ̀ ẹni tí o ti ni ìfarahàn ààrùn yìí lara. Àwọn oje ara tí o ni kòkòrò Èbólà ni itọ́, ikun, èébì, ìgbẹ́, òógùn, omijé/omi ekún, ọmú/wara ọmú, ìtọ̀ àti àtọ̀.

DEFINITION: (PL) Bruise, area of discolouration on the skin caused by a blow, contusion.
TRANSLATION: n bani láwọ̀ jẹ́, ó wá láti ipaṣẹ̀ lílù.

DEFINITION: (SG) A blue or purplish bruise that results from bleeding under the skin.
TRANSLATION: ó jásí ẹ̀jẹ̀ láti inú ara. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 99

DEFINITION: Abnormal swelling caused by excess accumulation of fluid in tissues or body cavities.
TRANSLATION: Ohun àìyẹ wíwú tí ó wà nípaṣẹ̀ oje nínú àwọn ìṣù tàbí ihò ara.

DEFINITION: (EFV) Efavirenz (EFV)is a non-nucleoside reverse transcriptase inhibitor (NNRTI). It is used as part of a highly active antiretroviral therapy (HAART) for the treatment of human immuno- deficiency virus (HIV) type 1.
TRANSLATION: máa n lò ó bi òògùn ìtọ́jú àìlera pípẹ́ tàbí fún ìtọ́jú KASA 1.

DEFINITION: testing This is a testing or proper examination of disease.
TRANSLATION: ààrùn tí ó múnádóko.

DEFINITION: (Of a drug or treatment) The maximum ability of a drug or treatment to produce a result regardless of dosage. A drug passes efficacy trials if it is effective at the dose tested and against the illness for which it is prescribed. In the procedure mandated by the Food and Drug Administration, phase II clinical trials gauge efficacy, phase III trials confirm it.
TRANSLATION: òògùn tàbí ìtọ́jú fún ìpèsè èsì láìláì fi ìlò rẹ̀ ṣe.

DEFINITION: chemical compound that separates into ions in a solution or when molten, and is able to conduct electricity.
TRANSLATION: tí ó n pín sí ọta nígbà tí ó bá yípọ̀, tí ó sì ṣéṣe kó mú iná wá.

DEFINITION: criteria Factors used to determine whether a person is eligible (inclusion criteria) or
TRANSLATION: ohun tí a fi ń mọ̀ bóyá ènìyàn bá yẹ tàbí kò yẹ láti ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 100 not eligible (exclusion criteria) to participate in a clinical trial. Eligibility criteria may include disease type and stage, other medical. kópa ní ti ajẹmọ́-ìtọ́jú. Ìkúnjú òsùnwọ̀n lè ní ẹ̀yà ààrùn àti ìpele tàbí ọ̀nà ìṣegùn mìíràn.

DEFINITION: (Enzyme-Linked Immunosorbent Assay) A laboratory test to determine the presence of antibodies to HIV in the blood. A positive ELISA test generally is confirmed by the Western Blot test.
TRANSLATION: ELISA Àyẹ̀wò ELISA jẹ́ èyí tí a fi n mọ bóyà àwọn sójà sí KASA wà nínú ẹ̀jẹ̀.

DEFINITION: controllers A very small subset of people infected with HIV who are able to maintain suppressed viral loads for years without antiretroviral (ARV) drugs. Although antiretrovial therapy (ART) may be theoretically beneficial for elite controllers, there is no clinical data supporting therapy for this group.
TRANSLATION: KASA Ọ̀ wọ́ àwọn péréte tí ó lè tẹrí KASA ba láìjẹ́ pé wọn lo òògùn apa KASA. Bí o tilẹ̀ jẹ́ pé ìtọ́jú nípa lílo òògùn apa KASA lè wúlò fùn àwọn asàkóso gbajúmọ̀, kò sí ẹ̀rí ajẹmọ́-ìtọ́jú ti ó fi ìdí èyí múlẹ̀ fún àwọn ọ̀wọ́ yií.

DEFINITION: humans, an infant developing in the uterus (womb) from conception until about the third month of pregnancy.
TRANSLATION: ọlẹ̀ tí ó ṣẹ̀ṣẹ̀ ń dàgbà nínú láti ìbẹ̀rẹ̀ oyún títí di osù kẹta oyún.

DEFINITION: department The department of a hospital responsible for an unexpected and sudden event that must be dealt with urgently.
TRANSLATION: ka ilé-ìwòsàn tí ó wà fún aìrò tẹ́lẹ̀ àti ìsẹ̀lẹ̀ òjijì tí a gbúdọ̀ bójútó ní kánkán.

DEFINITION: stress Signs of stress are different in everyone, with some people expressing more physical signs, like fatigue or
TRANSLATION: ìdàmú tí ó yàtọ̀ ní ara ènìyàn, tí ọ̀pọ̀ máa ń wá nípa ti ara bí i rírẹ̀, tàbí ẹ̀jẹ̀ ríru, tí ọ̀pọ̀ ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 101 high blood pressure, and others expressing more emotion or psycho- logical signs, like irritability or depression. Signs of stress include: irritability, depressed mood, anxiety. fihàn nípa ìmọ̀lára tàbí ìhùwàsí bí i ìríra tàbí ìrẹ̀wèsì.

DEFINITION: state of arousal that can be experienced as pleasant or unpleasant.
TRANSLATION: wíwú yálà èyí tó dára tàbí ìdàkejì.

DEFINITION: Empirical evidence, data, or knowledge, also known as sense experience, is a collective term for the knowledge or source of knowledge acquired by means of the senses, particularly by observation and experimentation.
TRANSLATION: Ẹ̀ rí àfojúrí, tí a tún mọ̀ sí ìrírí orí jẹ́ àkójọpọ̀ ọ̀rọ̀ fún ìmọ̀ tí a rí nípa iṣẹ́ orí, páàpáà àkíyèsí àti afiṣòdiwọ̀n.

DEFINITION: therapy Empiric therapy or empirical therapy is therapy based on experience and, more specifically, therapy begun on the basis of a clinical educated guess in the absence of complete or perfect information.
TRANSLATION: Ìtọ́jú àfojúrí jẹ́ ìtọ́jú adálórí àfojúrí. Ó bẹ̀ẹ̀rẹ̀ lórí ìdánilẹ́ẹ̀kọ́ nípa ìtọ́jú àròṣe tàbí àìsí ìfitónilétí tóyè koro.

DEFINITION: Inflammation of the brain, usually caused by a viral infection. Encephalitis can also be caused by a bacterial infection, toxin, or autoimmune process. Symptoms of encephalitis range from mild, such as
TRANSLATION: wíwú tí ó wá láti ipasẹ̀ ìkóràn kòkòrò. Ọpọlọ wíwú tún wá nípa ìkóràn batéríà, oró tàbí ìgbéṣẹ̀ àìda ara. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 102 flu-like symptoms, to severe, such as seizures. In people with HIV, encephalitis may be due to HIV infection or opportunistic infections, such as Toxoplasma gondii infection.

DEFINITION: Abnormality of structure of function involving the brain.
TRANSLATION: ̣edéédé ojús ̣e tó je ̣ mó ̣ ọpọlọ.

DEFINITION: of life/ Support care This refers to health care, not only of patients in the final hours or days of their lives, but more broadly care of all those with a terminal illness or terminal disease condition that has become advanced, progressive and incurable.
TRANSLATION: Ìtọ́jú ìlera tí kì í ṣe fún àwọn tí ó ti gba ọjọ́ ikú wọn nìkan, sùgbọ́n ìtọ́jú tí ó gbòòró fún àwọn tí ó ní ààrùn gbére.

DEFINITION: a disease occurs frequently and at a predictable rate in a specific location or population. For example, HIV-2 is endemic to West Africa.
TRANSLATION: tí ó wá lemọ́lemọ́ ni ibi tí a lè rò ní agbègbè kan.

DEFINITION: Viewing the inside of a body cavity (e.g. colon) with an endoscope, a device using flexible fibre optics.
TRANSLATION: ara Wíwo inú ihò ara pẹ̀lú ẹ̀rọ ìwonú ara.

DEFINITION: disease Final period or phase in the course of a disease leading to a person's death.
TRANSLATION: ààrùn tí ó yọrí sí ikú. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 103

DEFINITION: Liver Disease (ESLD) The most severe stage of liver disease, at which point the liver is barely functioning, if at all. The treatment for end-stage liver disease (ESLD) is a liver transplant.
TRANSLATION: Ìpèlè ààrùn tí ó burú jùlọ, tí ó jẹ́ pé ẹ̀dọ̀ ko tilẹ̀ siṣẹ́ mọ́ rárá. Ìtójú òpin ìsiṣẹ́ ẹ̀dọ̀ ni ìpàrọ̀ rẹ̀.

DEFINITION: Renal Disease (ESRD) The most severe stage of kidney (renal) disease at which point the kidneys are barely functioning, if at all. The treatment for end-stage renal disease (ESRD) is dialysis or a kidney transplant.
TRANSLATION: Ìpèlè ààrùn kíndìnrín tí ó burú jùlọ tí ó jẹ́ pé kíndìnrín kò tilẹ̀ siṣẹ́ mọ́. Ìtọ́jú òpin ìsiṣẹ́ kíndìnrín ni ìyàsọ́tọ̀ mólékù ńlá àti kékere tàbí ìpàrọ̀ kíndìnrín.

DEFINITION: Pertaining to the intestines. Certain bacterial enteric infections are more common or more severe in people with HIV than in people with healthy immune systems.
TRANSLATION: Àwọn ìkóràn ajẹmọ́fun batéríà ni ó wọ́ pọ̀ lára àwọn tí ó ń gbé pẹ̀lú KASA ju àwọn ti ara wọn dápé lọ.

DEFINITION: (EC) When a tablet or capsule is coated with a substance that prevents the medication from being released until it reaches the small intestine where it can then be absorbed.
TRANSLATION: Nígbà tí òògùn bá bó pẹ̀lú àwọn èròjà tí ó ń dènà òògùn láti wọ inú níbi tí ó le gbà.

DEFINITION: outer coat, or envelope, of HIV is composed of two layers of fat-like molecules called lipids taken from the membranes of human cells.
TRANSLATION: KASA ní ìpele méjì: mólékù ajẹmọ́-ọ̀rá tí a mú lára ìwọ́ àwọn hóró ènìyàn. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 104

DEFINITION: protein that, in small amounts, speeds up the rate of a biological reaction without itself being used up in the reaction (i.e. it acts as a catalyst).
TRANSLATION: Ẹnsaimu Purotéénì ní iye ìwọ̀n kékeré, to yára sí àsè oníye láìsí ọ̀nà ati lo ara rẹ̀ ní àsè.

DEFINITION: type of white blood cell, called granulocyte, that can digest microorganisms. The granules can be stained by the acid dye, eosin, for microscopic examination.
TRANSLATION: ẹ̀jẹ̀ funfun Ẹ̀ yà hóró ẹ̀jẹ̀ funfun tí a mọ̀ sí hóró ẹ̀jẹ̀ funfun alámì tólè lọ ìyóró.

DEFINITION: abnormal increase of eosinophils (a type of white blood cell) in the blood, tissues, or organs. Eosinophilia is often a response to infection or allergens (substances that cause an allergic reaction).
TRANSLATION: ẹ̀jẹ̀ funfun Àìyẹ àlẹ́kún ẹ̀yà hóró ẹ̀jẹ̀ funfun nínú ẹ̀jẹ̀, ìṣù tàbí ààgọ́ ara. Ó si máa ń se ìdáhùn sí ìkóràn èròjà tó ń fi àmi hàn.

DEFINITION: Folliculitis (EF) A rare, severe type of folliculitis (inflammation of hair follicles) characterized by itchy bumps or pus- filled sores on the face, chest, back, or arms. Eosinophilic folliculitis (EF) is mainly associated with advanced HIV infection.
TRANSLATION: ẹ̀yà hóró ẹ̀jẹ̀ funfun wíwú tí ó sọ̀wọ́n èyí tí ó ní àkójọpọ̀ ètútú ní ojú, àyà tàbí apá.

DEFINITION: outbreak of a disease that spreads more quickly and more extensively among a group of people than would normally be expected.
TRANSLATION: ààrùn tí ó yára tànkálẹ́ tí ó sì tàn kákìri àwọn ènìyàn ju bí i a ṣe lérò lọ. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 105

DEFINITION: prone disease Disease that is normally absent from a community or present at a low to moderate level but which can suddenly become epidemic.
TRANSLATION: Ààrùn tí a kì í sábà rí ní agbèègbè tàbí tí wíwà rẹ̀ kò tó nǹkan ṣùgbọ́n tí ó dédé gbilẹ̀ lójijì.

DEFINITION: threshold Critical incidence specified a priori, which, if exceeded, triggers a declaration of an epidemic or predetermined public health responses.
TRANSLATION: Ààrùn tí ó wá sáájú ìsẹ̀lẹ̀ àjàkálẹ̀ ààrùn tàbí kí jẹ́ èyí tí àwọn elétò kò fọhùn sí.

DEFINITION: surveillance The ongoing and systematic collection, analysis and interpretation of data about a disease or health condition. As part of a surveillance system to monitor the HIV epidemic in the US, the CDC, in collaboration with state and local health departments, other federal agencies, blood collection agencies and medical research institu- tions, conducts standardized HIV seroprevalence surveys in designated subgroups in the US population.
TRANSLATION: Ìtọpinpin àjàkálẹ̀ ààrùn Àkójọpọ̀ tí ó n lọ, àlàyé àti ìtumọ̀ àká nípa ààrùn tàbí ipò ìlera.

DEFINITION: branch of medical science that deals with the incidence, distribution and control of a disease in a population.
TRANSLATION: àjàkálẹ̀ ààrùn Ẹ̀ ka ìmọ̀-ìjìnlẹ̀ ìṣègùn tí ó jẹmọ́ ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀, pínpín àti ìdarí ààrùn tí gbogbo àwọn olùgbé.

DEFINITION: of Ebola This is the study about the spread of Ebola virus.
TRANSLATION: ìtànkálẹ̀ Ebola Èyí ni niní ẹ̀kọ́ bí Ebola s ̣e ń tàn kálè ̣. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 106

DEFINITION: covering of the internal and external organs of the body. Also the lining of vessels, body cavities, glands and organs. It consists of cells bound together by connective material and varies in the number of layers and the kinds of cells.
TRANSLATION: àti ìta ẹ̀yà ara. Àti àwọ iṣan, ihò ara, ẹṣẹ́ oje àti ẹ̀yà ara. O kún fún hóró ti wọn dìpọ̀ pẹ̀lú èròjà adi-nǹkan-pọ̀, ó sì yàtò ni iye ìpele àti ẹ̀yà horo.

DEFINITION: unique shape or marker carried on an antigen's surface that triggers a corresponding antibody response.
TRANSLATION: Àmì tí ó ṣe ọ̀ọ̀tọ̀ èyí tí ó wà lórí pèpele àjèjì adáralóró tí ó ṣe atọ́ni ààbò sójà ara.

DEFINITION: Virus (EBV) A herpes-like virus that causes one of the two kinds of mononucleosis (the other is caused by CMV). It infects the nose and throat and is contagious. EBV lies dormant in the lymph glands and has been associated with Burkitt's lymphoma and hairy leukoplakia.
TRANSLATION: kòkòrò herpes tó n fa ọ̀kan lára àjídìde jẹjẹrẹ omi ara. Èyí máa n ṣe ìkóràn bá imú àti ọ̀fun.

DEFINITION: total elimination of a pathogen, such as a bacterium, from the body. Eradication can also refer to the complete elimination of a disease from the world, such as the global eradication of smallpox.
TRANSLATION: bíi tí ó jẹ mọ́ batéríà nínú ara. Ó sì tún lè jẹ́ ìpaarẹ̀ ààrùn ní àgbáyé.

DEFINITION: Redness or inflammation of the skin or mucous membranes.
TRANSLATION: ojú ara tàbí ìwọ̀ aṣekùn.

DEFINITION: multiforme A skin disease characterized by papular (small, solid, usually conic elevation of the skin) or vesicular
TRANSLATION: ara tàbí ìdáranjẹ̀ ní gbogbo ara páàpáà jùlọ àgbègbè ààrin ojú ọgbẹ́. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 107 lesions (blisters), and reddening or discoloration of the skin often in concentric zones about the lesion. Erythema multiforme has been associated with many infections, collagen disease, drug sensitivities, allergies and pregnancy. A severe form of this condition is Stevens-Johnson Syndrome.

DEFINITION: or pertaining to erythema, of or pertaining to a reddening of the skin due to inflammation.
TRANSLATION: Ajẹmọ́ ara pípọ́n, tàbí ajẹmọ́ ara pípọ́n tórí wíwú.

DEFINITION: blood cells whose major function is to carry oxygen to cells.
TRANSLATION: Hóró ẹ̀jẹ̀ pupa tí ó ń siṣẹ́ ohun tí n gbé atẹ́gùn wọ inú àwọn hóró.

DEFINITION: passage down which food moves between the throat and the stomach.
TRANSLATION: tí oúnjẹ ń gbà láti ọ̀nà-ọ̀fun sí ikùn.

DEFINITION: Ethambutol (commonly abbreviated EMB or simply E) is a medication primarily used to treat tuberculosis. It is usually given in combination with other tuberculosis drugs, such as isoniazid, rifampicin and pyrazinamide.
TRANSLATION: Òògùn tí a fí n ṣe ìtọ́jú ikọ́-ife. A sábà máa n lò ó pẹ̀lú àwọn òògùn ikọ́-ife mìíràn.

DEFINITION: medical system A concept for analyzing health beliefs in terms of three interrelated
TRANSLATION: tí à ń gbà ṣàlàyé nípa ìtumọ̀ ìbáṣepọ̀ ìlera. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 108 dimensions: (1) The theory of aetiology/causation of sickness; (2) Methods for diagnosis; and (3) Prescription of appropriate therapies. In this manner, biomedicine can be analyzed as an ethnomedical system, one potential option among several for individuals seeking health care.

DEFINITION: cause of a disease or abnormal condition. Etiology may also refer to the branch of medical science that studies the causes of diseases.
TRANSLATION: ìdí ààrùn Ìdí ààrùn. Ẹ̀ kọ́ nípa iṣégùn tí ó ń kọ́ nípa orísìírísìí àwọn ààrùn.

DEFINITION: hirth This plant family is used locally to arrest bleeding in the event of an injury. The leaves of euphorbia hirth are used in traditional medicine for the treatment of boils, wounds and control of diarrhoea and dysentery.
TRANSLATION: Efinrin Ìlàna lílo ohun ọ̀gbìn ní ọ̀nà ìbílẹ̀ láti kojú ìṣẹ̀jẹ̀ ti ìpalára. A n lò ó fún ìtọ́jú eéwo, ojú ọgbẹ́ àti ìdádúró ìgbẹ́ gbuuru.

DEFINITION: epidemic An outbreak of Ebola viral disease that spreads more quickly and more extensively among a group of people than would normally be expected.
TRANSLATION: Ebola Àjàkálẹ̀ ààrùn Ebola tí ó yára tànkálẹ̀, tí ó sì tàn ká kiri ju bi a ṣe lérò lọ.

DEFINITION: outbreak Ebola virus disease outbreak is a sudden increase in occurrences of a disease in a particular time and place.
TRANSLATION: Ebola Ìbẹ́sílẹ̀ ààrùn Ebola ní òjijì àsìkò tàbí ibìkan pàtó.
patients EVD patients. Ẹlẹ́bòólà Ẹlẹ́bòólà. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 109

DEFINITION: tearing Epiphora, or excessive tearing, is defined as the overflow of tears from one or both eyes.
TRANSLATION: àkúnyawọ́ ìsun láti ojú kan tàbí méjèéjì.

DEFINITION: breastfeeding This is an act of feeding a child through breastfeeding only.
TRANSLATION: yàn Èyí ni ọ̀nà fífún ọmọ ní ọmú igbáyà níkan.
