DEFINITION: Inclusion criteria The medical or social standards determining whether a person may or may not be allowed to enter a clinical trial. For example, some trials may not include people with chronic liver disease, or may exclude people with certain drug allergies; others may exclude men or women or only include people with a lowered T-cell count.
TRANSLATION: arínúróde tí a fi n mọ̀ bóyá ènìyàn lè ṣe ìwádìí ajẹmọ́tọ́jú.

DEFINITION: of bodies Exhumation means the removal from the ground of a body or cremated remains. It also covers the disturbance of remains within a grave, particularly when a grave is reopened for burial.
TRANSLATION: sí ìwoòkú tàbí sísun òkú. Ó sábà máa ń kó bá òkú nínú ibojì pàápàá nígbà tí a bá sí sàárè fún ìsìnkú.

DEFINITION: Developed or originating outside the body.
TRANSLATION: ti ìta bẹ̀rẹ̀.

DEFINITION: toxic substance, made by bacteria, that is released outside the bacterial cell.
TRANSLATION: olóró tí ó wá láti ara batéríà, tí a wá tú sí ìta hóró batéríà.

DEFINITION: access A general term for methods of distributing experimental drugs to
TRANSLATION: bí a ṣe n pín àyẹ̀wò òògùn fún àwọn aláìsàn tí kò ní ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 110 patients who are unable to participate in ongoing clinical trials and have no other treatment options. Specific types of expanded access mechanisms include parallel track, Treatment IND, and compassionate use. ànfàní láti kó ipa nínu ìwádìí ajẹmọ́-ìtọ́jú ní àìsí ìlànà ìtọ́jú mìíràn.

DEFINITION: access (to treatment) This refers to the use of an investigational new drug (IND) outside of a clinical trial by patients with serious or life-threatening conditions who do not meet the enrolment criteria for the clinical trial in progress.
TRANSLATION: Èyí ni ìlànà lílo ìwádìí òògùn tuntun láì dá sí ìwádìí ajẹmọ́- ìtọ́jú àwọn aláìsàn tí ó wà ní ipò amẹ́mìí dání fún ẹni tí kò kájú òṣùnwọ̀n láti fi orúkọ sílẹ̀ fún ìlọsíwájú ìwádìí ajẹmọ́- ìtọ́jú.

DEFINITION: mother These are mothers who know how to manage their disease.
TRANSLATION: ni àwọn ìyá tí ó ní ìmọ̀ bíi wọ́n ṣe lè ṣe ìtọ́jú ààrùn ara wọn.

DEFINITION: of the condition An actual or stipulated condition is called an express condition. Sharing information to help people make sense of their involvement in an unfamiliar situation.
TRANSLATION: àìsàn gangan.

DEFINITION: to sun Sun exposure causes most of the skin changes that we think of as a normal part of ageing.
TRANSLATION: máa fa ìyípadà ní ara ju bí a ṣe lérò gẹ́gẹ́ bi òye pé àgbà ti dé.

DEFINITION: and heat treatment feeding cup Expression and heat treatment feeding cup is relevant to mothers especially those in Uganda.
TRANSLATION: ọmú Ife iṣẹ́ omi- ọmú ṣe pàtàkì sí ìyálọ́mọ tí ó wọ́pọ̀ sí àwọn ara Uganda. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 111

DEFINITION: system/Gene expression In HIV vaccine production, cells into which an HIV gene has been inserted to produce desired HIV proteins.
TRANSLATION: ìran Nínú ìpèsè àjẹsára, àwọn hóró ní èyí tí ẹ̀yọ́-ìran KASA tí a lò láti pèsè purotéénì tí KASA nílò.

DEFINITION: Resistant Tuberculosis (XDR-TB) A relatively rare type of multiple drug resistant tuberculosis (MDR-TB). Extensively drug resistant tuberculosis (XDR-TB) occurs when a Mycobacterium tuberculosis strain becomes resistant to drugs used to treat TB, including the two most effective first-line antibiotics (isoniazid and rifampin) and most of the second-line drugs. XDR-TB progresses more rapidly and is more severe in people coinfected with HIV than in people infected with XDR-TB alone.
TRANSLATION: Ẹ̀ yà ayan-òògùn lódì ikọ́-ife. Ayan-òògùn lódì fún ikọ́-ife máa ń wáyé nígbà tí ẹ̀ka kòkòrò ikọ́-ife ní ìgara lòdì sí òògùn tí a ń lò fún ìtọ́jú ikọ́- ife.

DEFINITION: bleeding This is a discharging of blood outside the body.
TRANSLATION: ìta ojú ara.

DEFINITION: Manifestation of tuberculosis in any body site apart from the lungs and bronchila tree.
TRANSLATION: fun Ikọ́fe tí ó je ̣yo ̣ ní apá ibòmíràn lára yàtò ̣ sí è ̣dò ̣fóró àti ò ̣fun.

DEFINITION: mask A covering for the whole head or the face alone either to protect or disguise the face.
TRANSLATION: ohun ààbò tàbí ìbòjú. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 112

DEFINITION: waste material that is eliminated through the anus.
TRANSLATION: tí a yà láti ojú ihò-ìdí.
Failure to thrive Growth and/or developmental stunting. Àìdọ́ gbà Àìdọ́gba pẹ̀lú àwọn akẹgbẹ́ ẹni.

DEFINITION: Organizations (FBOs) Faith-based organizations are a vital part of civil society. They provide a substantial portion of care in developing countries, often reaching vulnerable populations living under adverse conditions.
TRANSLATION: ìgbàgbó ̣ Àjọ ajẹmọ́ ìgbágbọ́ jẹ́ ara àwùjọ ọ̀làjú. Wọn a máa pèsè ìtọ́jú ní àwọn orílẹ̀-èdè tí wọ́n ṣẹ̀ṣẹ̀ ń gòkè àgbà, wọn a sì máa na ọwọ́ sí àwọn tí wọ́n wà nínú ewu.

DEFINITION: healing This is an act of applying faith for healing purposes.
TRANSLATION: Èyí ni ìwà lílo ìgbàgbọ́ fun ètò ìwòsàn.

DEFINITION: Having or showing true and constant support or loyalty.
TRANSLATION: olótìítọ́ tàbí ọ̀nà fífi àtìlẹ́yìn hàn nígbà gbogbo.

DEFINITION: Faithfulness is defined as loyalty, devotion; trustworthiness; factualness.

DEFINITION: tubes Part of the female reproductive system. A pair of ducts opening at one end into the uterus and at the other end into the peritoneal cavity, over the ovary. Each tube serves as a passage through which the ovum (egg) is carried to the uterus and through which spermatozoa (sperm) moves toward the ovary.
TRANSLATION: kan lára ètò ìbísí obìnrin. Ọ̀ na sísí awẹ́ iwọ méjì tí apákan jásí ilé ọmọ àti ìkejì sí awọ ihò inú lóri ìbísí obìnrin.

DEFINITION: negative result A negative test result that incorrectly indicates that the condition being
TRANSLATION: èsì èké máa ń tọ́ka sí pé nǹkan kò sí nígbà tí ó sì jẹ́ ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 113 tested for is not present when, in fact, the condition is actually present. DEFINITION: positive result A positive test result that incorrectly indicates that the condition being tested for is present when, in fact, the condition is actually not present. For example, a false positive HIV test indicates a person has HIV when, in fact, the person is not infected with HIV.

DEFINITION: counselling Family counselling is a branch of psychotherapy that works with families and couples in intimate relationships to nurture change and development.

DEFINITION: Health International (FHI) This is a non-profit human development organization based in North Carolina. DEFINITION: syndrome A hereditary or acquired kidney disorder that impairs the reabsorption of electrolytes, glucose, amino acids, and other nutrients into the bloodstream when blood passes through the kidneys.
TRANSLATION: kídìnrín yìí lè jẹ́ àjogúnbá tí ó sì ń ṣe àkóbá fún sísàn ẹ̀jẹ̀ sínú kídìnrín.

DEFINITION: disease Fatal familial insomnia (FFI) is an extremely rare autosomal dominant inherited prion disease of the brain. It is almost always caused by a mutation to the protein PrPC, but can also develop spontaneously in patients with a non-inherited mutation variant called sporadic fatalinsomnia (sFI).
TRANSLATION: àìrórunsùn tí ó n wáyé sáájú ààrùn ọpọlọ. Ó jẹ́ àmúwá ìyípadà purotéénì PrPC tí ó sì tún le jẹyọ lára aláìsàn pẹ̀lú àyípadà tí kì í ṣe àjogúbá tí amọ̀ sí àìrórunsùn.

DEFINITION: Extreme tiredness or weariness resulting from physical or mental activity.
TRANSLATION: ó wá láti ara iṣẹ́ àti ori.

TRANSLATION: Nígbà mìíràn, ó máa n s ̣òro fún ọmọ láti mu ọmú ní igbáyà ìyá rẹ̀, ọ̀nà mìíràn ni láti fi ife fún-un lọ́yàn. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 115

TRANSLATION: Ètò ìmọ̀-ìjìnlẹ̀ nípa ìṣàkóso ìnáwó àti ohun ìní.

DEFINITION: prick A procedure in which a finger is pricked with a lancet to obtain a small
TRANSLATION: a n gbà lu ìka lọ́nà àti gba ẹ̀jẹ̀ fún àyẹ̀wò. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 116 quantity of capillary blood for testing. Also called a fingerstick.

DEFINITION: Combination (FDC) Two or more drugs contained in a single dosage form, such as a capsule or tablet. An example of a fixed-dose combination HIV drug is Atripla (a combination of efavirenz, emtricitabine, and tenofovir). By reducing the number of pills a person must take each day, fixed-dose combination drugs can help improve adherence to an HIV treatment regimen.

DEFINITION: pain Flank pain refers to pain or discomfort in your upper abdomen or back. It is located below the ribs and above the pelvis and on the side. Flank pain basically refers to pain in your side and back. Usually, the pain is worse on one side of your body.
TRANSLATION: ríro ní òkè inú tàbí ẹ̀yìn. Ó wà lábẹ́ ìhà egungun àti ìbàrá ìdí àti ẹ̀gbẹ́ rẹ̀.

DEFINITION: virus Any member of a genus (and family) of arboviruses that cause a wide range
TRANSLATION: fún kòkòrò, ó jẹ́ ààrùn jákèjádò nínú ènìyàn. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 117 of diseases in vertebrates (including humans).

DEFINITION: Fluids are a subset of the phases of matter and include liquids, gases, plasmas and, to some extent, plastic solids.
TRANSLATION: àyọsílẹ̀ tí o ṣe kókó bí i ìṣọ̀n, gáásì àti oje-ara.

TRANSLATION: tábúlẹ́tì tí a n fisí ojú òbò sáájú ìbálòpọ̀ tí ohun dènà oyún.

TRANSLATION: ni ẹ̀yà àtípò Fítáámì B ti a máa ń lò fún itoju aláìlokunto. Ó wọ́pọ́ ninu ewébẹ̀, ẹja tútù, ẹ̀dọ̀ ati iwukara. Wọn a tún maa pè é ni Folacin, Folate ati Fitaami B9.

TRANSLATION: jẹjẹrẹ Òògùn ìfúnnilẹ́jẹ̀ ajẹmọ́-jẹjẹrẹ fún ìtọ́jú jẹjẹrẹ láti dabòbò àwọn hóró tí ó dára lòdì sí àtakò rẹ̀. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 118

DEFINITION: small anatomical cavity or deep narrow-mouthed depression; a small lymph node.

DEFINITION: Dendritic Cells (FDCs) These are cells of the immune system found in primary and secondary lymph follicles of the B cell areas of the lymphoid tissue.
TRANSLATION: ara Èyí jẹ́ àwọn hóró àjẹsára tí a n rí nínú hóró ihò irun ara.

TRANSLATION: Agbé kòkòrò pamọ́ jẹ́ asojú ìkóràn.

DEFINITION: & Drug Administration (FDA) The Public Health Service agency responsible for (among others) ensuring the safety and effectiveness of drugs, biologics, vaccines and medical devices used in the diagnosis, treatment and prevention of HIV infection, AIDS and AIDS-related opportunistic infections. The FDA also works with the blood banking industry to safeguard the nation's blood supply.
TRANSLATION: òsìṣẹ́ ìlera àwùjọ tí n ṣe ààbò fún iṣẹ́ òògùn, àjẹsára àti irinṣẹ́ ìṣègùn tí a lò fún ìdàmọ̀, ìtọ́jú àti ìdènà ìkóràn KASA, ààrùn ìṣọdọ̀lẹ àjẹsára àti àwọn ààrùn ajẹmọ́- ìṣọdọ̀lẹ àjẹsára.

DEFINITION: physical form in which a drug is manufactured.
TRANSLATION: àgbélẹ̀rọ tí a ń gbà pèsè òògùn.

DEFINITION: drugs Medications provided at no charge to patients.
TRANSLATION: Òògùn tí a fúnni lái gbowó kankan ló ̣wo ̣ aláisàn.

DEFINITION: Clinic These are dedicated HIV clinics that are not integrated with a non-HIV care facility.

DEFINITION: bat Megabats constitute the suborder Megachiroptera, and its only family Pteropodidae of the order Chiroptera (bats). They are also called fruit bats, Old World fruit bats, or, especially the general Acerodon and Pteropus, flying foxes.
TRANSLATION: eléso.

DEFINITION: Capsicum frutescens is a species of chili pepper that is sometimes considered to be part of the species Capsicum annuum.
TRANSLATION: ìjọ̀sì amoùnjẹ dùn.

DEFINITION: Blood Count (FBC) A blood test that measures the following components in a sample of
TRANSLATION: Àyẹ̀wò ẹ̀jẹ̀ tí ó ṣe òdiwọ̀n irú ẹ̀jẹ̀ tí ó wà lára bíi hóró ẹ̀jẹ̀ ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 120 blood: red blood cells, white blood cells, platelets, and haemoglobin. A full blood count (FBC) with differen- tial also measures the levels of the five types of white blood cells found in blood: neutrophils, lymphocytes, monocytes, eosinophils, and basophils. pupa, hóró ẹ̀jẹ̀ funfun. A tún máa ṣé òdìwọ̀n ní ọ̀nà máàrún ẹ̀yà hóró ẹ̀jẹ̀ funfun tí a rí nínú ẹjẹ.

TRANSLATION: Sójà tó sopọ̀ mọ́ àjèjì adáralóró tí ó ní ipa. Sójà ara máa n ṣọ KASA di aláìlágbára tàbí ṣe ìdènà àti ṣe àkóbá fún hóró.

DEFINITION: Fundoscopy is a test that allows a health professional to see inside the fundus of the eye and other structures using an ophthalmoscope (or funduscope). It is done as part of an eye examination and may be done as part of a routine physical examination.
TRANSLATION: ọ̀nà ìwo- ẹyinjú Àyẹ̀wò ọ̀nà ìwo ẹyinjú tí àwọn akọ́ṣẹ́ nípa ìlera láti wo ẹyinjú àti àwọn ìgbèsè míìràn nípa lílo irinṣe. A n ṣe èyí ní àsìkò àyẹ̀wò ojú tàbí ṣe àyẹ̀wò lórèkórè.

DEFINITION: nail infections Fungal nail infections often start after a fungal infection on the feet. They occur more often in toenails than in fingernails. And they are most often seen in adults as they age.
TRANSLATION: Jomijomi/ajèkáná bẹ̀ẹ̀rẹ̀ láti ìkóràn osunwuuru ní atẹlẹsẹ̀. Èyí máa n yọ lójú èkánná. Ó wọ́pọ̀ lára àgbàlagbà.

DEFINITION: is a simple organism that lacks the green pigment chlorophyll.
TRANSLATION: Osunwuuru Èyí ni oníye tí o ṣe aláìsán ohun ayí àwọ̀ padà. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 121

DEFINITION: first of seven steps in the HIV life cycle. HIV binds to the CD4 receptor and a coreceptor (either CCR5 or CXCR4) on the host cell, causing the viral envelope to fuse with the host cell membrane. This fusion allows HIV to release HIV RNA and HIV enzymes, such as reverse transcriptase and integrase, into the host cell.
TRANSLATION: nínú méje ìgbésí-ayé KASA. KASA a máa so mọ́ agbawọle CD4 àti olùgbàwọlé CCR5 àti CXCR4 lára hóhó àgbalejò. Ìtamọ́ yìí fayègba KASA tú RNA àti ẹńsáìmù rẹ̀ jáde

DEFINITION: inhibitor Antiretroviral (ARV) HIV drug class. Fusion inhibitors block the HIV envelope from merging with the host cell membrane (fusion). This prevents HIV from entering the host cell.
TRANSLATION: wọ́ òògùn KASA. Adènà ìpapọ̀ máa ń dí èèpo KASA lọ́wọ́ láti papọ̀ mọ́ hóró agbàlejò. Èyí sì máa ń dènà KASA láti wọlé sára hóró agbàlejò

DEFINITION: interferon A T cell-derived stimulating substance that suppresses virus reproduction, stimulates other T cells and activates macrophage cells.

DEFINITION: Transpeptidase (GGT) An enzyme found in many organs in the body, including the liver. Gamma- glutamyl transpeptidase may be mea- sured as part of a liver function test.
TRANSLATION: Ẹnsaimu GGT Ẹńsáìmù tí à ń rí nínú ọ̀pọ̀ ẹ̀yà ara, pẹ̀lú ẹ̀dọ̀ fóró. Ẹńsáìmù GGT ni a lè se òdiwọ̀n rẹ̀ bíi ara ẹ̀yà àyẹ̀wò iṣẹ́ ẹ̀dọ̀-fóró

DEFINITION: mass of nervous tissue composed principally of nerve-cell bodies,
TRANSLATION: ìmọ̀lára ìṣù tí ó ní ìmọ̀lára hóró ara, tí ó sábà máa ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 122 usually lying outside the central nervous system. àṣàkóso ara n wà ní ààrin gbùngbùn ìmọ̀lára.

DEFINITION: Allium sativum, commonly known as garlic, is a species in the onion genus, Allium. Its close relatives include the onion, shallot, leek, chive, and rakkyo.
TRANSLATION: ilẹ̀ jẹ́ ẹ̀yà ẹgbẹ́ àlùbọ́sà, sálọ́ọ́tì, ewébẹ̀, amú oúnjẹ dùn àti ràkíyò.

DEFINITION: draw in breath with a sudden short audible intake.
TRANSLATION: èèmí kékeré tí a lè gbọ́ ketekete.

DEFINITION: Inflammation of any segment of the gastrointestinal tract, from the mouth to the anus.
TRANSLATION: Wíwú ikùn àti ìfun láti ẹnu sí ojú ihò-ìdí.

DEFINITION: Adjective referring collectively to the stomach and small and large intestine.
TRANSLATION: Àpèjúwe tí ó n tọ́kasí àpapọ̀ ikùn àti ìfun kékeré àti nlá.

DEFINITION: Relating to sexual attraction or activity among male partners.
TRANSLATION: Ajẹmọ́ ìbálòpọ̀ ọkùnrin àti ọkùnrin.

DEFINITION: basic unit capable of transmitting characteristics from one generation to the next. It consists of a specific sequence of DNA or RNA that occupies a fixed position locus on a chromosome.
TRANSLATION: Hóró tí ó ṣíṣé ̣ kíkó àbúdá láti ìran kan sí òmíràn. Èyí ní ìtọ̀lẹ́yìn DNA àti RNA tí ó jẹ́ àyè inú okùn ìran.

DEFINITION: drug A drug that has the same active ingredients, dosage, formulation, safety, strength, route of adminis- tration, quality, effectiveness, and intended use as a brand-name drug.
TRANSLATION: Òògùn tí ó ní èròjà, ìgbésè, ìsàkóso, agbára àti orúkọ ìlò kan náà. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 123

DEFINITION: Having to do with genes and genetic information.
TRANSLATION: ó ní ṣe pẹ̀lú ẹ̀yọ́ -ìran àti ìfitónilétí nípa jínnì.

DEFINITION: engineering Group of new research techniques that manipulate the DNA (genetic material) of cells. The gene-splicing technique, which produces recombinant DNA, is a method of transporting selected genes from one species to another.
TRANSLATION: ran Àkójọpọ̀ irinṣẹ́ ìwádìí tí óhún ṣe àyínìpadà àwọn ohun èròjà jínnì ti hóró.

DEFINITION: Pertaining to the external and/or internal organs of reproduction.
TRANSLATION: ati inú/ eya-ara bíbí ọmọ.

DEFINITION: herpes A sexually transmitted disease caused by the herpes simplex virus and affecting the genital and anal regions with painful blisters.
TRANSLATION: herpes Ààrùn àìsàn ìbálòpọ̀ tí ó wá nípasè kòkòrò herpes, tí o n ṣe àkóbá fún abẹ́ áti ihò-ìdí pẹ̀lú ìléròrò tó nira.

DEFINITION: mutilation Female Genital Mutilation comprises all procedures that involve partial or total removal of the external female genitalia, or other injury to the female genital organs for non-medical reasons (WHO). It is also sometimes referred to as female genital cutting or female circumcision.
TRANSLATION: abẹ́ ni ìgbésè ̣ yíyọ apákan tàbí gbogbo ojú-abẹ́ obìnrin, tàbí ṣe ìpalára sí ojú- abẹ́ obìnrin, tí kì í ṣe ìlànà ìṣègùn.

DEFINITION: ulcer Any of several diseases that are characterized by genital sores. Genital ulcers are usually sexually transmitted infections, including genital herpes (herpes simplex virus 2 infection),
TRANSLATION: ààrùn egbò ojú-abẹ́. Èyí máa ń wáyé nípa ààrùn ìbálòpọ̀ pẹ̀lú ààrùn apisi herpes. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 124 syphilis, and chancroid. Genital ulcer diseases increase the risk of sexual transmission of HIV.

DEFINITION: warts A sexually transmitted infection caused by the human papilloma virus (HPV). Genital warts appear as raised pink or flesh-coloured bumps on the surface of the vagina, cervix, tip of the penis, or anus.
TRANSLATION: a máa wáyé nípa ààrùn ìbálòpọ̀.

DEFINITION: tract All organs involved in the production and excretion of urine plus all organs involved with reproduction. Organs of the genitourinary tract include the kidneys, bladder, fallopian tubes, and penis.
TRANSLATION: Gbogbo òpó ilé itọ̀ àti èyí tí ó n ṣe àtúnṣe.

DEFINITION: complete genetic material of an organism, including all of its genes. The genome is contained in a set of chromosomes in humans, a single chromosome in bacteria, and a DNA or RNA molecule in viruses. The HIV genome consists of an RNA molecule and includes nine genes.
TRANSLATION: Gbogbo èròjà ajẹmábẹ́ ti oníye, pẹ̀lú ẹ̀yọ́-ìran.

DEFINITION: Antiretroviral Resistance Test (GART) A type of resistance test that detects drug-resistant mutations in HIV genes. Resistance testing is used to guide the selection of an HIV regimen when
TRANSLATION: ̣wò fún afa-ìjákulè ̣ Ẹ̀ ya ìjákulẹ̀ àtakò tó n ṣe ìdámọ̀ àtakò òògùn fún ìyípadà ẹ̀yọ́-ìran KASA. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 125 initiating or changing antiretroviral therapy (ART).

DEFINITION: violet Crystal violet or gentian violet is a triarylmethane dye used as a histological stain and in Gram’s method of classifying bacteria.
TRANSLATION: a máa ń lò fi kun ojú egbò.

DEFINITION: centres Structures within lymphoid tissues that contain FDCs in which immune responses are initiated.
TRANSLATION: Ọ̀ nà láàrin ìmọ̀lára omi-ara tí ó ní FDCs ní èyí tí ìpìlẹ̀ṣẹ̀ èsì àjẹsára.

DEFINITION: Infection of the intestine with a flagellate protozoan, which causes diarrhoea and other symptoms.
TRANSLATION: Àrunsu Ìkóràn tinú ikùn pẹ̀lú pùròtósúà flagellate èyí tí ó n fa ìgbẹ́ gbuuru àti àìsàn mìíràn.

DEFINITION: to Fight HIV/AIDs, TB and Malaria (GFATM) This is an international financing organization that aims to attract and disburse additional resources to prevent and treat HIV and AIDS, tuberculosis and malaria.
TRANSLATION: GFATM Àjọ káríayé tí ó ń wá àti/tàbí pèsè ìrànlọ́wọ́ gbígbóguntí àti títọ́jú KASA àti ìsọdọ̀lẹ àjẹsára, ikọ́-ife àti ibà.

DEFINITION: conjugated protein in which the non- protein group is a carbohydrate (i.e. a sugar molecule); also called glucoprotein.
TRANSLATION: purotéènì onísúgà Àfibọ̀ purotéénì ní èyí tí àwọn aláìní àkojọpọ̀ purotéénì jẹ́ aadùn ara.

DEFINITION: 120 Glycoprotein 120, a protein that protrudes from the surface of HIV and binds to CD4+ T cells.
TRANSLATION: purotéènì onísúgà 120 Ẹ̀ yà purotéénì onísúúgà 120 tí ó ní àfibọ̀ àwọn aadùn ara ní pèpele KASA tí ó rọ̀mọ́ sójà ìdábòbo 4. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 126

DEFINITION: 160 Glycoprotein 160, a precursor of HIV envelope proteins gp41 and gp120.
TRANSLATION: purotéènì onísúgà 160 Ẹ̀ yà purotéénì onísúúgà 160 tí ó ní àfibọ̀ èèpo KASA onípurotéénì gp41 àti gp120.

DEFINITION: 41 Glycoprotein 41, a protein embedded in the outer envelope of HIV. Plays a key role in HIV's infection of CD4+ T cells by facilitating the fusion of the viral and the cell membranes.
TRANSLATION: purotéènì onísúgà 41 Ẹ̀ yà purotéénì onísúúgà 41 tí ó ní àfibọ̀ èèpo KASA. A máa ṣe iṣẹ́ pàtàkì fún ìkóràn KASA ti sójà ìdábòbo 4 pẹ̀lú àwọn hóró nípa ṣíṣe ìjìpọ̀ kòkòrò àti ìwọ̀ hóró.

DEFINITION: of various ruminants of the genus capra related to the sheep.
TRANSLATION: ẹ̀dà ẹranko tí ó ní ẹnu èyí tí ó ni ìjẹmọ́ àgùntàn.

DEFINITION: sexually transmitted bacterial disease that causes inflammation of the genital mucous membrane, burning pain when urinating, and a discharge. It is caused by a gonococcus bacterium.
TRANSLATION: tí o n fa ààrùn bateria tí ó n fa ìwọ̀ ikun abẹ́ wíwú, tí ó máa n fa ìrora tí a báa n tọ̀.

DEFINITION: largest ape, with a relatively short but very powerful body and coarse dark hair.
TRANSLATION: tí o nípọn pẹ̀lú irun sákisàki ní gbogbo ara, ó kéré ṣùgbọ́n ó kún fún agbára.

DEFINITION: gown, from medieval Latin gunna, is a usually loose outer garment from knee- to full-length worn by men and women in Europe from the early Middle Ages to the 17th century, and continuing today in certain professions; later, gown was applied to any full-length woman’s garment
TRANSLATION: o síngbọnlẹ̀ tí obìnrin àti ọkùnrin máa n wọ̀ ní Europe ni ìbẹ̀rẹ̀ sẹ́ńtúrì 17 tí wọn si tí ń wọ ni àsànyàn-iṣẹ kan; láìpẹ kabaádi ohun ti àwọn obinrin n wọ pẹ̀lú yẹ̀rì. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 127 consisting of a bodice and attached skirt.

DEFINITION: & Wright Stain Wright’s stain is a histologic stain that facilitates the differentiation of blood cell types. It is classically a mixture of eosin (red) and methylene blue dyes. It is used primarily to stain peripheral blood smears and bone marrow aspirates which are examined under a light microscope.
TRANSLATION: Wright Aaró Gram Wright máa n ṣe àlékún bá ìyàsọ́tọ̀ àwọn ẹ̀yà hóró ẹ̀jẹ̀.

DEFINITION: cell type of the immune system filled with granules of toxic chemicals that enable them to digest microorganisms.
TRANSLATION: funfun alámì Ẹ̀ yà hóró àjẹsára pẹ̀lú ata ẹ̀jẹ̀ funfun alámì jẹ́ èyí tí o n fọ́ ẹyawuuru sí wẹ́wẹ́.

DEFINITION: colony stimulating factor (G-CSF) A protein that stimulates neutrophils, which are a type of white blood cell, to multiply and mature. A laboratory- produced version of this protein is used to boost a low neutrophil count.
TRANSLATION: funfun alámì jí Purotéénì tí ó lọ́wọ́ nínú ẹ̀yà hóró ẹ̀jẹ̀ funfun láti sọ ọ́ di púpọ̀ kí ó sì lè gbó dáadáa.

DEFINITION: deficiency or abnormal decrease in the number of granulocytes, a type of white blood cell. Granulocytopenia may be caused by certain bone marrow diseases, chemotherapy, or certain drugs used to treat HIV and opportunistic infections.
TRANSLATION: funfun alámì Àìtó tàbí àdínkù aláìbójúmu iye hóró ẹ̀jẹ̀ funfun. Àìtó hóró ẹ̀jẹ̀ funfun alámì lè wáyé nípa lílo àwọn òògùn KASA kan. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 128

DEFINITION: amaranth Amaranthus, collectively known as amaranth, is a cosmopolitan genus of annual or short-lived perennial plants. Some amaranth species are cultivated as leaf vegetables, pseudo cereals, and ornamental plants.
TRANSLATION: Ẹ̀ fọ́ tẹ̀tẹ̀ jẹ́ ohun ọ̀gbìn tí ó lè ti ilẹ̀ wù.

DEFINITION: is a multifaceted response to loss, particularly to the loss of someone or something that has died, to which a bond or affection was formed. Although conventionally focused on the emotional response to loss, it also has physical, cognitive, behavioural, social, and philosophical dimensions.
TRANSLATION: ìyàsọ́tọ̀ èsì sí pípadánù nǹkan pàápàá èyí tí a ní ìrẹ́pọ̀ kíkún sí.

DEFINITION: tree Guavas are common tropical fruits cultivated and enjoyed in many tropical and subtropical regions.
TRANSLATION: guafa Èyí wọ́pọ̀ ní ìwọ̀-oorùn ní àwọn agbèègbè kan.

DEFINITION: Syndrome (GBS) A rare acute neurological disorder in which the immune system mistakenly attacks part of the peripheral nervous
TRANSLATION: system. Guillain-Barré Syndrome (GBS) primarily destroys the myelin that covers the peripheral nerves, causing the nerve signals to slow down. This damage can result in weakness and sometimes paralysis of the legs, arms, face, and breathing muscles. Àìsàn GBS Ògidì àìsàn ọpọlọ tí ètò àjẹsára sèsì dójúkọ ètò ìmọ̀lára. Ó sábà máa ń pa ìbò ìmọ̀lára lọ́nà àti sọ ọ́ di akúrẹtẹ̀ ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 129

DEFINITION: Guilt is a cognitive or an emotional experience that occurs when a person realizes or believes − accurately or not − that he or she has compromised his or her own standards of conduct or has violated a moral standard and bears significant responsibility for that violation. It is closely related to the concept of remorse.
TRANSLATION: bi jẹ́ ìrírí ìmọ̀ tí ó ṣẹlẹ̀ nígbà tí ènìyàn bá mọ ẹ̀bi ní ẹ̀bi, tàbí gbàgbọ́ ní tòótọ́ tàbí ṣe aláìgbàgbọ́ pé ènìyàn náà ti kọ ẹṣẹ̀ agẹ̀rẹ̀.

DEFINITION: of blood The flow out of blood rapidly and in large quantities, or the release of large quantities of a blood in a fast-flowing stream.
TRANSLATION: Yíya ẹ̀jẹ̀ ní ìwọ̀n púpọ̀, tàbí ìdàsílẹ̀ ẹ̀jẹ̀.

DEFINITION: Development of larger-than-normal breasts in males. Gynecomastia is due to excess growth of breast tissue, not fat tissue. Gynecomastia is sometimes caused by natural hormonal changes, but it can also be due to use of certain medications, including antiretroviral (ARV) drugs.
TRANSLATION: igbá àyà ọmọkùnrin.

DEFINITION: use of multiple drugs that act on different viral targets is known as highly active antiretroviral therapy (HAART). HAART decreases the patient’s total burden of HIV,
TRANSLATION: ̣pò ̣ òògùn KASA Èyí ní ìlànà lílo ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ òògùn tí ó n siṣẹ́ ọ̀tọ̀ọ̀tọ̀ fún ìdojúkọ KASA. Àlòpapò ̣ yìí a máa ṣe àdínkù bá gbogbo ìs ̣òro aláìsàn nípasè ̣ KASA, a ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 130 maintains function of the immune system, and prevents opportunistic infections that often lead to death. sì máa ṣe ìtọ́jú àjẹsára. A sì tún máa dènà àwọn ààrùn tí ó lè yọrí sí ikú láti wọ inú ara.

DEFINITION: Someone that studies blood and blood- forming tissues and the disorders associated with them.
TRANSLATION: Ẹni tí ó kọ́ ẹ̀kọ̀ nípa ẹ̀jẹ̀ àti àìyẹ tí ó rọ̀ mó ̣ o ̣.

DEFINITION: study of blood and blood-forming tissues and the disorders associated with them.
TRANSLATION: ẹ̀jẹ̀ Ẹ̀ kọ́ nípa ẹ̀jẹ̀ àti àìyẹ tí ó rọ̀ mó ̣ ọ.

DEFINITION: iron-containing protein in red blood cells that transports oxygen around the blood.
TRANSLATION: Ìmọ̀lára ìrìn tí ó ní purotéénì nínú àwọn hóró ẹ̀jẹ̀ pupa tí ó n gbé atẹ́gùn ní àyíká ẹ̀jẹ̀.

DEFINITION: disorder linked to a recessive gene on the X-chromosome and occurring almost exclusively in men and boys, in which the blood clots much more slowly than normally, resulting in extensive bleeding from even minor injuries.
TRANSLATION: Àìyẹ tí ó ní àpọ̀jù ẹyọ́-ìran lóri okun-ìran-X, tí ó máa n ṣẹlẹ̀ sí okùnrin tí ẹ̀jẹ̀ dídì a máa kéré ju bí ó ti yẹ lọ.

DEFINITION: influenza This is associated with acute and chronic respiratory infections and is a common cause of influenza infections. Kòkòrò
TRANSLATION: ògidì àti kòkòrò òfìkìn líle, tí ó jẹ́ ọ̀nà kíkó ọ̀fìkìn.

DEFINITION: loss of blood from a ruptured blood vessel, either internally or externally.
TRANSLATION: ẹ̀jẹ̀ láti ibi ìyapa ìsùn ẹ̀jẹ̀, yálà ní inú tàbí ìta.

DEFINITION: Hemostasis or haemostasis is a process which causes bleeding to stop,
TRANSLATION: ìgbéṣẹ̀ dídá ẹ̀jẹ̀ dúró sí ojú òpó kan-náà. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 131 meaning to keep blood within a damaged blood vessel (the opposite of hemostasis is haemorrhage). It is the first stage of wound healing. This involves coagulation − blood changing from a liquid to a gel.

DEFINITION: loss Hair loss is the condition of falling off of hair from one's head.
TRANSLATION: ríre jẹ́ ni ipò kí i irun máa já lórí ènìyàn.

DEFINITION: leukoplakia A whitish, slightly raised lesion that appears on the side of the tongue. Thought to be related to Epstein-Barr virus infection, it was not observed before the HIV epidemic.
TRANSLATION: funfun tí ó máa n yọ ní ẹ̀gbẹ́ ahó ̣n, tí ó jẹmọ́ ìkó ààrùn kòkòrò. Àkíyèsí rè ̣ kò sí s ̣áájú àjàkálẹ̀ KASA.

DEFINITION: time it takes a drug to lose half its original concentration or activity after being introduced into the body. Drug half-life is considered when determining drug dosing.
TRANSLATION: Ìdajì ipa òògùn nínú ara nígbà tí a lò ó sínú ara.

DEFINITION: gloves A shaped covering for the hand that includes five separated sections for the thumb and fingers, and extends to the wrist or the elbow.
TRANSLATION: ohun tí ó ní awẹ́ márùn-ún fún ojú ìka ọrùn ọwọ́ kọ̀kan, tí ó sì gùn dé o ̣rùn ọwó ̣ tàbi ìgúnpá.

DEFINITION: gesture of gripping and shaking another person’s hand, used as a greeting or farewell and to seal an agreement.
TRANSLATION: mọ́lẹ̀ àti bíbọ ẹnikejì lọ́wọ́ fún ìkínni ìdágbére tàbí ìfohùnsọ̀kan. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 132

DEFINITION: reduction Harm reduction (or harm minimization) is a range of public health policies designed to reduce the harmful consequences associated with various human behaviours, both legal and illegal.
TRANSLATION: ewu ni iye ìmúlò ìlera àwùjọ tí a n lò láti ṣe àdínkù bá ìpalára tí ó jẹmọ́ ìhùwàsí ènìyàn yálà ní abẹ́ òfin tàbí èyí tí kò bófin mu.

DEFINITION: register These are confidential records where clients information are recorded.
TRANSLATION: ìwé ìràntí tí a n kọ ọ̀rọ̀ nípa àwọn aláìsàn sí.

DEFINITION: worksheet These are worksheets that may assist centres in determining which diseases or conditions to report.
TRANSLATION: HCT Èyí ni àwọn ìwé ètò iṣẹ́ tí ó n ran àwọn ibùdó lọ́wọ́ lọ́nà àti mọ irú ààrùn tàbí ipò tí wọn yóò jábọ̀ fún.

DEFINITION: pain felt deep within the skull. Most headaches are caused by emotional stress or fatigue but some are symptoms of serious intracranial disease.
TRANSLATION: Ìrora láti inú agbárí. Ọ̀ pọ̀ ẹ̀fọ́rí ní ó n wá láti ipaṣẹ̀ wàhálà tàbí àìlera, ṣùgbọ́n, ní ọ̀pọ̀ ìgbà, ó jẹ́ àmì àìsàn inú ọpọlọ.

DEFINITION: process of curing somebody or something or of becoming well.
TRANSLATION: àìsàn àti ṣíṣe ìmúláradá

DEFINITION: care The provision of medical and related services aimed at maintaining good health, especially through the prevention and treatment of diseases.
TRANSLATION: lera Ìpèsè ìtọ́jú ìlera pipe páàpáà jùlọ fún ìdíwọ́ fún ìdènà àti ìtọ́jú.

DEFINITION: education Persuasive methods used to encourage people (either individually or
TRANSLATION: Ìlànà ìyípadà tí a n lò láti gba ènìyàn ní ìyànjú, ní èyí tí ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 133 collectively) to adopt lifestyles that educators believe will improve health and to reject habits regarded as harmful to health or likely to shorten life expectancy. àwọn olùdánilẹ́kọ̀ gbàgbọ́ pé ó lè mú àtúnṣe bá ìlera àti pé kí i a lè kọ ìwà ìpalára sí ìlera tó lè gé ayé ènìyàn kúrú ní àìròtẹ́lẹ̀.

DEFINITION: Resources and Services Administration (HRSA) A public health service agency that administers (among others) education and training programmes for health care providers and community service workers who care for AIDS patients. HRSA also administers programmes to demonstrate how communities can organize their health care resources to develop an integrated, comprehensive system of care for those with AIDS and HIV infection.
TRANSLATION: ètò ìrànlọ́ wọ́ Àjọ HRSA tí ó n ṣe àmójútó ètò ẹ̀kọ́ fún àwo ̣n as ̣ètó ̣jú àwọn tí ó n gbé pẹ̀lú ààrùn ìṣọdọ̀lẹ àjẹsára àti KASA.

DEFINITION: workers Health workers are persons employed by public health agencies.
TRANSLATION: ìlera ni àwọn tí ó n siṣẹ́ lábẹ́ àjọ ìlera gbogboogbò.

DEFINITION: problem Hearing loss, also known as hearing impairment, or anacusis, is a partial or total inability to hear. An affected person may be described as hard of hearing.
TRANSLATION: àgbọ́ ya Àìlegbọ̀ dáadáa tàbí ìsòro ìgbọ́ yálà díẹ̀díẹ̀ tàbí rárá. À n pe irú wọn ní adití.

DEFINITION: disease Any medical condition of the heart or the blood vessels supplying it that impairs cardiac functioning.
TRANSLATION: tí ọkàn wà tàbí òpó ẹ̀jẹ̀ tí ó n fa ìfàsé ̣hìn ìṣẹ́ àìsàn ọkàn. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 134

DEFINITION: to heart Openly straightforward and direct without reserve or secretiveness.
TRANSLATION: Ọ̀ nà kí ènìyàn ní inú sí ẹnìkejì rẹ̀, ní àìní iyè méjì.

DEFINITION: transplant To transfer an organ or tissue from one body to another or from one place in somebody's body to another.
TRANSLATION: ẹ̀yà ara tàbí ìṣù láti ara ẹnìkan sí ẹlòmíràn.

DEFINITION: syndrome A rare but life-threatening complication of pregnancy that is characterized by Hemolysis (breakdown of red blood cells), elevated liver enzyme levels, and a low platelet count. HELLP develops late in pregnancy, or sometimes after birth.
TRANSLATION: HELLP Ìnira ipò oyún tí ó lè mú ẹ̀mí dáni ní pípa hóró ẹ̀jẹ̀; èyí tí ń ṣe ìgbéga ẹńsáìmù ẹ̀dọ̀-fóró àti òǹkà hóró.

DEFINITION: infection An infection by a helminth is known as helminthiasis, soil-transmitted helminthiasis, helminth infection or intestinal worm infection.
TRANSLATION: aràn jẹ́ ààrùn tí n ràn tàbí ekòló inú.

DEFINITION: ratio The T-Lymphocyte Helper/Suppressor Profile (Helper/Suppressor ratio, T4:T8 ratio, CD4:CD8 ratio) is a basic laboratory test in which the percentage of CD3-positive lymphocytes in the blood positive for CD4 (T helper cells) and CD8 (a class of regulatory T cells) are counted and compared.
TRANSLATION: kẹ́rin sí ìkẹjọ̀ Hóró T jẹ́ hóró ẹ̀jẹ̀ funfun tí ó n ṣe àkóso nínú ètò àjẹsára ara.

DEFINITION: laboratory test that measures the volume of red blood cells in whole blood. Hematocrit is normally ordered as part of a complete blood count.
TRANSLATION: pupa Àyẹ̀wò tí ó ń ṣe òdiwọ̀n iye hóró ẹ̀jẹ̀ pupa nínú gbogbo ẹ̀jẹ̀ ní yàrá àyẹ̀wò. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 135

DEFINITION: Poisonous to the blood and to the organs and tissues involved in the production of blood, such as the bone marrow.
TRANSLATION: Oró inú ẹ̀jẹ̀ àti ìsù níbi ìpèsè ẹ̀jẹ̀ pupa, gbogbo ẹ̀jẹ̀ bí i mùdùnmúdùn.

DEFINITION: Blood in the urine. The use of certain antiretroviral (ARV) drugs may cause hematuria.
TRANSLATION: a bá a n lo òògùn KASA, ó lè fa ìtọ̀ ẹ̀jẹ̀.

DEFINITION: rupture of red blood cells (or the destruction of red blood cells).
TRANSLATION: pupa Ìrun hóró ẹ̀jẹ̀ pupa.

DEFINITION: viral inflammatory process and inflection of the liver.
TRANSLATION: Kòkòrò ìkóràn àrùn ẹ̀dọ̀ wíwú.

DEFINITION: co-infection Hepatitis B, caused by infection with the hepatitis B virus (HBV), which is most commonly passed on to a partner during intercourse, especially during anal sex, as well as through sharing drug needles.
TRANSLATION: Ampatitis B, Jẹ̀dọ̀jẹ̀dọ̀ B tí ó wá láti ipasè kòkòrò jẹ̀dọ̀jẹ̀dọ̀ B. A lè ko láti ara ìbálòpọ̀ pàápàá ìbálòpọ̀ ojú ihò- ìdí, àti nípa lílo abẹ́rẹ́ kannáà.

DEFINITION: Surface antigen test (HBsAg) This test looks for hepatitis B surface antigens in the blood.
TRANSLATION: B olójú àjèjì adáralóró Àyẹ̀wò ààrùn jẹ̀dọ̀jẹ̀dọ̀ B olójú àjèjì adáralóró.

DEFINITION: Inflammation of the liver due to the hepatitis C virus.
TRANSLATION: Ẹ̀ dọ̀ wíwú nítorí àìsàn hóró ẹ̀dọ̀ wíwú. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 136

DEFINITION: co-infection Non-A, non-B hepatitis, caused by the hepatitis C virus, which appears to be spread through sexual contact as well as through sharing drug needles.
TRANSLATION: Àìsí A, àìsí jẹdọjẹdọ B tí ó wá láti ìpaṣẹ̀ kòkòrò jẹ̀dọ̀jẹ̀dọ̀ C, A lè ko láti ara ìbálòpọ̀ pàápàá ìbálòpọ̀ ojú ihò-ìdí, àti nípa lílo abẹ́rẹ́ kannáà.

DEFINITION: Toxic damage to the liver. Drugs, including antiretroviral (ARV) drugs, can cause hepatotoxicity.
TRANSLATION: tí ó ń ba ẹ̀dọ̀ jẹ́. Òògùn KASA gan lè fa jẹjẹrẹ ẹ̀dọ̀.

DEFINITION: Passed genetically, or capable of being passed genetically, from one generation to the next.
TRANSLATION: láti ìran kan sí òmíràn.

DEFINITION: Simplex Virus 1 (HSV-1) Infection An infection caused by herpes simplex virus 1 (HSV-1) and usually associated with lesions on the lips, mouth, and face. HSV-1 is infected (even if lesions are not visible). Treatment cannot completely clear HSV-1 from the body, but antiviral therapy can shorten and prevent outbreaks and reduce the risk of transmission.
TRANSLATION: Ìkóràn HSV 1 ti isan ara wíwú bíi ètè, ẹnu àti ojú. Ìtọ́jú kìí sábà mú HSV 1 kúrò nínú ara ṣùgbọ́n òògùn apa kòkòrò lè ṣe àdínkù ewu kíkóràn rẹ̀.

DEFINITION: Simplex Virus 2 (HSV-2) infection An infection caused by herpes simplex virus 2 (HSV-2) and usually associated with lesions in the genital or anal area. HSV-2 is very contagious and is transmitted by sexual contact with someone who is infected (even if lesions are not visible). Treatment
TRANSLATION: Ìkóràn HSV-2 ti isan ara wíwú ti ètè, ẹnu àti ojú, ìtọ́jú kìí sábà mú HSV- 2 kúrò nínú ara ṣùgbọ́n òògùn apa kòkòrò lè ṣe àdínkù èwu ìkóràn rẹ̀. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 137 cannot eradicate HSV-2 from the body, but antiviral therapy can shorten and prevent outbreaks and reduce the risk of transmission.

DEFINITION: varicella zoster virus The varicella virus causes chicken pox in children and may reappear in adults as herpes zoster. Also called shingles, herpes zoster consists of very painful blisters on the skin that follow nerve pathways. Kòkòrò
TRANSLATION: a máa fa ìgbóna lára ọmọ wẹ́wẹ́, a máa fa herpes zoster lára àwọn àgbàlagbà.

DEFINITION: virus A family of viruses. Herpes also refers to infection with one of the human herpes viruses and characterized by collections of small blister. Kòkòrò herpes
TRANSLATION: ẹbí kòkòrò. Herpes tún ni ọ̀kan lára ìkóràn kòkòrò herpes tí ó ní àbùdá àkójọpọ̀ ìléròrò kékèké.

DEFINITION: pattern of sexuality in which sexual behaviour and thinking are directed towards people of the opposite sex. It includes both normal and deviant forms of sexual activity.
TRANSLATION: ìbálòpọ̀ ní èyí tí ìwà ìbálòpọ̀ àti èrò ọkàn ènìyàn darí sí ara enìkejì.Yálà ṣíṣedéédé tàbí àìṣíṣedéédé irú eré géle yìí láàárin wọn.

DEFINITION: is an involuntary spasm of the diaphragm and respiratory organs, with a sudden closure of the glottis and a characteristic gulping sound.
TRANSLATION: ohun àìfẹ́ tí máa n mú inú gìrì pẹ̀lú ìmísínú àti ìmísíta.

DEFINITION: blood pressure Unusually high blood pressure in the arteries. It encompasses a typical elevation of either the peak blood pressure at each heartbeat systolic
TRANSLATION: Ẹ̀ jẹ̀ ríru inú òpó ẹ̀jẹ̀ ńlá ní òrèkórè. Ó jẹ́mọ́ ìgbèrú ọkàn tàbí àyà jíjá ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 138 pressure, or the running pressure between heart beats diastolic pressure, or both.

DEFINITION: blood sugar High blood sugar, or hyperglycemia, is a major concern, and can affect people with both type 1 and type 2 diabetes.
TRANSLATION: Àpọ̀jù súgà ẹ̀jẹ̀ ni óń ṣe àkóbá fún ẹni tí ó ní ìtọ súgà ẹ̀yà 1 àti 2.

DEFINITION: fever High fever is an abnormally increased body temperature.
TRANSLATION: líle jẹ́ àìdà tí n ṣe àlékún ìbá ara gbígbóná.

DEFINITION: risk behaviour Behaviours that are most likely to lead to infection: unprotected sex (anal, vaginal, sometimes oral); using contaminated needles/sharing syringes; coming in ultimate contact with bodily fluids (blood, semen, vaginal fluids, and sometimes saliva).
TRANSLATION: Ìwà tí ó n yọrí sí ìkóràn ìbálòpọ̀ aláìláàbò páàpáà ní ojú ihò-ìdí àti nǹkan ojú ara obìnrin.

DEFINITION: risk group A group in the community with an elevated risk of disease.
TRANSLATION: Àkójọpọ̀ ẹgbẹ́ agbèègbè tí ó n gbé ewu ààrùn.

DEFINITION: testing A method of matching the self antigens on the tissues of a transplant donor with those of a recipient. The closer the match, the better the chances that the transplant will not be rejected.
TRANSLATION: ara Ọ̀ nà ìbáramu ti àjèjì adáralóró lórí ìṣù adálóri olùfúnni àti olùgbà

DEFINITION: disease caused by the fungus Histoplasma capsulatum. Most people inhale the spores of the fungus Histoplasma capsulation.
TRANSLATION: itopilasima Àìsàn tí ó wá láti ipasẹ̀ osunwuuru ìmọ̀lára-ara ẹ̀jẹ̀. Ọ̀ pọ̀ ènìyàn ni ó ní kòkòrò ìfisímú osunwuuru ìmọ̀lára-ara ẹ̀jẹ̀. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 139

DEFINITION: associated disease A word used for people who have a decreased ability to fight infection. People with HIV or AIDS are immunosuppressed because their CD4 cells are decreased by the virus. People being treated for cancers may be immunosuppressed because of drugs they are given to fight the cancer.
TRANSLATION: ajẹmọ́ KASA Ọ̀ rọ̀ tí a n lò fún àdínkù agbára láti kojú ìkóràn. Àwọn tí ó n gbé pẹ̀lú KASA tàbí ààrùn ìṣọdọ̀lẹ àjẹsára ní ó n ṣe àdínkù bá àjẹsára lórí sójà ìdábòòbò 4 tí adínkù bá.

DEFINITION: associated nephropathy (HIVAN) HIV-associated nephropathy (HIVAN) refers to kidney disease developing in association with HIV infection.
TRANSLATION: Kídìrín ajẹmọ́ KASA jẹ́ ààrùn tí ó ní i ṣe pẹ̀lú ìkóràn KASA.

DEFINITION: client This is a person who receives help or advice about his/her status of HIV from health practitioners.
TRANSLATION: àwọn ènìyàn tó n gba ìmọ̀ràn nípa ìlera KASA lọ́wọ́ àwọn akọ́ṣẹ́mọṣẹ́ ìlera.

DEFINITION: clinic These are clinics that provide medical care to patients infected with HIV/AIDS.
TRANSLATION: KASA Èyí ni àwọn ilé tí àwọn oníKASA tó ń gba òògùn máa ń lọ.

DEFINITION: disease Characterized by a gradual deterioration of immune function. During the course of infection, crucial immune cells called CD4+ T cells are disabled and killed, and their numbers progressively decline. CD4+ T cells play a crucial role in the immune response, signalling other cells in the
TRANSLATION: iṣẹ́ àjẹsára dínkù. Ní àsìkò ìkóràn, àwọn hóró àjẹsára lórí sójà ìdábòòbò 4 + hóró T di àìlókun tí a pa. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 140 immune system to perform their special functions.

DEFINITION: drug resistance (HIVDR) This is the ability of HIV to mutate and reproduce itself in the presence of antiretroviral drugs.
TRANSLATION: òògùn Èyí ni agbára KASA láti gbèrú sí i níwájú òògùn apa KASA.
drugs Drugs for HIV patients. Òògùn KASA Àwọn òògùn tí a n fún àwọn tí n gbẹ́ pẹ̀lú KASA.

DEFINITION: encephalopathy Brain inflammation and disorder caused by HIV infection.
TRANSLATION: KASA Ààrùn ọpọlọ tí ìkóràn KASA ń fà.

DEFINITION: exposed babies These are babies that their parents are HIV positive.
TRANSLATION: Èyí ni àwọn ọmọ tí òbí wọn ń gbé pẹ̀lú KASA.

DEFINITION: incidence HIV incidence is the number of new HIV infections in a population during a certain time period.
TRANSLATION: tuntun KASA Èyí jẹ́ ònkà ìkóràn tuntun KASA láàárìn àwọn olùgbé ní àsìkò kan pàtó.

DEFINITION: infection Invasion of the body by harmful organisms (pathogens), such as HIV.
TRANSLATION: ti ara nípa àwọn ohun àbẹ̀mí eléwu bíi KASA.

DEFINITION: load A count of the amount of HIV virus in the blood. It is measured in copies per millilitre and gives an idea of how active the virus is.
TRANSLATION: Ìwọ́n òǹkà kòkòrò KASA nínú ẹ̀jẹ̀. À ǹ ṣe òdiwọ̀n wọn nípa ìdá ọ̀kẹ́ lítà tí ó ń fi oye kòkòrò hàn
medication A drug used to treat HIV virus. Òògùn KASA Èyì ni àwọn òògùn tí à ń lò fún ìtọ́jú kòkòrò KASA.

DEFINITION: negative Having taken a test that revealed no antibodies to HIV in the bloodstream.
TRANSLATION: tí àyẹ̀wò fihàn pé kó ní ààrùn KASA nínú ẹ̀jẹ̀.

DEFINITION: patient This is a person who is living with HIV virus.
TRANSLATION: ẹni tí ó n gbé pẹ̀lú KASA. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 141

DEFINITION: positive Having shown by a test for antibodies to HIV in the bloodstream to be infected with HIV.
TRANSLATION: Ẹni tí àyẹ̀wò fihàn pé ó ní kòkòrò KASA nínú ẹ̀jẹ̀.

DEFINITION: positive people These are people that have been tested for antibodies to HIV in the bloodstream.
TRANSLATION: àyẹ̀wò fihàn pé ó ní kòkòrò KASA nínú ẹ̀jẹ̀.

DEFINITION: prevention An action or actions taken to stop an individual from contracting HIV or to stop HIV from happening.
TRANSLATION: ọ̀nà tí ènìyàn n gbà láti ṣe ìdíwọ́ kíkó kòkòrò KASA tàbí ṣe ìdádúró ìtànkálẹ̀ rẹ̀.

DEFINITION: screening Looks for antibodies to HIV in the blood or mouth fluid. (Antibodies do not cause diseases. You cannot get HIV from spit that does not have blood in it.) It can take up to six months for HIV antibodies to form after someone has been exposed to HIV. If there is worry that someone has been newly infected, a viral load may be drawn.
TRANSLATION: wíwo àwọn sójà ara sí KASA nínú ẹ̀jẹ̀ tàbí oje ẹnu. Sójà ara kií fa ààrùn. A kò lè kó KASA lára itọ́ láìláì jẹ́ pé ó ní ẹ̀jẹ̀ nínú. A lè gbà á tó osù mẹ́fà fún sójà ara láti kórajọ lẹ́yìn tí ènìyàn bá ti fi ara hànde sí KASA.

DEFINITION: sensitive protection The protection of health workers that deals with HIV patients.
TRANSLATION: Ààbò tí ó wà fún àwọn òsìṣẹ́ ìlera tí ó n ṣe ìtọ́jú àwọn tí n gbé pẹ̀lú KASA.

DEFINITION: status Whether a person has HIV infection or not.
TRANSLATION: ènìyàn ní ìkóràn KASA tàbí kò ní.

DEFINITION: test A test for the human immuno- deficiency virus, the cause of AIDS.
TRANSLATION: fún KASA, èyí tó n yọrí sí ààrùn ìṣọdọ̀lẹ àjẹsára. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 142

DEFINITION: Testing Services (HTS) HIV testing services (HTS) include the full range of services that should be provided together with HIV testing.
TRANSLATION: Èyí ni gbogbo iṣẹ́ tó ni ṣe pẹ̀lú àyẹ̀wò KASA.

DEFINITION: transmission This is an act of getting HIV through sex or other means.
TRANSLATION: jẹ́ ọ̀nà tí a n gbà kó KASA nípaṣe ìbálòpọ̀ àti àwọn ọ̀nà mìíràn.

DEFINITION: wasting syndrome A person with HIV wasting syndrome loses at least 10 per cent of their body weight and has at least 30 days of either diarrhoea or weakness and fever. A person with HIV-associated wasting is considered to have AIDS. Severe loss of weight and muscle, or lean body mass, leads to muscle weakness and organ failure.
TRANSLATION: KASA Ẹni tí ó ní àìsàn gbígbẹ KASA máa ń sọ ìwọ́n mẹ́wàá nínú títóbi ara láàárín ọgbọ̀n ọjọ́ èyí tí ìgbẹ́ gbuuru, rírẹ̀ tàbí ibà lè fà. Ẹni tí o ni àìsan gbígbẹ ajẹmọ́ KASA ni a kà sí pe ó ni ààrùn àjẹsára. Ọpọ ìpàdánù ìwúwo ara tàbí ìṣàn tàbí tínrín máa n yọrí sí ìṣèmẹ́lé ìsan tàbí àìsiṣẹ́ ẹ̀yà ara.

DEFINITION: work planning This is an act of providing avenues that can prevent one from getting HIV.
TRANSLATION: Èyí ni ọ̀nà wíwá ìlànà àti dẹ́kun kíkó KASA.

DEFINITION: Division (HAD) The Division of AIDS (DAIDS) was formed in 1986 to develop and implement the national research agenda to address the HIV/AIDS epidemic. Towards that end, the division supports a global research portfolio on HIV/AIDS, its related co-infections, and co-morbidities.
TRANSLATION: Abala ìṣàkóso àjákálè ̣ KASA àti ààrùn ìṣọdọ̀lẹ àjẹsára Ètò yìí wà fún ìlànà ìwádìí láti kojú KASA àti ààrùn ìṣọdọ̀lẹ àjẹsára àti ìkúnpá aáyan káriayé. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 143

DEFINITION: (HAF) This is a foundation that is contributing to the reduction of HIV infection in Nigeria especially HIV prevention activities among people living with HIV.
TRANSLATION: ààrùn ìṣọdọ̀lẹ àjẹsára Àjọ tó n pèsè ìrànwọ́ owó fún àdínkù ìkóràn KASA ní Nigeria pàápàá ìdènà KASA láàrin àwọn tó n gbé pẹ̀lú KASA.

DEFINITION: Programme Sustainability Analysis Tool (HAPSAT) The HIV/AIDS Programme Sustainability Analysis Tool (HAPSAT) was developed by the USAID funded Health Systems 20/20 Project to assist governments and donors with the development of HIV/AIDS policies and implementation plans.
TRANSLATION: ìgbógunti KASA àti ààrùn ìṣọdọ̀lẹ àjẹsára Ètò adálórí ìgbógunti KASA àti ààrùn ìṣọdọ̀lẹ àjẹsára ni àjọ USAID ṣàgbékalẹ̀ rè ̣ láti ran àwo ̣n ìjọba àti àwọn afúnni lọ́wọ́ pẹ̀lú ìmúṣẹ àwọn ohun ìmúlò nípa KASA àti àarùn ìṣọdọ̀lẹ àjẹsára.

DEFINITION: tuberculosis Tuberculosis which develops at the instance of the immune compromise caused by HIV.
TRANSLATION: KASA Ikọ́-ife tí ó wáyé nípa ìjákulè ̣ àjẹsára ajẹmọ́ KASA.

DEFINITION: test A test that detects the presence of HLA-B*5701. The HLA-B*5701 molecule is linked to hyper-sensitivity to the antiretroviral (ARV) drug abacavir. A person who tests positive for HLA-B*5701 should not use abacavir.
TRANSLATION: Àyẹ̀wò tí ohun ṣe ìdámọ̀ wíwà àyẹ̀wò HLA-B-5701. Mólékù yìí ní ìṣepọ̀ mọ́ ìṣesí òògùn kòkòrò lára. Ẹni tí ó bá n ṣe àyẹ̀wò HLA-B-5701 kò gbudò ̣ lo òògùn kòkòrò.

DEFINITION: disease Hodgkin disease is a type of lymp- homa. Lymphoma is a cancer of a part of the immune system called the
TRANSLATION: Hodgkin Èyí jẹ́ ẹ̀yà jẹjẹrẹ omi-ara. Ó jẹ́ jẹjẹrẹ tí ó wà lára ètò àjẹsára tí a mọ̀ sí ẹ̀wọ́n omi-ara. A máa ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 144 lymph system. The first sign of Hodgkin disease is often an enlarged lymph node. The disease can spread to nearby lymph nodes. Later it may spread to the lungs, liver, or bone marrow. mú ẹ̀wọ́n omi-ara wú. Ó sì lè tànká sí àyíká ẹ̀wọ́n omi-ara páàpáà sí inú ẹ̀dọ̀fóró, ẹ̀dọ̀ àti mùdùnmúdùn eegun.

DEFINITION: hands Holding hands is one of the more casual, yet simultaneously intimate physical acts.
TRANSLATION: jẹ́ ọkan lára àjọṣepọ̀ nípa sísúnmọ́ ara ẹni.

DEFINITION: prepared milk This is a home-made milk prepared for a child.
TRANSLATION: ilé Wàrà/mílíkì tí a pèsè ní ilé fún ọmọ.

DEFINITION: visit This is a voluntary home-based service that the technical personnel, as well as community volunteers and NGO/ community-based organizations staff discuss Ebola issues and provide a bar of soap to promote hand washing, print materials and a small sticker with an Ebola prevention message to apply on their door.
TRANSLATION: jẹ́ iṣẹ́ àtinúwá tí àwọn akóṣẹmọsẹ́ nípa Ẹbọla ń se nípa ìdánilẹ́ẹ̀kọ́ àti ipèsè ike ọṣe ìfọwọ́, ìwé pélébé alálẹ̀mọ́ọ̀rigi tí ó ní àkọlé àwọn àkòrí ọ̀rọ̀ nípa Ebola ti wọn yíò lẹ̀ sí ẹnú ọ̀nà àbáwọlé wọn.

DEFINITION: visitor Home visitor is a home-based programme by health workers that provide comprehensive head start services to families.
TRANSLATION: ilé jẹ́ ètò ilé tí ó dálé ètò òsìṣẹ́ ìlera tí ó n pèsè iṣẹ́ ìbẹ̀rẹ̀ tí ó múnádóko fún àwọn ẹbí.

DEFINITION: care Home-based care (HBC) is defined as the provision of comprehensive services, including health and social services by formal and informal
TRANSLATION: ilé Ìtọ́jú ní ilé jẹ́ ìpèsè ẹ̀kúnrẹ́rẹ́ iṣẹ́ pẹ̀lú iṣẹ́ agbèègbè lọ́wọ́ àwọn oníṣẹ́ ìtọ́jú ìlera ní líle àti àìle. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 145 caregivers in the home. HBC includes physical, psychosocial and spiritual care.

DEFINITION: Similar in appearance or structure, but not necessarily function.
TRANSLATION: kan-un tàbí ọ̀nà iṣẹ́ tí i a mọ́ pé kò ṣe dandan.

DEFINITION: Somebody who is sexually attracted to members of his or her own sex.
TRANSLATION: tí ó ní ìfẹ́ ìbálòpọ́ sí ẹ̀yà kannáà.

DEFINITION: Sweet fluid produced from plant nectar by bees.
TRANSLATION: tí a pèsè láti ara oyin.

DEFINITION: transmission These are viruses that are transmitted among the same generation.
TRANSLATION: kòkòrò tí ó n tàn ká kiri ìran kannáà.

DEFINITION: chemical messenger produced by the body and carried by the blood.
TRANSLATION: Atarají Èyí jẹ́ oun atarají tí ara n pèsè tí ó n gbé ẹ̀jẹ̀ wọ inú ara.

DEFINITION: wards The block forming a division of a hospital (or a suite of rooms).
TRANSLATION: wáádù Pínpín ilé ìwòsàn sí ìpele sí ìkọ̀kan.

DEFINITION: animal or plant (or specific part of an animal or plant) in which another organism or microorganism lives.
TRANSLATION: Ẹranko tàbí ọ̀gbìn tí àwọn mìíràn n sàba sí.

DEFINITION: factors The body's potent mechanisms for containing HIV, including immune system cells called CD8+ T cells, which may prove more effective than any antiretroviral drug in controlling HIV infection.
TRANSLATION: ara tí ó ní KASA pẹ̀lú ètò àjẹsára tí sójà ìdábòòbò 8 + hóró T tí ó ní agbára ju òògùn apa kòkòrò ìkóràn KASA. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 146

DEFINITION: contact/Contact tracing Household contacts should be considered “epidemiology linked”.
TRANSLATION: àfarakàn délé Ìwà àfarakàn délé jẹ́ àsomọ́ ẹ̀kọ́ nípa ààrùn.

DEFINITION: or belonging to the species Homo sapiens or its closest relatives.
TRANSLATION: ẹ̀yà ẹ̀dá ènìyàn àti àwọn tí ó súnmọ́ wọn.

DEFINITION: growth hormone (HGH) A hormone that is produced by the pituitary gland and stimulates growth.
TRANSLATION: ìtarají Ìtarají tí a n pèsè láti ara ẹsẹ́ pìtúrì.

DEFINITION: Herpesvirus 6 (HHV-6) infection An infection caused by human herpesvirus 6 (HHV-6). HHV-6 is primarily transmitted through saliva and usually causes disease only in children or people with weakened immune systems. HHV-6 can cause neurological diseases, such as encephalitis and febrile seizures. HHV-6 can also cause fever and rash (roseola), which mostly affects children between 6 months and 2 years old.
TRANSLATION: tí ó wá láti ara HHV-6. HHV-6 ní a máa n kó láti ara itọ́, tí ó sì lè fa ààrùn ní ara ọmọ tí wọ́n ní àjẹsára tó lẹ.

DEFINITION: herpes virus 7 (HHV-7) A type of herpes virus found in the saliva of people infected with human herpesvirus 7 (HHV-7). HHV-7 has not been definitively documented to cause a specific disease.
TRANSLATION: tí ó wá láti ara HHV-7. HHV-7 ní a máa n kó láti ara itọ́. Kò sí àkọsílẹ̀ wípé HHV-7 máa n fa ààrùn.

DEFINITION: Immuno- deficiency Virus (HIV) Human Immuno-deficiency virus is the cause of AIDS (acquired immunodeficiency syndrome). Kòkòrò Apa
TRANSLATION: Ìgékúrú fún Kòkòrò apa sójà ara, tí ó n yọrí sí àrùn ìṣọdọ̀lẹ àjẹsára. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 147

DEFINITION: Immuno- deficiency Virus (HIV-1) (1) The retrovirus isolated and recognized as the etiologic (i.e. causing or contributing to the cause of a disease) agent of AIDS. HIV-1 is classified as a lentivirus in a subgroup of retroviruses. (2) Most viruses and all bacteria, plants and animals have genetic codes made up of DNA, which uses RNA to build specific proteins.
TRANSLATION: apa kòkòrò tí ó dáwà ní a mọ̀ sí ohun tó n fa ààrùn, bí i àwọn as ̣ojú ààrùn ìṣọdọ̀lẹ àjẹsára.

DEFINITION: Immunodeficiency Virus (HIV-2) A virus closely related to HIV-1 that has been found to cause immune suppression.
TRANSLATION: ajẹmọ́ KASA-1 tí a mọ̀ sí ohun tí ó n fa àdínkù àjẹsára.

DEFINITION: Leukocyte Antigens (HLA) A group of molecules found on the surface of almost every cell in the body. Human leukocyte antigens (HLAs) present protein fragments (peptides) to immune cells. If the cells recognize the peptides as foreign, the body mounts an immune response.
TRANSLATION: mólékù tí a n rí ní pèpele hóró inú ara. Àyẹ̀wò HLA máa n pèsè purotéénì fún àwọn hóró àjẹsára. Tí ó bá ṣe alábàpàdé àjèjì adáralóró nínú ara, a ṣe ìtaají wọn.

DEFINITION: Papilloma Virus (HPV) A virus that is the cause of warts of the hands and feet, as well as lesions of the mucous membranes of the oral, anal and genital cavities. More than 50 types of HPV have been identified, some of which are associated with cancerous and precancerous conditions. The virus can be
TRANSLATION: tí ó n fa wọ́nwọ́n ti ọwa àti ẹsẹ̀, pẹ̀lú àwọn egbò ti ìwọ́ àṣekùn ti ẹnu, ihò-ìdí àti ojú abẹ́. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 148 transmitted through sexual contact and is a precursor to cancer of the cervix.

DEFINITION: T-cell lymphotropic virus type I (HTLV-I) A retrovirus that infects only T lymphocytes (T cells). Human T cell lymphotropic virus type 1 (HTLV-1) is transmitted through exposure to contaminated blood, through sexual contact, and from an infected mother to her child at birth or through breastfeeding via breast milk. Kòkòrò HTLV 1
TRANSLATION: jẹ́ pé omi-ara nìkan ni ó ń ràn. Kòkòrò HTLV1 ni ó máa ń ràn nípaṣẹ̀ ẹ̀jẹ̀ tí ó bàjẹ́, ìbálòpọ̀ àti lára iyá sí ọmọ ni àsìkò ìbí(mọ) nípa ìfọ́mọlọ́yàn.

DEFINITION: to human transmission Human to human transmission refers to the infected avian sources to humans that have been a concern since the first documented case of human infection in 1997 due to the global spread that constitutes a pandemic threat.
TRANSLATION: Ìkóràn èèyàn síra ni ìkóràn ẹyẹ sí ẹlòmíràn tí a rí àkọsílẹ̀ rẹ̀ ní ọdún 1997 fún ìdí ìtànkálẹ̀ ààrùn káríayé.

DEFINITION: immunity The branch of the immune system that relies primarily on antibodies.
TRANSLATION: ka ètò àjẹsára adálórí àwọn sójà ara.

DEFINITION: offspring produced from mating plants or animals from different species, varieties or genotypes.
TRANSLATION: a bí láti ara ìbálòpọ̀ sí èranko ní oríṣirísi ẹyà tàbí irú jínnì kannáà.

DEFINITION: hybrid cell produced by the fusion of an antibody-producing lymphocyte with a tumor cell. Hybridomas are used in the production of monoclonal antibodies.
TRANSLATION: àdàmọ̀dì tí a pèsè láti ara ìyípọ̀ ìpèsè sójà sí jẹjẹrẹ pẹ̀lú jẹjẹrẹ hóró. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 149

DEFINITION: is a condition of adequate supply of body fluids.
TRANSLATION: omi nínú ara.

DEFINITION: science dealing with the preservation of health.
TRANSLATION: kọ́ ìmọ̀-ìjìnlẹ̀ tí ó wà fún ààbò àti ìtọ́jú ìlera.

DEFINITION: Abnormally high blood sugar (glucose) level. The use of some antiretroviral (ARV) drugs may cause hyperglycemia.
TRANSLATION: Apoju súgà nínú ẹ̀jẹ̀ Ipò àìyẹ súgà nínú ẹ̀jẹ̀. Òògùn apa kòkòrò lè wá ní ipasẹ̀ ọ̀pọ̀ súgà nínú ẹ̀jẹ̀

DEFINITION: Excess lipids (cholesterol, triglycerides, or both) in the blood. Hyperlipidemia increases the risk of high blood pressure, heart disease, and stroke.
TRANSLATION: ẹ̀jẹ̀ Àpọ̀jù ọ̀rá inú ẹ̀jẹ̀ le fa ewu ẹ̀jẹ̀ ríru, ààrùn ọkàn àti ìrọpárọsẹ̀.

DEFINITION: increase in the number of cells in a tissue or organ. Hyperplasia may be due to a normal, increased demand for cells or may be a sign of precancerous changes.
TRANSLATION: iye àwọn hóró nínú ìmọ̀lára tàbí ara. Afa- jẹjẹrẹ lè jẹ́ àlékún àwọn hóró tàbí àmì ìyípadà òyì jẹjẹrẹ.

DEFINITION: syndrome A life-threatening allergic reaction to a drug. Hypersensitivity syndrome is characterized by fever, rash, organ involvement (most frequently the liver), and high blood levels of eosinophils (a type of white blood cell).
TRANSLATION: lára Ewu amẹ́mìídání ìṣesí òògùn. Ewu ìṣesí òògùn lára ní àbùdá ibà, ara sísú, ìkópa ẹ̀ya ara pàápàá ẹ̀dọ̀ àti ẹ̀yà hóró ẹ̀jẹ̀ funfun. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 150

DEFINITION: Persistently elevated blood pressure. Blood pressure is the force of blood pushing against the walls of the arteries. Hypertension can harm the arteries and increase the risk of stroke, heart attack, and kidney failure.
TRANSLATION: Ẹ̀ jẹ̀ ríru ni ipá tí ẹ̀jẹ̀ fi ń kọjá nínú òpó apínjẹ̀. Ẹ̀ jẹ̀ ríru yìí lè ba òpó apínjẹ̀ jẹ́ kí ó sì ṣe àlékún ewu ìrọlápá-ìrọlẹ́sẹ̀, àkóbá fún ọkàn, àti ìsọsẹ́sílẹ̀ kídìnrín.

DEFINITION: mia Excessive accumulation of triglycerides (a type of fat) in the blood. Hypertriglyceridemia increases the risk of high blood pressure, heart disease, and stroke.
TRANSLATION: ẹ̀jẹ̀ Àpọ̀jù ọ̀rá inú ẹ̀jẹ̀ lè se àlékún ewu fún ẹ̀jẹ̀ ríru, ààrùn ọkàn àti ìrọlápá-ìrọlẹ́sẹ̀.

DEFINITION: higher-than-normal levels of uric acid in the blood. Hyperuricemia may be an adverse effect of some antiretroviral (ARV) drugs.
TRANSLATION: nínú Ẹ̀ jẹ̀ Èyí jẹ́ ipò ìtọ̀ nínú ẹ̀jẹ̀ ju bí ó ti yẹ lọ. Ó lè jẹ́ àtunbọ̀tán lílo òògùn apa KASA.

DEFINITION: globulinemia Abnormally low levels of immunoglobulins.
TRANSLATION: funfun Àìtó hóró ẹ̀jẹ̀ funfun.

DEFINITION: Hypoglycaemia, also known as low blood sugar or low blood glucose, is when blood sugar decreases to below normal levels.
TRANSLATION: ẹ̀jẹ̀ Èyí ni tí àìtó súgà tàbí ẹ̀jẹ̀ bá ṣe àdínkù sí ìwọ̀n síṣedéédé.

DEFINITION: Condition in which the sex glands produce little or no hormones. Hypogonadism commonly occurs during HIV infection.
TRANSLATION: ìṣabiamọ Ipò ní èyí tí ẹsẹ́ oje ara ìbálòpọ̀ pèsè kékeré tàbí àìsí oje. Àìpèsè ìtarají ìsabiyamọ wọ́ pọ̀ ní àsìkò ìkóràn KASA.

DEFINITION: tentative statement or supposition that may then be tested through research.
TRANSLATION: ọ̀rọ̀ tàbí ìdáwọ́lé tí a lè ṣe àyẹ̀wò nípa ìwádìí. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 151
Hypoxia Reduction of oxygen supply to tissue. Àìtó èèmí ara Àdínkù ìpèsè atẹ́gùn sí ìmọ̀lára.

DEFINITION: of cases This is an act of identifying patients that have a notifiable disease, e.g. Ebola virus.
TRANSLATION: Ọ̀ nà síṣe ìdámọ̀ aláìsàn tí ó ní kòkòrò bí i Èbólà.

DEFINITION: Occurring spontaneously or from an unknown cause.
TRANSLATION: oní tẹ̀léǹtẹ̀lé láti ibi àìmọ̀dí.

DEFINITION: Thrombocytopenic Purpura (ITP) An autoimmune disorder in which the immune system destroys platelets. The destruction of platelets leads to abnormal blood clotting and easy or excessive bruising and bleeding. The exact cause of idiopathic thrombocy- topenic purpura is unknown; however, the disorder may develop with a viral infection, including HIV.
TRANSLATION: aláìnídìí Àìda àjẹsára ni èyí tí ètò àjẹsára pa hóró amẹ́jẹ̀dì. Èyí máa ń yọrí sí àìda ẹ̀jẹ̀ dídì àti ìsẹ̀jẹ̀.

DEFINITION: side effect Secondary unintended effect of a medical treatment that is unique or peculiar to an individual.
TRANSLATION: Ìmò ̣lára si òògùn tí ó je ̣ mó ̣ ẹnìkan.

DEFINITION: unique and characteristic parts of an antibody's variable region, which can themselves serve as antigens.
TRANSLATION: araaláàdáani Àkànṣe àti ẹ̀yà agbèègbè sójà kan tí wọ́n le jẹ̀ ẹ́ àjèjì adáralóró sí ara wọn.

DEFINITION: Protected against infection, usually by the presence of antibodies.
TRANSLATION: ̣wó ̣ ìkóràn, pàápàá nípasẹ̀ ìfarahàn àwọn sójà ara. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 152

DEFINITION: complex An immune complex, sometimes called an antigen-antibody complex, is a molecule formed from the integral binding of an antibody to a soluble antigen. The bound antigen and antibody act as a unitary object, effectively an antigen of its own with a specific epitope.
TRANSLATION: Àpapọ̀ sójà ara àti àjèjì adáralóró ni mólékù tí a ti ara sójà pèsè lòdì sí àjèjì adáralóró. Àti sójà pẹ̀lú àjèjì adáralóró máa n ṣiṣẹ́ ọ̀tọ̀ọ̀ọ̀tọ̀.

DEFINITION: deficiency A breakdown or inability of certain parts of the immune system to function, thus making a person susceptible to certain diseases that they would not ordinarily develop.
TRANSLATION: tàbí àìlágbára iṣẹ́ àwọn ẹ̀yà ètò àjẹsára tí ó n mú èèyàn ṣe àìlágbára sí àwọn ààrùn tí wọn kò lè dàgbàsókè láíláí.

DEFINITION: response The activity of the immune system against foreign substances.
TRANSLATION: ètò àjẹsára máa n lòdì sí àwọn èròjà àjèjì.

DEFINITION: system The interacting combination of all the body's ways of recognizing cells, tissues, objects, and organisms that are not part of itself, and initiating the immune response to fight them.
TRANSLATION: àti mọ ìsopọ̀ àwọn hóró ara, ìmọ̀lára, ẹ̀yàwuuru àti àwọn oun tí kì í ṣe ti ara, kí a wá dojú kọwọ́n nípa ètò àjẹsára.

DEFINITION: Thrombocytopenic Purpura Bleeding disorder or blood bleeding problem due to immune disorder.
TRANSLATION: ajẹmó ̣ ṣégeṣège àje ̣sára Ìs ̣òro ìs ̣è ̣jè ̣ aje ̣mó ̣ s ̣éges ̣ège àje ̣sára.

DEFINITION: is the balanced state of having adequate biological defences to fight
TRANSLATION: ní ọ̀nà àti wọ ìjàkadì sí ìkóran, ààrùn tàbí àìfẹ́ ìbí, ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 153 infection, disease, or other unwanted biological invasion, while having adequate tolerance to avoid allergy, and autoimmune diseases. nígbà tí a bá n fi ara da lọ́nà àti yàgò fún ààrùn.

DEFINITION: process of making someone immune, e.g. by vaccination.
TRANSLATION: fífún ènìyàn ní abẹ́rẹ́ àjẹsára.

DEFINITION: is the ability of the body to produce a normal immune response following exposure to an antigen.
TRANSLATION: kí ara lè pèsè ìdáhùn àjẹsára nígbà tí àjèjì adáralóró bá fi ara hàn.

DEFINITION: deficiency of immune response or a disorder characterized by a deficient immune response; classified as antibody (B cell), cellular (T cell), combined deficiency or phagocytic dysfunction disorders.
TRANSLATION: sí ìdáhùn àjẹsára tàbí àìdà ajẹmọ́ ìdáhùn àjẹsára tí a mọ sí sójà ara.

DEFINITION: substance, also called an antigen, capable of provoking an immune response.
TRANSLATION: tí a mọ̀ sí àjèjì adáralóró jẹ́ èyí tí ó lè tako ìdáhùn àjẹsára.

DEFINITION: ability of an antigen or vaccine to stimulate an immune response.
TRANSLATION: Ìgbésẹ̀ kí àjèjì adáralóró tàbí àjẹsára lọ́nà àti lọ́wọ́ nínú ìdáhùn àjẹsára.

DEFINITION: known as antibodies, they are glycoprotein molecules produced by plasma cells (white blood cells). They act as a critical part of the immune
TRANSLATION: ní mólékù purotéénì tí àwọn hóró ẹ̀jẹ̀ funfun n pèsè. Wọ́n wà fún ìṣekúpa àwọn kòkòrò tó n tako ara. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 154 response by specifically recognizing and binding to particular antigens, such as bacteria or viruses and aiding in their destruction.

DEFINITION: surveillance or immuno- surveillance Immune surveillance is a theory that the immune system patrols the body not only to recognize and destroy invading pathogens but also to host cells that become cancerous.
TRANSLATION: Ìtọpinpin ìtànkákiri àjẹsára Ìtọpinpin ìtànkákiri àjẹsára nínú ara kì í ṣe láti mọ tàbí pa àwọn kòkòrò ṣùgbọ́n mọ olùgbàlejò hóró tí ó ti ní jẹjẹrẹ.

DEFINITION: modulator Any substance that influences the immune system.
TRANSLATION: àjẹsára Àwọn èròjà tí ó n lọ́wọ́ sí ètò àjẹsára.

DEFINITION: agent or substance that triggers or enhances the body's defence; also called immunopotentiator.
TRANSLATION: tí ó n ṣe ìrànwọ́ fún ààbò ara.

DEFINITION: suppressed A word used for people who have a decreased ability to fight infection. People with HIV or AIDS are immunosuppressed because their CD4 cells are decreased by the virus. People being treated for cancers may be immunosuppressed because of the drugs they are given to fight the cancer.
TRANSLATION: rọ̀ tí á n lò fún ẹni tí ó ní ìṣòro àti wọ̀dìmú pẹ̀lú ìkóràn. Àwọn ènìyàn tí ó n gbé pẹ̀lú KASA tàbí ààrùn ìṣọdọ̀lẹ àjẹsára, nítorí pé hóró ìdábòòbò 4 wọn ni kòkòrò yìí n fà sí ẹ̀yìn. Àwọn tí a n fún ní ìtọ́jú jẹjẹrẹ ní wọn lè jẹ́ oníṣọdọ̀lẹ àjẹsára nítorí àwọn òògùn tíwọ́n n fún wọn láti pa/wọ̀jàkadì ti jẹjẹrẹ.

DEFINITION: suppression A state of the body in which the immune system is damaged and does
TRANSLATION: tí ara wà nígbà tí ètò àjẹsára bá ti bàjẹ́ tàbí ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 155 not perform its normal functions. Immunosuppression may be induced by drugs or result from certain disease processes, such as HIV infection. àìlèṣedéédé. Aṣọdọ̀lẹ àjẹsára lè wá nípasẹ̀ àwọn òògùn kan tàbí nípa ìgbéṣẹ̀ ààrùn bí i ìkóràn KASA.

DEFINITION: Treatment aimed at reconstituting an impaired immune system.
TRANSLATION: Ìtọ́jú tí ó wà fún àtúnṣe bíbàjẹ́ ètò àjẹsára.

DEFINITION: plant or animal toxin (i.e. poison) that is attached to a monoclonal antibody and used to destroy a specific target cell.
TRANSLATION: ohun ọ̀gbìn tàbí ẹranko tí ó somọ́ sójà ara monoclona tí a n lò láti pa àwọn hóró kan.

DEFINITION: kidney Kidney disease is the reduced ability of the kidney to carry out its normal functions.
TRANSLATION: kídìnrín máa n ṣe àdínkù bá kídìnrín láti s ̣e iṣẹ́ rẹ nínú ara.

DEFINITION: Impetigo is a contagious skin infection that usually produces blisters or sores on the face, neck, hands, and diaper area.
TRANSLATION: Ààrùn ìkóràn ara tí ó n ṣe àgbéjàde ìléròrò tàbí egbò ni ojú, ọrùn, ọwọ́ àti ní ara ọmọdé.

DEFINITION: kit Provides national and local stakeholders, as well as programme managers, with key considerations and a road map for instituting and implementing critical, relevant, practical and timely communication for responding to the threat of an Ebola Virus Disease (EVD) outbreak.
TRANSLATION: Ebola Ìbáṣepọ́ àti ìdáhùnsí àwọn olùdarí ètò nípa ṣíṣe ìlànà lọ́nà àti dènà ìtànkálẹ̀ Ebola. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 156

DEFINITION: vitro In an artificial environment, referring to a process or reaction occurring therein, as in a test tube or culture medium.
TRANSLATION: àtọwọ́ dá Àyíká àtọwọ́dá tí ó túmọ̀ sí ọ̀nà tàbí ìṣesí nínú nkan kan náà, pàápàá nínú túbù àyẹ̀wò.

DEFINITION: vivo ("In life") Studies conducted within a living organism (e.g. animal or human studies).
TRANSLATION: Àyẹ̀wò ẹ̀kọ́ ní àgbèègbè eyawuuru bí i ti ẹranko tàbí ènìyàn.

DEFINITION: is a sexual relationship between people classed as being too closely related to marry each other.
TRANSLATION: tí ó súnmọ́ ara ju kí wọ́n fẹ́ràn ara wọn lọ.

DEFINITION: number of new cases occurring in a given population over a certain period of time.
TRANSLATION: ò ̣tun ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ Iye ònkà àṣẹ̀ṣẹ̀kó láàrin àwọn olùgbé kan fún ìgbà kan.

DEFINITION: period The period between the time somebody is infected with a disease and the appearance of its first symptom.
TRANSLATION: Àkókò láàrin àsìkò ìkóràn ààrùn àti àsìkò tí ó jẹyọ.

DEFINITION: medicine, a strong reason for believing that a particular course of action is desirable. In a wounded patient, the loss of blood, which would lead to circulatory collapse, is an indication for blood transfusion.
TRANSLATION: isoogun, ìdí tí a fi gbàgbọ́ pé ìgbẹ́sè fún ǹkan dára. Nínú aláìsàn tí ó ṣèṣeè sọ ẹ̀jẹ̀ nù, léyì tó lè yí sí ìsubú ìṣọ̀n, oun ni ìtọ́kasí fún gbígba ẹ̀jẹ̀.

DEFINITION: sign that shows the condition or existence of something: a pointer or light that shows the state or condition of something.
TRANSLATION: tí ó n fi ipò nǹkan hàn. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 157

DEFINITION: or discomfort in the stomach associated with difficulty in digesting food.
TRANSLATION: tàbí inú kíkún tí ó rọ̀mọ́ ìnira àìdà oúnjẹ.

DEFINITION: diagnosis Identification of a disorder in a child within the first year of life.
TRANSLATION: /aròbó Ìdámọ̀ àìsàn ọmọwọ́/aròbó láàrin o ̣dun kan tó dáyé.

DEFINITION: feeding options Alternatives to breastfeeding as the best choice for a baby may be determined by maternal inadequacy, illness or absence, and by infant illness or deformity.
TRANSLATION: ní oúnjẹ Ọ̀nà mìíràn fún ìfáròbó ní oúnjẹ le wáyé nígbà tí ìyá bá ṣàárè ̣ tàbí ṣaláìsí, àárè ̣ aròbó sì le fà á.

DEFINITION: fluid Any body secretion that can transfer infection from one person to another.
TRANSLATION: ara tí ó lè fa ìkóràn láti ò ̣dò ̣ ẹnìkan sí ẹlòmíràn.

DEFINITION: needle These are needles that were not sterized or that have been contaminated by blood.
TRANSLATION: abẹ́rẹ́ tí a kò ṣè ìtọ́jú wọn tàbí àwọn tí ẹ̀jẹ̀ bàjẹ́.

DEFINITION: person Someone who has contacted a disease from another person.
TRANSLATION: ni ẹni tí ó kó ààrùn láti ara ẹlòmíràn.

DEFINITION: sharp objects The exposure (to microbial contamination) of any device or object used to puncture or lacerate the skin.
TRANSLATION: àkóràn Àwọn ìkóràn tí ó ràn láti ara ohun èlò nígbà tí a bá gún ara ní abẹ́rẹ́.

DEFINITION: invasion and multiplication of microorganisms such as bacteria, viruses, and protozoa. The effective agent may be transmitted by a patient or carrier, in airborne droplets expelled
TRANSLATION: ìsọdipúpọ̀ ẹ̀yà abẹ̀mi-àìfojúrí bíi, batéríà, kòkòrò ati pòtosua. Asojú aláìnílárí ni aláìsàn lè kó ààrùn tabi ìránṣẹ́ afẹ́fẹ́ òfúfù ìrì ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 158 during coughing and sneezing, or by direct contact. òwúrọ̀ tó jáde nígbà tí abá wúkọ́ tabi sín-in tábi nípa pèkí-n-pèkí.

DEFINITION: Capable of being transmitted by infec- tion, with or without actual contact.
TRANSLATION: ṣése kí i ràn yálà nípa pẹ̀kí-n-pẹ̀kí tàbí ọ̀nà míìràn.

DEFINITION: (EBV) mononucleosis An acute infectious disease associated with Epstein-Barr virus. Symptoms may include: fever, swelling of lymph nodes, and a decrease in the cells that fight infection.
TRANSLATION: ààrùn ìkóràn ajẹmọ́ kòkòrò Esipitini-Báà. Àwọn ààmì àìsàn yìí ni: ibà ẹ̀wọ́n omi ara wíwú, àdínkù àwọn hóró tí ń bá ààrùn kíkó jà.

DEFINITION: disease Any disease that can be transmitted from one person to another.
TRANSLATION: ààrùn tí a lè kó láti ara ẹnìkan sí ẹlòmíràn.

DEFINITION: is the immediate defensive reaction of tissue to any injury, which may be caused by infection, chemicals or physical agents. It involves pain, heat, redness, swelling, and loss of function of the affected part.
TRANSLATION: aàbò ìfura lọ́wọ́ ìmọ̀lára sí egbò, tí ó lè tara ìkóràn wá, kẹ́míkà tàbí asojú t’ára. Ó ní ìrora, iṣù-iná, pípọ́n,wíwú, àti àdánù iṣé ní apá ibi tí ó ní ìpalára. Ìṣọ̀n ẹ̀jẹ̀ lójú àpa egbò a fẹ̀, débi pé ẹ̀jẹ̀ tó n ṣòn ní agbèègbè á pọ̀ si.

DEFINITION: of the testicle Orchitis is inflammation of one or both testicles in men, usually caused by an infection.
TRANSLATION: jẹ́ ọ̀kan lára kórópọ̀n méjì lára o ̣kùnrin tí ó wá láti ara ìkóràn.

DEFINITION: or swelling of the brain Encephalitis is an inflammation of the brain tissue. It is most often caused by viral infections. In some cases, bacterial infections can cause encephalitis.
TRANSLATION: ọpọlọ le wáyé nípasè ̣ ìkóràn kòkòrò tàbí batéríà. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 159

DEFINITION: human respiratory (lung) infection of undetermined cause. Symptoms may include: sudden onset, fever, feeling physically or mentally tired, severe aches and pains, and shortness of breath.
TRANSLATION: Aisan ààrùn ọkàn ẹ̀dá ènìyàn lọ́nà àìmọ̀dí. Àwọn ààmì àìsàn yìí ni: ìdàmú òjijì, ibà, ìrẹra, ara ríro tàbí kíkan, àìlè mí gaara.

DEFINITION: Education and Communication (IEC) IEC refers to a public health approach aimed at changing or reinforcing health-related behaviours in a target audience, concerning a specific problem and within a predefined period of time, through communication methods and principles.
TRANSLATION: ìbáraẹni- sọ̀rọ̀ lórí IEC Èyí ni ìlera àwùj́ọ tí ó ń yí ìwùwàsí nípa ìlera àwọn ènìyàn padà lórí ìsòro kan pàtó.

DEFINITION: consent The type of protection available to people considering entering a drug trial. Before entering the trial, participants must sign a consent form that contains an explanation of: (1) why the research is being done, (2) what researchers want to accomplish, (3) what will be done during the trial and for how long, (4) what risks are in the trial, (5) what benefits can be expected from the trial, (6) what other treatments are available, and (7) the participant's right to leave the trial at any time.
TRANSLATION: ààbò tí ó wà fún ènìyàn lọ́nà ìwádìí ajẹmọ́tọ́jú. Kí i tó dé bíi ajẹmọ́tọ́jú, ọ̀wọ́ akópa gbúdọ̀ finúfíndọ̀ fọwọ́ sí àwọn ìwádìí. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 160

DEFINITION: Users (IDU) Substance use, abuse, and dependence that have been closely associated with HIV infection since the beginning of the epidemic. Injection drug use accounts for approximately 10% of HIV infections globally and 30% of those outside of Africa.
TRANSLATION: alábẹ́rẹ́ jé ̣ ò ̣nà kan gbòógì tí a n gbà kó kòkòrò KASA láti ìbè ̣rè ̣pè ̣pè ̣. Káríayé àti ní Aáfíríkà ni ìlòògùn alábẹ́rẹ́ ti n fa ìkóràn KASA.

DEFINITION: injection is a method of introducing a drug into the body with a hollow needle and a syringe which is pierced through the skin into the body (usually intravenous, but also intra- muscular or subcutaneous).
TRANSLATION: Ọ̀ nà ìfabẹ́ẹ́rẹ́ lo òògùn wọ inú ara.

DEFINITION: introduction of a substance (inoculums, e.g. a vaccine, serum or virus) into the body to produce or to increase immunity to the disease or condition associated with the substance.
TRANSLATION: ohun èròjà àjẹsára, omi- ara tàbí kòkòrò sínú ara lati ṣe àlékún bá a àjẹsára sí ààrùn tàbí ipò tí ó rọ̀mọ́ èròjà yìí.

DEFINITION: department A patient who is admitted to a bed in a hospital ward and remains there for a period of time for treatment, examination or observation.
TRANSLATION: ó ní àyè ìbùsùn ní ìle-ìwòsàn, tí ó sì wà ní ibẹ̀ fún ìgba dí ẹ̀ fún ìtọ́jú.

DEFINITION: Review Board (IRB) (1) A committee of physicians, statisticians, community advocates and others that ensures that a clinical trial
TRANSLATION: ẹgbẹ́ àwọn oníṣègùn, alágbàwí agbègbè tí ó n ṣe ìdánilójú pé ìwádìí ajẹmọ́tọ́jú ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 161 is ethical and that the rights of study participants are protected. All clinical trials in the United States must be approved by an IRB before they begin. (2) Every institution that conducts or supports biomedical or behavioural research involving human subjects must, by federal regulation, have an IRB that initially approves and periodically reviews the research so as to protect the rights of human subjects. jẹ́ àṣà, tí ó sì n ṣe ààbò àwọn ọ̀wọ́ akópa.

DEFINITION: natural hormone made by pancreas that controls the level of sugar glucose in the blood.
TRANSLATION: insulin Oje ara abínibí tí a pèsè láti ara àmọ́ tí ó n ṣe ìdarí àádùn ẹ̀jẹ̀ súugà nínú ẹ̀jẹ̀.

DEFINITION: enzyme used by the virus to integrate its genetic material into the host cell's DNA.
TRANSLATION: Ẹnsaimu integrase Ẹnsaimu KASA tí kòkòrò máa n lò láti mú aṣepọ̀ bá èlò jínnì sí olùgbàlejò hóró DNA.

DEFINITION: process by which the different parts of an organism are made a functional and structural whole, especially through the activity of the nervous system and of hormones. As related to HIV, it is the process by which the viral DNA migrates to the cell's nucleus where it is spliced into the host's DNA with the help of viral integrase.
TRANSLATION: òrísirísi ẹ̀yà oníyẹ ní ó n ṣiṣẹ́ páàpáà nípa iṣẹ́ ètò ìmòlára àti oje-ara. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 162

DEFINITION: weakness Weakness is the feeling of body fatigue (tiredness). A person experiencing weakness may not be able to move that part of their body properly or they may experience tremors (uncontrollable movement or twitches) in the area of weakness.
TRANSLATION: ni kí i ènìyàn máa ṣe àárẹ̀ ní gbogbo ara. Irú ènìyàn bẹ́ ẹ̀ kòní lè dáragbé bí ó ṣe yẹ, tí a ṣi tún nira láti yí i ara ní agbèègbè àárẹ̀ yìí.

DEFINITION: to treat Analysis of clinical trial results that includes all data from patients in the groups to which they were randomized (i.e. assigned through random distribution) even if they never received the treatment.
TRANSLATION: ̣ ṣètó ̣jú. Ìtúpalè ̣ èsì ìwádìí ajẹmọ́tọ́jú tí ó ní gbogbo àká àwọn aláìsàn lé ̣lé ̣gbé ̣je ̣gbé ̣ sí ibi tí wọ́n yóò wà fún ìtọ́jú.

DEFINITION: general term used to describe a family of 20-25 proteins that cause a cell to become resistant to a wide variety of viruses. They are produced by cells infected by almost any virus.
TRANSLATION: ti kòkòrò Ìperí gbogbo purotéénì 20-25 fún ẹbí tí ó n mú hóró jẹ́ àtakò sí ọ̀pọ̀ kòkòrò. Ní èyí tí àwọn ìkóràn kòkòrò n pèsè sínú gbogbo kòkòrò.

DEFINITION: (IL-2) One of a family of molecules that control the growth and function of many types of lymphocytes. Interleukin-2 is an immune system protein produced in the body by T cells.
