It has potent effects on the proliferation, differentiation and activity of a number of immune system cells, including T cells, B cells and natural killer cells. Commercially, IL-2
TRANSLATION: kan lára mólékù tí ó n darí ìdàgbàsókè àti iṣẹ́ ọ̀pọ̀ àwọn jẹjẹrẹ omi-ara. Àjẹsára IL-2 ni ètò àjẹsára purotéénì tí ara n pèsè nínú àwọn hóró T. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 163 is produced by recombinant DNA technology and is approved by the Food and Drug Administration for the treatment of metastatic renal (i.e. kidney) cell cancer.

DEFINITION: bleeding This is a blood disorder inside the body.
TRANSLATION: ẹ̀jẹ̀ nínú ara.

DEFINITION: Relating to or situated in the small, narrow spaces between tissues or parts of an organ.
TRANSLATION: Ajẹmó ̣ ààyè kékeré, àwọn àlàfo tínrín láàrin ìmọ̀lára tàbí ẹ̀yà ara.

DEFINITION: act of intervening, especially a deliberate entry into a situation or dispute in order to influence events or prevent undesirable consequences.
TRANSLATION: ààrin àríyànjiyàn láti la ìjà torí ohun àìròtẹ́lẹ̀.

DEFINITION: partner Intimate partner has to do with friends or relationships that are so close, familiar; personal, private; warm, friendly and more importantly involving sexual relations.
TRANSLATION: Ọ̀ rẹ́ oníbàlòpọ̀ ni ọ̀rẹ́ tàbí ìbáṣepọ̀ tó súnmọ́ ara wọn, páàpáà jùlọ ọ̀rẹ́ oníbàlòpọ̀.

DEFINITION: partner violence (IPV) This is a behaviour within an intimate relationship that causes physical, psychological or sexual harm to those in the relationship, including acts of physical aggression, sexual coercion, psychological abuse and controlling behaviours.
TRANSLATION: tímọ́ tímọ́ ẹní lò Ìwà eré géle láàrin olólùfgéle láàímọ́tímọ, ìpalára tàbí aagél ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 164

DEFINITION: period Intrapartum period is the period from the onset of labour to the end of the third stage of labour.
TRANSLATION: jẹ́ àsìkò láti ìgbà ìrọbí sí ìpele kẹ́ta ìrọbí.

DEFINITION: Injected into the fluid surrounding the spinal cord.
TRANSLATION: Ìlànà gígún ọ̀pá ẹ̀yìn pẹ̀lú abẹ́rẹ́.

DEFINITION: (IV) Of or pertaining to the inside of a vein, as of a thrombus, or an injection, infusion or catheter.
TRANSLATION: inú iṣan bí i èyí tí a gún sínú iṣan.

DEFINITION: (IND) The status of an experimental drug after the Food and Drug Administration agrees that it can be tested in people.
TRANSLATION: fáyè ̣wò Òògùn tí as ̣àkóso oúnje ̣ àti òògùn bá fo ̣wó ̣ sí pé a lè yè ̣wò lára ènìyàn.

DEFINITION: new drug application A programme to provide experimental treatments to a class of patients who lack satisfactory alternative treatment. IND stands for Investigational New Drug application, which is part of the process to get approval from the Food and Drug Administration for marketing a new prescription drug in the US.
TRANSLATION: òògùn tuntun Ètò tó n pèsè àyẹ̀wò ìtọ́jú fún àwọn ẹgbẹ́ aláìsàn tí wọn ò ní ìtẹ́lọ́rùn yíyàn ìtọ́jú.

DEFINITION: solution Dissolution of iodine in an aqueous medium to form an admixture.
TRANSLATION: ìyodínì pò ̣ mó ̣ omi. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 165

DEFINITION: Inflammation of the iris and ciliary body of the eye.
TRANSLATION: Ẹyinjú yíyún tí ó sì pó ̣n.
Iritis Inflammation of the iris of the eye. Pípó ̣n ààrin ẹyinjú Ààrin e ̣yinjú yíyún tí ó sì pó ̣n.

DEFINITION: deficiency anaemia Inadequacy of blood due to insufficient intake of mineral iron.
TRANSLATION: ẹ̀jẹ̀ nípasè ̣ àìje ̣tó ohun aṣaralóore.

DEFINITION: Seclusion from the majority for a special purpose, e.g. observation.
TRANSLATION: láàrin ò ̣p ̣ò ̣ fún ìdí pàtàkì bí àyè ̣wò.

DEFINITION: (INH) Isoniazid, marketed under other names including isonicotinylhydrazide (INH) and Hydra, is an antibiotic used as a first-line agent in the prevention and treatment of tuberculosis.
TRANSLATION: tí a n tà lábẹ́ INH àti àdàmọ̀dì jẹ́ sójà tí a n lò fún ìdènà àti ìtọ́jú. A tún lè pè é ní òògùn jẹjẹrẹ.

DEFINITION: belli Cystoisospora belli, previously known as Isospora belli, is a parasite that causes an intestinal disease known as cystoisosporiasis. This protozoan parasite is opportunistic in immune- suppressed human hosts.
TRANSLATION: ni kòkòrò tí ó n fa ààrùn ìfun. Pùròtósúà yìí jẹ́ ajẹmọ́ àjẹsára tí olùgbàlejò lè tẹ̀mọ̀lẹ̀.

DEFINITION: Itraconazole is a triazole antifungal agent prescribed to patients with fungal infections. The drug may be given orally or intravenously.
TRANSLATION: ̣ osunwuuru Èyí jẹ́ aṣojú òògùn osunwuuru fún àwọn aláìsàn tí ó ní ìkóràn osunwuuru. A lè lò gbé e mì tàbí fà á sínú ara.

DEFINITION: United Nations Programme on The Joint United Nations Programme on HIV and AIDS (UNAIDS) is the main advocate for accelerated,
TRANSLATION: UNAIDS Àjọ UNAIDS United Nations àti ìgbéláruge ̣ aáyan nípa ìdènà ìtànkálẹ̀ààrùn. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS

DEFINITION: and AIDS (UNAIDS) comprehensive and coordinated global action on the HIV/AIDS epidemic.

sarcoma A previously uncommon form of cancer that attacks the connective tissue, bones, cartilage and muscles of the body. The cancer may spread and also attack the eyes. If the cancerous area is near the surface of the skin, lesions inches in length may develop.
TRANSLATION: jẹjẹrẹ tí ó n kọlu àpapọ̀ ìmọ̀lára, eegun, kèrékèré àti iṣan inú ara. Jẹjẹrẹ yìí lè tànká sínú ojú. Tí ó bá jẹmọ́ pèpele ojú ara, ó lè ṣe àwọn ohun àìfẹ́ lójú ara.

DEFINITION: score A subjective score between 0-100, assigned by a physician to describe a patient's ability to perform common tasks.
TRANSLATION: karnofsky Èyí jẹ́ ònkà láti 0-100 tí àwọn oníṣègùn máa n lò láti ṣe àlàyé agbára ohun tí aláìsàn lè ṣe.

DEFINITION: Ketoconazole is a synthetic imidazole antifungal drug used primarily to treat fungal infections.
TRANSLATION: osunwuuru Òògùn osunwuuru ní a n lò fún ìtọ́jú ìkóràn osunwuuru.

DEFINITION: Either of a pair of organs in the abdomen of vertebrates that filter waste liquid resulting from metabolism of the blood, which is subsequently excreted as urine.
TRANSLATION: nínú àwọn è ̣yà abèjì inú tí ó n sé ̣ ìdọ̀tí inú ẹ̀jẹ̀, èyí tí à n tọ̀ dànù.

DEFINITION: failure Renal failure, also known as kidney failure or renal insufficiency, is a medical condition in which the kidneys fail to adequately filter waste products from the blood.
TRANSLATION: kíndìnrín Èyí jẹ́ ipò tí kíndìrín ti kùnà láti sé ̣ ìdọ̀tí inú ẹ̀jẹ̀ dànù. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 167

DEFINITION: cells Killer cells attack cells infected with HIV or other viruses or transformed by cancer. Also known as cytotoxic T cells (or cytotoxic T lymphocytes).
TRANSLATION: kòkòrò Apa kòkòrò n gbógun ti hóró tí ó ní ìkóràn KASA tàbí àwọn kòkòrò míìràn, àti èyí tí jẹjẹrẹ ti bàjé ̣.
Kupffer cells Specialized macrophages in the liver. Hóró Kupffer Àkànṣe ẹ̀yà ara ìnú ẹ̀jẹ̀ nínú ẹ̀dọ̀fóró.

DEFINITION: mice The laboratory mouse is a small mammal of the order Rodentia which is bred and kept for scientific research.
TRANSLATION: tí a n lo eku fún ìwádìí ìjìnlẹ̀ ṣáyẹ́nsì.

DEFINITION: (1) Place for scientific research: a place where research and testing is carried out. (2) Room for teaching science: a room or place with appropriate equipment for teaching science or doing scientific work.
TRANSLATION: ìjìnlè ̣/Làáàbù (1) Ibi tí a ti n ṣe ìwádìí ìmò ̣- ìjìnlẹ̀: ibi tí àyẹ̀wò àti ìṣèwádìí ti n wáyé. (2) Yàrá tí a ti n kọ́ nípa ìwádìí ìmò ̣-ìjìnlẹ̀: yàrá tí ó ní irinṣẹ́ tó péye fún kíkọ́ ìmò ̣-ìjìnlè ̣ àti síse ìmò ̣-ìjìnlè ̣.

DEFINITION: sequence of actions by which a baby and the afterbirth placenta are expelled from the uterus at childbirth.
TRANSLATION: ìṣe alátẹ̀léra èyí tí ọmọ àti ibi ọmọ jáde láti inú- ọmọnú nígbà ìbí.

DEFINITION: of care Lack of care is defined as lack of feeling, emotion, interest, and concern.
TRANSLATION: sí àìní ìfọwọ́bà, ìmọ̀lára àti ìfọkànsìn.

DEFINITION: of interest Lack of interest is an act of showing less concern about something.
TRANSLATION: ìlànà àìkọbi ara sí nǹkan.

DEFINITION: of support The actual or perceived absence of meaningful assistance in negotiating challenges encountered in the course of pursuing a goal.
TRANSLATION: dènà kíkojú ìs ̣òro àtis ̣às ̣eyo ̣rí jẹ́. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 168

DEFINITION: acidosis Lactic acidosis is a physiological condition characterized by low pH in body tissues and blood (acidosis) accompanied by the build-up of lactate, especially L-lactate, and is considered a distinct form of metabolic acidosis. Lactic acidosis is characterized by lactate levels >5 mmol/L and serum pH <7.35.
TRANSLATION: Ipò òsùwọ̀n tí ó kéré sí pH nínú àwọn ìmọ̀lára ara àti ẹ̀jẹ̀.

DEFINITION: group of closely related HIV isolates that includes the LAV, IIIB and BRU strains of HIV. Used in HIV vaccine development.
TRANSLATION: ohun ìbáramu ìyàsọ́tọ̀ KASA tí ó ní LAV, IIB àti BRU nínú KASA, èyí ti a n lò fún ìdàgbàsókè àjẹsára KASA.

DEFINITION: cells Lymphocytes transformed in the laboratory into lymphokine activated killer cells, which attack tumor cells.
TRANSLATION: jẹjẹrẹ nínú yàrá àyẹ̀wò sí èlò jẹjẹrẹ omi-ara èyí tí ó n jí àwọn ohun apa hóró tí ó kọlu jẹjẹrẹ hóró.

DEFINITION: cells Dendritic cells in the skin that pick up an antigen and transport it to the lymph nodes.
TRANSLATION: langerhans Hóró ìmọ̀lára tí ó ní àjèjì adáralóró, tí ó sì gbẹwọ inú ẹ̀wọ́n omi-ara.

DEFINITION: fever Viral disease carried by rats. It is common in West Africa. Infections occur through direct contact with or consumption of food contaminated by rodent’s urine or faecal matter containing virus particles.
TRANSLATION: alásà Kòkòrò ààrùn tí à ń kó lára eku. Èyí wọ́pọ̀ ní Ìwọ̀-oòrùn ilẹ̀ Afíríkà. A lè kó ààrùn yìí nípa ìfarakínra tàbí ouńjẹ tí ó ní ìtọ̀ eku tàbí ohun mìíràn tí ó ní kòkòrò. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 169

DEFINITION: period when an organism (i.e. a virus or a bacterium) is in the body and not producing any ill effects.
TRANSLATION: Ìfarasin Àkókò tí kòkòrò fi hàn nínú ara tí kò sì fa àìlera.

DEFINITION: period This is the amount of time it takes for HIV infection to become full-blown AIDS. It depends on the general health and nutritional status of the person before and during the time of HIV infection, but may last up to 10 years.
TRANSLATION: ̣dò ̣le ̣ àje ̣sára Àsìkò tí ó gba KASA kí ó tó di ààrùn ìso ̣dò ̣le ̣ àje ̣sára.Àsìkò yìí dá lórí bí ìlera akárùn s ̣e le tó. Ó lè tó o ̣dún mé ̣wàá.

DEFINITION: ventricle Left ventricle, thicker than the right, receives blood from the pulmonary vein via the left atrium and pumps it into the aorta.
TRANSLATION: òsì Káà agbẹ́jẹ̀wọlé apá òsì nípọn ju ọ̀tún lọ; wọn a máa gba ẹ̀jẹ̀ láti inú òpó agbẹ́jẹ̀jáde ajẹmọ́ ẹ̀dọ̀fóró sí ìyẹ̀wù ọkàn kí ó sì pọ́mpù rẹ̀ sí òpó ìpínjẹ̀ nlá.

DEFINITION: genus Legionella is a pathogenic group of Gram-negative bacteria that includes the species L. pneumophila, causing legionellosis (all illnesses caused by Legionella) including a pneumonia-type illness called Legionnaires’ disease and a mild flu- like illness called Pontiac fever.
TRANSLATION: legionella Ààrùn bateria ti ẹ̀dọ̀fóró ti ẹgbẹ́ afàìsàn òdì-Gram bateria tí ó ní ẹ̀yà ẹ̀dọ̀fóró dídùn. Wọ́n ti ara kòkòrò ẹ̀dọ̀fóró wá ní ẹ̀yà àìsàn ẹ̀dọ̀fóró àti àìsàn lùkúlùkú.

DEFINITION: Cymbopogon, better known as lemongrass, is a genus of Asian, African, Australian, and tropical island plants in the grass family. Some
TRANSLATION: wọ́pọ̀ ní Asia, Áfíríkà, Australia, àti erékùsù ilẹ̀ olóoru tí ó wà pẹ̀lú àwọn ẹ̀yà mìíràn. À n lò wọ́n fún ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 170 species are commonly cultivated as culinary and medicinal herbs because of their scent, resembling that of lemons. àgbo nítori wó ̣n fi òórùn jo ̣ ọsàn wé ̣wé ̣.

DEFINITION: "Slow" virus characterized by a long interval between infection and the onset of symptoms. HIV is a lentivirus as is the simian immunodeficiency virus (SIV), which infects non-human primates.
TRANSLATION: lenti Kòkòrò lenti jẹ́ kòkòrò láàárìn ìkóràn àti ìbẹ̀rẹ̀ àìsàn. KASA wà lára kòkòrò lenti tí ó lè ran ẹ̀dà èeyàn àti ọ̀bọ.

DEFINITION: lesbian is a female homosexual: a female who experiences romantic love or sexual attraction to other females.
TRANSLATION: obìnrin tí ó ń ní ìbálòpò ̣ pè ̣lú obìnrin bí i rẹ̀.

DEFINITION: general term to describe an area of altered tissue (e.g. the infected patch or sore in a skin disease).
TRANSLATION: gbogboogbo tí ó n tọ́kasí agbèègbè ibi ọgbẹ́.

DEFINITION: often fatal cancer in which white blood cells displace normal blood, leading to infection, shortage of red blood cells anaemia, bleeding, and other disorders. Certain types of childhood leukaemia respond well to treatment, which includes drugs chemotherapy and radiotherapy.
TRANSLATION: tí ó le ní èyí tí ó lé hóró ẹ̀jẹ̀ funfun kúrò nínú ẹ̀jẹ̀, èyí tí ó n yọrí sí ìkóràn, àìtó hóró ẹ̀jẹ̀ pupa, àìlẹ́jẹ̀tó, ìṣẹ̀jẹ̀ àti àwọn àìda mìíràn. Àìsàn yìí máa n tètè gbọ́ ìtọ́jú nígbà kékeré nígbà tí wọ́n bá lo òògùn.
Leukocytes All white blood cells. Hóró ẹ̀jẹ̀ funfun Gbogbo hóró ẹ̀jẹ̀ funfun. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 171

DEFINITION: decrease in the number of white blood cells. The adult threshold value for leukopenia is usually taken as less than 4,000 white blood cells per cubic millimetre of blood.
TRANSLATION: funfun Iye àlà àdínkù hóró ẹ̀jẹ̀ funfun gbà kéré tán ẹgbẹ̀rún máàrún fún kúbik ìdá ọ̀kẹ́ mítà.

DEFINITION: sensitivity Light sensitivity (Photophobia) is not an eye disease, but a symptom of many conditions such as infection or inflammation that can irritate the eyes. Light sensitivity can also be a symptom of underlying diseases that do not directly affect the eyes, such as virus-caused illnesses or severe head- aches or migraine.
TRANSLATION: kìí ṣe ààrùn ojú, ṣùgbọ́n a máa mú ojú wú. Àìlèwo-ìmọ́lẹ̀ tún lè jẹ́ àmì ààrùn abẹ́lé tí kìí ṣe ìpalára fún ojú tààrà, bí i àìsàn tí n fa kòkòrò tàbí ẹ̀fọ́rí tí ó le.

DEFINITION: of a group of fats and fat-like compounds, including sterols, fatty acids and many other substances.
TRANSLATION: kan lára ọ̀rá tàbí àkójọpọ̀ ọ̀rá àti àwọn ohun mìíràn.

DEFINITION: spherical particle in an aqueous (watery) medium (e.g. inside a cell) formed by a lipid bilayer enclosing an aqueous compartment.
TRANSLATION: tí ó jẹ́ àkósọ.

DEFINITION: largest solid organ in the body, situated in the upper part of the abdominal cavity.
TRANSLATION: yà ara tí ó tóbi jù ní ara, tí ó wà ní apá òkè kòròfo inú.

DEFINITION: function The liver filters and processes blood as it circulates through the body. It
TRANSLATION: dọ̀ a máa yímọ́ ẹ̀jẹ̀. A máa fọ àwọn èròjà tí ó sọ àwọn ohun ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 172 metabolizes nutrients, detoxifies harmful substances, makes blood clotting proteins, and performs many other vital functions. tí ó léwu di aláìléwu, mú dídì ẹ̀jẹ̀ di purotéénì, kí wọ́n sì máa ṣe àwọn iṣẹ́ àkànṣe mìíràn.

DEFINITION: dose A loading dose is an initial higher dose of a drug that may be given at the beginning of a course of treatment before dropping down to a lower maintenance dose.
TRANSLATION: Èyí ni òògùn tí a kọ́kọ́ fún ni ní ọ̀pọ̀ rẹ̀ àkókò ìtọ́jú kí a tó wá máa dẹwọ́ rẹ̀ díẹ̀díẹ̀

DEFINITION: Government Action Committee on AIDS (LACA) Community-level governmental agency for integrated response to prevent new HIV infections and mitigate the impact of AIDS on human development in the state.
TRANSLATION: nípa àrùn ìṣọdọ̀lẹ àjẹsára Ìgbìmò ̣ ìjọba ìbílẹ̀ tó n dènà KASA tuntun, tí ó sì n dín ipa ààrùn ìṣọdọ̀lẹ àjẹsára kù lórí ìgbèrú o ̣mo ̣nìyàn ní ìpínlè ̣.

DEFINITION: herbal remedies Herbal remedies can be a safer, less expensive alternative to pharmaceuticals, and many of them can be grown in one’s backyard.
TRANSLATION: tí ó dára, ó jẹ́ ìdàkejì òògùn òyìnbó, tí a lè gbìn sí ọgbà ilé.

DEFINITION: county One of the highest cumulative incidences of EVD in Liberia.
TRANSLATION: kan lára ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ àkójọpọ̀ ààrùn Ebola tí ó ga jùlọ ní Liberia.

DEFINITION: Terminal Repeat Sequence (LTR)
TRANSLATION: component of the AIDS genome. Tẹ̀léntẹ̀lé LTR Ẹ̀ yà apá kọ̀kan tói ètò ara ènìyàn tí ó n gbé pẹ̀lú ààrùn ìṣọdọ̀lẹ àjẹsára.

DEFINITION: non- progressors Individuals who are HIV-infected for seven or more years, have stable CD4+
TRANSLATION: ní àìsàn Ènìyàn tí ó n gbé pẹ̀lú KASA fún ọdún méje tàbí jùbẹ́lọ ni ó ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 173 T cell counts of 600 or more cells per cubic millimeter of blood, no HIV- related diseases and no previous antiretroviral therapy. máa n ní sójà ídábòbò 4 àti ònkà hóró 600 tàbí hóró tí ó ju ìdá-ọ̀kẹ́ mítà ẹ̀jẹ̀ ní àìsí òògùn apa kòkòrò.

DEFINITION: (LPV) Lopinavir (ABT-378) is an anti- retroviral of the protease inhibitor class. It is used against HIV infections as a fixed-dose combination with another protease inhibitor.
TRANSLATION: máa n lo òògùn KASA láti kojú ààrùn kíkó bí i òògùn oníkóró pẹ̀lú àpapọ̀ òògùn jẹjẹrẹ àti òògùn kòkòrò mìíràn.

DEFINITION: feeling of grief after losing someone or something of value.
TRANSLATION: nígbà tí a bá pàdánù ènìyàn tàbí nǹkan tí ó ní iye.

DEFINITION: oily liquid applied to moving parts of a mechanism in order to reduce friction, heat, or wear, or to surfaces in close contact to prevent them from adhering to one another.
TRANSLATION: ohun tí ó máa n mú nǹkan yọ̀ tàbí dẹ́kun lílẹ̀pọ̀.

DEFINITION: relating to or constituting the loins or the vertebrae between the thoracic vertebrae and the sacrum region.
TRANSLATION: Eegun ìbàdí Ajẹmọ́ ìbàdí. Ó wà láàrin`okè ara àti ìsàlè ̣ rè ̣.

DEFINITION: puncture A procedure in which fluid from the subarachnoid space in the lumbar region is tapped for examination. Also known as spinal tap.
TRANSLATION: ̣pá è ̣yìn Ìgbéṣẹ̀ fífa oje ò ̣pá è ̣yìn fún àyẹ̀wò.

DEFINITION: air-breathing vertebrate animals, either of the paired spongy respiratory organs, situated inside the rib cage,
TRANSLATION: ìmísíta afẹ́fẹ́ ẹranko ọlọpa-ẹ̀hìn méjì tí ó wà. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 174 that transfer oxygen into the blood and remove carbon dioxide from it.

DEFINITION: fluid present within the vessels of the lymphatic system. It consists of fluid that bathes the tissues, which is derived from the blood and is drained by the lymphatic vessels. It passes through a series of filter lymph nodes and is ultimately returned to the bloodstream via the thoracic duct. Omi-ara
TRANSLATION: wà ní àyíká àwọn òpó jẹjẹrẹ omi-ara. Ó ní oje tí ó n bo ìmọ̀lára tí a n rí nínú ẹ̀jẹ̀, tí ó rẹ̀ nínú òpó jẹjẹrẹ omi-ara.

DEFINITION: nodes Small, bean-sized organs of the immune system distributed widely throughout the body. Lymph fluid is filtered through the lymph nodes in which all types of lymphocytes take up temporary residence. Antigens that enter the body find their way into lymph or blood and are filtered out by the lymph nodes or spleen respectively, for attack by the immune system.
TRANSLATION: omi-ara Ètò àjẹsára kékeré tí a n pín kákìri gbogbo ara. Oje omi-ara máa n fọ́n sínú ẹ̀wọ́n omi-ara ní èyí tí ọlọnú jẹjẹrẹ omi-ara gbàyè fún ara wọn. Àjèjì adáralóró tí ó n wọ inú omi- ara tàbí ẹ̀jẹ̀ tí ó sì fọ́n wọ inú ẹ̀wọ́n omi-ara tàbí fún àtakò sí ètò àjẹsára.

DEFINITION: Associated Virus (LAV) This was the former name given to HIV.
TRANSLATION: ni orukọ ti a fún KASA tẹ́lẹ̀.

DEFINITION: Syndrome (LAS) Generalized lymphadenopathy is an early sign of infection with HIV.
TRANSLATION: pẹ́tẹ́lẹ́. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 175

DEFINITION: vessels A body-wide network of channels similar to the blood vessels that transport lymph to the immune organs and into the bloodstream.
TRANSLATION: ka ara tí ó jẹ́ ìṣọ̀n ẹ̀jẹ̀ ajẹmọ́ òpó ìpínjẹ̀ tí ó n gbé omi-ara sí àjẹsára ara àti sí inú ẹ̀jẹ̀.

DEFINITION: organs Include tonsils, adenoids, lymph nodes, spleen and other tissues. Act as the body's filtering system, trapping invaders (i.e. foreign particles from bacteria, viruses, etc.) and presenting them to squadrons of immune cells that congregate there. Within these lymphoid tissues, immune activity is concentrated in regions called germinal centres, where the thread-like tentacles of follicular dendritic cells (FDCs) form networks that trap invaders.
TRANSLATION: omi- ara Ohun ìfọ́n bí i ẹ̀wọ́n omi-ara, ọlọnú àti àwọn ìmọ̀lára àti àjèjì adáralóró bí i bateria, kòkòrò ṣe sínú àjẹsára hóró.

DEFINITION: tissue The part of the body's immune system that is important for the immune response. It occurs as discrete organs in the form of the lymph nodes, tonsils, thymus, and spleen, and also as diffuse groups of cells not separated from surrounding tissues.
TRANSLATION: omi-ara Ẹ̀ yà ètò àjẹsára tí ó wólù fún ìdáhùn àjẹsára. Ó wà bí i ẹ̀yà ara tí ó dáwà, ní ìrísí ẹ̀wọ́n omi- ara àti ọlọnú àti ìdàpọ̀ hóró láì yapa ní agbèègbè ìmọ̀lára.

DEFINITION: Products of the lymphatic cells that stimulate the production of disease-
TRANSLATION: ara Èyí ni èròjà jẹjẹrẹ hóró omi- ara tí ó lọ́wọ́ nínú ìpèsè ohun ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 176 fighting agents and the activities of other lymphatic cells. Among the lymphokines are gamma interferon and interleukin-2. tí n bá ààrùn jà àti àwọn iṣẹ́ hóró omi-ara mìíràn.

DEFINITION: malignant tumor of the lymphoid tissue. The major types of lymphoma are Hodgkin’s disease and non- Hodgkin’s lymphomas.
TRANSLATION: Jẹjẹrẹ omi-ara jẹ́ èyà àrídìmú omi-ara ti ààrùn Hodgkin àti aláìní jẹjẹrẹ omi-ara.

DEFINITION: large immune cell that devours invading pathogens and other intruders. Stimulates other immune cells by presenting them with small pieces of the invader. Macrophages can harbour large quantities of HIV without being killed, acting as reservoirs of the virus.
TRANSLATION: Hóró àjẹsára nlá tí ó n pa àwọn ohun afàìsàn àti àwọn olùfihàn. Ìlọ́wọ́ sí àwọn hóró àjẹsára mìíràn nípa síṣe ìfihàn wọn. Olú hóró àjẹsára lè fi àyè gba ìwọ̀n KASA nlá ní àìṣe pé ó pá a.

DEFINITION: Resonance Imaging (MRI) Medical imaging that uses radio frequency radiation as its source. MRI is a noninvasive diagnostic technique that can provide information on the form and function of internal tissues and organs of the body.
TRANSLATION: àgó ̣ ara Ẹ̀rọ tí ó n pèsè ìmò ̣ nípa irufé ̣ àti is ̣é ̣ àwo ̣n ìs ̣ù ara àti àwo ̣n è ̣yà ara.

DEFINITION: oxygen level This is an act of stabilizing respiration system.
TRANSLATION: eemi Èyí ní ọ̀nà ìdúrósinsin ètò ti atẹ́gùn. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 177

DEFINITION: Maize, known in some English- speaking countries as corn, and in the United Kingdom as sweetcorn, is a large grain plant domesticated by indigenous peoples in Mesoamerica in prehistoric times.
TRANSLATION: ẹ̀ya ohun-ọgb̀ìn tí àwọn kan npè ní erín.

DEFINITION: Histocompatibility Complex (MHC) The major histocompatibility complex (MHC) is a set of cell surface proteins essential for the acquired immune system to recognize foreign molecules in vertebrates.
TRANSLATION: Ètò ìbámu iṣan tí ó n ṣàfihàn kòkòrò àjèjì nínú ara.

DEFINITION: syndrome Decreased intestinal absorption resulting in loss of appetite, muscle pain and weight loss.
TRANSLATION: sára Àìsàn àilègbé oúnjẹ tí ó n yọrí sí àìlèjẹun, iṣan ríro àti pípàdánù ìwọ̀n.

DEFINITION: generalized, non-specific feeling of discomfort.
TRANSLATION: ònfà ìnira.

DEFINITION: infectious disease caused by a parasite that is transmitted by the bite of infected mosquitoes. Common in tropical countries, the disease is characterized by recurring chills and fever.
TRANSLATION: tí a kó láti ìta ẹ̀fọn. A máa fa ibà àti otútù.

DEFINITION: smears The mainstay of malaria diagnosis has been the microscopic examination of blood, utilizing blood films. Although blood is the sample most frequently
TRANSLATION: Fiimu ibà Àtìlẹ́yìn ìdámọ̀ àìsàn ibà ni àyẹ̀wò ẹ̀rọ ẹ̀jẹ̀ nípa lílo fímù ẹ̀jẹ̀ní a fí n ṣe ìdámọ̀ àìsàn, ṣùgbọ́n, ìtọ̀ àti itọ́ ni ó jẹ́ ọ̀nà ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 178 used to make a diagnosis, both saliva and urine have been investigated as alternative less invasive specimens. More recently, modern techniques utilizing antigen tests or polymerase chain reaction have been discovered, though these are not widely implemented in malaria endemic regions. mìíràn fún ṣiṣe àyẹ̀wò tí kò gunpá.

DEFINITION: condom Male condoms are condoms men wear on the penis to protect them from STD during sexual intercourse.
TRANSLATION: ìdáàbòbò ọkùnrin Èyí ni rọ́ọ́bà tí àwọn ọkùnrin máa n wọ̀ sórí okó ní ọ̀nà àti dènà ààrùn ìbálòpọ̀.

DEFINITION: lack of healthy foods in the diet, or an excessive intake of unhealthy foods, leading to physical harm.
TRANSLATION: purotéénì Àìrí oúnjẹ tí ó ní purotéénì jẹ ní èyí tí ó léwu fún ara.

DEFINITION: of Ebola/AIDS These are ways and manner by which Ebola/AIDS are managed.
TRANSLATION: Ebola Èyí ni ipò àti ọ̀nà tí a n gbà ṣe àbójútó Ebola àti ààrùn ìṣọdọ̀lẹ àjẹsara.

DEFINITION: is the state of weakening and wasting away of the body which occurs most often in children and infants.
TRANSLATION: Èyí ní ipò àìlágbára àti rírù ní ara ọmọdé àti ọmọ ọwọ́.

DEFINITION: hemorrhagic fever Marburg hemorrhagic fever is a rare, severe type of hemorrhagic fever which affects both humans and non- human primates. Caused by a genetically unique zoonotic (that is, animal-borne) RNA virus of the
TRANSLATION: marburg Ibà Marburg jé ̣ ibà líle, ajẹmé ̣jè ̣, tó s ̣ò ̣wó ̣n ̣tó mán n s ̣e ènìyàn àte ̣ranko. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 179 filovirus family, its recognition led to the creation of this virus family.

DEFINITION: cell A granulocyte found in tissue. The contents of the mast cells, along with those of basophils, are responsible for the symptoms of allergy.
TRANSLATION: funfun alámì ńlá Ẹ̀ yà hóró ẹ̀jẹ̀ funfun tí ó wà nínú ìmọ̀lára. Ohun tí hóró ẹ̀jẹ̀ funfun alámì ńlá pẹ̀lú hóró basofi ni láti wà fún ìdámọ̀ àìsàn.

DEFINITION: is an act of reaching orgasm by manual stimulation. It is seen as a release for sexual tensions that a teenager feels strongly and frequently. It is practically of no physical harm.
TRANSLATION: dída omira tí ó wó ̣pò ̣ láàárín àwo ̣n ò ̣dó ̣ tí wó ̣n sì máa ń ṣe fún ìtura. Kò ní ìpalára rárá.
Maternal Pertaining to the mother. Ajẹmọ́ ìyá/ Ìṣabiamọ Ajẹmọ́ ìyá tàbí `iṣabiamọ.

DEFINITION: mortality The number of deaths due to complications of pregnancy, childbirth, and the puerperium expressed as a proportion of all births (i.e. including stillbirths).
TRANSLATION: ìṣabiamọ Èyí ni iye ikú tí ó wà láti ipaṣẹ̀ ìnira/ ìsoro oyún, ọmọ bíbí àti àkópọ̀ iye gbogbo ìbí.

DEFINITION: Newborn and Child Health (MNCH) The maternal newborn and child health programme (MNCH2) is a country led programme which aims to reduce maternal and child mortality in Northern Nigeria and it is funded by the Department for International Development (DFID).
TRANSLATION: jé ̣ ètò tí orílẹ̀-èdè n darí láti ṣe àdínkù ikú ìyá àti ọmọ ní Àríwá Nàìjíríà, tí àwọn DFID ṣe agbátẹrù rè ̣. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 180

DEFINITION: Concentration (Cmax) A pharmacokinetic measure used to determine drug dosing. Cmax is the highest concentration of a drug in the blood, cerebrospinal fluid, or target organ after a dose is given.
TRANSLATION: nínú ẹ̀jẹ̀ Ẹ̀ kún òdiwọ̀n òògùn lílò. Ẹ̀ kun òògùn nínú ẹ̀jẹ̀, oje ọpọlọ àti ọ̀pá ẹ̀yìn tàbí asojú ara nígbà a bá ti fún wa ní òògùn.

DEFINITION: arithmetic average or the sum of all the values divided by the number of values.
TRANSLATION: iye gbogbo ohun tí a pín.

DEFINITION: middle number in a sequence of numbers, taken as the average of the two middle numbers when the sequence has an even number of numbers (e.g. 4 is the median of 1, 3, 4, 8, 9).
TRANSLATION: Agbedeméjì Agbedeméjì iye nọ́mbà, yíyọ àbọ̀ nínú ọ̀kan lára nọ́mbà ni agbedeméjì nígbà tí ìṣirò bá ní nọ́mbà tó dọ́gba.

DEFINITION: laboratory A place where research and testing is carried out.
TRANSLATION: ìṣègùn Gbọ̀ngàn ìṣèwàdìí ajẹmọ́ ìṣègùn.

DEFINITION: referral In medicine, referral is the transfer of care for a patient from one clinician to another. Tertiary care is usually done by referral from primary or secondary medical care personnel.
TRANSLATION: Nípa ti ìlera, ó jẹ́ ìlànà gbígbé aláìsàn láti ibìkan sí ibòmíràn. Ìtọ́jú gíga ní a sábà máa n lò nípa ìfihàn láti ìbẹ̀rẹ̀ sí ìpèlè kejì ìtọ́jú ajẹmọ́lera láti ọ̀dọ oníṣègùn mìíràn.

DEFINITION: visor These are glasses/transparent shields used to cover the eyes during any surgical operation.
TRANSLATION: ni awo ife abẹ tí a n lò fi bo ojú ní àsìkò iṣẹ́ abẹ. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 181

DEFINITION: cells A subset of T lymphocytes that have been exposed to specific antigens and can then proliferate (i.e. reproduce) rapidly on subsequent immune system encounters with the same antigen.
TRANSLATION: hóró omi ìrántí tí ó faragbá àjèjì adálóró, kí i o sì jẹ́ àfikún àwọn ètò àjẹsára tí ó ní ìṣòro kannáà.

DEFINITION: disease of the brain and spinal column that may be either a mild illness caused by a virus or a more severe, usually life-threatening, illness caused by a bacteria. Symptoms may include: fever, headache, vomiting, malaise (yucky or blah feeling), and stiff neck.
TRANSLATION: tàbí ọ̀pá ẹ̀yìn tí ó lè jẹ́ àìsàn tí ó mọ nìwọ̀nba tí kòkòrò sokùnfà rẹ̀ tàbí èyí tí ó gbóna girigiri tí ó jẹ́ èyí tí ó mú ewu ìmú-ẹ̀mí lọ dáni tí batéríà lè sokùnfà rẹ̀: ààmì àìsàn yìí ni ibà, orí-fífọ́, èébì bíbì àti ọrùn líle pandi.

DEFINITION: discharge of blood and tissue from the uterus at the end of the female reproductive cycle.
TRANSLATION: ẹ̀jẹ̀ àti ìmọ̀lára láti ojú ara obìnrin lópin ìyípo ìsobìnrin.

DEFINITION: problem A disorder involving the hormone- regulated build-up and shedding of the inner lining of the human uterus in mature females.
TRANSLATION: Ṣégeṣège ẹ̀jẹ̀, èyí tí ó jẹ́ nǹkan oṣù obìnrin tí kò lọ déédé.

DEFINITION: (ribonucleic acid) that carries the genetic code for a particular protein from the nuclear DNA (i.e. the DNA in the cell's nucleus) to a ribosome in the cytoplasm and acts as a template, or pattern, for the formation of that protein.
TRANSLATION: jẹ́ àkójọ jinni fún purotéénì kan láti ara DNA nínú hóró ìmọ̀lára. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 182

DEFINITION: sum of the processes by which a particular substance is handled (as by assimilation and incorporation or by detoxification and excretion) in the living body.
TRANSLATION: i a ṣe n kápá iye èròjà kan nínú ara.

DEFINITION: substance produced by metabolism or by a metabolic process.
TRANSLATION: ohun èròjà tí ìyòrò tàbí ìgbéṣẹ̀ ìyòrò n pèsè.

DEFINITION: Transfer of a disease-producing agent (e.g. cancer cells or bacteria) from an original site of disease to another part of the body with the development of a similar lesion in the new location (e.g. spread of cancer from an original site to other sites in the body).
TRANSLATION: Gbígbé aṣojú ìpèsè ààrùn bí jẹjẹrẹ hóró tàbí batéríà láti ibi ìwáṣẹ̀ ààrùn sí apá ẹ̀yà ara mìíràn pẹ̀lú ìdàgbàsókè ọgbẹ́ kannáà ní ibòmìíràn nínú ara.

DEFINITION: (drugs for substitution treatment) Methadone is an opioid medication. An opioid is sometimes called a narcotic. Methadone reduces withdrawal symptoms in people addicted to heroin or other narcotic drugs without causing the “high” associated with the drug addiction.
TRANSLATION: methadone Òògùn methadone jẹ́ òògùn tí ó máa n ṣe àdínkù bá àìsàn nínú ara àwọn ènìyàn tí kò ṣe aláìní òògùn olóró tàbí ní ìpalára sí wọn.

DEFINITION: Microscopic living organisms, including bacteria, protozoa and fungi. Kòkòrò
TRANSLATION: àyẹ̀wò fi wo àwọn bateria, potosua àti osunwuuru.

DEFINITION: agent (e.g. a chemical or antibiotic) that destroys microbes. Apa kòkòrò
TRANSLATION: sójà tí ó n pa kòkòrò àìfojúrí. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 183

DEFINITION: ted Surrounded by a thin layer of protection. A means of protecting a drug or vaccine from rapid breakdown.
TRANSLATION: tínrín tí o n ṣe àbò. Ó jẹ́ ọ̀nà bíbo òògùn tàbí àjẹsára lọ́wọ́ dídẹnukọlẹ̀.

DEFINITION: examination Microscopic examination is a rapid screening method for the detection of yeast and bacteria.
TRANSLATION: awobíntín Èyí jẹ́ abẹ ẹ̀rọ fún àyẹ̀wò láti mọ ìwúkàrà àti gbateria.

DEFINITION: Disease resulting from infection with a protozoal pathogen from the Microsporida order.
TRANSLATION: tí ó wá láti ara ìkóràn potosua.

DEFINITION: Somebody trained to help deliver babies and offer support and advice to pregnant women.
TRANSLATION: ó kọ́ṣẹ́ nípa ìgbẹ̀bí fún ọmọ, tí ó sì tún jẹ́ olùgbani- nímọ̀ràn fún àwọn aláboyún.

DEFINITION: anaemia Mild anaemia is defined as hemoglobin levels between 10 g/dL and 12 g/dL.
TRANSLATION: Aìtó ẹ̀jẹ̀ ìwọ̀nba ní ipò hóró ẹ̀jẹ̀ agbẹ̀mí láàárin 10g/dL àti 12g/dL.

DEFINITION: Concentration (Cmin) A pharmacokinetic measure used to determine drug dosing. Cmin is the lowest concentration of a drug in the blood, cerebrospinal fluid, or target organ after a dose is given.
TRANSLATION: ẹ̀jẹ̀ Ìkéréjù òdiwọ̀n òògùn lílò. Ìkéréjù òògùn nínú ẹ̀jẹ̀, oje ọpọlọ àti ọ̀pá ẹ̀yìn tàbí asojú ara nígbà a bá ti fún wa ní òògùn.

DEFINITION: feeding This is combining breastfeeding and bottle feeding.
TRANSLATION: oúnjẹ Ìdàpọ̀ ọyàn àti oúnjẹ àpòfó ̣mo.

DEFINITION: strain of HIV used in vaccine development.
TRANSLATION: Ìgara KASA tí a n lò fún ìdàgbàsókè àjẹsára. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 184

DEFINITION: departure, subjective or objective, from a state of physiological or psychological well-being. In this sense sickness, illness and morbid condition are similarly defined and synonymous. Morbidity can be measured in terms of 3 units: (a) persons who were ill; (b) the illnesses (periods or spells of illness) that these persons experienced; (c) the duration (days, weeks, etc.) of these illnesses.
TRANSLATION: ègbè tàbí aláìsègbè nínú ìfòyemọ̀ tàbí isesí wíwà ní àlàáfíà. Nínú irú ipò yìí, àìsàn, ààrùn àti àárẹ̀ máa ń jọra.

DEFINITION: assemble, prepare, or put into active service.
TRANSLATION: múra tàbí ọ̀nà ìmúṣẹ́ṣe.

DEFINITION: anaemia Blood volume deficiency which is not life-threatening but bad enough to impair daily activities of living. In humans, haemoglobin levels between 7 and 10 g/dL.
TRANSLATION: dé Àìtó è ̣jè ̣ tí kò mé ̣mìí dání ṣùgbó ̣n tí ó le fa agara ojoojúmó ̣.

DEFINITION: contagiosum A disease of the skin and mucous membranes caused by a poxvirus. It is characterized by scattered flesh-toned white papules. The disease most frequently occurs in children and adults with impaired immune response. It is transmitted from person to person by direct or indirect contact and lasts up to three years.
TRANSLATION: Ààrùn ara àti ìwọ̀ àṣekún tí ó wá láti ara kòkòrò. Ó máa n wá lemọ́lemọ́ ní ara ọmọdé àti àgbàlagba. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 185

DEFINITION: medium-sized primate belonging to a group including baboons, marmosets, capuchins, macaques, guenons, and tamarins, but excluding apes, lemurs, and tarsiers. Native to tropical regions.
TRANSLATION: kan lára àwọn ẹ̀dà onírunlára tí ó jẹ́ akẹgbẹ́ ìnàkí ṣùgbọ́n, ó yàtọ̀ sí ìnàkí.

DEFINITION: antibodies Antibodies produced by a hybridoma or antibody-producing cell source for a specific antigen. Monoclonal antibodies are useful as a tool for identifying specific protein molecules.
TRANSLATION: Àwọn sójà tí a n pèsè láti ara ohun àdàmọ̀dì àwọn hòrò tàbí hóró tí n pèsè sójà ara tí ó jẹ́ orísun àjèjì adáralóró kan pàtó. A tún máa n fi mọ mólékù purotéénì kan pàtó.

DEFINITION: large white blood cell that ingests microbes or other cells and foreign particles. When a monocyte enters tissues, it develops into a macrophage.
TRANSLATION: ẹ̀jẹ̀ funfun ńlá Hóró ẹ̀jẹ̀ funfun ńlá máa n fọ́ kòkòrò àìfojúrí tàbí àwọn hóró mìíràn sí ohun àjèjì. Nígbà tí hóró ẹ̀jẹ̀ funfun ńlá bá wọ inú àwọn ìmọ̀lára, a máa dàgbà di olú hóró àjẹsára.

DEFINITION: vaccine A vaccine that is specific for only one antigen.
TRANSLATION: Àjẹsára tí ó wà fún àjèjì adáralóró kan pàtó.

DEFINITION: analgesic and narcotic drug obtained from opium and used medicinally to relieve pain.
TRANSLATION: adínrorakù Òògùn tí ó n dín ìrora kù, tí a rí lára òògùn olóró, tí a n ló bí i òògùn láti dín ìrora kù.

DEFINITION: incidence of death in the population in a given period.
TRANSLATION: ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ ikú ní iye ìlú fún àkókò kan. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 186

DEFINITION: measure This is a number of deaths within a given period of time.
TRANSLATION: Ìṣẹ̀sẹ̀lẹ̀

DEFINITION: bite Mosquito bite is the itchy bumps that appear after mosquitoes use their mouthparts to puncture the skin and feed on blood.
TRANSLATION: tí ó lé nígbà tí ẹ̀fọn bá tani ní ara, tí a yun ṣùgbọ́n tí ó sẹ̀jẹ̀.

DEFINITION: Populations (MARPs) Populations most-at-risk (MARP) for becoming infected with HIV include injection drug users, sex workers and their clients, men who have sex with men, and prisoners. MARPs are considered at risk for HIV due to behaviours and practices that heighten their vulnerability to the virus.
TRANSLATION: adojúkọ ewu Ọ̀ pọ̀ ènìyàn adojúkọ ewu ni àwọn tí wọ́n lè tètè kó KASA lára wọn ni àwọn alòògùn pẹ̀lu-abẹ́rẹ́, olówò-nàbì àti oní- bàárà wọn, ọkùnrin tí ń ba ọkùnrin lò pọ̀ àti ẹlẹ́wọ̀n. Ọ̀ pọ̀ ènìyàn adojúkọ ewu ni wọ́n dojú kọ ewu KASA nítorí ìwùwàsí àti ìsesí wọn, òun ló sì mú wọ́n dójú kọ ewu kòkòrò náà.

DEFINITION: of unknown status Mothers who are unaware of their HIV status.
TRANSLATION: KASA Àwo ̣n ìyá aláìmọ́ ipò KASA ara awọn.

DEFINITION: and voice organ in people and animals.
TRANSLATION: ara ti ènìyàn àti ẹranko n gbá jẹun, tí wó ̣n sì fi n sò ̣rò ̣.

DEFINITION: sores Mouth sores, including canker sores, are minor irritations that usually disappear after a week or two.
TRANSLATION: àti ìbẹ́ ẹnu jẹ́ àwọn ìríra tí ó n parẹ́ lẹ́yìn ọ̀ṣẹ̀ kan tàbí méjì.

DEFINITION: Anything that concerns or pertains to mucous membranes and the skin (e.g. mouth, vagina, lips, anal area).
TRANSLATION: Ohunkóhun tí ó jẹ mọ́ awọ inú àti ara bí i ẹnu, òbò, ètè àti àwọn oju ihò. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 187

DEFINITION: immunity Resistance to infection across the mucous membranes. Dependent on immune cells and antibodies present in the lining of the urogenital tract, gastrointestinal tract and other parts of the body exposed to the outside world.
TRANSLATION: Àtakò sí ìkóràn sí awọ inú. Àwọn ohun wọ̀nyìí daralé hóró àjẹsára àti sójà tí ó wà ní ilé ìbísí àti ilé ìtọ̀, t’inú àtikùn àti àwọn ẹ̀yà ara tó hàn síta.

DEFINITION: membrane A moist layer of tissue that lines body cavities or passages that have an opening to the external world (e.g. the lining of the mouth, nostrils or vagina).
TRANSLATION: fẹ́lẹ́ tí ìmọ̀lára tí ó wà ní ihò ara tàbí àwọn òpó tí ó ṣí ṣíta.

DEFINITION: resistant TB (MDR-TB) Multi-drug-resistant tuberculosis (MDR-TB, also known as Vank's disease) is a form of TB infection caused by bacteria that are resistant to treatment with at least two of the most powerful first-line anti-TB drugs, isoniazid (INH) and rifampicin (RMP).
TRANSLATION: Èyí ni ikó ̣fe tí bateríà tó fà á n já àwo ̣n òògùn ikó ̣fe tó lágbára jùlo ̣.

DEFINITION: Programme (MAP) This programme was implemented in three stages. The first stage would be an “emergency response,” which entails putting in place essential structures, policies, and capacity; working with communities in delivering services; better understanding implementation
TRANSLATION: yìí wà fún ìdáhùn pàjáwìrì, ìdènà, ìtọ́jú fún KASA àti ààrùn ìṣọdọ̀lẹ àjẹsára ní Afrika. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 188 dynamics; and generally learning by doing. Stage two would scale up and mainstream prevention, treatment, and care, based on evidence of effective innovation as outlined in the World Bank’s Commitment to HIV/AIDS in Africa. Stage three would focus on areas or groups where the spread of the disease continued.
Multiple partners More than two sexually related friends. Ọ̀ pọ̀ oníbàálòpọ̀ Ènìyàn tí ó ní ọ̀rẹ́ alábásùn púpọ̀.

DEFINITION: pain Muscle pain is most often related to tension, overuse, or muscle injury from exercise or physically demanding work.
TRANSLATION: jẹ́mọ́ àbájáde ohun ìjayà, àlòpa, tàbí èyí tí ó wá láti ara eré ìdárayá.

DEFINITION: is a change in the genetic material *DNA* of a cell, or the change this causes in a characteristic of the individual, which is not caused by normal genetic processes.
TRANSLATION: ni ìyípadà èròjà jinni nínú hóró, kí i ó yí àwọn nǹkan padà nínú ènìyàn tí kìí ṣe ìbámu ti ìbí.

DEFINITION: bacterium of the genus Myco- bacterium or a closely related genus.
TRANSLATION: Batéríà tí ẹyọ-iran tàbí ajẹmọ́ ẹyọ-iran.

DEFINITION: Avium Complex (MAC) A bacterial infection that can be localized (limited to a specific organ or area of the body) or disseminated throughout the body. It is a life- threatening disease, although new therapies offer promise for both
TRANSLATION: batéríà tí ó wà fún agbèègbe kan nínú ara tàbí tí a pín kákiri ara. Ó jẹ́ ààrùn amẹ́ẹ̀mí dání ṣùgbọ́n ìlànà tuntun fún wa ní ìrètí ò ̣tun fún ìdènà àti ìtọ́jú tó péye. Ààrùn ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 189 prevention and treatment. MAC disease is extremely rare in people who are not infected with HIV. yìí kò wọ́pọ̀ sí àwọn tí ó n gbé pẹ̀lú KASA.

DEFINITION: pertaining to, or caused by mycoplasmas.
TRANSLATION: Makopílásímà Ajẹmọ́, tàbí èyí tí ó n fa makopílásímà
Mycosis Any disease caused by a fungus. Àìsàn ọ̀súnwúrú Ònfà osunwuuru.

DEFINITION: substance that sheathes nerve cells, acting as an electric insulator that facilitates the conduction of nerve impulses.
TRANSLATION: ohun èròjà alápò fẹ́lẹ́fẹ́lẹ́ ìmọ̀lára hóró tí ó n ṣe iṣẹ́ ẹ̀yẹ́-iná afọ̀nàhàn sí agbára ìmọ̀lára.

DEFINITION: Impairment of the blood cell- producing function of the bone marrow.
TRANSLATION: Àwọn ohun àìpéye ẹ̀jẹ̀ tí ó n pèsè mùndùnmúndùn eegun.
Myelotoxic Destructive to bone marrow. Apa mùndùn- múndùn Apa mùndùnmúndùn eegun.

DEFINITION: Agency for the Control of AIDS (NACA) A Nigerian government organization set up to coordinate intersectoral collaboration for limiting the HIV/AIDS epidemic. It was initially known as the National Action Committee on AIDS (NACA).
TRANSLATION: ìjo ̣ba Nàìjíríà tí ó wà fún kòkárí ètò àwo ̣n e ̣gbé ̣ tó n dènà àjàkálè ̣ KASA àti ààrùn ìso ̣dò ̣le ̣ àje ̣sára.

DEFINITION: and Reproductive This is a nationally representative survey of 10,000 respondents
TRANSLATION: NARHS Àjọ yìí máa n pèsè ìmọ̀ àti ìhùwàsí kíkún nípa ìfitóniétí ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS

DEFINITION: Surveys (NARHS) consisting of 5128 women aged 15-49 years and 4962 men aged 15-64 years. The objective was to provide information on levels of HIV preventive knowledge and behaviour, other sexually transmitted diseaeses, HIV voluntary counselling and testing, stigma and discrimination against people living with HIV/AIDS, maternal health, sexual behaviour, and reproductive health issues including family planning, female circumcision, gender violence and communication for behaviour change.
TRANSLATION: ààrùn ìbálòpọ̀, pẹ̀lú ìgbaniníyànjú àti àyẹ̀wò ìfinúfídọ̀ nípa KASA lòdì sí àbùkù tí ó nńkan àwọn tó n gbé pẹ̀lú ààrùn ìṣọdọ̀lẹ àjẹsára.

DEFINITION: and STI Control Programme (NASCP) The National AIDS and STI Control Programme was established in 1987 to spearhead the Ministry of Health’s interventions on the fight against HIV/AIDS.
TRANSLATION: NASCP A gbé ẹ̀ka yìí kalẹ̀ ní 1987 tí iléeṣẹ́ ètò ìlera n dásí láti kojú KASA àti ààrùn ìṣọdọ̀lẹ àjẹsára.

DEFINITION: Clearing House Information centre provided by Centres for Disease Prevention and Control.
TRANSLATION: CDC Ibùdó ìfitónilétí nípa ẹ̀ka tí ó n se ìdarí àti ìdékun ààrùn.

DEFINITION: Spending Assessment (NASA) NASA is a tool within the national monitoring and evaluation framework and is a recommended measurement tool to track HIV spending at country level to report to GARPR indicator.
TRANSLATION: tó n ṣe àbójúwò fún àyẹ̀wò nínáwó lórí KASA ní orílè-èdè. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 191

DEFINITION: Blood Transfusion Service (NBTS) NBTS was established to provide adequate provision and equitable distribution of safe donor blood throughout Nigeria in order to eliminate the hazards associated with a decentralized, hospital-based and unregulated blood transfusion services.
TRANSLATION: A dá ẹ̀ka yìí sílẹ̀ láti máa pín ẹ̀jẹ̀ ní ọ̀pọ̀ yanturu ní orílẹ̀-èdè láti dẹ́kun kòsíkòsí ẹ̀jẹ̀ nigbà gbogbo.

DEFINITION: Cancer Institute (NCI) An NIH institute with the overall mission of conducting and supporting research, training and disseminating health information with respect to the causes, diagnosis and treatment of cancer. NCI also performs these functions for HIV infections and associated diseases.
TRANSLATION: Ilé-iṣé ̣ tó wà fún agbátẹrù fún ìwádìí àti ìdánilẹ̀ẹ́kọ́ nípa ìfitónilétí nípa ìlera adálórí ìdámọ́ àìsàn àti ìtọ́jú jẹjẹrẹ.

DEFINITION: Ebola Response Centre (NERC) The Sierra Leone government’s national agency for coordinating the fight against the Ebola epidemic.
TRANSLATION: orílẹ̀-èdè Sàró fún ìṣàkóso àjàkálè ààrùn Ebola.

DEFINITION: Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases (NIAID) An NIH institute that conducts and supports research to study the causes of allergic, immunologic and infec- tious diseases, and to develop better means of preventing, diagnosing and treating illnesses. NIAID is responsible for the federally funded, national basic research programme in AIDS.
TRANSLATION: NIAID Ilé-iṣé ̣ tí ó wà fún agbátẹrù fún ìwádìí àti ẹ̀kọ́ nípa ìdí àwọn ààrùn ìkóràn àti láti mọ ọ̀nà tí a n gbà láti dènà, ṣe ìdàmọ̀ àìsàn àti ìtọ́jú àwọn ààrùn gbogbo. Ilé-iṣé ̣ NIAID máa n ṣe agbátẹrù ètò ìwádìí nípa ààrùn ìṣọdọ̀lẹ àjẹsára. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 192

DEFINITION: Institute of Child Health and Human Development (NICHD) An NIH institute that conducts and supports research on the reproductive, developmental and behavioural processes that determine the health of children, adults, families and populations. Thus, NICHD supports clinical research related to the transmission of HIV from infected mothers to their offspring, the progression of disease in HIV-infected infants and children, and the testing of potential therapies and preventatives for this population.
TRANSLATION: NICHD Ilé-iṣé ̣ tí ó wà fún agbátẹrù fún ìwádìí àti ẹ̀kọ́ ìwádìí nípa ìbísí, ìgbòrò àti ìhùwàsí mímọ ìlera ọmọdé, àgbàlagbà, ẹbí àti iye àwọn ènìyàn ní ìlú. Ilé-iṣé ̣ NICHD máa n ṣe agbátẹrù ètò ìwádìí nípa ìkóràn KASA láti ara ìyá sí àwọn ọmọ.

DEFINITION: Institutes of Health (NIH) A multi-institute agency of the Public Health Service (USA), NIH is the federal focal point for health research. It conducts research in its own laboratories and supports research in universities, medical schools, hospitals and research institutions throughout the country and abroad.
TRANSLATION: NIH máa n ṣe agbátẹrù ètò ìwádìí ní yàrá àyẹ̀wò àti àtìlẹ́yìn fún àwọn ilé ẹ̀kọ́ gíga, ilé ẹ̀kọ́ ìṣègùn, ilé-ìwòsàn àti àwọn ẹka tí wọn n ṣe ìwádìí ní orílẹ̀-èdè àti òkè-òkun.

DEFINITION: Library of Medicine (NLM) An NIH institute, NLM is one of three US national libraries. It is the world's largest research library in a single scientific and professional field (i.e. medicine). NLM provides (among others) electronic and print information services relating to
TRANSLATION: Ọ̀ kan lára yàrá ìkàwé mẹ́ta ní orílẹ̀ àgbáyé tí ó n ṣe ìwádìí nípa ìmọ̀-ìjìnlẹ̀. Wọ́n n pèsè iṣẹ́ nípa KASA àti ààrùn ìṣọdọ̀lẹ àjgbsára. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 193 HIV/AIDS, including AIDSLINE, AIDSTRIALS, AIDSDRUGS and the AIDS Bibliography.

DEFINITION: Prevention Information Network (CDC- NPIN) Disseminates information on HIV/AIDS, viral hepatitis, other sexually transmitted diseases, and tuberculosis (TB). Information is available via the Web, phone, e-mail, and postal mail.
TRANSLATION: Ìfọ́nká ìfotónilétí nípa KASA àti ààrùn ìsọdọ̀lẹ àjẹsára, kòkòrò jẹ̀dọ̀jẹ̀dọ̀, ààrùn ìbálòpọ̀ àti ikọ́-ife. Ifitónilétí yìí lè jẹ́ nípa ayélujára, fóónù àti ìfìwéránṣẹ́.

DEFINITION: security The protection of a nation from attack or other danger by maintaining adequate armed forces and guarding state secrets.
TRANSLATION: tí orílẹ̀-èdè rí gbà lòdì sí ìdojúkọ tàbí ewu nípa ríra nǹkan ìjà ogun fún wọn àti pípa àṣírí ìlú mọ́.

DEFINITION: history study Study of the natural development of something (such as an organism or a disease) over a period of time.
TRANSLATION: àdámọ́ Ẹ̀ kọ́ nípa ìdàgbàsókè àdámọ́ bíi ènìyàn tàbí àrùn fún ìgbà kan.

DEFINITION: killer cells A type of lymphocyte that does not carry the markers to be B cells or T cells. Like cytotoxic T cells, they attack and kill tumor cells and protect against a wide variety of infectious microbes. They are "natural" killers because they do not need additional stimulation or need to recognize a specific antigen in order to attack and kill. Persons with immunodeficiences
TRANSLATION: Ẹ̀ yà jẹjẹrẹ omi-ara tí ó n gbé àmì yálà hóró B tàbí T. Bí i aporó òògùn hóró T, wọn a máa tako ọ̀nà àti pa hóró jẹjẹrẹ, kí i ó sì máa dábòòbò ààrùn kòkòrò àìfojúrí. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 194 such as those caused by HIV infection have a decrease in "natural" killer cell activity.

DEFINITION: (V) To administer medication in the form of a mist inhaled into the lungs.
TRANSLATION: aláfẹ́fẹ́ fún fífàsínú ẹ̀dọ̀fóró.

DEFINITION: nebulizer or nebuliser (see spelling differences) is a drug delivery device used to administer medication in the form of a mist inhaled into the lungs.
TRANSLATION: Èyí jẹ́ irinṣẹ́ ìlo òògùn tí ó jẹ́ ti ìfàsínú ẹ̀dọ̀fóró.

DEFINITION: part of the body joining the head to the shoulders. It is the region supported by the cervical vertebrae.
TRANSLATION: tó n so orí pọ̀mọ́ èjìká. Agbèègbè tó n ṣèrànwọ́ pẹ̀lú eegun ọrùn.

DEFINITION: Shedding of surface components of tissue, such as cells from internal body surfaces, due to death of a portion of tissue.
TRANSLATION: àwọn èròjà ní pèpele ìmọ̀lára bí i àwọn hóró ní pèpele ìta ara fún ìdí ikú isan.

DEFINITION: small sharp metal pin used in acupuncture to stimulate points on the body.
TRANSLATION: pínnì tí a n lò fi gún apá kan ní ojú ara.

DEFINITION: and Syringe Programmes (NSPs) Needle and syringe programmes (NSPs) are a type of harm reduction initiative that provide clean needles and syringes to people who inject drugs (sometimes referred to as PWID).
TRANSLATION: alábẹ́rẹ́ àti sìrínìnjì ni ọ̀kan lára ètò láti dín ewu kù nípa pípèsè abẹ́rẹ́ àti sìnrínìnjì tí ó mọ́ dáadáa fún àwọn ènìyàn tí wọ́n gba òògun nípa abẹ́rẹ́ gígún

DEFINITION: tree Azadirachta indica, also known as Neem, Nimtree, and Indian Lilac is a
TRANSLATION: jẹ́ ẹ̀yà igi ti ẹbí igi gẹdú. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 195 tree in the mahogany family Meliaceae.

DEFINITION: of the regulatory genes of the HIV virus. Three HIV regulatory genes – tat, rev and nef – and three so-called auxiliary genes – vif, vpr and vpu – contain information necessary for the production of proteins that control the virus's ability to infect a cell, produce new copies of the virus or cause disease.
TRANSLATION: Nef Ọ̀ kan lára ẹ̀yọ́ ìran fún kòkòrò KASA. Ẹ̀ yọ́ ìran síṣedéédé fún KASA ní tat, rev àti nef pẹ̀lú àwọn aṣèrànwọ́ ẹ̀yọ́ ìran bí i vif, vpr àti vpu tí ó n pèsè ìfitónilétí fún ìpèsè purotéénì tí ó n darí ipa hóró láti kó ààrùn àti ìṣelọ́pọ̀ ẹ̀dà àwọn ààrùn wọ́nyìí.

DEFINITION: (NFN) Nelfinavir (NFN) (brand name Viracept) is an antiretroviral drug used in the treatment of the human immunodeficiency virus (HIV). Nelfinavir belongs to the class of drugs known as protease inhibitors (PIs) and like other PIs is almost always used in combination with other antiretroviral drugs.
TRANSLATION: ni òògùn apa kòkòrò KASA.

DEFINITION: Concerning the first four weeks of life after birth.
TRANSLATION: ti ọ̀sẹ̀ mẹ́rin àyè lẹ́yìn ìbí.

DEFINITION: abnormal and uncontrolled growth of tissue; a tumor.
TRANSLATION: àibójúmu àti àìlèdarí ìdàgbàsókè ìmọ̀lára.
Nephrotoxic Poisonous to the kidneys. Májèlé kíndìnrín Májèlé kíndìnrín. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 196

DEFINITION: bundle of fibres that uses electrical and chemical signals to transmit sensory (a bundle of conducting nerves that transmit impulses from the brain or spinal cord to the muscles and glands) and or inwards from the sense organs to the brain and spinal cord.
TRANSLATION: àwọn ọ̀ran tó n lo àmì àrá ati ẹ̀là láti gbé iyè, àti ìdì sísàwárí ẹ̀so tó n gbé ohun àìròtẹ́lè láti ọpọlọ tabi ọ̀pá èhìn sí iṣon àti ẹsẹ́ oje-ara tàbí nínú láti àwọn ẹ̀yà ara sí ọpọlọ àti ọ̀pá èhìn.

DEFINITION: sharp, shooting pain along a nerve pathway.
TRANSLATION: mímú tí ó n pani lára.

DEFINITION: complications of AIDS Central nervous system (CNS) damage.
TRANSLATION: ìmọ̀lára ajẹmọ́ ìsọdọ̀lẹ Ìbàjẹ́ gbùngùn ìsàkóso ìmọ̀lára ajẹmọ́ ìsọdọ̀lẹ.

DEFINITION: name given to a group of disorders involving nerves. Symptoms range from a tingling sensation or numbness in the toes and fingers to paralysis. It is estimated that 35 per cent of people with HIV disease have some form of neuropathy. A "peripheral neuropathy" refers to the peripheral nerves outside the spinal cord.
TRANSLATION: tí a fún àkójọpọ̀ àìda ìmọ̀lára. Àìsàn yìí máa n fa àìbàlẹ̀ ọkàn tàbí ìka ríro. Àkọsílẹ̀ fi yéwa pé ìdá márùndínlógójì àwọn tó n gbé pẹ̀lú KASA máa n ní ààrùn Ìmọ̀lára.

DEFINITION: process by which an antibody binds to specific antigens, thereby "neutralizing" the microorganism.
TRANSLATION: i sójà ṣe sopòò mọ́ àjèjì adáralóró kan pàtó, kí i ó sì sọ kòkòrò àìfojúrí di ìpaṣẹ́. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 197

DEFINITION: antibody An antibody that keeps a virus from infecting a cell, usually by blocking receptors on the cell or the virus.
TRANSLATION: Sójà ara tí ó n ṣe ààbò kí kòkòrò máa baà ran hóró nípa mímọ odi mọ́ hóró.

DEFINITION: domain The section of the HIV envelope protein gp120 that elicits antibodies with neutralizing activities.
TRANSLATION: purotéénì gp120 tí èèpo KASA tí ó n yọ àwọn sójà jade níbi ìpaṣẹ́.

DEFINITION: abnormally low level of circulating white blood cells (neutrophils) that remove bacteria.
TRANSLATION: ẹ̀jẹ̀ funfun Àìbójúmu ipò ìṣànyíká ẹ̀yà hóró ẹ̀jẹ̀ funfun tó n yọ batéríà pátápátá.

DEFINITION: called polymorph nuclear neutrophil (PMN). A white blood cell that plays a central role in the defence of a host against infection. Neutrophils engulf and kill foreign microorganisms.
TRANSLATION: ẹ̀jẹ̀ funfun Ẹ̀ ya hóró ẹ̀jẹ̀ funfun tí ó n dáàbòbò olùgbàlejò láti kó ààrùn. A máa pa àwọn kòkòrò àjèjì.

DEFINITION: Delta AIDS Response (NiDAR) The secret of the success of NiDAR is that the communities are in charge. Each of the hospitals is managed by a committee headed by a nominee of the community. The committee is responsible for the efficient management of the hospital and provision of the required services.
TRANSLATION: Niger Delta sí ààrùn ìṣọdọ̀lẹ Àjẹsára Àsírí àṣeroyí NIDAR ni pé, àwùjọ ni ó wà ní ojú ọpọ́n. Ìgbìmọ̀ yìí wà fún ìṣàkóso ilé ìwòsàn àti ìpèsè iṣẹ́ ìrànwọ́.

DEFINITION: Business Coalition Against AIDS (NIBUCAA) NIBUCAA’s vision is to help develop a private sector which is informed and committed to addressing the growing
TRANSLATION: NIBUCAA A dá ẹ̀ka yìí sílẹ̀ láti ró àwọn oníṣẹ́ aládàáni láti dẹ́kun ìsòro ajẹmọ́ KASA àti ààrùn ìsọdọ̀lẹ ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 198 challenges of HIV & AIDS in the workplace and in the broader community. Member companies ensure that employees living with HIV are given the same rights, benefits and opportunities as their colleagues. ajẹsára ní ibi-iṣẹ́ àti àwùjọ ní àpapọ̀. Àjọ ilé-iṣẹ́ tí wọ́n jẹ́ ọmọ ẹgbẹ́ àjọ yìí máa n sapa pé òṣìṣẹ́ tí ó ń gbé pẹ̀lú KASA náà ní ẹ̀tọ́ kan náà pẹ̀lú àwọn akẹgbẹ́ tí ó kù.

DEFINITION: Centre for Disease Control (NCDC) The Nigeria Centre for Disease Control (NCDC) was established in 2005. NCDC's mission is to identify, assess and communicate current and emerging threats to human health posed by infectious diseases.
TRANSLATION: 2005 ni wó ̣n dá Àjọ yí sílẹ̀. Ó wà fún ìkúnpá ìdènà ìkóràn àwo ̣n ààrùn ní orílè ̣ èdè Nàìjíríà.

DEFINITION: National Response Information Management System (NNRIMS) The Nigeria National Response Information Management System (NNRIMS) was put in place to track the successes and challenges of strategic plans. The primary goal of the NNRIMS Operational Plan is to provide a simple and robust monitor- ing and evaluation system that will facilitate (a) tracking of progress in the implementation of the National HIV/ AIDS response and (b) using informa- tion to inform programmes, policies and service delivery as part of the multi-sectoral HIV and AIDS response in Nigeria based on the National Strategic Framework (2005-2009).
TRANSLATION: NNRIMS Àjọ NNRIMS wà láti máa mójútó ìpèníjà sí àṣeyọrí àwọn ilànà àti igbékalẹ̀. Àfojúsùn NNRIMS gan-an nípé ilànà ìmúṣẹ́ṣe ni láti pèsè ìmójútó tí ó rọrùn tí ó sì múnádóko làti mọ ibi tí iṣẹ́ gbé dúro gan-an nípa dídásí KASA àti ààrùn ìsọdọ̀lẹ Àjẹsára nípa lílo ìfitónilétí àwọn ètò ẹ̀rí-máa- jẹ́mi-nìsó àti àti àwọn ìlànà ìmúṣẹ́se láti orísìí ọ̀nà dídásí KASA àti ìsọdọ̀lẹ àjẹsára ní orílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjíríà. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 199

DEFINITION: fever This is a virus transmitted to humans via animals.
TRANSLATION: tí ènìyàn n kó lára ẹranko.

DEFINITION: Nocardia is the causative agent of an infectious disease affecting either the lungs (pulmonary nocardiosis) or the whole body (systemic nocardiosis).
TRANSLATION: lè jẹ́ ààrùn ẹ̀dọ̀fóró nokádíà tàbí gbogbo ara.

DEFINITION: generalized disease in humans and other animals caused by nocardia asteroides characterized by primary pulmonary lesions that may be subclinical or chronic hematogenous spread to deep viscera, including the central nervous system; most commonly occurs in immunosuppressed patients.
TRANSLATION: nokadíà Ààrùn gbogboogbò tí ó n ràn láti ara ẹranko bí i nokadíà.

DEFINITION: disease Any disease that cannot be transmitted from one person to another.
TRANSLATION: ni ààrùn tí kò le ràn láti ara ẹnìkan sí ẹlòmíràn.

DEFINITION: Governmental Organization (NGO) A non-profit organization dedicated to helping individuals and families overcome poverty.
TRANSLATION: ṣe ti ìjọba Ilé isẹ́ tí kìí ṣe fún èrè jíjẹ tí ó ń pèsè iṣẹ́ ìrànwọ́ fún àwọn ènìyàn àti ẹbí láti bọ́ lọ́wọ́ òṣì.

DEFINITION: lymphoma Non-Hodgkin’s lymphoma is a cancer that starts in cells called lymphocytes, which are part of the body's immune system.
TRANSLATION: Hodgkin Jẹjẹrẹ tí ó n bẹ̀rẹ̀ láti ara hóró tí ó wà lára àjẹsára. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 200

DEFINITION: test Behavioural patterns of individuals when a test result is good.
TRANSLATION: aláìfihàn Èsì àyè ̣wò aláìfihànní àyẹ̀wò tí kò ṣe àwárí atako KASA nínú ẹ̀jẹ̀

DEFINITION: Inflammatory Drug (NSAID) A distinct class of analgesic drugs which provide pain relief by counteracting the body’s inflammation process.
TRANSLATION: (NSAID) Ọ̀ wọ́ òògùn apàrora wíwú.

DEFINITION: acid Molecule consisting of many nucleotides chemically bound together; e.g. deoxyribonucleic acid (DNA) and ribonucleic acid (RNA). Biologically occurring polynucleotides in which the nucleotide residues are linked in a specific sequence by phosphodiester bonds.
TRANSLATION: hóró Mólékù tí ó ní èròjà kòkòrò púpò tí a yí kẹ́míkà bíi DNA àti RNA pọ̀ mọ́.

DEFINITION: Bodies in the nucleus that become enlarged during protein synthesis and contain the DNA template for ribosomal RNA.
TRANSLATION: Kókó hóró tí ó di wíwú ní àsìkò ìsiṣẹ́ purotéénì tí ó ní àwòṣe DNA fún RNA.

DEFINITION: analogue Nucleosides are related to nucleotides, the subunits of nucleic acids; however, they do not carry the phosphate groups of the nucleotides. Nucleoside analogues generally are synthetic compounds similar to one of the components of DNA or RNA; a general type of antiviral drug (e.g. acyclovir and AZT).
TRANSLATION: hóró 1 Ajẹmọ́ èròjà kókó hóró 2 ni ẹ̀yà èròjá kókó hóró 1. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 201

DEFINITION: subunit of DNA or RNA that consists of a nitrogenous base (A, G, T, or C in DNA, AG, U or C in RNA), a phosphate molecule, and a sugar molecule (deoxyribose in DNA, and ribose in RNA).
TRANSLATION: hóró 2 Ìpín DNA tàbí RNA tí ó ní nitirojin (A,G,T, tàbí C nínú- DNA; AG, U, tàbí C nínú RNA) èròjà kókó hóró tí a rí nínúèròjà inú kókó hóró .

DEFINITION: (1) The central controlling body within a living cell, usually a spherical unit enclosed in a membrane and containing genetic codes for maintaining the life systems of the organism and for issuing commands for growth and reproduction. (2) The nucleus of a cell is an organelle (i.e. a cellular organ) that is essential to such cell functions as reproduction and protein synthesis.
TRANSLATION: Gbùngbun ìṣèdarí àwọn àyè hóró nínú ara tí ó wà ní ìhámọ́ awọ tí ó ní àwọn kóòdú jinni fún ídàgbàsókè àti ìbísí.

DEFINITION: cell A lymphocyte that develops in the bone marrow and lacks the characteristic surface markers of the B and T lymphocytes. Null cells represent a small proportion of the lymphocyte population. Stimulated by the presence of an antibody, null cells can attack certain cellular targets directly and are known as "natural killer" or NK cells.
TRANSLATION: omi-ara tí ó dàgbà nínú mùndùnmúndùn eegun èyí tí ó ṣe aláìní àwọn àmì omi-ara B àti T. Hóró aláìlámì dúró fún horo omi-ara kékeré. Èyí a máa dí àyè sójà ara, hóró aláìlámì lè dojúkọ àwọn hóró kan pàtó tí a mọ́ sí àdámọ̀ apani tàbí àwọn hóró NK. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 202

DEFINITION: Somebody trained to look after sick or injured people, especially somebody who works in a hospital or clinic, administering the care and treatment that a doctor prescribes.
TRANSLATION: tó n ṣe ìtọ́jú àwọn aláìsàn ní ilé ìwòsàn, páàpáààwọn tó n ṣe àbójútó àti ìtọ́jú wọn gẹ́gẹ́ bí dókítà ṣe pá ní àṣẹ.

DEFINITION: class of synthetic polyamide materials made by copolymerizing dicarboxylic acids with diamines.
TRANSLATION: ohun èròjà àtọwọ́dá ohun kíkan tí ó jẹ́ oníbejì.

DEFINITION: monocotyledonous plant of genus Alium allied to garlic, used as vegetable and spice.
TRANSLATION: ọ̀gbìn inú ilẹ̀ tí a nlò fún ìsebẹ̀ èyí tí ó n mú oúnjẹ dùn.

DEFINITION: trial A clinical trial in which doctors and participants know which drug or vaccine is being administered.
TRANSLATION: ajẹmọ́tọ́jú ní èyí tí àwọn dókítà àti ọ̀wọ́ akópa mọ irú òògùn àti ajẹsára tí a le lò.

DEFINITION: infection An illness caused by an organism that usually does not cause disease in a person with a normal immune system. People with advanced HIV infection suffer opportunistic infections of the lungs, brain, eyes and other organs.
TRANSLATION: tí ó wá láti ara ẹyawuuru tí kìí sábà fa àrùn lára ènìyàn tí ó ní ètò àjẹsára tí ó dápé. Àwọn tíwọ́n ní ìkóràn KASA ajìfà tí ó ga nínú ẹ̀dọ̀fóró, ọpọlọ, ojú àti àwọn ara mìíràn.

DEFINITION: testing This is a condition of voluntary testing which targets the screening of pregnant women for HIV infection to avoid transmission to the baby.
TRANSLATION: Afaramọ́ àyè ̣wò KASA Àyẹ̀wò KASA wò ̣fún tí a n ṣe fún olóyún lọ́nà àti dènà ìkóràn ran ọmọ. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 203

DEFINITION: testing This is a condition of performing an HIV test after notifying the patient that the test is normally performed but that the patient may elect to decline or defer testing. Consent is then assumed unless the patient declines testing.
TRANSLATION: KASA Síṣe àyẹ̀wò fún àwọn tó n gbé pẹ̀lú KASA ṣùgbọ́n tí wọ́n ní ànfààní ìye ̣ra fún àyẹ̀wò.

DEFINITION: Polio Vaccine (OPV) This is a drug used to prevent infectious viral disease affecting the central nervous system that causes paralysis.
TRANSLATION: rọpá rọsẹ̀ Òògùn tó n dènà ààrùn ìkóràn èyí tí ó n ṣe ìpalára fún ètò ààrin gbùngbùn tó n fa ààrùn rọpárọṣẹ̀.

DEFINITION: part of the body that has a specific function.
TRANSLATION: inú Ẹ̀ yà ara inú tí ó ní iṣẹ́ kan pàtó.

DEFINITION: Relating to that division of the pharynx between the soft palate and the epiglottis. Pharynx is a tube that connects the mouth and nasal passages with the oesophagus, the connection to the stomach. Epiglottis is a thin, valve- like structure that covers the glottis, the opening of the upper part of the larynx (the part of the throat containing the vocal cords) during swallowing.
TRANSLATION: sí ọ̀fin láàárìn òkè ẹnu àti ẹ̀kù ìpè-ọ̀fun wíwú. ọ̀fun jẹ́ túúbù tí ó so ẹnu àti imú pọ̀ mọ́ òòfà-ọ̀fun sí ìsopọ̀ ikùn.

DEFINITION: child whose parents are both dead and who has been abandoned by his or her parents, especially a child not adopted by another family.
TRANSLATION: tí kò ní ìyá àti bàbá tàbí tí àwọn méjèèjì kọ̀ sílẹ̀ tí ẹbí wọn gan-an kò tẹ́wọ́gbà. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 204

DEFINITION: and vulnerable children (OVC) The concept generally refers to orphans and other groups of children who are more exposed to risks than their peers.
TRANSLATION: akángunséwu Ọmọ aláìnìyá àti àwo ̣n mìíràn tí wó ̣n kángun sí ewu ju ẹlẹgbé ̣ wọn lọ.

DEFINITION: patient who comes to the hospital, clinic, or dispensary for diagnosis and or/treatment but does not occupy a bed.
TRANSLATION: tí ó wá sí ilé ìwòsàn fún ìdámọ̀ àìsàn tàbí ìtọ́jú ṣùgbọ́n, tí a kò gbàyè ibùsùn fún ní ilé ìwòsàn

DEFINITION: department A section in the hospital where outpatient cases are handled.
TRANSLATION: alálọbọ̀ Aláìsàn tí ó n gba ìtọ́jú ní ilé ìwòsàn, yálà ibi tí ẹnìkan dáwà tàbí èyí tí ọ̀gọ̀rọ̀ ènìyàn wà, ṣùgbọ́n, tí a kò gbàyè ibùsùn fún-un ní ilé ìwòsàn fún ènìyàn náà.

DEFINITION: kits The outreach kits include guidelines, practical tips, activities and other resources to help scientists participate more fully with youth groups, community organizations, classroom teachers and students in kindergarten through high school (K-12).
TRANSLATION: ìpolongo Ohun èlò ìta gbangba ní ìlànà, ìtanilólobó ní ojúkorojú pẹ̀lú àwọn ohun tí ó n ṣe ìranwọ́ fún ìmọ̀-ìjìnlẹ̀ àwọn ọ̀wọ́ akópa fún àwọn ọ̀dọ́, àjọ agbèègbè, tísà àti àwọn ọmọ iléèwé jẹ́léosinmi.

DEFINITION: of the female reproductive system. One of a pair of female gonads (a gamete-producing gland) found on each side of the lower abdomen, beside the uterus, in a fold of the broad
TRANSLATION: yà ìbísí ètò obìnrin. Ọ̀ kan lára ẹ̀yà ìbu ẹyin méjì tí a rí ní apá ìṣàlẹ̀ inú, ní ẹ̀gbẹ́ ilé ọmọ. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 205 ligament. At ovulation, an egg is extruded from a follicle on the surface of the ovary under the stimulation of certain hormones.

DEFINITION: unpleasant sensation that can range from mild, localized discomfort to agony. Pain is a response to impulses from the peripheral nerves in damaged tissue, which pass to nerves in the spinal cord where they are subjected to a gate control. This gate modifies the subsequent passage of the impulses in accordance with descending controls from the brain.
TRANSLATION: tólè wá láti ohun yẹpẹrẹ, ìnira àyikasí ìrora. Ìrora ni èsì àìròtẹ́lè láti inú agbèègbè ìmọ̀lára sí ìṣù bíbàjẹ́, tó gba inú ìmọ̀lára nínú ọ̀pá èyìn, níbi tíwọ́n dáwọn lọ́wọ́ kọ́ sí. Níbí yìí sí ọ̀nà àìròtẹ́lè mìíràn sí ìsọ̀kalè ìdarí láti ọpọlọ.

DEFINITION: Light in colour or shade; containing little colour or pigment.
TRANSLATION: funfun Iná pupa tí ó ní àwọ̀ tàbí ohun ayí àwọ̀ padà.

DEFINITION: treatment that provides symptomatic relief, but not a cure.
TRANSLATION: tó n pèsè ìrànlọ́wọ́ fún àìsàn aláìlámì ṣùgbọ́n, kò wà fún ìtọ́jú.

DEFINITION: care Palliative care is a multidisciplinary approach to specialized medical care for people with serious illnesses. It focuses on providing patients with relief from the symptoms, pain, physical stress, and mental stress of a serious illness – whatever the diagnosis.
TRANSLATION: gbogbo nìṣe fún ìtọ́jú àwọn aláìsàn. Ó tún pèsè iṣẹ́ ìtura fún ìdámọ́ àìsàn, ìrora, wàhálà ara àti ìpòrúru ọkàn ajẹmọ-àìsàn-ìwádìí yòówù ó jẹ́. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 206

DEFINITION: gland situated near the stomach that secretes a digestive fluid into the intestine through one or more ducts and also secretes the hormone insulin.
TRANSLATION: ṣe ìpínyà láàárìn oje ní inú láti ìwọ̀ kan tàbí jùbẹ́lọ̀.

DEFINITION: Inflammation of the pancreas that can produce severe pain and debilitating illness.
TRANSLATION: àmọ́ wíwú tí ó n pèsè ìrora gíga àti àìsàn tó n dín agbára kù.

DEFINITION: Deficiency of all cell elements of the blood.
TRANSLATION: Àìtó gbogbo hóró ẹ̀jẹ̀.

DEFINITION: disease prevalent throughout an entire country, continent or the whole world.
TRANSLATION: Àjàkálẹ̀ ààrùn tó n dàmú ti onílé àti àlejò ní orílẹ̀-èdè.

DEFINITION: smear A method for the early detection of cancer and other abnormalities of the female genital tract, especially of the cervix and uterus, employing exfoliated cells (cells that have been shed into vaginal fluid) and a special staining technique for microscopic examination that differentiates diseased tissue.
TRANSLATION: nà ilé ọmọ Ọ̀ nà àti tètè mọ jẹjẹrẹ àti sége sège mìíràn ajẹmọ́ ojuara obinrin paapaa ọ̀na ilé-ọmọ àti ilé-ọmọ, èyí a maa mú yíyé hóró sinu oje oju-ara obinrin, lilo àkànse irinsẹ amu-nnkan- tobi láti sayewo ìyàtọ̀ ìṣù àìsàn.

DEFINITION: benign tumor (as a wart or condyloma) resulting from an overgrowth of epithelial tissue on papillae of vascularized connective tissue as of the skin.
TRANSLATION: jẹjẹrẹ ara tójẹ́ àbájáde ìdàgbàsókè ìṣù lórí ìsopọ̀ ìṣù. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 207

DEFINITION: track A system of distributing experimental drugs to patients who are unable to participate in ongoing clinical efficacy trials and have no other treatment options.
TRANSLATION: pínpín àyẹ̀wò òògùn fún àwọn aláìsàn tí ó sòro fún láti kópa nípa ìwádìí ajẹmọ́tọ́jú àti àwọn ọ̀nà ìtọ́jú mìíràn.

DEFINITION: plant or animal that lives and feeds on or within another living organism; does not necessarily cause disease.
TRANSLATION: tàbí ẹranko tó n jẹ nínú àwọn ohun mìíràn ní èyí tí kòle fa àìsàn.

DEFINITION: tissue of an organ (as distinguished from supporting or connective tissue).
TRANSLATION: tí a yà sọ́tọ̀ fún àtìlẹ́yìn àti ìsopọ̀ ìṣù.

DEFINITION: to child Concerning the connection between individuals and their offspring (e.g. communication dynamics, transfer of traits, or transmission of infection).
TRANSLATION: Ajẹmó ̣ ìjọra ìwà, àìsàn àti ìkóràn láàrin àwọn ènìyàn àti ìran.

DEFINITION: to children transmission The transmission of HIV from an HIV- positive mother to her child during pregnancy, labour, delivery or breastfeeding is called mother-to-child transmission.
TRANSLATION: mọ Ìkóràn àìsàn láti ara òbí sí ọmọ ní àsìkò oyún, ìrọbí, ìbí tàbí fífún ọmọ lọ́yàn.

DEFINITION: in or through the digestive system. For example, parenteral can pertain to blood being drawn from a vein in the arm or introduced into that vein via a transfusion (intravenous), or to injection of medications or vaccines
TRANSLATION: ṣe nípa ètò oúnjẹ.Àìfẹnulò tó jẹ mọ́ ẹ̀jẹ̀ tí a fà nínú iṣan tàbí ara. Ó sì le jẹ́ fífa òògùn gba inú iṣan tàbí ara. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 208 through the skin (subcutaneous) or into the muscle (intramuscular).

DEFINITION: subjective sensation experienced as numbness, tingling or a "pins-and- needles" feeling.
TRANSLATION: ségesège ìmọ̀lára tí a n kẹ́fín nípa ìfigún abẹ́rẹ́.

DEFINITION: mortality Paternal mortality is the number of deaths of fathers within a given period of time.
TRANSLATION: Ònkà ikú bàbá ni iye ikú àwọn bàbá fún àkókò kan pàtó.

DEFINITION: disease-producing microorganism or material.
TRANSLATION: Ohunkóhun tí ó n fa ààrùn àìfojúrí.

DEFINITION: origin and development of a disease.
TRANSLATION: ààrùn Orísun àti ìgbèrú àrùn .

DEFINITION: of spread This is a process by which diseases spread.
TRANSLATION: tí ààrùn n gbà tànkálẹ̀.

DEFINITION: counsellor Peer counsellors are compassionate guides. They apply knowledge, use specific tools, and follow certain rules to help people get pass obstacles and reach their goals.
TRANSLATION: agbaniníyànjú Ojúgbà agbaniníyànjú jẹ́ ató ̣nisó ̣nà olóju àánú tí wó ̣n n lo ìmò ̣, irinṣé ̣ àti ìlànà àfojúsùn yanjú ìs ̣òro àwo ̣n èèyan títí dé èbúté ògo wo ̣n.

DEFINITION: outreach Peer outreach is really about building relationships. There are many people we see frequently and we want them to feel safe when we approach them. It is an effort to bring services or information to people of one’s socio- demographic group where they live or spend time.
TRANSLATION: ìpolongo Ojúgbà ìpolongo jẹ́ ọ̀nà ìbáraẹniṣepọ̀. Ọ̀ pọ̀ ènìyàn tí a n rí lóòrèkóòrè, tí a fẹ́ kí wọ́n wà ní àìléwu nígbà tí a bá súnmọ́ wọn. Ó tún aáyan titan ìròyìn àti ojús ̣e ká láàrin e ̣gbé ̣ níbi tí wo ̣n n gbé tàbí tí wo ̣n ti n lò sí. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 209

DEFINITION: review The process by which new scientific or medical findings, announced by one researcher, are reviewed by other scientists or physicians before these findings are published.
TRANSLATION: tuntun fún ìwádìí ìmọ́- ìjìnlẹ̀ ṣáyẹ́nsì tàbí ìṣègùn tí olùwádìí kan kéde, ni àyẹ̀wò tí àwọn onímọ̀ ìjìnlẹ̀ ṣáyẹ́nsì tàbí oníṣègùn ṣe kí wọ́n tó gbé ìwádìí yìí jade.

DEFINITION: Inflammatory Disease (PID) A term used to describe infections of the uterus, the fallopian tubes and the ovaries. PID is usually the result of untreated sexually transmitted disease, primarily chlamydia or gonorrhoea.
TRANSLATION: t’obìnrin Ìperí tí a nlò fi ṣe àlàyé ìkóràn ti ilé-ọmọ, ìfun ẹ̀yìn àti àwọn ìbu ẹyin. Àìsàn odò ikùn t’obìnrin jẹ́ àbájáde àìtọ́jú ààrùn ìbálòpọ̀ páàpáà ààrùn ojú-abẹ́.

DEFINITION: external male sex organ. The penis contains two chambers, the corpora cavernosa, and corpus spongiosum.
TRANSLATION: o ̣kùnrin. Ó ní kórópọ̀n méjì.

DEFINITION: approved antiprotozoal drug used for the treatment and prevention of Pneumocystis carinii pneumonia (PCP) infection. It can be delivered intravenously or intramuscularly or inhaled as an aerosol. Aerosolized pentamidine is approved for the prophylaxis of PCP in HIV-positive individuals with CD4+ counts below 200 per cubic millimetre or for those with prior episodes of PCP.
TRANSLATION: pentamidin Òògùn apa pòtósúà, èyí tí ó wà fún ìtọ́jú ìkóràn otútù àyà ajẹmọ́ ìṣọdọ̀lẹ. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 210

DEFINITION: Inject Drugs (PWID) People who inject drugs continue to face punitive legal environments, a variety of human rights abuses and have poor access to services; these and other factors combine to exacerbate their risk of acquiring HIV.
TRANSLATION: ̣ Agúnòògùn lábé ̣ré ̣ máa n fojú winá òfin è ̣ka tí n jàfún ẹ̀tọ́ ọmọnìyàn fún títẹ idà òfin iṣẹ́ wọn lójú. Àwọn ohun tí ó rọ̀mọ́ ewu KASA kíkó nìyí.

DEFINITION: Biochemical formed by the linkage of up to about 50 amino acids to form a chain. Longer chains are called proteins. The amino acids are coupled by a peptide bond, a special linkage in which the nitrogen atom of one amino acid binds to the carboxyl carbon atom of another. OR: peptide is the smallest unit of protein.
TRANSLATION: purotéénì Kẹ́míkà oníbejì tí a ṣe nípa ìdìpọ̀ tó kéré tán bí i àdọ́ta asidi amino láti jẹ́ ìdìpọ̀.

DEFINITION: adherence This is the level by which a patient follows drug prescription. The degree to which a patient’s compliance with a recommended regimen approaches full compliance on a percentage grading scale.
TRANSLATION: ìgbàtọ́ jú Èyí ni kí i aláìsàn máa tẹ̀lé ìlànà òògùn lílò.

DEFINITION: Acute or chronic inflammation of the membranous sac (pericardium) surrounding the heart.
TRANSLATION: Ògidì àpò ọkàn wíwú tí ó yí ọkàn ká. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 211

DEFINITION: fibrous membrane that forms a sac surrounding the heart and attached portions of the main blood vessels.
TRANSLATION: ọkàn wíwú tí ó yí ọkàn ká àti ìpín òpó ẹ̀jẹ̀.

DEFINITION: Pertaining to the period immediately before and after birth.
TRANSLATION: ó ní ṣe pẹ̀lú àsìkò tó tẹ̀lẹ́ àti ẹ́yìn ìbí.

DEFINITION: Blood Mononuclear Cell (PBMC)
TRANSLATION: Peripheral Blood Mononuclear Cell. Hóró PBM Hóró PBM.

DEFINITION: neuropathy Damage to or disease affecting nerves which may impair sensation, movement, or other aspects of health, depending on the type of nerves affected.
TRANSLATION: àrànkára Ààrùn ìmọ́lára tí ó ń ṣe àìlera fún ìgbápágbé ̣sè ̣ àti àwo ̣n abala àgó ̣ọ ara mìíràn.

DEFINITION: anaemia A severe form of anaemia, found mostly in older adults, that results from the body's inability to absorb vitamin B12. Symptoms include weakness, breathing difficulties, and weight loss.
TRANSLATION: B12 Ẹ̀ yà àìtó ẹ̀jẹ̀ ńlá tí a máa n rí lára àgbàlagbà, èyí tí ó jẹ́ àbájáde àìlegbà fítámì B12 sí ara. Àwọn àmì àìsàn yìí ni àìlera, ìnira láti mí àti ìwọ̀n jíjá.

DEFINITION: Generalized Lymphadenopathy (PGL) Chronic, diffuse, non-cancerous lymph node enlargement. Typically, it has been found in those with immune system disturbances who develop frequent and persistent bacterial, viral and fungal infections.
TRANSLATION: pẹ́tẹ́lẹ́ abárakú tí omi- ara wíwú. A máa n ri nínú ètò àjẹsára nípa bateria, kòkòrò àti ìkóràn osunwuuru.

DEFINITION: health This is the overall well-being of a person.
TRANSLATION: ènìyàn. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 212

DEFINITION: safety Personal safety refers to freedom from physical harm and the threat of physical harm, and freedom from hostility, aggression, harassment, and devaluation. Safety includes worry about being victimized as well as actual incidents.
TRANSLATION: Èyí túnmọ̀ sí òmìnira lọ́wọ́ ìpalára àti ìdérùbà ewu àti lọ́wọ́ ìkanra, ìfínràn àti ìjáwálẹ̀. Àbò ní àníyàn àìmá farapa àti ìfarapa gaa-an.

DEFINITION: Affected by AIDS (PABA) Persons who are not HIV infected but whose lives are touched by the HIV epidemic through close associates who are/were HIV infected.
TRANSLATION: àje ̣sára Àwọn èèyàn tí ìgbé ayé wọn fara pẹ́ KASA nípa ìbátan pẹ̀lú oníKASA.

DEFINITION: pinpoint-sized purple or red spot on the skin.
TRANSLATION: kékeré ní ojú ara.

DEFINITION: cell that is able to ingest and destroy foreign matter, including bacteria.
TRANSLATION: tí ó ní agbára láti pa àjèjì adáralóró pẹ̀lú bateria.

DEFINITION: process of ingesting and destroying a virus or other foreign matter by phagocyte.
TRANSLATION: mímì àti pípa kòkòrò àjèjì adáralóró pẹ̀lú hóró àjẹsára.

DEFINITION: Pharmacists, also known as chemists, are health care professionals who practise in pharmacy, the field of health sciences focusing on safe and effective medication use.
TRANSLATION: akọ́ṣẹ́mọṣẹ́ ètò ìlera tó kọ́ nípa ẹ̀kọ́ nípa ìpoogùn adálórí ìmọ̀-ìjìnlẹ̀ ṣáyẹ́nsì ọ̀nà lílo òògùn.

DEFINITION: processes (in a living organism) of absorption, distribution, metabolism and excretion of a drug or vaccine.
TRANSLATION: ara Àwọn ohun ìpapòdà ni yíya òògùn tàbí àjẹsára dànù. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 213

DEFINITION: surgical incision made in a vein, or a puncture made by a needle to draw blood for testing.
TRANSLATION: ìgbẹ́jẹ̀wọlé Abẹ́rẹ́ tí a n lò láti fa ẹ̀jẹ̀ nínú iṣan fún àyẹ̀wò.

DEFINITION: comfort This is the feeling of well-being brought about by internal and environmental conditions that are experienced as agreeable and associated with contentment and satisfaction.
TRANSLATION: tí a n rí nígbà tí a bá ní ìfọ̀kànbalẹ̀.

DEFINITION: glutinin (PHA) Phytohaemagglutinin is a lectin found in plants, especially certain legumes. PHA actually consists of two closely related proteins, called leucoagglutinin (PHA-L) and PHA-E. The letters E and L indicate these proteins agglutinate erythrocytes and leukocytes.
TRANSLATION: pọ̀ Asọ hóró ẹ̀jẹ̀ pọ̀. Ó wó ̣pò ̣ láàrin ohun ò ̣gbìn bíi è ̣wà.

DEFINITION: boxes Pill boxes are pill dispensers used in keeping drugs.
