TRANSLATION: oníhóró Àpótí tí a n tọ́jú òògùn pamọ́ sí.

DEFINITION: count Pill count is a kind of strategy that can be very helpful for confirming medication adherence and helping to reduce the risk of diversion.
TRANSLATION: òògùn oníhóró ní ìgbésẹ̀ tí a fi ń ṣe ìdámọ̀ òògùn gidi tí ń mú àdínkù bá ewu ìyípadà

DEFINITION: of blood The average adult has about 10 pints of blood in his body. Roughly 1pint is given during a donation. A healthy
TRANSLATION: tí óní àpò ẹ̀jẹ̀ mẹ́wà nínú ara. Hóró kan péré ní a máa fún ènìyàn ní àsìkò ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 214 donor may donate red blood cells every 56 days, or double red cells every 112 days. A healthy donor may donate platelets as few as 7 days apart, but a maximum of 24 times a year. ìfúnni. Afúnnilẹ́jẹ̀ máa n fẹ̀jẹ́lẹ̀ ní gbogbo ọjọ́ mẹ́rìndínlọ́gọ́ta tàbí ṣe ìlọ́po méjì àwọn hóró ẹ̀jẹ̀ ni gbogbo ọjọ́ àdọ́fàléméjì. Afẹ̀jẹ́lẹ̀ tí ó pé lè fí ẹ̀jẹ̀ sí lẹ̀ fún bí i ọjọ́ méje, ó pẹ́ jù ìgbà mẹ́rìnlélógún láàárín ọdún kan.

DEFINITION: gland The pituitary gland regulates the activities of other endocrine glands and many body processes. It is a pea-sized gland hanging from the base of the brain. It is attached by a short stalk. The pituitary consists of three parts: anterior lobe, intermediate lobe and posterior.
TRANSLATION: pìtúrì máa n fòpin sí iṣẹ́ míìràn. Ó dàbi ẹṣẹ́ afajọ ewa tókọ́ ọpọlọ.

DEFINITION: inactive substance against which investigational treatments are compared for efficacy.
TRANSLATION: lòdì sí ìwádìí ìtọ́jú ní afínwéra fún agbára.

DEFINITION: controlled study A method of investigation of drugs in which an inactive substance (the placebo) is given to one group of patients, while the drug being tested is given to another group. The results obtained in the two groups are then compared.
TRANSLATION: Ọ́ nà ìwádìí òògùn ní èyí tí a fún àwọn aláìsàn ní pàsẹ́bò nígbà tí a fún àwọn mìíràn ní òògùn tí a ti ṣe àyẹ̀wò fún. Àwọn èsì wọn ni a gbé yẹ̀wò síra.

DEFINITION: effect A physical or emotional change occurring after a substance is taken or
TRANSLATION: ara tabí ẹ̀dùn tó ṣẹlẹ̀ lẹ́yìn ìgbà tí a lo òògùn tí kìí ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 215 administered that is not the result of any special property of the substance. The change may be beneficial, reflecting the expectations of the patient and, often, the expectations of the person giving the substance. ṣe èsì àkànṣe ara òògùn yíi. ìyípadà lè jẹ́ ànfàní tó n ṣe ohun àfojúsọ́nà aláìsàn, ní ọ̀pọ̀ ìgbà ó lè jẹ́ àfojúsùn ẹni tí a n fún ní òògùn.

DEFINITION: liquid part of the blood and lymphatic fluid in which the blood cells are suspended.
TRANSLATION: yà oje ẹ̀jẹ̀ àti hóró omi- ara, níbi tí ati pa hóró ẹ̀jẹ̀ ti.

DEFINITION: cells Large antibody-producing cells that develop from B cells.
TRANSLATION: Hóró omi-ara tí sójà ara n gbé jade láti ipaṣe hóró B.

DEFINITION: selective removal of certain proteins or antibodies from the blood (followed by reinjection of the blood). This process is sometimes used in the treatment of some peripheral neuropathies and is an integral part of passive immunotherapies for HIV.
TRANSLATION: Yíyọ àwọn purotéénì tàbí sójà nínú ẹ̀jẹ̀ nípa pípadà fisínú ẹ̀jẹ̀. A n lò ó fún ìtọ́jú KASA.

DEFINITION: irregularly shaped disc-like cyctoplasmic fragment of megakaryocyte that is shed in the marrow sinus and subsequently found in the peripheral blood where it functions in clotting.
TRANSLATION: tí ó dà sínú mùndùnmúdùn tí a rí lóri ìpèpele ẹ̀jẹ̀ tí ó sọwọ́n di dídì.

DEFINITION: count This is the number of cytoplasmic body in the blood that aids in clotting.
TRANSLATION: Ìye ònkà ìdọ̀tí tí a n rí nínú ẹ̀jẹ̀ èyí tí o sọwọ́n di dídì. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 216

DEFINITION: Pneumocystis jiroveci (previously classified as Pneumocystis carinii), causes pneumonia in immuno- suppressed patients, usually following intensive chemotherapy.
TRANSLATION: ajẹmọ́ ìsọdọ̀lẹ Pòtósúà òtútù àyà ajẹmọ́ ìsọdọ̀lẹ máa n fa otútù àyà lára aláìsàn tó ṣe aláìní àjẹsára.

DEFINITION: carinii pneumonia (PCP) The kind of pneumonia that happens to people living with HIV/AIDS. OR: A life-threatening lung infection that can affect people with weakened immune systems, such as those infected with HIV. More than three-quarters of all people with HIV disease will develop PCP if they do not receive treatment to prevent it.
TRANSLATION: ìṣọdọ̀lẹ Àkànṣe otútù àyà tí ó ṣẹlẹ̀ sí àwọn tó n gbé pẹ̀lú KASA àti ààrùn ìṣọdọ̀lẹ àjẹsára.

DEFINITION: jiroveci pneumonia It is found everywhere in the soil, but only causes disease in immuno- suppressed people (like HIV and AIDS). Causes fever, a dry cough and shortness of breath that gets worse over days to weeks. Can be fatal if not treated.
TRANSLATION: lè ri ní gbogbo ilẹ̀ erùpè, ṣugbọn ó n fa àìsàn lára àwọn tí ó ní KASA àti ààrùn ìṣọdọ̀lẹ àjẹsára. Ó lè fa ibà, ikọ́ gbígbẹ ati aìlèmí sókè dáadáa tí ó le burú jọjọ fún ọjọ́ pé́ré́te sí ọ̀sè. Ólè la ikú tí a kò bá tètè se ìtọ́jú ẹ̀.

DEFINITION: Inflammation of one or both lungs, with dense areas of lung inflammation.
TRANSLATION: kan lára ẹ̀dọ̀fóró wíwú .

DEFINITION: is an infectious viral disease affecting the central nervous system that causes paralysis.
TRANSLATION: ni kòkòrò ààrùn ìkóràn tí ó n ṣe àkóbá fún àarìn gbùngbùn ìmọ̀lára tí ó lè fa rọpárọsẹ̀. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 217

DEFINITION: of several enzymes that catalyze the formation of DNA or RNA from precursor substances in the presence of pre-existing DNA or RNA acting as templates (i.e. patterns).
TRANSLATION: nínú àwọn ẹnsáìmù tó n ṣe àlékún bá ìṣesí DNA tàbí RNA láti sáájú ohun èròjà DNA tàbí RNA tí ó jẹ́ àwòṣe.

DEFINITION: Chain Reaction (PCR) (1) A laboratory process that selects a DNA segment from a mixture of DNA chains and rapidly replicates it; used to create a large, readily analyzed sample of a piece of DNA. It is used in DNA finger-printing and in medical tests to identify diseases from the infectious agent's DNA. (2) As related to HIV: A sensitive laboratory technique that can detect and quantify HIV in a person's blood or lymph node.
TRANSLATION: Àyẹ̀wò tí a fí n pín DNA sí ìṣọ̀rí lọ́nà àti dènà ìdàpọ̀ síṣe ẹ̀dà. À n lo èyí fún ìpèsè ẹ̀yà DNA lọ́pọ̀ yanturu fún àlàyé. À n lò ó láti ṣe ìdámọ̀ ààrùn láàárin àwọn asojú DNA. (2) Ajẹmọ́ KASA: jẹ́ irinṣẹ́ yàrá àyẹ̀wò tí ó n ṣe ìdámọ̀ àti ìwọ̀n KASA nínú ẹ̀jẹ̀ ènìyàn tàbí hóró omi-ara.
Inflammation of many nerves at once. Àìsàn wíwú òpó ìmọ̀lára Àìsàn wíwú òpó ìmọ̀lára lẹ́kansoso.

DEFINITION: vaccine A vaccine that is active against multiple viral strains.
TRANSLATION: pọ̀ ààrùn Àjẹsára tí ótó kojú ọlọ́pọ̀ kòkòrò ààrùn.

DEFINITION: large rodent covered with long sharp quills.
TRANSLATION: tí ó ní àwo ̣n è ̣gún gígùn, tí ó sì mú s ̣ómús ̣ómú lára.

DEFINITION: Relating to or denoting the period after childbirth.
TRANSLATION: ìbímọ Ajẹmọ́ àsìkò lẹ́yìn ibímọ. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 218

DEFINITION: counselling This is counselling that is done after undergoing a HIV test.
TRANSLATION: tí a ṣe lẹ́yìn àyẹ̀wò.

DEFINITION: abstinence This is an act of avoiding having sex before marriage especially when HIV status is not a certain.
TRANSLATION: ìgbéyàwó Ṣíséra fún ìbálòpọ̀ s ̣aájú ìgbéyàwó páàpáà nígbà tí a kò mọ ipò KASA dájú.

DEFINITION: test This is a condition of going for HIV test to know one’s status before marriage.
TRANSLATION: ìgbéyàwó Ipò lílọ fún àyẹ̀wò bóyá ènìyàn ní KASA tàbí kò ní ṣaájú ìgbéyàwó.

DEFINITION: quarantine This is an act of temporarily isolating for observation an asymptomatic individual who is suspected of having a contagious disease.
TRANSLATION: afurasí Ọ̀ nà yíyàsó ̣tò ̣ e ̣ni tí a fura sí pé ó ní ààrùn ìkóràn fún àyè ̣wò.

DEFINITION: measure taken beforehand to ward off evil or secure good or success; precautionary act; as to take precautions against risks of accident.
TRANSLATION: tí a n gbé s ̣aájú ibi tàbí ṣe àṣeyọrí, tàbí kí aní mímúrasílẹ̀ sáájú ìjambá ewu.

DEFINITION: cells Cells from which other cells are formed by natural processes.
TRANSLATION: hóró tí a tí n sẹ̀dá àwọn hóró mìíràn nípa ìlànà abínibí.

DEFINITION: state of carrying a developing embryo or foetus within the female body.
TRANSLATION: ọlẹ̀ tàbi ọmọ inú obìnrin.

DEFINITION: Carrying a developing foetus within the body.
TRANSLATION: ọlẹ̀ nínú ara.

DEFINITION: woman A woman carrying a developing embryo or foetus.
TRANSLATION: obìnrin tó ní o ̣lè ̣ tàbí ọmọ nínú. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 219

DEFINITION: written order issued by a physician or other qualified practitioners that authorizes a pharmacist to supply a specific medication for a patient, with instructions on its use.
TRANSLATION: Ìwé ìlànà ìlòògùn tí àwọn oníṣègùn kọ èyí tí ó n sọfún apoògùn láti fún aláìsàn ní òògùn pẹ̀lú ìlànà bí a ṣe n lò ó.

DEFINITION: Emergency Plan for AIDS Relief (PEPFAR) This is a United States governmental initiative to address the global HIV/AIDS epidemic and help save the lives of those suffering from the disease, primarily in Africa.
TRANSLATION: fún ààrùn ìṣọdọ̀lẹ àjẹsára Ètò yìí wà fún ààbò àwọn tó n gbé pẹ̀lú KASA àti ààrùn ìṣọdọ̀lẹ àjẹsára ní ilẹ̀ adúláwọ̀.

DEFINITION: counselling This is client counselling that is done before undergoing a HIV test.
TRANSLATION: Ìgbaniníyànjú tí a ṣe s ̣áájú àyẹ̀wò KASA.

DEFINITION: measure of the proportion of people in a population affected with a particular disease at a given time.
TRANSLATION: àìsàn Òs ̣ùwọ̀n iye àwọn ènìyàn tó ṣe àgbákò ààrùn ní ìgbà kan pàtó.

DEFINITION: of Mother-to-child Transmission Prevention of mother-to-child transmission (PMTCT) programmes provide antiretroviral treatment to HIV-positive pregnant women to stop their infants from acquiring the virus.
TRANSLATION: sí ọmọ Ètò ìdènà ìkóràn ìyá sí í ọmọ pèsè ìtọ́jú òògùn apa KASA lára aláboyún tó n gbé pẹ̀lú KASA láti dènà kíkó kòkòrò yìí ran ọmọ.

DEFINITION: medical services These are services to prevent people from getting sick and detecting diseases and conditions before they become serious.
TRANSLATION: Èyí ni àwọn tí wọ́n wà fún àwọn ènìyàn tí wọn kòle dá ara wọn tọ́jú.

DEFINITION: vaccine The branch of vaccines whose main aim is the prevention of disease.
TRANSLATION: yà àjẹsára tí ó ń ṣe iṣẹ́ ìdènà ààrùn. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 220

DEFINITION: caregivers These are people who are primarily responsible for members of the family who are unable to care for themselves. A primary caregiver is the person who takes primary responsibility for someone who cannot care fully for themselves. It may be a family member, a trained professional or another individual. Depending on culture there may be various members of the family engaged in care.
TRANSLATION: tó Èyí ni àwọn tí wọ́n n s ̣e ètò ìtó ̣jú wà fún àwọn mọ̀lẹ́bí tí wọn kò sì le dá ara wọn tọ́jú. Afunninítọ̀ọ́jú alarọ̀wọ́tó jẹ ènìyàn tí ó ni pjuse láti ṣe itọju ẹni ti ko le da ara rẹ tọ́jú. Ó lè jẹ́ mọ̀lẹ́bi, akọ́sẹ́-mọ́sẹ́ tabi ẹnikẹ́ni. Eyi wa lori aṣa ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ mọlẹbi ni o le se iṣẹ́ yìí.

DEFINITION: member of an order of mammals with a large brain and complex hands and feet, including humans, apes, and monkeys.
TRANSLATION: àti ọ̀bọ Ẹgbẹ́ àwọn afọ́mọlọ́mú tí wọ́n ní ọpọlọ ńlá, ọwọ́ àti ẹsẹ̀ aṣéṣe ohun púpọ̀ bíi ènìyàn, ìnàkí àti ọ̀bọ.

DEFINITION: symptom that indicates the onset of a disease.
TRANSLATION: Àmì ìbẹ̀rẹ̀ ààrùn.

DEFINITION: forecast of the probable outcome or course of a disease.
TRANSLATION: ohun tó s ̣eésẹ̀ kó sẹlẹ̀ tàbí ìdí àìsàn.

DEFINITION: Multifocal Leukoencepha- lopathy (PML) Progressive Multifocal Leukoencepha- lopathy is a rare and usually fatal viral disease characterized by progressive damage (-pathy) or inflammation of the white matter (leuko-) of the brain
TRANSLATION: PML jé ̣ èyí tí kò wó ̣pò ̣, ṣùgbó ̣n tí ó léwu jọjọ. Díè ̣díè ̣ ni ó máa n pa e ̣ni tí àje ̣sára rè ̣ bá ti mé ̣he ̣. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 221 (-encephalo-) at multiple locations (multifocal). It is caused by the JC virus, which is harmless except in cases of weakened immune systems.

DEFINITION: means taken to prevent disease, such as immunization against diphtheria or whooping cough or fluoridation to prevent dental decay in children.
TRANSLATION: Gbogbo ọ̀nà tá a mọ̀ láti ṣe ìtọ́jú/ìdíwọ́ àìsàn bí abẹ́rẹ́ àjẹsára lọ́wọ́ ikọ́ líle tàbí ọ̀nà gbígbèrú láti se ìdíwọ́ ehín kíkẹ̀ fún ọmọde.

DEFINITION: is the exchange of sex for money. The majority of prostitutes are women who sell their services to men. There are some men also who sell their services.
TRANSLATION: Iṣẹ́ síṣe ìbálòpọ̀ fún owó. Ọ̀ pọ̀ àwọn olówò nàbì yìí jẹ́ obìnrin. Àwọn ọkùnrin mìíràn náà wà tí máa ń siṣẹ́ òwò nàbì yìí.

DEFINITION: enzyme that hydrolyzes (i.e. breaks down) proteins to their component peptides.
TRANSLATION: purotéènì Ẹnsáìmú afọ́ purotéènì sínú peptide.

DEFINITION: inhibitors HIV protease is an aspartyl enzyme essential to the replicative life cycle of HIV. The three-dimensional molecular structure of the HIV protease has been fully determined. Pharmaceutical developers are therefore able to rationally design compounds to inhibit it and thus interfere with the replication of the virus.
TRANSLATION: purotéènì Adènà KASA jẹ́ àkànṣe ẹnsáìmù tí ó wúlò fún àtúnṣe ìyípò KASA. Ìlànà mólékù oníṣepọ̀ mẹ́ta tí ó jẹ́ ẹnsáìmù afọ́ purotéénì ni ati dámọ̀. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 222

DEFINITION: barriers Any material that constitutes a shield for reducing the risk of exposure to harm.
TRANSLATION: Ohunkóhun tí ó le dènà ewu ìkóràn.

DEFINITION: of the three nutrients used as energy sources (calories) by the body. Protein molecule is a complex structure made up of one or more chains of amino acids, which are linked by peptide bonds.
TRANSLATION: Purotéènì Ọ̀ kan lára ohun asaralóre méta tí a n lò láti gba agbára (kálórì) sí ara. Mólékù purotéènì ni ó jẹ́ èyí tóní ẹyọkan tàbí ọ̀pọ̀ àwọn amino ásìdì, tó jàn mọ́ ìdì purotéènì.

DEFINITION: detailed plan for a clinical trial that states the trial's rationale, purpose, drug or vaccine dosages, length of study, routes of administration, who may participate and other aspects of trial design.
TRANSLATION: fún ìwádìí ajẹmọ́tọ́jú tí ó sọ nípa ọgbọ́n, ìdí, òògùn tàbí iye òògùn àjẹsára, ìwọ́n iye ẹ̀kọ́, ipa ìṣàkóso ti àwọn akópa àti àwọn nǹkan míìràn.

DEFINITION: general term for the colloidal complex of protein that constitutes the living material of a cell. It includes cytoplasm and nucleoplasm. Omi
TRANSLATION: ìperí tóní àkànṣe purotéènì tó ní èròjà àyè hóró.

DEFINITION: group of one-celled animals. Some protozoa can cause human disease. Kòkòrò
TRANSLATION: tí àwọn ẹranko. Àwọn pòtósúà kan máa n fa àrùn sí ènìyàn.

DEFINITION: Initiated Testing and Counselling (PITC) Screening for HIV infection that occurs on the recommendation of a health care provider such as a doctor or nurse.
TRANSLATION: olùtọ́ jú Àyẹ̀wò àti ìgbìyànjú olùtọ́jú. Wíwá ìkóràn KASA nítorí pé onímọ̀ ìṣègùn fọ́wọ́ síi. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 223

DEFINITION: Papular Eruption (PPE) Pruritic papular eruption of HIV (Human Immunodeficiency Virus) is often reported as the most common rash seen in HIV infection.
TRANSLATION: Èyí jẹ́ ìkóràn KASA nípa ara sísú.
Pseudovirion A virus-like particle. Ẹ̀ rùn ajọ kòkòrò Ẹ̀ rùn ajọ kòkòrò.

DEFINITION: Psoriasis is a long-lasting autoimmune disease characterized by patches of abnormal skin. These skin patches are typically red, itchy, and scaly.
TRANSLATION: Ààrùn ìtìpẹ́pẹ́ ara jẹ́ àpẹẹrẹ àìbójúmu ara tí ó lè jẹ́ pupa, yíyún àti aṣekale.

DEFINITION: Health Service (PHS) The Public Health Service (PHS) is the operating division of the Health and Human Services Department (HHS) responsible for promoting the protection and advancement of the American population's physical and mental well-being.
TRANSLATION: ilera gbogboogbò Iṣẹ́ ilera gbogboogbò. Ilé is ̣é ̣ yìí ló n s ̣aáyan ìlékún ìdáàbòbò ìlera àwo ̣n ará Amé ̣ríkà.

DEFINITION: health specialists Experts in the overall health of the community.
TRANSLATION: gbogboogbò Alámọ̀já nípa ìlera gbogbo àwùjo ̣.

DEFINITION: health workers Community health workers (CHWs) are frontline public health workers who have a close understanding of the community they serve.
TRANSLATION: gbogboogbo Òsìṣẹ́ ìlera gbogboogbo ni àwọn òsìṣẹ́ ìlera tí wọ́n ní ìmọ̀ nípa agbèègbè tíwọn n siṣẹ́ fún.
Pulmonary Pertaining to the lungs. Ajẹmọ́ ẹ̀dọ̀fórá Ajẹmọ́ ẹ̀dọ̀fóró. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 224

DEFINITION: artery Either of two arteries that carry blood in need of oxygen from the right side of the heart to the lungs.
TRANSLATION: ̣jáde ajẹmó ̣ è ̣dò ̣fóró Èyíkéyìí nínú àwọn òpó agbé ̣jè ̣jáde tí ó nílò até ̣gùn láti apá ò ̣tún ọkàn sínú ẹ̀dọ̀fóró.
Pulmonary edema Accumulation of fluid in the lungs. Àrogún oje nínú ẹ̀dọ̀fóró Ákójọpọ̀ ísọ̀n nínú ẹ̀jẹ̀.

DEFINITION: valve A device that controls the movement of liquids or gases through pipes or other passages by opening or closing of the channels.
TRANSLATION: Irinṣẹ́ tó n darí ìrìn ṣíṣàn tàbí gáásì nínú àwon ọ̀pá oníhò tàbí àwon àyè nípa ṣíṣí tàbí títì èbúté ọkọ̀ ojú omi àti ìsàlẹ̀ odò.

DEFINITION: vein One of the four veins that carry oxygen-rich blood from the lungs to the left side of the heart.
TRANSLATION: ẹ̀dọ̀ fóró Ọ̀ kan lára ọ̀pá mẹ́rin tó n pín ẹ́jẹ̀ láti inú ẹ̀dọ̀fóró sí apá òsì ọkàn.

DEFINITION: regular expansion and contraction of an artery, caused by the heart pumping blood through the body. It can be felt through an artery that is near the surface such as the one in the wrist on the same side as the thumb.
TRANSLATION: àti ìgékúrú ọ̀pá apín ẹ̀jẹ̀ jade, tówá látipasè pípọ̀mpù ẹ̀jẹ̀ láti inú ọkàn sí gbogbo ara.

DEFINITION: rate Number of peripheral arterial pulsations palpated in a minute.
TRANSLATION: Ìwọn iye lílù tó wáyè nínú ọkàn fún ìṣẹ́jú kan.

DEFINITION: is any of several diseases characterized by small haemorrhages under the skin.
TRANSLATION: kan lára àrùn púpọ̀ tí ohun sokùnfa ẹ̀jẹ̀ wíwọ̀ lábẹ́ ara.

DEFINITION: Pyrazinamide is a drug used to treat tuberculosis. The drug is largely
TRANSLATION: Oògùn tí a fí n ṣe ìtọ́jú ikọ́fe. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 225 bacteriostatic, but can be bacteriocidal on actively replicating tuberculosis bacteria.

DEFINITION: Enforced isolation of people or animals that may have been exposed to a contagious or infectious disease, e.g. when entering a country.
TRANSLATION: agbára ṣe ìyàsọ́tọ̀ ènìyàn tàbí ẹranko tóní àrùn ìkóràn, àpẹẹrẹ, tí a bá n wọ orílè-èdè kan lọ.

DEFINITION: trial A study in which participants are randomly assigned to either a treatment arm or placebo arm of a clinical trial.
TRANSLATION: kọ́ ní èyí tí àwọn akópa aláìtò-lọ́wọ̀ọ̀wọ́ yálà sí apá ìtọ́jú tàbí apá pílásíbò ti ìwádìí ìṣègùn.

DEFINITION: crime of using force to have sexual intercourse with somebody.
TRANSLATION: Ẹ̀ sẹ̀ fífi ipá báni lòpọ̀.

DEFINITION: Diagnostic Test (RDT) This is a fast test taken to find out what kind of disease a person has.
TRANSLATION: àìsàn kánkán láti mọ irú ààrùn tí ènìyàn ní

DEFINITION: feedback Rapid-feedback evaluation is a method to improve the retention rates of an HIV/AIDS health care intervention.
TRANSLATION: yíyára egbò dẹ́kun ní ọ̀nà làti se ìmúgbòòrò bá iye kòkòkò àti éèdì.

DEFINITION: test kit These are the materials used for actualizing same-day result test.
TRANSLATION: Àwọn ohun èlò tí à ń lò fún àyẹ̀wò elésì òòjọ́ .

DEFINITION: temporary eruption on the skin, usually typified by reddening − either discrete red spots or generalized reddening − which may be accompanied by itching.
TRANSLATION: fún ìgbà díè ní àgọ́ ara, ó sábà n yọ bi pípọ́n − yálà dídáwà àbàwọ́n pupa tàbí àkójọpọ̀ pípọ́n − tó lè mú yíyún lọ. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 226

DEFINITION: test When a test sample for HIV is positive (HIV infected), it is called a reactive test.
TRANSLATION: KASA tó já sí bé ̣è ̣ ni.

DEFINITION: capacity to produce adverse reactions.
TRANSLATION: Agbára àti pèsè ìṣeṣí alálánfàní.

DEFINITION: molecule on the surface of a cell that serves as a recognition or binding site for antigens, antibodies or other cellular or immunological components.
TRANSLATION: pèpele hóró tó n siṣẹ́ síṣèdámọ̀ tàbí jẹ́ àbùdá fún àjèjì adáralóró, sọ́jà tàbí àwon hóró mìíran tàbí ẹyọ- inú àjẹsára.

DEFINITION: medicine, someone who receives something from a donor, such as a blood transfusion or a kidney transplant.
TRANSLATION: ìṣègùn, eni tó gba nkan lọ́wọ́ ọlọ́rẹ, bi gbígba ẹ̀jẹ̀ tàbi ìpàrọ̀ iwe.

DEFINITION: organism whose genome contains integrated genetic material from a different organism.
TRANSLATION: Àwon oníye tí ètò ara ènìyàn tóní àwon ohun èlò ese jinni láti ara orísirísi oníye.

DEFINITION: last 6 to 8 inches of the large intestine. The rectum stores faeces until defecation.
TRANSLATION: ìda mẹ́fà sí mẹ́jọ ìfun nlá. Abọ́dìí máa n tọ́jú ìgbẹ́ títí di ìgbà tí a yà á dànù.

DEFINITION: blood cell Any red-coloured cell in blood that contains haemoglobin and carries oxygen to the tissues.
TRANSLATION: Èyíkéyì hóró ẹ̀jẹ̀ tóní atégùn tó n gbẹ́ ẹ̀dá ara sínú ẹ̀jẹ̀.

DEFINITION: zone A particular area that is prone to infectious disease.
TRANSLATION: tó sése kóní ààrùn ìkóràn. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 227

DEFINITION: of the eye This is a condition by which the eyes become hyperaemic and appears to turn red.
TRANSLATION: Ipò kí ojú máa pọ́n.

DEFINITION: form A document for directing a patient to an appropriate specialist or agency for definitive treatment.
TRANSLATION: ìfisọ́ wọ ajẹmọ́ lera Fọ́ọ́mù tí a fí n rán aláìsàn lọ sí ibùdó ìtọ́jú tó dántọ́ fún síṣe ìdámọ̀ àìsàn àti ìtọ́jú ààrùn wọ́n.

DEFINITION: genes As related to HIV: Three regulatory HIV genes − tat, rev and nef − and three so-called auxiliary genes − vif, vpr and vpu − contain information for the production of proteins that control (i.e. regulate) the virus' ability to infect a cell, produce new copies of the virus or cause disease.
TRANSLATION: Ajẹmọ́ KASA, ẹyọ-ìran KASA nígbà gbogbo àti àwon aṣèrànwọ̀ ẹyọ-ìran tóní ìmọ̀ ẹ̀rí nípa ìpèsè purotéènì tó n darí agbára kòkòrò láti kó ààrùn ran hóró, kí ósì wá pèsè ẹ̀dà kòkòrò tuntun tàbí fa àrùn.

DEFINITION: cells T cells that direct other immune cells to perform special functions. The chief regulatory cell, the CD4+ T cell or T helper cell, is HIV's chief target.
TRANSLATION: nà Àwo ̣n hóró T tó ṣè ìdarí àwon hóró àjẹsára mìíran láti máa pèsè ìṣẹ́ àkàns ̣e. Olórí àwon adarí hóró, ni olùrànlọ́wọ́ hóró T ni olórí àfojúsùn KASA.

DEFINITION: by family Rejection by family is the physical and or emotional distancing between at least two family members in an arrangement which is usually considered unsatisfactory by at least one involved party.
TRANSLATION: ẹbí ni yíyẹra nípa ara àti ẹ̀dùn, ó kéré tán láàrin ẹbí méjì tó jẹ́ àkànṣe ohun tí kò tẹ́nilọ́rùn nípa ẹnìkan. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 228

DEFINITION: of Ebola disease Little is known about Ebola relapse because this is considered to be rare. Severe, sudden illness associated with the detection of the Ebola virus in the body of a person who has recovered from an initial infection was first documented in 2015.
TRANSLATION: Ebola Díè ̣ la mò ̣ nípa ìfàṣẹ́yìn àrùn Ebola nítorí kò wó ̣pò ̣. Ní o ̣dún 2015 ni a s ̣è ̣s ̣è ̣ rí àko ̣sílè ̣ nípa àárè ̣ líle tó n s ̣e e ̣ni tó jà bó ̣ ló ̣wó ̣ às ̣è ̣s ̣è ̣kó Ebola.

DEFINITION: fever An acute infectious disease caused by spirochetes of the genus borrelia and transmitted by the bite of the genus ornithodoros and of body lice.
TRANSLATION: ààrùn ńlá ibà iná orí nípa ohun tó tani.

DEFINITION: lessening of the severity or duration of outbreaks of a disease, or the abatement (diminution in degree or intensity) of symptoms altogether over a period of time.
TRANSLATION: bá ohun ìdíbàjẹ́ tàbí iye àkókò àjàkálè ààrùn, tàbí ìfàsẹ́hìn àìsàn l’ápapọ̀ fún ìgbà àkókò kan.
Renal Pertaining to the kidneys. Ajẹmọ́ kíndìnrín Nípa ti kíndìnrín.

DEFINITION: feeding
TRANSLATION: Alternative to breastfeeding. Ìrọ́ pò ìfọ́ mọlọ́ yàn Ìrọ́pò ìfọ́mọlọ́yàn.

DEFINITION: turning back, repetition, duplication, reproduction. It is a process by which DNA makes copies of itself when the cell divides. The two strands of the DNA molecule unwind and each strand directs the synthesis of a new strand complementary to itself.
TRANSLATION: àṣetúnṣe, àtúntè, bíbí. Ìgbésè tí DNA se ẹ̀dà púpọ̀ nígbà tí hóró bá pín. Ìpín mólékù DNA yi dẹ̀, léyì tí ìpín kọ̀ọ̀kan darí ìsopọ̀ ìpín tuntun sí ìdàkejì ara rẹ̀. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 229 1285 Reproductive health Reproductive health is defined as a state of physical, mental, and social well-being in all matters relating to the reproductive system, at all stages of life. Ìlera ajẹmọ́ ìbí Ìlera bíbí ẹ̀dá túmọ̀ sí ipò ìlera ara, ọpọlọ, ayọ̀ àti àláfìa àwùjọ ní ìbámu pẹ̀lú ọ́rọ̀ tó jẹmọ́ ètò bíbí, ní gbogbo ìpele láyé.

DEFINITION: degree of immunity that the body possesses: a measure of its ability to withstand disease.
TRANSLATION: àjẹsára tí ara ní: ìwọ̀n iye agbára láti foríti àìsàn.

DEFINITION: arrest Respiratory failure is inadequate gas exchange by the respiratory system, with the result that levels of arterial oxygen, carbon dioxide or both cannot be maintained within their normal ranges.
TRANSLATION: ìmísímú-ìmísíta jẹ́ pàsípàrọ̀ ètò ìmísímú-ìmísíta fún àító gáásì pẹ̀lú ìrètí pé àtẹ́gùn inú ọkàn kòle sàmúdúró síṣe déédé wọn.

DEFINITION: to Ebola The way in which the body or part of the body reacts to the symptoms of Ebola.
TRANSLATION: Ebola Ọ̀ nà tí ara tàbí apá kan lára ṣe ṣesí sí àmí àìsàn Ebola.

DEFINITION: to HIV/ AIDS The way in which the body or part of the body reacts to the disease of HIV/AIDS.
TRANSLATION: ààrùn ìsọdọ̀lẹ àjẹsára Ọ̀ nà tí ara tàbí apá kan lára ṣe ṣesí sí KASA àti ààrùn ìṣọdọ̀lẹ àjẹsára.

DEFINITION: Ebolavirus Reston virus is one of five known viruses within the genus Ebolavirus. Reston virus causes Ebola virus disease in non-human primates; unlike the other four ebolaviruses, it is not Kòròrò Ebola Reston
TRANSLATION: Ebola Reston jé ̣ ò ̣kan lára àwọn kòkòrò márùn- ún tó n fa Ẹ̀bólà. Ṣùgbó ̣n lára ẹranko ni ó ti n fà á. Ọdún 1990 ni ó s ̣è ̣s ̣è ̣ hànde. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 230 known to cause disease in humans, but has caused asymptomatic infections. Reston virus was first described in 1990 as a new "strain" of Ebola virus (EBOV).

DEFINITION: endothelial cells A system of interstitial cells that includes all the phagocytic cells, which trap and consume foreign agents, except the leukocytes circulating in the bloodstream. This system forms a network throughout the body and is another of the body's defence systems against invading organisms in the connective tissues of the body.
TRANSLATION: àwón hóró tóní oje ara, èyí máa n yọmijáde, ó tún ní gbogbo àwọn hóró tó n mú àwọn ohun èlò tí kò fẹ́, èyí máa n pa asojú àjèjì yàtọ̀ sí hóró omi ara tó ṣànyíká gbogbo inú ẹ̀jẹ̀. Èyí wá jẹ́ ìsopọ̀ sí gbogbo ara, tí ó si jẹ́ àbò fún ara mìíràn lòdí sí ìkọjú ìjà sí àwọn oníye tó n so ìṣù mọ́ ara.

DEFINITION: Light-sensitive tissue at the back of the eye that transmits visual impulses via the optic nerve to the brain.
TRANSLATION: ojú Kókó iná ìṣù lẹ́yìn ojú tó jẹ́ àtagbà agbára ìrọlù rírí nípa ẹ̀sọ ti ojú sí ọpọlọ.

DEFINITION: Inflammation of the retina, linked in AIDS to CMV infection. If it becomes untreated, it can lead to blindness.
TRANSLATION: inú ojú Agbòji wíwú tó sopọ̀ mọ́ àrùn ìṣọdọ̀lẹ àjẹsára sí àrùn CMV. Tó bá fi lè di aláìṣetọ́jú, ó lè yọrí sí ìfọ́jú.

DEFINITION: syringe Non-smart syringes that have been used once before for any purpose and reintroduced for use again with or without sterilization.
TRANSLATION: àlòtúnlò abẹ́rẹ́ tí a ti lò té ̣le ̣ yálà a so ̣ ó ̣ dò ̣tun tàbí a kò sọ ó ̣ dọtun. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 231

DEFINITION: of the regulatory genes of the HIV virus. Three HIV regulatory genes − tat, rev and nef − and three so-called auxiliary genes − vif, vpr and vpu − contain information necessary for the production of proteins that control the virus's ability to infect a cell, produce new copies of the virus or cause disease.
TRANSLATION: REV Ọ̀ kan lára aṣèdarí ẹyọ-ìran KASA. Mẹ̀ta àṣèdarí ẹyọ- ìran KASA àti àwon aṣèrànwọ̀ ẹyọ- ìran tí óní ìmọ̀ ẹ̀rí nípa ìpèsè purotéènì tó n darí agbára kòkòrò láti kó àrùn ran hóró, kí ósì wá pèsè ẹ̀dà kòkòrò tuntun tàbí fa àrùn.

DEFINITION: transcriptase An enzyme that permits DNA to be made, using RNA as the template. An enzyme found mainly in retroviruses that catalyses the synthesis of DNA from RNA. It enables the viral RNA to be integrated into the host DNA.
TRANSLATION: aparadà Ẹ́ nsàìmù tó n fàyè gba DNA kó seése nípa lílo ẹ̀yà RNA). Ẹ́ nsàìmù tá a rí nínú òògùn kòkòrò tó n pín ìdá DNA láti RNA. Ó mú kí kòkòrò RNA láti dàpọ̀ mọ́ agbàlejò DNA.

DEFINITION: factor A group of antigens that may or may not be present on the surface of the blood cells, it forms the basis of the rhesus blood group system. Most people have the rhesus factor, i.e. they have Rh-positive.
TRANSLATION: Àkójọpọ̀ àjèjì adáralóró tóle wà tàbí àìsí nínú pèpele àwọn hóró ẹ̀jẹ̀, ló n dígun ilé fún ètò ìṣọ̀rí ẹ̀jẹ̀ résọ̀sì. Ọ̀ pọ̀ ènìyàn lóní ìpín résọ̀sì.

DEFINITION: negative The absence of Rhesus factor on the surface of an individual’s blood cells.
TRANSLATION: sì Àìní ìpín résọ́sì lójú hóró è ̣jè ̣ ẹnìkan.

DEFINITION: positive The presence of Rhesus factor on the surface of an individual’s blood cells.
TRANSLATION: ọ̀sì Níní ìpín résọ́sì lójú hóró è ̣jè ̣ ẹnìkan. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 232

DEFINITION: fever A non-contagious acute fever marked by inflammation and pain in the joints. It chiefly affects young people and is caused by a streptococcal infection.
TRANSLATION: líle tí kì í ràn tí ó je ̣ mó ̣ eegun títa àti ríro. Ó wó ̣pò ̣ láàrin àwo ̣n ò ̣dó ̣.

DEFINITION: acid (RNA) A nucleic acid, found mostly in the cytoplasm of cells, which is important in the synthesis of proteins. The amount of RNA varies from cell to cell. RNA, like the structurally similar DNA, is a chain made up of subunits called nucleotides. In protein synthesis, messenger RNA (mRNA) replicates the DNA code for a protein and moves to sites in the cell called ribosomes.
TRANSLATION: ìwò ààrùn ojú tí a sábà n rí nínú oje hóró tó ṣe pàtàkì fún ìdá purotéènì. Iye RNA máa n yàtọ̀ láti ara hóró kan sí hóró mìíràn, RNA jẹ́ oníbátan DNA nínú okùn tóní àwọn ẹ̀ka tí a n pè ní agbéròjà inú hóró.

DEFINITION: cytoplasmic organelle composed of ribonucleic acid and protein that functions in the synthesis of protein. Ribosomes interact with messenger RNA and transfer RNA to join together amino acid units into a polypeptide chain according to the sequence determined by the genetic code.
TRANSLATION: Oje hóró tóní ilé ásídì àti ìkójọ purotéènì tó n siṣẹ́ ìdá purotéènì. Agbéròjà inú hóró máa n ní ìbáṣepọ̀ pẹ̀lú òjíṣẹ́ RNA, kí ó sì gbẹwọ inú RNA láti jànpọ̀ mọ́ hóró peptide gẹ́gẹ́ bi ìlànà tí kóòdù jinni múwá.

DEFINITION: Rifampicin, also known as rifampin, is an antibiotic used to treat a number of bacterial infections.
TRANSLATION: rifampicin Òògùn apa kòkòrò batéríà là ńlò láti tọ́jú ọ̀pọ̀ àrùn ìkóràn batéríà. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 233

DEFINITION: auricle (of the heart) The right auricle of the heart is a small, cone-shaped pouch which comes out from the upper and front part of the atrium and overlaps the root of the aorta. It is muscular, and pumps deoxygenated blood from the bloodstream into the heart's right ventricle.
TRANSLATION: òkè ọ̀tún Ẹ̀ yà etí ìta tó yọrí jáde láti orí. Ó jẹ́ ìyẹ̀wù tí ẹ̀jẹ̀ n gbà wọnú ọkàn.

DEFINITION: ventricle The right ventricle pumps blood received from the vanae cavae (via the right atrium) into the pulmonary artery.
TRANSLATION: apá ìsàlẹ̀ ọ̀tún Ìyẹ̀wù- odò ọ̀tún máa gba ẹ̀jẹ̀ tí wọn n pọ́mpù látara ìyẹ̀wù òkè ọkàn ọ̀tún sínú ọ̀pá apín ẹ̀jẹ̀ jáde sínú ẹ̀dọ̀fóró.

DEFINITION: communication The process by which national and local government authorities provide information to the public in an understandable, timely, transparent and coordinated manner before, during and after a crisis; also promotes effective exchange of information and opinion among scientists, public health and veterinary experts during the alert phase to better assess, manage and coordinate preparedness and response activities.
TRANSLATION: nà tí orílẹ̀-èdè àti ìjọba ibílẹ̀ ń gbà ṣe ìfitónilétí fún gbogboogbò lọ́nà tí yóó yéni, ní àkókò lọ́nà tóyè koro àti ní ètò tí ó gáyátà sáájú, ní àsìkò àti lẹ́yìn ewu, tí ó sì ń ṣe ìgbélárugẹ pàsípàrọ̀ tí ó múnádóko fún ìfitónilétí àti èrò àwọn onímọ̀ ìjìnlẹ̀, akọ́sẹ́mọṣẹ́ fún ìfitóniléti àti èrò àwọn onímọ̀ ìjìnlẹ̀, akọ́ṣẹ́mọṣẹ́ nípa ẹranko àti ìlera gbogboogbò lásìkò ìfitónilétí fún sísàmúlò, àti ìdarí ìgbaradì pẹ̀lú èsì ìṣẹ́. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 234

DEFINITION: factor Something that increases a person's chances of developing a disease, such as a habit (cigarette smoking) or exposure to some environmental hazards, that leads the individual concerned to have a greater likelihood of developing an illness. Òǹfa ewu
TRANSLATION: n mú ọ̀pọ̀ ànfàní ènìyàn pọ̀ láti kó àrùn. Bi àsà (sìgá mímu) tàbí ìfihàn sí ewu àyíká, tó n mú kíi ènìyàn ní ore-ọ̀fẹ́ láti ṣe àìsàn.

DEFINITION: reduction In epidemiology, risk reduction can be absolute or relative.The absolute risk reduction is the change in the risk of an outcome of a given treatment or activity in relation to a comparison treatment or activity. The relative risk reduction is a measure calculated by dividing the absolute risk reduction by the control event rate.
TRANSLATION: Nínú è ̣kó ̣ àjàkálè ̣ àrùn, àdínkù ewu le ní ìdí, ó sì le má ní ìdí.

DEFINITION: (RTV) Ritonavir (RTV) is an antiretroviral medication used along with other medications to treat HIV/AIDS. This combination treatment is known as highly active antiretroviral therapy (HAART). Often, a low dose is used with other protease inhibitors.
TRANSLATION: ritonavir A máa n lo òògùn apa kòkòrò pẹ̀lú àwọn òògùn mìíràn fún ìtọ́jú KASA àti àrùn ìṣọdọ̀lẹ àjẹsára. Ìdàpọ̀ òògùn ìtọ́jú yìí ni amọ̀ sí òògùn KASA líletí a máa ń lò mọ́ adènà KASA afọ́ purotéènì.

DEFINITION: of infection A root canal procedure is performed when the nerve of the tooth becomes infected or the pulp becomes damaged. Gbòǹgbò
TRANSLATION: odò lílà ni a n ṣe nígbà tí ìmọ̀lára eyín bá kó ààrùn tàbí tí kò ìs ̣ù rè ̣ bá ti bàjẹ́. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 235

DEFINITION: acute contagious disease that is milder than typical measles but is damaging to a baby when occurring early in pregnancy. Can cause a flu- like disease with joint pain in adults.
TRANSLATION: Rubella Ààrùn tó n ràn tí kò le tó gbajúgbajà àrùn kítìpí lọ, ṣùgbọ́n ó le somọ́ ìdì alábò- ara tóbá tètè yọ ní ìbẹ̀rẹ̀ pẹ̀pẹ̀ oyún. Ó lè fa àjàkálẹ̀ àrùn tó n fa orikèríkè ara ríro fún àwọn àgbàlagbà.

DEFINITION: white CARE Act The Ryan White Comprehensive AIDS Resources Emergency (CARE) Act of 1990 represents the largest dollar investment made by the US Congress to date specifically for the provision of services for people with HIV infection. Òfin Ryan white
TRANSLATION: ni ṣe ìmúgbòrò dídára àti fún wíwà ìtọ́jú tó péye fún gbogbo énìyàn àti àwọn tó n gbé pẹ̀lú ìkóràn KASA.

DEFINITION: sex Safe sex is a sexual activity engaged in by people who have taken precautions to protect themselves against sexually transmitted infections (STIs) such as HIV.
TRANSLATION: dájú Ìbálòpọ̀ aláìléwu tí àwọn ènìyàn n ṣe ní ò ̣nà àtidènà kíkó àrùn ìbálòpọ̀ bi KASA.

DEFINITION: box These are the things that are needed to prevent accident in the company or hospital.
TRANSLATION: Ìgbéṣẹ̀ tó n dènà ìjàmbá tàbí ìpalára ní iléeṣẹ́ tàbí ilé ìwòsàn.

DEFINITION: solution In medicine, saline (also saline solution) is a general phrase referring to a sterile solution of sodium chloride (NaCl, more commonly known as
TRANSLATION: a bá lo omi iyọ̀, à máa n rí ipò ìlera nígbà tí a bá lò sínú iṣọ̀n-ẹ̀jẹ̀, àyábẹ̀, àbàjáde omi iyọ̀ a máa yọrí sí àbàjáde omi. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 236 table salt) in water, but is only sterile when it is to be placed parenterally (such as intravenously); otherwise, a saline solution is a salt water solution.

DEFINITION: watery secretion in the mouth produced by the salivary glands that aids in the digestion of starch.
TRANSLATION: láti ẹnu tó jẹ́ ìpèsè ẹṣẹ́ itọ́ tó n ṣèrànwọ́ àti fó ̣ oúnje ̣ aje ̣mó ̣ s ̣úgà sí wẹ́wẹ́.

DEFINITION: Salmonella is a genus of rod-shaped Gram-negative bacteria of the Enterobacteriaceae family.
TRANSLATION: Salmonella Batéríà Salmonella jẹ ọ̀kan lára ẹbí batéríà.

DEFINITION: and warm water A readily available aqeous solution with potentials for use as a home remedy.
TRANSLATION: alọ́ wọ́ rọ́ Èyí ni ọ̀nà lílo àpòpò ̣ omi tó lọ́wọ́rọ́ àti iyọ̀ fún ìtọ́jú nínú ilé.

DEFINITION: therapy Salvage therapy, also known as rescue therapy, is a form of therapy given after an ailment does not respond to standard therapy. The most common diseases that require salvage therapy are HIV and various tumors. The word is not clearly defined; it is used both to mean a second attempt and a final attempt.
TRANSLATION: Ìtọ́jú àgbẹ́milà ni a tún mọ̀ sí ìtọ́jú adóòlà ẹ̀mí. Ọ̀ kàn lára ìtọ́jú tí a máa n fún aláìsàn lẹyin ìgbà tí ara ba kọ ìgbékalẹ̀ ìlànà ìtọju. Àwọn àìsàn tí a sábà maa n lọ itoju agbèmílà fún ni KASA àti orísìírísìí ìsù- èèmọ́. Ọ̀ rọ̀ yìí kò ni oríkì kan tí o gúnmọ́, a máa n lò ó láti túmọ̀ si ìgbìyànjú keji ati igbiyanju ìkẹyìn.

DEFINITION: small part or quantity of something, such as blood or soil, for scientific or medical examination or analysis.
TRANSLATION: Ìwọ̀n kékeré nǹkan bíi ẹ̀jẹ̀ tàbí ilẹ̀ fun ìwádìí àti àlàyé ajemọ́- sáyènsì tàbí ìlera. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 237

DEFINITION: condition Sanitation generally refers to the provision of facilities and services for the safe disposal of human waste.
TRANSLATION: ̣tótó ni pípèsè ohun èlò àti iṣẹ́ fún dida ìdọ̀tí ọmọnìyàn nú ní aláìmú ewu dání.

DEFINITION: study and maintenance of public health and hygiene, especially the water supply and sewage systems.
TRANSLATION: kọ́ nípa ìtọ́jú ìlera gbogboogbo àti ìmọ̀tótó páàpáà ètò fífúnni lómi àti omi sísàn lọ.

DEFINITION: Sanitizers are substances or preparation designed to kill germs.
TRANSLATION: tótó Ohun èlò ìmọ́tótótó ní àwọn èròjà tàbí ìpalẹ̀mọ́ tí a la kalẹ láti pa àwọn kòkòrò.

DEFINITION: gel Sanitizer gel is a supplement or alternative to hand washing with soap and water. Many preparations are available, including gel, foam, and liquid solutions.
TRANSLATION: Ìpawọ́ apa-kòkòrò ni ọnà mìíràn sí fifi ọsẹ àti omi fọ ọwọ́ ẹni. Ọ̀ pọ̀ ìpèsè rẹ ni ó wa tí o fi mọ́ ìpawọ́, fóòmù àti ohun olómi.

DEFINITION: (SQV) Saquinavir (SQV) is an antiretroviral drug used together with other medications to treat or prevent HIV/AIDS.
TRANSLATION: Saquinavir Òògùn Saquinavir jẹ́ òògùn apa kòkòrò. A máa n loó pẹ̀lú àwọn ẹ̀yà òògùn mìíràn fún ìtọ́jú tàbí ìdènà KASA àti ààrùn ìṣọdọ̀lẹ àjẹsára.

DEFINITION: of a group of tumors usually arising from connective tissues. These tumors may occur in any part of the body, as they arise in the tissues that make up an organ rather than being restricted to a particular organ.
TRANSLATION: Ọ̀ kan lára ẹ̀yà jẹjẹrẹ tí ó sábà máa n jẹyọ lára ìmọ̀lára. Jẹjẹrẹ yìí lè jẹyọ nibikíbi ni àgọ́ ara, bí wọ́n ṣe maa jẹyọ lára ìmọ̀lára tí o parapọ̀ di ẹ̀yà ara dípò kí wo wà pẹ̀lú ẹ̀yà ara kan ni pàtó. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 238

DEFINITION: fever Infectious disease caused by a bacterium called group A streptococcus.
TRANSLATION: Ààrùn àkóràn tí batéríà tí a mọ̀ sí streptococcus maa n fà.

DEFINITION: of blood This is the process of exposing a sample of the blood specimen to investigative analysis for the detection of relevant infections that may dis- qualify the specimen for clinical use.
TRANSLATION: àyẹ̀wò ẹ̀jẹ̀ ní kíkún láti mò ̣ irúfé ̣ ìkóràn tí ó le dènà lílò ó fún ìwòsàn.

DEFINITION: test This is a test designed to identify those that are not affected by a disease.
TRANSLATION: ṣe ìdámọ̀ àwọn tí ààrùn kò tíì mú.

DEFINITION: is a pouch that hangs below the penis and contains the testes. It consists of an outer thin, widely wrinkled skin.
TRANSLATION: ̣ fé ̣lé ̣fé ̣lé ̣, tí ó hunjo ̣, ní abé ̣ okó. Inú ré ̣ ni àwo ̣n kórópò ̣n wà.

DEFINITION: Excessive secretion of sebum by the sebaceous gland. The glands are enlarged, especially on the nose and central face. The condition predisposes to acne and is common at puberty, usually lasting for a few years.
TRANSLATION: ìsun ti ohun elépo látara èyíkéyì ẹṣẹ́ oje-ara. Àwọn ẹṣẹ́ oje-ara niwọ́n tóbi, páàpáà ní imú àti ààrin ojú. Ipò yìí wọ́pọ̀ ni àkókò ìgbà àgùnbánirọ̀ ìwọn ọdun díẹ̀ náà ni yóó si fi wà.

DEFINITION: dermatitis A chronic inflammatory disease of the skin of unknown etiology (i.e. cause or origin) characterized by moderate erythema; dry, moist or greasy scaling; and yellow crusted patches on various areas, including the mid-parts of the
TRANSLATION: Ààrùn ara wíwú ńlá tí orirun rẹ̀ ò lálàyé alábùdà àwọ̀ pípọ́n, gbígbẹ, tútù tàbí ìgbélọsókè ìlọra, àti àwọn ẹya ara mìíràn bii abẹ ojú, etí tábí agbegbe ojú ara. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 239 face, ears, supraorbital regions (above the orbit of the eye), umbilicus (the navel), genitalia, and especially the scalp.

DEFINITION: Treatment Treatment that is given when initial treatment (first-line therapy) does not work, or stops working.
TRANSLATION: kejì Ìtọ́jú tí a fún- ni nígbà tí ìtọ́jú àìsàn ìbẹ̀rẹ̀ kòbá ṣiṣẹ́ tàbí kọṣẹ́.

DEFINITION: medications Sedatives encompass a wide variety of drugs with different mechanisms of action that can induce depression of the central nervous system (CNS).
TRANSLATION: ifinilọ́ kànbalẹ̀ Ifinilọ́kànbalẹ̀ jẹ́ àkójọpọ̀ orísìírísìí àwon òògùn pẹ̀lú àwọn ohun mìíràn tó n yọrí sí àìsedédé gbùgbun ààrin ìmọ̀lára.

DEFINITION: genital examination A genital self examination is used to check for signs and symptoms that might indicate the presence of a sexually transmitted infection (STI) or to find any abnormalities.
TRANSLATION: ẹni wò Àyẹ̀wò ojú ara ẹni ní a fí ń mọ àmì àti àìsàn tí ó lè ṣàfihàn ààrùn ìbálòpọ́ tàbí ṣe àwárí onírúrú ohun àìyẹ nínú ara.

DEFINITION: fluid that is released through the penis during orgasm. Semen is made up of fluid secreted by the prostate gland and seminal vesicles with a small contribution from Cowper’s glands.
TRANSLATION: ó n jáde láti ojú okó nígbà ìdà omi ara. Àtọ̀ jẹ́ àkójọpọ̀ ìsun oje nípa ibú omi- àtọ̀ àti àtọ̀ àpò-ara kékeré pẹlù àfikún kékeré láti ẹṣẹ́ oje-ara.

DEFINITION: is a process by which the response to a stimulus increases with repeated presentation of that stimulus;
TRANSLATION: Ìlanilọ́ yẹ Eyi ni ìgbésẹ̀ ìgbèrú ìdáhùn imọlara nipa àṣefúnse ìsàfihàn. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 240 for example, increased behavioural response to the same dose of a drug.

DEFINITION: multiplication of pathogenic organisms or their toxins in the blood along with signs of clinical infection.
TRANSLATION: Ìló ̣po kòkòrò àti oró inú ẹ̀jẹ̀ pè ̣lú àwọn àmì ìkóràn àìsàn.

DEFINITION: development of antibodies to a particular antigen. When people develop antibodies to HIV or an experimental HIV vaccine, they "seroconvert" from antibody-negative to antibody-positive.
TRANSLATION: Ìdàgbàsókè sọ́jà sí àjèjì adáralóró kan. Bí àwon ènìyàn kan bání sọ́jà sí KASA tàbí àyẹ̀wò àjẹsára KASA, wọ́n máa ṣe ìyípadà omi ẹ̀jẹ̀ láti òdì sọ́jà dídára.

DEFINITION: test Any of a number of tests that are performed on the clear portion of blood (serum). Often refers to a test that determines the presence of antibodies to antigens such as viruses.
TRANSLATION: iye àyẹ̀wò tí a ṣe lórí ìka omi ẹ̀jẹ̀. A ṣábà máa n lò fún àyẹ̀wò mímọ bóyá sọ́jà wà fún àjèjì adáralóró, bi kòkòrò.

DEFINITION: related to HIV infection: The proportion of persons who have serologic (i.e. pertaining to serum) evidence of HIV infection at any given time.
TRANSLATION: nínú ẹjẹ Ajẹmọ́ ìkóràn KASA: ìwọ̀n iye àwọn ènìyàn tóní omi ẹ̀jẹ̀ bi ẹ̀rí ìkóràn KASA ní àkókò kan pàtó.

DEFINITION: Result of a test for specific antibodies. The state of either having or not having detectable antibodies against a specific antigen, as measured by a blood test (serologic test). For example, HIV seropositive means that a person has detectable antibodies to
TRANSLATION: inu ẹjẹ Èsì àyẹ̀wò nínú è ̣jè ̣ fún sọ́jà ara kan pàtó. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 241 HIV; seronegative means that a person does not have detectable HIV antibodies.

DEFINITION: clear, thin and sticky fluid portion of the blood that remains after coagulation. Serum contains no blood cells, platelets or fibrinogen.
TRANSLATION: ẹ̀jẹ̀ tómó gaara tó ṣẹ́kù lẹ́yìn ẹ̀jẹ̀ dídì. Omi ẹ̀jẹ̀ kòní àwọn hóró ẹ̀jẹ̀ rárá, hóró amẹ́jẹ̀dì tàbí ohun asaralóre nínú ẹ̀jẹ̀ dídì.

DEFINITION: delivery framework A service delivery framework (SDF) is a set of principles, standards, policies and constraints used to guide the design, development, deployment, operation and retirement of services delivered by a service provider with a view to offering a consistent service experience to a specific user community.
TRANSLATION: ìfijíṣẹ́ tí a n lò láti darí ìdàgbàsókè àti ífẹ̀yìntì lẹ́nu iṣẹ́ tí a ṣàgbẹ́jáde lọ́wọ́ olùpèsè iṣẹ́ pẹ̀lú èrò láti pèsè ìrírí ìṣẹ́ fún agbèègbè kan.

DEFINITION: Delivery Points (SDPs) This is a set of components that provides service delivery architecture (such as service creation, session control and protocols) for a type of service delivered to a consumer, whether it is a customer or other system.
TRANSLATION: Àwọn tí wọ́n n pèsè èròjà iṣẹ́ fún àwọn oníbàárà wọn.

DEFINITION: provider A company that provides a specific service or services, e.g. health or life insurance.
TRANSLATION: àkàns ̣e Ìléeṣẹ́ tó n pèsè iṣẹ́ àkànṣe bí ìlera tàbí adójútòfò-è ̣mí. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 242

DEFINITION: Acute Respiratory Syndrome (SARS) Severe acute respiratory syndrome (SARS) is a serious form of pneumonia. It is caused by a virus that was first identified in 2003. Infection with the SARS virus causes severe breathing difficulty) and sometimes death.
TRANSLATION: SARS jé ̣ ààrùn òtútù àyà líle tí ó n fa ìnira mímí, tí ó sì lè já sí ikú.

DEFINITION: anaemia Extreme reduction in the number of circulating red blood cells (RBCs), the amount of haemoglobin, or the volume of packed red blood cells (haematocrit).
TRANSLATION: paraku Aìtó ẹ̀jẹ̀ paraku máa n wáyé nígbà tí ìwọ̀n hóró ẹ̀jẹ̀ pupa bá dínkù gan-an.

DEFINITION: dehydration Extreme shortage of fluids within the body.
TRANSLATION: Omi ara gbẹ kọjá bóṣeyẹ lọ.

DEFINITION: exudative pharyngitis Severe inflammation of the pharynx (throat). Symptoms may include: enlarged or sore areas in your throat that might be uncomfortable when swallowing food or water.
TRANSLATION: ọ̀fun bá n tani. Àwọn àmì àìsàn yìí ni: ò ̣fun wíwú, tàbí ọgbẹ́ ní ọ̀fun tó máa fa ìnira tí a bá n gbé oúnjẹ tàbí omi mì.

DEFINITION: Biological maleness and femaleness, determined by genetic endowment and hormones.
TRANSLATION: ọkùnrin àti obìnrin tí a pèsè nípa jínnì tí a bí mọ́ni àti oje-ara.

DEFINITION: worker Someone who makes a living through having sex.
TRANSLATION: nàbì Àwọn tí wọ́n n fi òwò as ̣é ̣wó ṣiṣẹ́ ṣe.

DEFINITION: and Reproductive System (SRS) This includes the external and internal sex organs.
TRANSLATION: ìbísí Àkójo ̣pò ̣ è ̣yà ara tìta àti tinú fún ìbálòpọ̀ tìta àti tinú ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 243

DEFINITION: debut/First sexual experience This is an act of introducing young women to sexual life for the first time. OR: The first sexual experience.
TRANSLATION: Èyí ni ìgbésẹ̀ gbígba àwọn kògbókògbó ọmọge sí òwò nàbì fún ìgbà àkọ́kọ́.

DEFINITION: health Sexual health is a state of physical, mental and social well-being in relation to sexuality.
TRANSLATION: ni ipò ìlera ara, ọpọlọ àti àláfia àwùjọ ní ìbámu pẹ̀lú ìbálòpọ̀.

DEFINITION: networking A sexual network is a social network that is defined by the sexual relation- ships within a set of individuals.
TRANSLATION: alátagbà ni àtagbà àwùjọ tó túnmọ̀ sí ìbásepọ̀ ìbálòpọ̀ láárìn àwọn ènìyàn kan.

DEFINITION: Transmitted Disease (STD) Also called venereal disease. A contagious disease usually acquired by sexual intercourse or genital contact. Historically, the five venereal diseases are: gonorrhoea, syphilis, chancroid, granuloma inguinale and lymphogranuloma venereum.
TRANSLATION: tí a kó láti ara ìbálòpọ̀ bíi sífílì àti àtọ̀sí.

DEFINITION: box or sharps containers A sharps container is a container that is filled with used medical needles (and other sharp medical instruments.
TRANSLATION: ìdabẹ́rẹ́nù jẹ́ ibi tí a n kó àwọn abẹ́rẹ́ tí wọ́n ti lò àti àwọn irinṣẹ́ ìṣègùn tó mú sí.

DEFINITION: object An object that can cause injury to a person.
TRANSLATION: mímú tó lè ṣe èèyàn léṣe.
Shingles Herpes Varicella Zoster Virus. Aléfọ́ ọlọ́ jàá Kòkòrò herpes farisila Zoster. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 244

DEFINITION: Genetically engineered hybrid virus having a HIV envelope and a SIV core.
TRANSLATION: jínnì kòkòrò àdàmọ̀dì tóní èèpo KASA àti àkàndá KASA.

DEFINITION: Shock is a life-threatening condition that occurs when the body is not getting enough blood flow.
TRANSLATION: wọ́ Ìjayà jẹ́ ipò tí ó la ẹ̀mí lọ, èyí máa n wáyé nígbà tí ẹ̀jẹ̀ ò bá ṣàn dáadáa ní àgọ́ọ́ ara.

DEFINITION: of breath Difficulty in breathing. Medically referred to as dyspnea.
TRANSLATION: mí. Tí àwọn oníṣègùn n pèní ìsòro èèmí.

DEFINITION: cell A red blood cell that is crescent- shaped as a result of an inherited mutation in the cell's haemoglobin.
TRANSLATION: Hóró ẹ̀jẹ̀ pupa tó jẹ́ àbàjáde àjogúnbá ìyípadà DNA tó n gbé ẹ̀dá ara sínú hóró ẹ̀jẹ̀.

DEFINITION: effects The action or effect of a drug (or vaccine) other than that desired. The term usually refers to undesired or negative effects, such as headache, skin irritation or liver damage. Experimental drugs must be evaluated for both immediate and long-term side effects.
TRANSLATION: tàbí ipá àjẹsára òògùn ju èyí tí a fẹ́. Ìtumọ̀ yìí ni ohun àìfẹ́ tàbí ipa òdì bi ẹ̀fọ́rí, ara yíyún, tàbí bíbàjẹ́ ẹ̀dọ̀. Àyẹ̀wò òògùn gbó ̣dọ̀ fi ìdí rẹ̀ múlẹ̀ fún àbàjáde ẹsẹ́kẹsẹ̀ tàbí ọlọ́jọ́ pípẹ́.

DEFINITION: Immunodeficiency Virus (SIV) An HIV-like virus that infects monkeys, chimpanzees and other non- human primates. KASA ara
TRANSLATION: ọ̀bọ, ìnàkí àti àwọn ẹ̀dà onírunlára.

DEFINITION: medication Medication (also called medicine or pharmaceutical drugs) is the use of licensed drugs to treat or cure an illness. Some drugs are freely sold.
TRANSLATION: pérété Èyí ni ìlo òògùn tóní ìwè àṣẹ fún ìtọ́jú tàbí ìwòsàn aláìsàn. Ọ̀ pọ̀ òògùn ni kò ní ìwè àṣẹ ṣùgbọ́n tí a n tàwọ́n. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 245
Single orphan A child with one of the parents dead. Ọmọ aláìlóbìíkan Ọmọ tí ọ̀kan lára àwọn òbí rẹ̀ tikú.

DEFINITION: peeling Peeling skin is unintended damage to and loss of the upper layer of your skin (epidermis).
TRANSLATION: ṣíṣí ní ìbàjẹ́ tí a kò lérò àti àdánù ìpele òkè ara.

DEFINITION: scraping Skin scraping is a technique in dermatology that is applied in a high proportion of cases to obtain samples of the uppermost layers of the skin for analysis.
TRANSLATION: híha Ayẹ̀wò ajẹmọ́ ara híhani ìlànà ẹ̀kọ́ nípa ààrùn ara tí a n lò ní ọ̀pọ̀ ìgbà.

DEFINITION: Highly contagious disease caused by a poxvirus and marked by fever and the formation of scar-pustules. A world- wide inoculation programme has almost eradicated the poxvirus from the human population.
TRANSLATION: nlá nípaṣè kòkòrò tó n fa ibà àti àléébù.

DEFINITION: group A social group is a collection of people who interact with each other and share similar characteristics and a sense of unity. A social category is a collection of people who do not interact but who share similar characteristics.
TRANSLATION: ni àkójọpọ̀ àwọn ènìyàn tó n bára wọn sọ́rọ́ lórí ohun kannáà.

DEFINITION: linen These are contaminated clothes as a result of blood stain or worn by infected people that had injury.
TRANSLATION: ni aṣọ tí ẹ̀jẹ̀ yí tàbí tó gbó lára ẹni tóní ọgbẹ́ tàbí ìpalára.

DEFINITION: throat Pain in the throat. Sore throat may be caused by many different causes,
TRANSLATION: dùn ní ọ̀fun, egbò/ ọgbẹ́ ọ̀fun lè wá ní ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ ọ̀nà bíi ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 246 including bacterial or viral infection of the tonsils or pharynx. batéríà tàbí kòkòrò ààrùn ìkóràn ti ẹ̀yà arídìmú omi-ara eṣé tàbí ọ̀fun.

DEFINITION: means originate from: reveal the origin of something; obtain from a particular supplier.
TRANSLATION: ó ti ṣẹ̀wá, fífi ìpilẹ̀ṣẹ̀ hàn.

DEFINITION: called semen: (1) the generative substance of male animals. (2) The reproductive cell or gamete of the male; a spermatozoon.
TRANSLATION: ohun tó n dà lára ọkùnrin. (2) Àwọn hóró ìbísí tàbí hóró ìbálòpọ̀, tí amò sí àtọ̀.

DEFINITION: tap A lumbar puncture, also known as a spinal tap, is a medical procedure in which a needle is inserted into the spine, most commonly to collect cerebrospinal fluid for diagnostic testing.
TRANSLATION: Èyí jẹ́ ìlànà ìṣègùn níbi tí a tí n fi abẹ́rẹ́ gún ọ̀pá-ẹ̀yìn, ní ọ̀pọ̀ ìgbà láti gba oje ọpọlọ àti ọ̀pá ẹ̀yìn fún àyẹ̀wò ìdámọ̀ àìsàn.

DEFINITION: (1) Any distilled alcoholic liquor such as brandy, rum, whisky, or gin. (2) An aqueous solution of ethanol, especially one obtained by distillation.
TRANSLATION: Àfẹ́sẹ́ ọtí alágbára bi burandí, rọ́ọ́mù, wisikí, tàbi gíínì. (2) Ìyàsọ́tọ̀ olómi ti ọtí ẹmu, pàápàá èyí tí a gbà látara ìfẹ́sẹ́.

DEFINITION: care Spiritual care is a person-centred care which seeks to help people (re)discover hope, resilience and inner strength in times of illness, injury, transition and loss. Spiritual care is
TRANSLATION: gbàgbọ́ Ìtọ́jú tẹ̀mí ni ìtọ̀jú tó n fúnni ní ìrètí, afúni ní okun lásìkò àìsàn, ìpalára, ìpárọ̀ àti àdánù. Ìtọ́jú tẹ̀mí ní a n pèsè láti ọwọ́ gbogbo àwọn òsìṣẹ́ ìlera, ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 247 provided by all who work in health and social care as well as by patients, carers and friends. àwùjọ àti aláìsàn, alábòjútó àti àwọn ẹbí.

DEFINITION: support Offering spiritual support for family or friends. People who are very ill often ask spiritual questions in seeking comfort, meaning and hope.
TRANSLATION: Fífún ni àtìlẹyìn ẹ̀mí fún ẹ́bí tàbí ọ̀rẹ́. Àwon tí wọ́n bá ṣe àìsàn máa n fí wálẹ̀ lọ́nà tẹ̀mí, wíwá ìrọ̀rùn, ìtumọ̀ àti ìrètí.

DEFINITION: Someone who believes that the spirits of dead people can communicate with the living, especially through mediums.
TRANSLATION: gbàgbọ́ pé òkú le bá alàyè wíjọ́.

DEFINITION: ductless vascular organ in the left upper abdomen of humans and other vertebrates that helps to destroy old red blood cells, form lymphocytes, and store blood.
TRANSLATION: àìlọ́pọ̀ ní òkè inú ènìyàn àti ẹranko ọlọ́pàá-ẹ̀hìn tó n sẹ̀ ìrànwọ́ láti pa àwọn hóró omi-ara, èyí tó n tọ́jú ẹ̀jẹ̀ pamọ́.

DEFINITION: Substance coughed up from the respiratory tract and usually ejected by mouth, e.g. saliva, phlegm, or mucus.
TRANSLATION: a pọ̀ jáde pẹ̀lú ìmísímú-ìmísóde láti ẹnu, bi itọ́, kẹ̀lẹ̀bẹ̀ tàbí ikun.

DEFINITION: for gene expert testing A sample of phlegm that is collected for laboratory testing from a patient with suspected tuberculosis.
TRANSLATION: tí a gbà sílè ̣ fún àyè ̣wò láte ̣nu e ̣ni tí a fura sí pé ó ní ikó ̣o ̣fe.

DEFINITION: cancer Cancer staging is the process of determining the extent to which
TRANSLATION: Ìke ̣rin Jẹjẹrẹ Ìpele jẹjẹrẹ ni ìlànà mímọ bi jẹjẹrẹ ṣe tànká sí. Às ̣à yíyan ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 248 a cancer has developed by spreading. Contemporary practice is to assign a number from I-IV to a cancer, with I being an isolated cancer and IV being a cancer which has spread to the limit of what the assessment measures. nọ́mbà láti ọ̀kan sí ìkẹ́rin sí ààrùn jẹjẹrẹ ló wó ̣pò ̣ lode-òní, tí ònkà àkọ́kọ́ máa jé ̣ ìbè ̣rè ̣, tí ìkẹ́rin yóó sì jẹ́ jẹjẹrẹ tó tànká ju bí ó tiyẹ lọ.

DEFINITION: of care Treatment regimen or medical management based on state-of-the-art patient care.
TRANSLATION: Àwọn òògùn ìtọ́jú tàbí ìṣàkóso ìṣègùn adálórí ìṣẹ́ ọnà ìtọ́jú aláìsàn.

DEFINITION: Agency for Control of AIDS (SACA) In Nigeria, SACA is the agency solely authorized to facilitate all stake-holder HIV/AIDS activities in every state.
TRANSLATION: orílẹ̀-èdè Nigeria, SACA jẹ́ àjọ tí ó n ṣe akitiyan fún ìmọ̀ kíkún nípa kòkòrò KASA àti ààrùn ìsọdọ̀lẹ àjẹsára fún àwọn ènìyàǹ, ẹbí àti agbègbè ti àjàkálẹ̀ ààrùn ń bájà.

DEFINITION: Blood Transfusion Service (SBTS) The SBTS provides blood to its members in an emergency. The blood is collected from their blood bank in in a state and is hand-carried, normally by a trauma-trained anaesthetist, to the treating doctor.
TRANSLATION: ìpínlẹ̀ Ẹ̀ ka yìí máa ń pèsè ẹ̀jẹ̀ ni pàjàwírì fún ẹgbẹ́ agbẹ̀jẹ̀sílẹ̀. À ń gba ẹ̀jẹ̀ yìí ní olú ìpínlẹ̀ láti ọwọ́ àwọn onímọ̀ nípa ẹ̀jẹ̀ sí ọ̀dọ̀ dókítà.

DEFINITION: significance A term based on statistical tests that is used to denote the probability that the observed association could have occurred by chance alone. Does not refer to medical or biological significance of an association. For example, a statistical significance at
TRANSLATION: adálórí àyẹ̀wò ìṣirò tí a n lò fún ìṣééṣe tí àkíyèsí àkójọpọ̀ lè ṣelẹ́ lọ́nà àìròtẹ̀lẹ̀. Kò tunmọ̀ sí ìṣègùn tàbí ti àmì ìbí ti àkójọpọ̀. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 249 the 1-percent level indicates a 1-in-100 chance that a result can be ascribed to chance.

DEFINITION: (D4T) Stavudine (D4T) is a HIV treatment drug which works by inhibiting HIV replication.
TRANSLATION: safudini Òògùn safudini wà fún ìtó ̣ju KASA tó máa n s ̣is ̣é ̣ nípa dídójúti ìs ̣ẹ̀dà KASA.

DEFINITION: cell An undifferentiated cell that is able to renew itself and produce all specialized cells within an organ.
TRANSLATION: Ẹ̀ yà hóró kannáà to séése láti tún ararẹ̀ ṣe àti pé kí ó pèsè gbogbo hóró àkànse nínú ẹ̀yà- ara.

DEFINITION: Syndrome A severe and sometimes fatal form of erythema multiforme that is characterized by conjunctivitis (eye inflammation) and often results in blindness, Vincent's angina (trench mouth) and ulceration of the genitals and anus.
TRANSLATION: Steven Johnson Èyí ni àìsàn tóle bi àìbójúmu ara pípọ́n tí èso ààrin ara tójẹ́ ẹ̀yà ojú wíwú èyí tó n fa ìfọ́jú, yàrà ẹnu àti ọgbẹ́ ojú abẹ́ àti ihò-ìdí.

DEFINITION: shame or disgrace attached to something regarded as socially unacceptable.
TRANSLATION: rọ̀mọ́ nǹkan èyí tí kò jẹ́ ìtẹ́wọ́gbà láwùjọ.

DEFINITION: is an act of characterizing something as disgraceful.
TRANSLATION: ìgbéṣẹ̀ títàbùkù nǹkan.

DEFINITION: of the numerous inflammatory diseases of the mouth having various causes, such as mechanical trauma,
TRANSLATION: ẹnu wíwú tó n ṣe okùnfà bi ìbanilọ́kànjẹ́, híhún, ẹ̀hun, àìtó fítáámì tàbí àrùn. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 250 irritants, allergy, vitamin deficiency or infection.

DEFINITION: test A stool analysis is a series of tests done on a stool (faeces) sample to help diagnose certain conditions affecting the digestive tract.
TRANSLATION: àyẹ̀wò ìgbẹ́ tí a se láti mọ ipò àìsàn tó n dàmú dídà oúnjẹ nínú ara.

DEFINITION: Nigeria HIV/AIDS Response (SNR) Multi-level systems support for integrated delivery of HIV/AIDS services in Nigeria.
TRANSLATION: àrùn ìṣọdọ̀lẹ àjẹsára ní Nigeria Àkójo ̣po ̣ aáyan fún ìkúnpá lórí ìdènà KASA àti àrùn ìṣọdọ̀lẹ àjẹsára ní Nigeria.

DEFINITION: sudden death of brain cells due to lack of oxygen caused by blockage of blood to the brain. It is a sudden attack of weakness affecting one side of the body.
TRANSLATION: ẹ̀gbà Dídákẹ́ àwọn hóró ọpọlọ lójijì fún ìdí aìsí atẹ́gùn, tí ó wá nípaṣẹ̀ ẹ̀jẹ̀ dídí sí ọpọlọ. Èyí ni ójijì àwọ̀n jíjá tó n ṣe àkóbá fún apá àgọ́ ara kan.

DEFINITION: space The space through which the spinal fluid circulates.
TRANSLATION: ẹ̀yìn Àyè tí ọ̀pá oje n gbà ṣọ̀n kákìri.

DEFINITION: infection An infection or phase of infection, without readily apparent symptoms or signs of disease.
TRANSLATION: tàbí ìpele ìkóràn, láìsí àmì àìsàn tàbí àmì ààrùn rárá.

DEFINITION: Beneath or introduced beneath the skin (e.g. subcutaneous injections).
TRANSLATION: ìwọ̀-ara. Àpẹẹrẹ awọ abẹ́rẹ́. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 251

DEFINITION: treatment Substitution treatment is a medical treatment that involves replacing an illegal opioid, such as heroin, with a longer acting but less euphoric opioid; methadone or buprenorphine are typically used and the drugs are taken under medical supervision.
TRANSLATION: Ìtọ́jú Ìfidípò jẹ́ ìtọ́jútó fàyè gba ìfidípò ohun àìda nínú ọpọlọ bi ìgbóná, tí a n fà gẹ́gẹ́ bi àbójútó ìṣègùn.

DEFINITION: vaccine A genetically engineered vaccine that is based on only part of the HIV molecule.
TRANSLATION: Àtúnṣe jinni àjẹsára tó dá lórí apá mólékù kòkòrò.

DEFINITION: Ebola Virus Ebola virus found in Sudan. A virus of the genus Ebolavirus is a member of the species Sudan ebolavirus if it is endemic in Sudan and/or Uganda. Kòkòrò Ebola Sudan
TRANSLATION: Ebola tí wó ̣n rí ní Sudan. Ìtànkálè ̣ rè ̣ kọ́kọ́yọ ní Sudan àti Uganda.

DEFINITION: fever A sudden fever is one of quick onset in a patient who was otherwise feeling well.
TRANSLATION: òjijì ni ìbẹ̀rẹ̀ àìsàn lára aláìsàn tí kó dáápé tẹ́lẹ̀.

DEFINITION: cane A tall tough-stemmed species of grass grown in warm regions throughout the world as a source of sugar, which is obtained from its sweet sap.
TRANSLATION: arí gẹ́gẹ́bi ìpèsè súgà tí a n rí lára aadùn ẹ.

DEFINITION: thoughts Suicidal thoughts, also known as suicidal ideation, are thoughts about how to kill oneself, which can range
TRANSLATION: ẹni Èrò ìgbẹ̀mí ara ẹni ló n bẹ̀ẹ̀rẹ̀ láti bi ìlànà èrò, tí o sì pàrì ìgbèsè ìgbẹ̀mí ara ẹni. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 252 from a detailed plan to a fleeting consideration and does not include the final act of killing oneself.

DEFINITION: drug Any of a class of synthetic chemical substances derived from sulfanilamide and used to treat bacterial infections. These drugs inhibit the action of para- aminobenzoic acid, a substance bacteria need in order to reproduce. Sulfa drugs are used primarily in the treatment of urinary tract infections and ulcerative colitis.
TRANSLATION: sulfa Èyíkèyí kíláásì ohun ìdá kẹ́míkà tí a tété rí òògùn sulfa tí a n lò fún ìtọ́jú kòkòrò àìfójúrí. Òògùn yí máa dójúti ásídì, àwon ohun èlò kòkòrò àìfójúrí tí a n lò fún ẹ̀dà. Òògùn sulfa ní a n lò fún ìtọ́jú ààrùn ilé ìtọ̀ àti ọgbẹ́ asẹ́ ìfun wíwú. Sọ́jà ara ló tì ṣe ìrọ́pò wọn fún ààrùn kòkòrò àìfójúrí.

DEFINITION: Sulfonamide (or called sulphonamide, sulfa drugs, sulpha drugs) is the basis of several groups of drugs. The original antibacterial sulfonamides are synthetic antimicrobial agents that contain the sulfonamide group.
TRANSLATION: sulfanami de Òògùn sulfa ni ọ̀kan gbòógì lára ẹgbẹ́ òògùn. Ògidì òògùn kòkòrò àìfójúrí sulfa ni ìdá adójúti asojú ìdàgbàsókè ẹ̀yàwuuru tóní àkójọpọ̀ òògùn sulfa.

DEFINITION: Investigators have proposed that a molecule known as a superantigen, either made by HIV or an unrelated agent, may stimulate massive quantities of CD4+ T cells at once, rendering them highly susceptible to HIV infection and subsequent cell death.
TRANSLATION: Àwọn olùṣèwàdí dábáá pé mólékù túmọ̀ sí pé àjèjì adáralóró dára jùlọ, yálà èyí tí a ṣe nípa KASA tàbí asojú alábàgbépọ̀, ó lè lọ́wọ́ nínú ọ̀pọ̀ ìwọ̀n hóró sójà ìdábòòbò 4+T lẹ́kàn ṣoṣo, tí ó sọwọ́n di aláìlágbára sí ìkóràn KASA àti ìtẹ̀lé ikú hóró. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 253

DEFINITION: for health workers Strengthening the health care workforce.
TRANSLATION: ìlera Ṣíṣe ìkúnpá fún ẹgbé ̣ òṣìṣé ̣ ìlera.

DEFINITION: group In a support group, members provide each other with various types of help, usually non-professional and non- material, for a particular shared, usually burdensome, characteristic.
TRANSLATION: ẹgbẹ́ aṣèrànwọ́, àwọn ọmọ ẹgbẹ́ máa ń pèsè orísìírísìí ìrànlọ́wọ́ fún ara wọn, pàápàá àwọn tí kò kún ojú òsùnwọ̀n àti èyí tí kìí gbé ogun èlò fún ìpín kan pàtó, pàápàá èyí tí ó lè pànìláyà

DEFINITION: cells (T8, CD8) Subset of T cells that halt antibody production and other immune responses.
TRANSLATION: Àyọsílẹ̀ àwọn hóró T tó n ṣe ìdàdúró ìpèsè sọ́jà ara àti gbígba àwọn àjẹsára mìíràn.

DEFINITION: marker A parameter that can serve as a substitute for an endpoint of interest. In HIV disease, the number of CD4+ T cells and CD8+ cells is a surrogate immunological marker of disease progression.
TRANSLATION: pó Àrọ́pó èníyàn tàbí nǹkan tó rọ́pò ìkéjì. Nínú ààrùn KASA, iye àwọn hóró sójà ìdábòòbò 4+ T àti hóró sójà ìdábòòbò 8 ni ìrọ́pò àmì ìjẹsára ti ìlọsíwájú ààrùn.

DEFINITION: Close or continuous observation or testing (e.g. serosurveillance) used, among others, in epidemiology.
TRANSLATION: Ìtọpinpin Àkíyèsí lẹmólẹmó tàbí àyẹ̀wò tí a n lò láàrin àwon mìíràn. Nínú ẹ̀kọ́ nípa mímọ ààrùn, ìṣọ́ àjẹsára fún ìgbésè ìbójúwò étò àjẹsára kọlẹ̀ nínú àwon ènìyàn.

DEFINITION: of EVD One who survived the Ebola virus. A person who recovered from a confirmed infection with the Ebola virus.
TRANSLATION: Ebola Ẹnì tórí yọ nínú ewu ààrùn kòkòrò Ebola lé ̣yìn ìtó ̣jú. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 254

DEFINITION: Acronym for Society for Women and AIDS in Africa.
TRANSLATION: SWAAN Ẹgbẹ́ àwọn obínrin tó n ṣe àmójútó àrùn ìṣọdọ̀lẹ àjẹsára nílè ̣ Afirika.

DEFINITION: small piece of absorbent material attached to the end of a stick or wire and used for cleansing of a surface, applying medicine, or collecting a sample of a substance.
TRANSLATION: Ìpèlé kékeré tí ó lè gba inú ihò ọ̀pá tàbí okùn wáyà, kí a wá lò láti fọ pépele ìfọ̀wọ́ tí a n lò mọ́ òògùn tàbí àkójọpọ̀ ohun èlò àyẹ̀wò.

DEFINITION: clear salty liquid that passes to the surface of the skin when somebody is hot or as a result of strenuous activity, fear, anxiety, or illness.
TRANSLATION: oníyọ̀ tó n jáde látojú ihò- ara nígbà tí ara ènìyàn bá n gbóná tàbí kó jẹ́ àbájáde is ̣é ̣ wàhálà, ẹ̀rù, àníyàn, tàbí àìsàn.

DEFINITION: pool This is a humanly constructed body of water where people swim for pleasure.
TRANSLATION: tí àwo ̣n ènìyàn tí n wẹ̀ fún afẹ́.

DEFINITION: perceptible, subjective change in the body or its functions that indicates disease or phases of disease, as reported by the patient.
TRANSLATION: gẹ́gẹ́bí èrò ìyípadà nínú ara tàbí iṣẹ́ tó n tọ́kasí ààrùn gẹ́gẹ́bí ìròyìn àláìsàn.

DEFINITION: ("Giant Cells") Dysfunctional multicellular clumps formed by cell- to-cell fusion. Cells infected with HIV may also fuse with nearby uninfected cells, forming balloon-like giant cells called syncytia. In test tube experi- ments, these giant cells have been associated with the death of uninfected
TRANSLATION: Aláìléye oní hóró púpọ̀ tí ó jẹ́ ìsopọ̀ àkóso hóró sí hóró. Àwọn hóró tí ó kó ààrùn bá kòkòrò lè sopọ̀ mọ́ àwọn hóró tí ààrùn kòràn, lára òmìrán àwọn hóró bàlúù tí a mọ̀ sí òmìrán hóró. Nínú yìí ni afiwè ikú hóró tí àrùn kòràn. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 255 cells. The presence of so-called syncytia-inducing variants of HIV has been correlated with rapid disease progression in HIV-infected individuals.

DEFINITION: group of symptoms and diseases that are together characteristic of a specific condition.
TRANSLATION: aìsàn Ìdàpọ̀ àwọn àmì àìsàn àti àwọn àmì tó papọ̀ sojú àkànṣe ipò àìsàn.

DEFINITION: Synergistic An interaction between two or more agents (drugs) that produce or enhance an effect that is greater than the sum of the effects produced by the individual agents.
TRANSLATION: Ìbáraẹnisepọ̀ láàrin asojú òògùn méjì tàbí jubẹ́lọ̀ tó n pèsè tàbí ṣe àlékún ipá tóju iye ìpèsè ipá àwọn asojú ènìyàn.

DEFINITION: (1) In chemistry, the formation of a compound from simpler compounds or elements. (2) The production of a substance (e.g. as in protein synthesis) by the union of chemical elements, groups or simpler compounds, or by the degradation (i.e. breaking down) of a complex compound.
TRANSLATION: Ibiyi tó dàpọ̀ mó ̣ra láti dàpọ̀ mọ́ ìrọ̀rùn ibiyi tàbí èròjà. (2) Ìpèsè àwon ohun èlò bi ìdá ohun asalóre pẹ̀lú ìdàpọ̀ èròjà kẹ́míkà, àkójọpọ̀ tàbí ìrọ̀rùn ibiyi tàbí bíbàjẹ́.

DEFINITION: sexually transmitted disease caused by a spirochaete bacteria called Treponema pallidum, resulting in the formation of lesions throughout the body.
TRANSLATION: tó wá láti pasè ̣ treponema pallidum, tó mú ìdásílè ̣ ọgbẹ́ wá sí gbogbo ara. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 256

DEFINITION: tube with a nozzle and piston or bulb for sucking in and ejecting liquid in a thin stream, used for cleaning wounds or body cavities, or fitted with a hollow needle for injecting or withdrawing fluids.
TRANSLATION: tẹ́ẹ́rẹ́ tí a fí n fa nǹkan olómi sínú ara tàbí jáde kúrò lára.

DEFINITION: drug allergy An unpredictable, generalized adverse reaction due to the triggering of an immune-mediated inflammatory process by a medication.
TRANSLATION: ajẹmó ̣ ara títa.

DEFINITION: Systole is a regular contraction of the heart. OR simply means when the heart pumps.
TRANSLATION: Ohun ni ìgba ìṣóki ọkàn.

DEFINITION: lymphocytes A lymphocyte of a type produced or processed by the thymus gland and actively participating in the immune response.
TRANSLATION: T Hóró omi ara T tí a pèsè lọ́wọ́ ètò àjẹsára ara tí a rí nínú hóró ẹ̀jẹ̀ funfun tí ó kópa nínú àjẹsára gbígbà.

DEFINITION: cover/mat This is a material used for covering a table.
TRANSLATION: ohun tí a n ló fi bo tébù tàbí tábìlì.

DEFINITION: small solid pill containing a measured medicinal dose, usually intended to be taken orally.
TRANSLATION: ní óró egbògi kékeré tí ó ní ìwọ̀n ní èyí tí a lè lò sí ẹnu.

DEFINITION: Forest Ebola virus TAFV Ebola Virus found in Tai Forest. Kòkòrò Ebola Taiforest
TRANSLATION: Ebola tí a rí ní Taiforest.

DEFINITION: reached/Day A progress charting method which logs on a daily basis the achievement of predefined objectives.
TRANSLATION: Ipò àfojúsùn ojoojúmọ́ tí a ṣètò. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 257

DEFINITION: of the regulatory genes of the HIV virus. Three HIV regulatory genes – tat, rev and nef – and three so-called auxiliary genes – vif, vpr and vpu – contain information necessary for the production of proteins that control the virus's ability to infect a cell, produce new copies of the virus or cause disease. The tat gene is thought to enhance virus replication.
TRANSLATION: TAT Ọ̀kan olùdarí ẹ̀yọ́- iran ti kòkòrò. Olùdarí ẹ̀yọ̀- iran kòkòrò mẹ́ta bi tat, rev, àti nef àti ẹ̀yọ̀- iran aṣèrànwọ́ mẹ́ta bi vif, vpr àti vpu tóní ìfitónilétí ìpèsè ohun asaralóre tó se pàtàkì fún ìdarí agbára kòkòrò láti ṣe ìkóràn bá kòkòrò, tó pèsè ẹ̀dà hóró tuntun tàbí fa ààrùn. ẹ̀yọ́-iran tat ni a rò pé ó lè mú èsì sí ìdáhùn sí kòkòrò.

DEFINITION: (a part of the body) with an indelible design by inserting pigment into punctures in the skin.
TRANSLATION: tí a se sí ara pẹ̀lú onírúrú ohun tí kò se parẹ́ nípa lílo ohun ayí àwọ̀ padà sí ara.

DEFINITION: person employed to look after technical equipment or do practical work in a laboratory.
TRANSLATION: ìmọ̀ ẹ́rọ tàbí tó n siṣẹ́ ní yàrá àyẹ̀wò.

DEFINITION: gauge, pattern or mould used as a guide to the form of the piece being made. In biology, a molecule (such as DNA) that serves as a pattern for the generation of another macromolecule (e.g. messenger RNA).
TRANSLATION: tàbí mímọ̀ tí a n ló láti dábòbò nkan tí a ṣe. ní ẹ̀kọ́ nípa oníyè, mólékù bi DNA tójẹ́ àpẹẹrẹ mólékù nlá. Àpẹẹrẹ, òjíṣẹ́ RNA.

DEFINITION: production of physical defects in offspring in utero (i.e. causing birth defects).
TRANSLATION: n Ìpèsè àbàwọ́n ara nínú bíbí ọmọ. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 258

DEFINITION: Beirn Community The National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases (NIAID) started the CPCRA in 1989, adding Terry Beirn's name in 1991 in honour of the late, former manager of the American Foundation for AIDS Research and health policy consultant for Senator Edward Kennedy. CPCRA is one of four HIV clinical trials programmes supported by NIAID.
TRANSLATION: CPCRA Ilé ẹ̀kọ́ nípa Ìmò ̣lára àti àrùn àkóràn ní orílẹ̀-èdè bẹ̀rẹ̀ CPCRA ní ọdún 1989, tí ó fi orúkọ Terry Beirn sí ní ọdún 1991 ní ọ̀nà àti bu ọlá fún olùdásílẹ̀ ìpílẹ̀sẹ̀ ìmúlò ìlera àti ìwádìí nípa ààrùn ìṣọdọ̀lẹ àjẹsára ni ilẹ́ America fún Senator Edward Kennedy.

DEFINITION: hospital These are the hospitals that specialize in complicated cases, e.g. provincial or national hospitals.
TRANSLATION: ni ilé-ìwòsàn tó n sè ìtọ́jú àwọn àìsàn tó gbópọn.
Testicles The male reproductive gland. Kórópọ̀n Àpò ìbísí àti ìbálòpò ̣ ọmọkùnrin.

DEFINITION: problem A disorder or disease of the testis or testes.
TRANSLATION: Ìs ̣òro tàbí ààrùn aje ̣mó ̣ kórópò ̣n.

DEFINITION: for tuberculosis This is an act of testing for turberclosis infection.
TRANSLATION: Ìlànà síṣe àyẹ̀wò fún ikọ́ ẹ̀gbẹ

DEFINITION: (Lockjaw) This is an infectious disease caused by a bacteria Clostridium tetani which usually enters the body through wounds.
TRANSLATION: tí ó wọnú ara nípase ọgbẹ́.

DEFINITION: social mobilization pillar This is a process that engage individuals to be pillars that fight diseases.
TRANSLATION: ìtanijí àwùjọ Ìlànà kíkọ́ ènìyàn bí a ṣe n jẹ́ òpó tì n wọ̀yá jà ti ààrùn. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 259

DEFINITION: vaccine A vaccine designed to boost the immune response to HIV in persons already infected with the virus.
TRANSLATION: Àjẹsára tí a ṣe láti ró àjẹsára gbígbà ni agbára sí ẹni tó n gbé pẹ̀lú kòkòrò.

DEFINITION: treatment of disease. Therapy is synonymous with treatment.
TRANSLATION: Ìtọ́jú ààrùn. Ìtọ́jú àìlera la tún n pè ní ìtọ́jú.

DEFINITION: Thioacetazone is used in the treatment of tuberculosis; it has only weak activity against Mycobacterium tuberculosis and is only useful in preventing resistance to more powerful drugs like isoniazid and rifampicin. It is never used on its own to treat tuberculosis.
TRANSLATION: thiacetazone Òògùn tí a fí n s ̣e ìtọ́jú ikọ́fe, a sábà máa nlò o papọ̀ pẹ̀lú àwọn òògùn ikọ́fe mìíràn láti dènà àìs ̣is ̣é ̣ àwo ̣n ògbóntagí òògùn mìíràn.

DEFINITION: treatment Third-line therapy, sometimes called salvage or rescue therapy, is a term describing treatment regimens for people who have few or limited anti- HIV drug options.
TRANSLATION: kẹta Ìgbéṣẹ̀ ìtọ́jú kẹta, ìgbà mìíràn wọ́n máa ń pè é ní ìtọ́jú ìdóòlà (ẹ̀mí) ni ọ̀rọ̀ ìperí tí wọ́n ń lò fún àwọn tí àǹfààní òògùn apa KASA péréte.

DEFINITION: throat is the anterior (front) portion of the neck beginning at the back of the neck.
TRANSLATION: fun ìbẹ̀rẹ̀ iwájú ìta ọrùn ní ẹ̀yìn ọrùn.

DEFINITION: cytopenia A decreased number of blood platelets (cells important for blood clotting).
TRANSLATION: Àdínkù ní iye adèèpà- ẹ̀jẹ̀ (hóró tó se kókó fún ẹ̀jẹ̀ dídì).

DEFINITION: patches in the mouth caused by the fungus Candida albicans. Thrush
TRANSLATION: máa ńwà ní ẹnu Egbò ẹnu tí ààrùn ọ̀súnwúrú máa ń fà. Ààrùn egbò ẹnu yìí ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 260 is one of the most frequent early symptoms of an immune disorder. The fungus commonly lives in the mouth, but only causes problems when the body's resistance is reduced either by antibiotics that have reduced the number of competitive organisms in the mouth, or by an immune deficiency such as HIV disease. nítorí ọ̀súnwúrú jẹ́ ààmì ìtètè mọ àìṣedédé ajẹsára. Ọ̀ súnwúrú máa n gbé ní ẹnu ṣùgbọ́n a máa fa ìsòro nígbà ti agbara àti gbógun mìí bá ti dínkù nípa lílo òògùn apa sójà ara.

DEFINITION: polypeptide hormone of the thymus that influences the maturation of T cells destined for an active role in cell- mediated immunity.
TRANSLATION: Homonu amú hóró T dàgbà Oje ara tí ó ní ètó àjẹsára ara tí ó ní agbára ipá ogbó àwon hóró T tí o lọ́wọ́ nínú hóró àjẹsára.

DEFINITION: mass of glandular tissue located in the neck or chest of most vertebrates. Found in the upper chest under the breastbone in humans, the thymus is essential to the development of the body's system of immunity beginning in fetal life (i.e. before birth). The thymus processes white blood cells, known as lymphocytes, which kill foreign cells and stimulate other immune cells to produce antibodies. The gland grows throughout childhood until puberty and then gradually decreases in size.
TRANSLATION: ẹṣẹ̀ iṣù tó wà nínú ọrùn tàbí àyà ẹranko ọlọ́pa-ẹ̀hìn. A n ri ní òkè àyà ní àbẹ́funfun tí igbáyà nínú ènìyàn, ètò àjẹsára ara ló ṣe kókó fún ìdàgbàsókè ètò ìbẹ̀rẹ̀ àjẹsára sáájú ara ti àwọn hóró ẹ̀jẹ̀ amọ̀ sí hóró omi ara, tí ohun pa àjèjì hóró àti rú àwon hóró àjẹsára mìíràn láti pèsè sọ́jà ara. ẹṣẹ máa n dàgbà látigbà kékeré títí di àgbàlagbà, tí ósì n dínkù ní ìwọ̀n. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 261

DEFINITION: Timing is a selection for maximum effect of a particular moment for doing something.
TRANSLATION: akoko Sísáré ni àsàyàn ipá tí ó pọ̀jù lọ fún àsìkò síṣe nǹkan.

DEFINITION: collection of similar cells acting together to perform a particular function. There are four basic tissues in the body: epithelial, connective, muscle and nerve.
TRANSLATION: àwon hóró tó jọra tó n siṣẹ́ papọ̀ fún iṣẹ́ kan pàtó. Orísirísi ìṣù mẹ̀ta ni ó wà nínú ara: ẹpilálíà, ìsopọ̀, isan àti ẹ̀ṣọ.

DEFINITION: (Also "titre") A laboratory measure- ment of the amount (or concentration) of a given compound in solution.
TRANSLATION: iye ìsopọ̀ èsì.

DEFINITION: gasp To draw in breath with a sudden short audible intake.
TRANSLATION: kẹ́kẹrẹ́ tí a lè gbọ́ ketekete.

DEFINITION: Toremifene is an oral selective estrogen receptor modulator (SERM) which helps to oppose the actions of estrogen in the body.
TRANSLATION: Esfrogen Èyí ni àsànyàn ibùdó àwòse oje ara tó n se ìrànlọ́wọ́ láti tako iṣẹ́ oje nínú ara.

DEFINITION: Lymphocyte Count (TLC) A lymphocyte is one of the subtypes of white blood cell in a vertebrate’s immune system.
TRANSLATION: T Hóró omi ara jẹ́ ọ̀kan lára ẹ̀yà hóró ẹ̀jẹ̀ funfun nínú ètò àjẹsára ẹranko ọlọ́pa- ẹ̀hìn.

DEFINITION: epidermal necrolysis Toxic epidermal necrolysis also known as Lyell’s syndrome is a rare, life- threatening skin condition that is usually caused by a reaction to drugs.
TRANSLATION: ̣ ajẹmó ̣-oró Àjàkálè ̣ olóró ìkúu hóró ara ni àìsàn tó lè mú ẹ̀mí dání tó n wá láti ara ìṣesẹ́ àwọn oògùn. Àìsàn yí a máa fa kí ìwọ̀ òde ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS

DEFINITION: disease causes the top layer of the skin (the epidermis) to detach from the lower layers of the skin (the dermis), all over the body, leaving the body susceptible to severe infection.
TRANSLATION: ìwáara ní gbogbo ara, tí ó le fa ààrùn kíkó.

DEFINITION: Degree of virulence of a toxic microbe or the degree of being harmful to the body of a poison; the capacity of a drug to damage body tissue or seriously impair body functions.
TRANSLATION: òògùn kòkòrò ìtọ́jú àìlera tí ó ní oró nínú, ipá òògùn láti pa iṣù ara tàbí kó ba àwọn iṣẹ́ ara kan jẹ́.

DEFINITION: Toxoplasmosis is an infection that is caused by the protozoan parasite Toxoplasma gondii. The parasite is carried by cats, birds and other animals and is found in soil contaminated by cat faeces and in meat, particularly pork. The parasite can infect the lungs, retina of the eye, heart, pancreas, liver, colon and testes.
TRANSLATION: toxoplasmosis Èyí ni ààrùn tí a kó lára ológbò, ẹyẹ àti àwọn eranko mìíràn. Ó tún le wà nínú ìgbé ̣ ológbò àti e ̣lé ̣dè ̣. Ó máa n ran è ̣dò ̣fóró, ojú, ọkàn, àmó ̣, è ̣dò ̣, ìfun àti kórópò ̣n.
