DEFINITION: Birth Attendant (TBA) A traditional birth attendant (TBA) is also known as a traditional midwife, community midwife or lay midwife.
TRANSLATION: ìbílẹ̀.

DEFINITION: burial rituals Tradition is important, but everyone must find a way to respect the dead and observe burial rites without putting themselves or anyone else in danger of catching Ebola.
TRANSLATION: Ìlànà ìsìnkú ìbílẹ̀. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 263

DEFINITION: healers Traditional medicine, as it is well known, is a cultural gem of various communities around the world and encompasses all kinds of folk medicine, unconventional medicine and indeed any kind of therapeutical method that had been handed down by the tradition of a community or ethnic group.
TRANSLATION: ìbílẹ̀ ní gbogbo ìlẹ̀délẹ̀ ní ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ ènìyàn lẹ́gbẹ̀, tí wọ́n ní ìlànà ìbílẹ̀ ní agbèègbè tàbí ẹ̀yà.

DEFINITION: Someone that has deep respect for tradition, especially for cultural or religious practices.
TRANSLATION: ìbọ̀wọ̀ fún àṣà àtọwọ́dọ́wọ́, páàpáà fún àṣà tàbí olùfọkànsìn.

DEFINITION: liver enzyme. A laboratory test that measures transaminase levels is used to assess the health of the liver.
TRANSLATION: ẹ̀dọ̀. Àyẹ̀wò tó n ṣe òsùnwọ̀n ìlera ẹ̀dọ̀.

DEFINITION: the double stranded DNA molecules unwind and form mRNA.
TRANSLATION: kíkọ́ òjíṣẹ́ mólékù RNA nípa lílo mólékù DNA gẹ́gẹ́ bi àwòṣe pẹ̀lú ìdápadà èsì ìfitóniletí jinni sí mólékù RNA. Ní ìbátan mọ́ kòkòrò: ójẹ́ ìlànà tí ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ kòkòrò se ìpèsè àwọn kòkòrò tuntun. Àwọn ẹ̀dà RNA tí a n pè ní òjíṣẹ́ RNA gbúdọ̀ jẹ́ àwọn ohun ìpèsè olùgbàlejò irinṣẹ́ ohun asaralóre hóró. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 264

DEFINITION: factor A fraction of white blood cells that apparently "transfers" capability to mount an immune response to a specific antigen.
TRANSLATION: ajẹsára Ìdà hóró ẹ̀jẹ̀ funfun tí ó hàn gbangba pé a gbé àjẹsára gbígbà sínú àjèjì adáralóró kan pàtó.

DEFINITION: transfer of blood or blood products from one person (the donor) into the circulation of the patient (the recipient) whose blood is deficient in quantity or quality through accident or disease.
TRANSLATION: ni lẹ́jẹ̀ tàbí ìsun ẹ̀jẹ̀ láti ọwọ́ ẹnìkan (ọlọ́rẹ) láti ṣòn sí alarẹ (olùgbà) tí ẹ̀jẹ̀ rẹ̀ kò tó níwọ̀n tàbí níye látipasẹ̀ ìjàmbá tàbí àìsàn.

DEFINITION: of HIV infected blood This is a condition of giving HIV infected blood through blood transfusion to an uninfected person.
TRANSLATION: Gbígbà ẹ̀jẹ̀ ẹni tó ní KASA sí ara ẹni tí kò ní.

DEFINITION: People (TG) Transgender people are people who experience a mismatch between their gender identity, or gender expression, and their assigned sex.
TRANSLATION: ẹni tí ó ní ìwà ìṣebí akọ àti abo.

DEFINITION: related to HIV: The process by which HIV messenger RNA is processed in a cell's nucleus and transported to the cytoplasm, the cellular material outside the nucleus. In the cytoplasm, the cell's protein- making machinery translates the messenger RNA into viral protein and enzymes.
TRANSLATION: mọ́ kòkòrò: ìlànà yìí ní èyí tí òjíṣẹ́ mólékù RNA ní ìlọsíwájú nínú àgọ́ọ́- hóró kí ó sì gbe sínú ohun inú hóró, ohun èlò hóró ní ìta àgọ́. Nínú ohun inú hóró, àwọn ohun ìpèsè olùgbàlejò irinṣẹ́ ohun aṣaralóre hóró yí òjíṣẹ́ RNA padà sí kòkòrò asaralóre àti ẹ́nsàìmù. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 265

DEFINITION: channels These are channels used to convey messages.
TRANSLATION: ni ọ̀nà tí a n gbà láti fí àwọn ìfiránṣẹ́ múlẹ̀.

DEFINITION: implantation of organ or tissue from one part of the body to another or from one person (the donor) to another (the recipient).
TRANSLATION: ara tàbí ìṣù láti ẹ̀yà ènìyàn kan sí ẹlòmíràn (Ọlọ́rẹ) sí (olùgbà).

DEFINITION: centre Centres where Ebola patients are taken to for treatment.
TRANSLATION: tí à tí ń mú àwọn elébòólà lo ̣ fún ìtọ́jú.

DEFINITION: for candida infections This is a kind of treatment for yeast infection that results from an overgrowth of yeast (a type of fungus) anywhere in the body. Candidiasis is by far the most common type of yeast infection.
TRANSLATION: ìwúkàrà Irú ìtọ́jú fún ààrùn ìwúkàrà tójẹ́ àbájáde ìdàgbàsókè ìwúkàrà níbikíbi ní àgọ́ọ́ ara. Ààrùn ìwúkàrà wà ní orísirísi ìpele.

DEFINITION: for opportunistic infections This is a treatment for an illness caused by an organism that usually does not cause disease in a person with a normal immune system. People with advanced HIV infection suffer from opportunistic infections of the lungs, brain, eyes and other organs.
TRANSLATION: akófà Èyí ni ìtọ́jú àìsàn tí ó wá nípaṣè oniye tí kì í sàbá fa ààrùn lára ẹni tí ó ní àjẹsára pipe. Àwon tíwọ́n ní ààrùn kòkòrò tó gara máa n jìyà àwọn ààrùn àfẹ́wá bi ẹ̀dọ̀ , ojú àti ní àwọn ẹ̀yà ara.

DEFINITION: for prevention Treatment for prevention refers to HIV prevention methods that use antiretroviral treatment (ART) to decrease the risk of HIV transmission.
TRANSLATION: ìdènà Èyí jẹ́ àwọn ọ̀nà ìdènà kòkòrò nípa lílo òògùn ìtọ́jú kòkòrò láti ṣe àdínkù bá ewu ìtànkálẹ́ kòkòrò. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 266

DEFINITION: for tuberculosis This is the treatment for tuberculosis diseases. Anti-tuberculosis drug treatment can be first-line or second- line, and typically involves combina- tion therapy with antimicrobial drugs.
TRANSLATION: ife Èyí ni ìlànà ìtọ́jú ààrùn ikọ́ ife. Ìlò òògùn ikó ̣ ife lè jé ̣ àkànpò ̣ rè ̣ mó ̣ àwo ̣n òògùn apa kòkòrò mìíràn.

DEFINITION: partner Treatment partners also known as Expedited Partner Therapy (EPT) is the clinical practice of treating the sex partners of patients diagnosed with chlamydia or gonorrhoea by providing prescriptions or medications to the patient to take to his/her partner without the health care provider first examining the partner.
TRANSLATION: ẹni Ìtọ́jú ẹnìkejì aláìsan láì jẹ́ pé olùwòsàn fojú rí ẹnìkejì rè ̣ pàápàá jùlọ nígbà tí aláìsàn bẹ́ẹ̀ bá ní ààrùn ìbálòpọ̀ àtọ̀sí.

DEFINITION: valve A heart valve consisting three flaps that prevent blood from flowing back into the right atrium when the right ventricle contracts.
TRANSLATION: káàmẹ́ta Èkú-ara ọkàn tí ó ní ìlùgbà mẹ́ta tó n se ìdíwọ́ fún ẹ̀jẹ̀ láti sàn padà sínú ìyẹ̀wù òkè ọkàn ọ̀tún nígbà tí a bá ní ìfarakàn ìyẹ̀wù-odò ọ̀tún.

DEFINITION: fever Tropical fevers are defined as infections that are prevalent in, or are unique to tropical and subtropical regions. Some of these occur throughout the year and some especially in rainy and post-rainy season.
TRANSLATION: Ibà ilẹ̀ ìta-oòru túnmọ̀ sí ààrùn tó wọ́pọ̀, yàtọ̀ sí agbèègbè ilẹ̀ ìta- oòrun. Èyí máa n wáyé fún gbogbo ọdún àti àsìkò òjò àti ìrékọjá òjò.

DEFINITION: Active disease caused by Myco- bacterium tuberculosis, as evidenced
TRANSLATION: tó ń wáyé nípasẹ̀ kòkòrò àìfojúrí iko-ife ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 267 by a confirmatory culture, or, in the absence of culture, suggestive clinical symptoms, including productive cough lasting >3 weeks, chest pain, hemoptysis, fever, night sweats, weight loss, and easy fatigability. Mycobacterium, èyí tí a rí ẹ̀rí rẹ̀, ìfẹ̀sẹ̀múlẹ̀ ìwòṣesí kòkòrò náà tàbí bí kò bá sí ìwòṣesí kòkòrò àwọn ààmì afunilára ajẹ́mọ́ ààrùn ní ikọ́ tí ó pẹ́ ó kéré tán ọ̀sẹ̀ mẹ́ta, àyà ríro, ikọ́ ẹ̀jẹ̀, ibà, òógùn alaalẹ́, ìwọ̀n jíjá àti àárẹ̀.

DEFINITION: fever A serious and sometimes fatal bacterial infection of the digestive system, caused by ingesting food or water contaminated with the bacillus Salmonella typhi.
TRANSLATION: àìfójúrí ti ètò ẹ̀dà oúnjẹ ara tí ó wá láti ipasẹ̀ gígún oúnjẹ ni òògùn tàbí kí omi kó dọ̀tí pẹ̀lú kòkòrò àìfójúrí.

DEFINITION: open sore on an external or internal surface of the body, caused by a break in the skin or mucous membrane which fails to heal.
TRANSLATION: ní pèpele ìta tàbí inú nípa ìlà ara tàbí ìwọ̀ aṣekun tó kọ̀ láti jinná.

DEFINITION: is a condition of getting less than the required food needed for health and growth.
TRANSLATION: asaralóoretó Èyí ni ipò ká máa jẹ àìtó oúnjẹ fún ìlera àti ìdàgbàsókè.

DEFINITION: fever Also known as Brucellosis, it is an infectious disease caused by various species of bacteria of the genus Brucella transmitted to humans from lower animals, especially, cattle, dogs and goats.
TRANSLATION: brucella Ààrùn tí a kó láti ara kòkòrò àìfojúrí tí a mò sí batéríà tó ràn ènìyàn látara ẹranko, páapáa màálù, ajá àti ewúrẹ́. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 268

DEFINITION: bruising or haemorrhaging Blood spots under the skin may be either purpura or petechiae. Purpura might look like bruises, but they are not caused by an injury as most regular bruises.
TRANSLATION: aláìnídìí.

DEFINITION: is a patented test kit used in running rapid HIV test in hospitals.
TRANSLATION: KASA Èyí ni irins ̣é ̣ tí a n lò fún síṣe àyẹ̀wò kánkán fún KASA ní ilé ìwòsàn.

DEFINITION: Nations General Assembly Special Session on HIV and AIDS (UNGASS) The General Assembly of the United Nations is expected to agree on a declaration of commitment that will strengthen political commitment and intensify efforts in the global fight against HIV/AIDS.
TRANSLATION: UNGASS Àjọ yìí wà fún títẹramọ́ ọ̀nà láti kojú kòkòrò KASA àti ààrùn ìsọdọ̀lẹ àjẹsára kárí-ayé

DEFINITION: United Nations Mission for Ebola Emergency Response.
TRANSLATION: UNMEER Èsì pàjáwìrì Ebola fún pàtàkì iṣẹ́ United Nation.

DEFINITION: sex This is an act of having sex without using a condom in order to prevent pregnancy and the spread of infectious diseases.
TRANSLATION: àbò nígbà ìbálòpọ̀ tí kò s ̣e ìdílọ́wọ́ fún àtilóyún àti ìtànkálẹ́ ààrùn kíkó.

DEFINITION: blood Donor blood that has not undergone recommended tests to certify it free of infection or contamination.
TRANSLATION: Ẹ̀jè ̣ tí a gbà, tí a kò tíì s ̣e àyè ̣wò rè ̣ pé kò ní àbà wó ̣n.

DEFINITION: object An instrument, device or material that has not undergone a process to render it free of microbial contamination.
TRANSLATION: irinṣẹ́ Irinṣé ̣ tàbí ohun èlò tí a kò tíì pa kòkòrò àti àbà wó ̣n ara rè ̣. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 269

DEFINITION: analysis of the physical, chemical, and microbiological properties of urine, carried out to help diagnose disease, monitor treatment, or detect the presence of a specific substance.
TRANSLATION: kẹ́míkà, àti ẹ̀kọ́ ìní ẹ̀yàwuuru ti ìtọ̀ àyẹ̀wò ìtọ̀ àti mímó ìdí ààrùn aláìsàn, láti lè jẹ́ ìrànlọ́wọ́ fún ìtọ́jú, tàbí fi mo àwon ohun èròjà kan nínú ara.

DEFINITION: fluid excreted by the kidneys which contains many of the body’s waste products.
TRANSLATION: jáde láti ara iwe tí ó ní ọ̀pọ́lọ́pọ́ ìdọ́tí ara.

DEFINITION: Urticaria, commonly referred to as hives, is a kind of skin rash notable for pale red, raised, itchy bumps.
TRANSLATION: agbọ́n/oyin jẹ́ ara ṣíṣú tó n fa ṣíṣú pupa, dìde, kókó yíyún.

DEFINITION: services These are machines or systems or items that are easy to use or understand.
TRANSLATION: irinṣẹ́ tí o sòro àtilò tàbí mọ́.

DEFINITION: hollow muscular organ located in the pelvic cavity of female mammals in which the fertilized egg implants and develops. Also called womb.
TRANSLATION: ara tó wà ní ihò ìkòkò ìdí ti abo oníwàrà ní èyí tí ọlẹ́ tó gbìn tàbí dàgbà. A tún n pèní ilé- ọmọ.

DEFINITION: is an active immunization in which dead or weakened microorganisms are introduced into the body. The microorganisms sensitize the immune system and if they enter the body next time they are destroyed by already produced antibodies.
TRANSLATION: Gbígba abẹ́rẹ́ àjẹsára sí ara fún ìdí ìṣelọ́pọ̀ àjẹsára lòdì sí ààrùn. Àjẹsára jẹ́ àsà àìlera asojú ààrùn, gbígba àjẹsára ni akọ́kọ́ lò ní China, India àti Persia, tí a ṣàfihàn sí ìlà-òòrùn ní 18th C látọwọ́ E. Jenner. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS
n pa kòkòrò àti láti dènà àrùn ọ̀fun, àrùn ọpọlọ àti ọ̀pá-ẹ̀yìn, àrùn dìgbòlugi àti ibà jẹ̀funjẹ̀fun. Àyẹ̀wò àjẹsára fún àwon jẹjẹrẹ kan ní ó sàwárí fún àyẹ̀wò eku.

DEFINITION: substance that contains antigenic components from an infectious organism. By stimulating an immune response (but not disease), it protects against subsequent infection by that organism.
TRANSLATION: ohun elo tó ní àwọn èròjà àjèjì adáralóró láti ara ààrùn oniye. Nípa ṣíṣe àfinkún fún àjẹsára gbígbà (súgbọ́n kìí se ààrùn), ohun dabòbò ààrùn kíkún ní iwájú nípa oniye.

DEFINITION: muscular canal that extends from the cervix to the outside of the body. It receives the erect penis during coitus: semen is ejaculated into the upper part of the vagina and from there the sperms must pass through the cervix and uterus in order to fertilize an ovum in the fallopian tube.
TRANSLATION: Ọ̀ nà oníṣán tó gùn láti ọrùn ilé o ̣mo ̣ sí ìta ara. Ó n fi àyè gba okó líle nígbà ìbálòpọ̀: àtọ̀ á dà sí ibi òkè òbò, láti ibè, àtọ̀ gbó ̣dọ̀ gba ojú ọrùn ilé o ̣mo ̣ àti ilé- ọmọnú láti di ọlẹ̀ nínú ìfun ẹyin.
Vaginal Related to the vagina. Ajẹmó ̣ òbò Èyí ni ojú ihò ìbísí tààrà obìnrin.

DEFINITION: secretions This is the variable amounts of secretions from the glands in the vagina and cervix.
TRANSLATION: Iye oje tó n jáde láti ojú nǹkan obìnrin àti ìlé ọmọ. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 271

DEFINITION: antibody region The part of an antibody's structure that differs from one antibody to another.
TRANSLATION: ara Apákan nínú ọ̀nà sọ́jà ara tí ó yátọ̀ sí sọ́jà mìíràn.

DEFINITION: vein A condition in which the surface veins, especially of the legs, become knotted and swollen, as a result of flaws in the valves of the affected veins.
TRANSLATION: wọlé Ipò ojú iṣan páàpáà ẹsẹ̀ tó díjú wú nípasẹ̀ àbàwọ́n ẹ́kù-ara ojú iṣan tó ṣéṣe. Wíwà níru ipò yí le jẹ̀ àjogúnbá, ìpalára, wíwú, tàbí dídì ẹ̀jẹ̀.

DEFINITION: nonpathogenic bacterium or virus used to transport an antigen into the body to stimulate protective immunity (e.g. in a vaccine).
TRANSLATION: kòkòrò àìfójúrí afáìsàn tí a n lò láti gbé àjèjì adáralóró sínú ara láti lọ́wọ́ nínú àbò àjẹsára.

DEFINITION: blood vessel that carries blood to the heart.
TRANSLATION: pá apín ẹ̀jẹ̀ wọkàn.

DEFINITION: thin layer of tissue that covers or separates something.
TRANSLATION: Ìṣù ìpèlè tínrín tó bó nkan tàbí láti pín ǹkan níyà.

DEFINITION: transmission A vertically transmitted infection is an infection caused by bacteria, viruses, or in rare cases, parasites transmitted directly from the mother to an embryo, foetus, or baby during pregnancy or childbirth. It can occur when the mother gets an infection as an intercurrent disease in pregnancy.
TRANSLATION: ìtànkálẹ̀ ìnàrò ni ààrùn tí ó wá láti ara bateria, kòkòrò, lọ́nà tí ó wọ́pọ̀, a máa jẹ́ láti ara ìyá sí oyún, ọmọ inú, tàbí ọmọ ní àsìkò oyún tàbí ìbí. Ó lè wáyé nígbà tí ìyá bá kó ààrùn gẹ́gẹ́ bi ààrùn tí ó wá nígbà kannáà lásìkò oyún. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 272

DEFINITION: Behaviour involving physical force intended to hurt, damage, or kill someone or something.
TRANSLATION: ó ní agbára tí a ti pinnu láti farapa, bàjẹ́, tàbí pa ènìyàn tàbí ǹkan.

DEFINITION: against women with AIDS
TRANSLATION: Violence against women with AIDS. Jàgídíjàgan sí obìnrin onísọdọ̀lẹ àjẹsára Ìfipálòdì sí àwọn obìnrin tó n gbé pẹ̀lú éèdì.

DEFINITION: or pertaining to a virus. For example, if a person has a viral rash.
TRANSLATION: ti kòkòrò. Àpẹẹrẹ tí ènìyàn bá ní kòkòrò ara.

DEFINITION: burden The amount of HIV virus in the circulating blood. Monitoring a person's viral burden is important because of the apparent correlation between the amount of virus in the blood and the severity of the disease: sicker patients generally have more virus than those with less advanced disease. A new, sensitive, rapid test – called the branched DNA assay for HIV-1 infection – can be used to monitor the HIV viral burden. Òǹka kòkòrò KASA
TRANSLATION: ó n sàn nínú ẹ̀jẹ̀. Ó ṣe pàtàkì láti ibójúwó ènìyàn tí ó ní ìnáwó kòkòrò torí gbangba ìbámu láàrin iye kòkòrò inú ẹ̀jẹ̀ àtì ìdíbàjẹ́ ààrùn : olùsọ́ aláìsàn lóní kòkòrò jù àwọn tóní ààrùn níwájú lọ.

DEFINITION: culture A laboratory method for growing viruses.
TRANSLATION: nà ayẹ̀wò fún ìdàgbàsókè àwọn kòkòrò.

DEFINITION: envelope As related to HIV: HIV is spherical in shape with a diameter of 1/10,000 of a millimetre. The outer coat, or envelope, is composed of two layers of
TRANSLATION: ìbátan mọ́ KASA: ìyípọ̀ kòkòrò ní iwọ̀ pẹ̀lu àlàjá 1/10,000 ti ìdá ọ̀kẹ́- mítà. Èèpò ìta tàbí àpòòwé lóní ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 273 fat-like molecules called lipids, taken from the membranes of human cells. Embedded in the envelope are numerous cellular proteins, as well as mushroom-shaped HIV proteins that protrude from the surface. ìpèle méjì ti mólékù ọ̀rá tí amọ́ sí ọ̀rà, tí a yọ lára aṣekun àwọn hóró ènìyàn.

DEFINITION: load A count of the amount of HIV virus in the blood. It is measured in copies per millilitre and gives an idea of how active the virus is.
TRANSLATION: bí a sè lè mọ iye kòkòrò nínú ẹ̀jẹ̀. Iye rẹ̀ se wọn ní ìdá- ọ̀kẹ́ mítà, kí o sì fún wa ní òye bí kòkòrò se láápọn sí.

DEFINITION: (Alternative spelling is Viraemia) The presence of virus in the bloodstream.
TRANSLATION: Wíwà kòkòrò nínú ẹ̀jẹ̀.

DEFINITION: virus particle existing freely outside a host cell. A mature virus.
TRANSLATION: Kòkòrò ìdọ̀tí inú ẹ̀jẹ̀ tí ó wá ní ìta olùgbàlejò hóró. Kòkòrò tógbó.
study of viruses and viral diseases. Ẹ̀ kọ́ nípa kòkòrò Ẹ̀ kọ́ nípa kòkòrò àti kòkòrò ààrùn.

DEFINITION: agent that destroys or inactivates a virus.
TRANSLATION: asojú tó n pa tàbí ṣe àìsiṣẹ́ kòkòrò.

DEFINITION: self-replicating, infectious, nucleic acid-protein complex that requires an intact host cell for its replication; its genome is either DNA or RNA.
TRANSLATION: ẹ̀kan àgọ́ọ́-hóró láàrìn ohun eèpò purotéènì, láti ìwọ̀n ọgọ́rùn sí ẹgbẹ̀rún méjì lára ọkan ìpari, ẹyọkàn túmọ̀ sí mítà 10-10. Alè sàfojúrí ẹ̀ nípa ẹ̀y-ara àfẹ̀ran. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS

ayé, tíwọ́n dòmìnira àti àrùn, àwọn kì í jísẹ́ hóró àyè, bi ìpòyídà àti ìdàgbàsókè, nígbà tíwọ́n bá wọnú ọ̀gbìn àyè, ẹranko tàbí kòkòrò àìfojúrí inu hóró, wọn a máa lo olùgbàlejò atẹ́gùn kẹ́míkà hóró asaralóre àti dídá agbára láti ṣẹ̀dá ara wọn.

DEFINITION: natural reservoir A natural reservoir or nidus (the latter from the Latin word for “nest”) is the long-term host of a pathogen of an infectious disease.
TRANSLATION: Ìfipamọ́ ààrùn fún ọjọ́ pípẹ́.
Pertaining to the major internal organs. Ajẹmọ́ ẹ̀yà inú ara Nípa ti inú ara.

DEFINITION: problem There are several problems that can affect the surface of the eye which can affect vision, although usually they mainly cause pain and redness.
TRANSLATION: pọ̀lọpọ̀ ìsòrò tólè ṣe àkóbá fún pèpele ojú èyí tólè ṣe àkóbà fún ìríran, lọ́pọ̀ ìgbà ló máa n fa ìrora àti ojú pípọ́n.

DEFINITION: signs The sign that indicates life, e.g. pulse, body temperature, breathing, and blood pressure.
TRANSLATION: tó túnmọ̀ sí ayé, àpẹẹrẹ, ilu kìku ti ọkàn, ara tó n lọ́wọ́rọ́, mímí àti ẹ̀jẹ̀ ríru.

DEFINITION: Vitamin C is a water-soluble vitamin. It is needed for normal growth and development. Water-soluble vitamins dissolve in water. Leftover amounts of the vitamin leave the body through the urine.
TRANSLATION: C ni a nílò fún ìdgbà- sókè. Fítáámì olómi ló tú bí omi. Iye àwon tókù ló n jáde gẹ́gẹ́bì ìtọ̀. Ọ̀ pọ̀ fítáámì ni a nínú oúnjẹ wa. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 275

DEFINITION: Arising, acting, or resulting from somebody's own choice or decision rather than because of external pressure or force.
TRANSLATION: ohun àfinúfindọ̀ ṣe ju kí ará ìta kàn-án nípa lọ

DEFINITION: Confidential Counselling & Testing (VCCT) This is when a person chooses to undergo HIV counselling so that they can make an informed choice about whether to be treated for HIV. It is now known as VCT (voluntary counselling and testing) or HCT (HIV counselling and testing).
TRANSLATION: ìgbékẹ̀lé aláìníkànnpá Yíyàn láti gba ìgbaníyànjú lórí KASA kí ó lè pínnú láti gba ìwòsàn tàbí kò ̣ láti gbà á.

DEFINITION: disclosure When a person shares information about his/her HIV status with others.
TRANSLATION: tí ènìyàn bá pín ipò kòkòrò rẹ̀ pẹ̀lú àwọn ènìyàn mìíràn.

DEFINITION: health workers These are freewill volunteers that work in the community.
TRANSLATION: Òsìṣẹ́ ìlera aláìníkanpá tó n siṣẹ́ fún agbèègbè.

DEFINITION: testing Arising, acting, or resulting from somebody's own choice or decision rather than because of external pressure or force.
TRANSLATION: Àyẹ̀wò aláìníkànnípá/ Àyẹ̀wò ìfìnufíndọ̀ se Èyí jẹ́ ohun àfìnúfíndọ̀ ṣe ju kí ara ìta kànnípá lọ.

DEFINITION: expel the contents of the stomach through the mouth as a result of a
TRANSLATION: a pọ̀ jáde láti inú fún ìdí àìsàn gìrì ẹran ara. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 276 series of involuntary spasms of the stomach muscle.

DEFINITION: blood The reflex action from ejecting blood from the stomach through the mouth.
TRANSLATION: lílé ẹ̀jẹ̀ inú ikùn jáde láti inú ẹnu.

DEFINITION: is an acronym, standing for “Water, Sanitation and Hygiene”.
TRANSLATION: ọwọ̀ ni àdàpè omi, ìmọ́tótó àti ìtẹ́nilọ́rùn.

DEFINITION: of hands This is an act of washing both hands to minimize microbial contamination and cross infection.
TRANSLATION: ni ọ̀nà fífọ ọwọ́ fún dídènà kòkòrò àìfojúrí.

DEFINITION: yam Dioscorea alata, known as purple yam and many other names, is a species of yam, a tuberous root vegetable. The tubers are usually bright lavender in colour, hence the common name, but they may sometimes be white.
TRANSLATION: ẹ̀yà isu tí ó pupa, nígbà mìíràn wọ́n á jẹ́ funfun.

DEFINITION: pulse Weak pulse is when a person is seriously injured or ill, one may have difficulty feeling a pulse. The pulse is the rate of one’s heartbeat.
TRANSLATION: Lílù ọ̀kàn aláìlókun nínú nígbà tí ènìyàn bá farapa tàbí ṣàìsàn, ó lè sòro láti mọ lílù ọkàn irú ènìyàn bẹ́ẹ̀. Lílù ọkàn ni òdiwọ̀n bí ọkàn ṣe ń sisẹ́ sí

DEFINITION: of the body
TRANSLATION: seen as body feebleness. Àìle ara Èyí ni a rí bi àìlera ara.

DEFINITION: loss Weight loss is a decrease in body weight which can be voluntary or involuntary.
TRANSLATION: ̣mo ̣ tàbí àìmò ̣ó ̣mò ̣ ṣe àdínkù ní ìwúwo ara. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 277

DEFINITION: blot test A laboratory test for the presence of specific antibodies, more accurate than the ELISA test.
TRANSLATION: ara Àkànṣe àyẹ̀wò fún wíwà sọ́jà ara, ó se déédé ju àyẹ̀wò ELISA lọ.

DEFINITION: whistling noise in the chest during breathing. Wheezing occurs as a result of the narrowing of the air waves. They are commonly heard in patients with asthma.
TRANSLATION: gulegule Ẹjọ́ wẹrẹwẹrẹ nígbayà bí a bá n mí. Mímí gulegule n wáyé nígbà tí a ná ní afẹ́fẹ́ ìjì. A sábà máa n ri gbọ lára àwọn tí ó ní ikọ́fe.

DEFINITION: blood cell One of the cells the body makes to help fight infections.
TRANSLATION: funfun Ọkan lára hóró ara tó n wọ̀jàkadì ti ààrùn.

DEFINITION: Existing or happening in many places, or affecting many people.
TRANSLATION: n dàmú ọ̀pọ̀ ènìyàn níbi gbogbo.

DEFINITION: period The time before antibodies are detectable in the blood and other body fluids of a person who was recently infected with HIV. Antibodies to HIV are detectable within 6-12 weeks after acquisition of HIV.
TRANSLATION: Èyí ní àsìkò ìs ̣aájú ìs ̣àkíyèsí sójà ara nínú è ̣jè ̣ àti omi ara alás ̣è ̣s ̣è ̣kó KASA. Ìs ̣àkíyèsí yìí máa n wáyé láàrin ò ̣sè ̣ mé ̣fà sí méjìlá lé ̣yìn ìkóràn KASA.

DEFINITION: Witchcraft (also called witchery or spellcraft) broadly means the practice of, and belief in, magical skills and abilities that are able to be exercised individually by designated social groups, or by persons with the necessary esoteric secret knowledge.
TRANSLATION: fífẹ́ lójú, ó túmọ̀ sí ìwà sí, ìgbàgbọ́, pípa idán àti agbára àti ṣe ìdárayá lórí ẹgbẹ́ ènìyàn pẹ̀lú làkáàyè ìmọ̀ ìdákọ́nkọ́.

DEFINITION: empowerment These are rights and privileges given to women.
TRANSLATION: ni ìrànwọ́ fún àwọn obìnrin. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 278

DEFINITION: Health Organization The World Health Organization is a specialized agency of the United Nations that is concerned with international public health.
TRANSLATION: yìí wà fún ìlera àwùjọ kárí-ayé.

DEFINITION: (dry skin) Dry skin (xerosis) is a condition of rough, dry skin with fine scaling of skin and, occasionally, with small cracks in the skin. Dry skin is also known as winter itch or asteatosis.
TRANSLATION: Ààrùn ara àti ẹyinjú gbígbe ni ipò tó nira, ara gbígbẹ pẹ̀lú ìgbélọsókè ara gbígbẹ, pẹ̀lú ara síṣán.

DEFINITION: Electromagnetic radiation of extremely short wavelength (beyond the ultraviolet), which pass through matter to varying degrees depending on its density.
TRANSLATION: Ìtànká òòfà- àrá tí ó kéré ní ìgbọ̀n- agbọ̀n tó n gba ohunkóhun tí a lè ojú rí kọjá ní ìwọ̀n bíwọ́n bá ṣe wúwo tó.

DEFINITION: Ebola hotline to speak to local community leaders for advice if Ebola is suspected in any community.
TRANSLATION: ìrànwọ́ Ebola Ẹ̀ fún ìrànwọ́ Ebolà fúàlámòjútó nígbà tí a bá ti ko.

DEFINITION: infection Overgrowth of yeast can affect the skin (yeast rash), mouth (thrush), etc.
TRANSLATION: ìdàgbàsókè ìwúkàrà lè ní ipálára.

DEFINITION: fever Yellow fever is an acute viral haemorrhagic disease transmitted by infected mosquitoes. The "yellow" in the name refers to the jaundice that affects some patients. Iba
TRANSLATION: Ibà pọ́njú-pọ́ntọ̀ jẹ́ ààrùn ajẹmọ́ kòkòrò tí ó máa ń ràn ká nípa ìkóràn ẹ̀fọn. Pupa rẹ́súrẹ́sú tí ó wà nínú orúkọ rẹ̀ wà fún akọ-ibà tí ó máa ń dàmú àwọn tí ó bá mú. ENGLISH-YORÙBÁ GLOSSARY OF HIV, AIDS AND EBOLA-RELATED TERMS 279

DEFINITION: Ebola virus Ebola Virus found in Zaire. Kòròrò Ebola Zaire Kòròrò Ebola Zaire.
(AZT) An antiviral drug used in the treatment of AIDS and HIV infection. The drug slows the growth of HIV infection in the body, but is not curative.
TRANSLATION: zibovudine Oògùn ìtọ́jú ààrùn kòkòrò àti ààrùn ìṣọdọ̀lẹ àjẹsára. Oògùn yìí máa n lọ́ra ààrùn kòkòrò nínú ara, sùgbọ́n kì í muni láradá.

DEFINITION: (Experimental Treatment) ZMapp is under development as a treatment for Ebola virus disease. It was first used experimentally to treat some people with Ebola virus disease during the 2014 Ebola crisis.
TRANSLATION: Ebola Àyọ́jú ìtọ́jú wà lábẹ́ ìdàgbà- sókè ìtọ́jú kòkòrò ààrùn Èbólà. Akọ́kọ́ sàmúlò rẹ̀ fún ìtọ́jú àwọn tí ó ní kòkòrò ààrùn Èbólà ní àsìkò rúkèrúdò ààrùn yìí.

DEFINITION: disease Common form of transmission of Ebola through direct contact with a person who is symptomatic (i.e. showing symptoms).
TRANSLATION: ẹranko sénìyàn Ọ̀ nà tí ó wọ́pọ̀ fún ìtànkálẹ̀ ààrùn Èbólà ni ìfarakínra pẹ̀lú ẹni tí ó ní ààmì àìsàn yìí lára.
